No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I was really looking forward to eating at Momofuku Ssam Bar but unfortunately had a very disappointing experience. I've eaten at his restaurant in Las Vegas and have always had an incredible experience. With that being said, the food was ok but the service was awful. We made a 9:30 year reservation and received a call around 8:30 saying that we could come by earlier. We weren't able to so showed up a few minutes before our 9:30 reservation. We were rudely greeted by the hostess who seemed to be extremely upset that we had shown up so late (at 9:28 for our 9:30 reservation). I understand people want to call it a night early sometimes but don't offer reservations at this time if you're not capable of delivering on the David Chang experience. So once they begrudgingly sat us, the waitress comes up and says kitchen is about to close so you have one shot to put in all your food. There's definitely a more customer-service appropriate way to say that...anyways we ordered the ssam set which was overall very good. Drinks were also solid. The meats were all good and I really enjoyed the salad. The raw fish dish, hamachi I think, was a little fishy but the bing and salad made up for it. The meats were all tasty and the star of the meal. We ordered the oysters which were pretty standard but the $55 cacio e pepe rice cakes were not worth the price tag. You could tell throughout the meal that they were trying to rush us so they could get out of there, which really deterred from the experience. Once again, I know everyone is tired and overworked but we're pretty low maintenance so I just ask for a decent experience when we're paying to go to a nice restaurant. The subpar service really put me off to coming back to this restaurant. Would not recommend it unless there's a turnaround and more focus on service.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Hit n miss on the dishes.  The best was the fries that came with the ribeye, the oysters, and the rice cakes.  The bad was the fish, prawns, and shrimp toast.
Great views, friendly service and tasty food. Awesome place for a nice dinner by the water! Highly recommend reservations, always packed. Good variety of drinks and food!

I had brunch with a group of 6 here on a weekend. The wait was about 10 minutes. The staff were all very nice. The drink menu was impressive. We were all very satisfied  with our drinks. The galbi steak bowl was good, but not the best I've ever had. I've had a lot better for less than $39 so it was definitely overpriced. I would visit again for its location and drinks, but would probably not dine too frequently.
No comment

Didn't eat a full meal here but a group of 4 of us stopped by for pre dinner drinks and apps. Drinks were good - good balanced flavor profiles and decent amount of alcohol (not too strong either). Docked a star for the size of the apps. The ricotta with chili oil was great but the accompanying bread was TINY and asking for more bread was several dollars extra which seemed excessive.

I have mixed feelings about this new iteration of Momofuku Ssam Bar. I was a big fan of the old location and appreciated how intimate it was and how it reflected the David Chang swagger of the other earlier Momofuku restaurants. That vibe is nowhere to be found in the new location. It feels like an overpriced tourist trap geared toward people who have a lot of money to spend, want to dabble in some gateway Korean food (and/or perhaps are not comfortable with venturing to K-town), and want to see and be seen. It looks like it was designed for social media posts. That being said, the food was decent. Our group participated in the full Ssam tasting menu and liked all of the dishes. Nothing was exceptionally memorable for me other than the salad (randomly). All of the dishes were very "safe" and not terribly exciting, but they were well executed. The service was good until the end, when we were asked to leave because they had to "free up the table," even though all of the large tables around us were unoccupied. One other observation that I found to be somewhat interesting (as an Asian) was that I didn't see any Asians among the many staff members who were working there the night we went. I find that unusual for  an Asian restaurant, but perhaps this just happened to be case the night we went. Ultimately, I doubt I will return to Ssam because it just feels like a "new Coke" version of the old location, but I do think the overall experience would be enjoyable for most people.
No comment
No comment

Excellent food. Excellent service and friendly. Great low lighting. We got the back menu option of $100 a plate for a course meal to be prepared right in front of us. Fun! The apps and starters were some of the most flavorful dishes. This is the kind of place you sit down and slowly eat and savor. Loved it.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Food was fresh and the flavors were incredible. We were celebrating our anniversary and my cousin's upcoming nuptials. The service was impeccable. If you're looking for something special make a reservation here.
We were in the city and decided to have lunch here. We were seated right away.  We ordered the chicken and fish sandwiches. Portions were large. Food was very tasty. Service was great too.

Had such a great meal with some friends! It's a little chilly if you're seated in the outside portion but we were wearing our jackets and there were heaters. The food was im goodness sooooo good! Everything we ordered was so fresh and so delicious. The waiter was so helpful and even gave us tips on what to order, which worked out really well. We had such a blast besides the food and drinks being amazing. Some of the dishes that I highly recommend are: Cacio e Pepe Rice Cakes, Impossible Pork Rice Cakes, American Country Ham, Smoked Sweet & Sour Ribs, Sizzling Bavette Steak, and Whole Roasted Fish. They were all so drool worthy, really go there. I only got one picture because well it was all too good to take pictures of.
No comment
No comment
Food is great. Service is ok. Maybe because it was Sunday evening. I recommend Rib eye steak.
No comment
No comment

I was very disappointed. I took my girlfriend there for Valentine's Day and the prefix menu they had was a joke. And misleading. Food was under seasoned took a while for the food to come out.( wasn't even that busy)  cocktails were wack. And everything super over priced. 0 out of 10 do not recommend. David Chang needs to do something about that spot. It's wack.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Great experience!  Delicious dinner, yummy drinks, and amazing staff. Went with a party of 8 and had the Ssam dinner. Amazing!

The food is excellent but our server is really bad and had bad attitude.  We ordered one set of pork bun and country ham he brought two sets of pork buns.... He never checked how we were doing during our meal and rushed us with check. It is a shame that such a good restaurant is lacking decent service

Everything from the drinks to the appetizer was great. The raw food and chicken wings with the ribs were good. The entree of the steak, pork belly I did not like then seasoning of them was a little off. The scallops had a weird after taste. Was not as fresh as I would like. The raw salmon was really good. The raw beef a little bit too salty. The cheesecake dessert was not bad. But the shaved ice is pretty plain. Mix feeling about here. But would come back and try some other things also.
No comment
Overhyped. Way too salty. If someone made a high end version of what Panda Express is to Chinese food, Ssam bar would be that.
No comment

Been to every David Chang's places including MOMOFUKU Ko l, however this is the worst of his poor establishments. Ambiance was awkward. Serving staffs were so out all over the place. Menu itself is obnoxiously off balanced. Ssam Set ($105 per person) was terrible. Just couldn't wait to get out of there. Heavily salted and impossible to identify unpleasantly stimulating spices in all the dishes. Oysters were not fresh so we left 4 pieces out of 6 untouched. Striped Bass Tartare was basically cooked by hot weather temperature that tasted like wood. Prawns were uncooked. Short ribs, pork shoulder, pork belly were all over seasoned and the servers who grilled the meats for our table didn't even ask how we wanted our meats to be cooked. Drink menu was not making sense at all. Canned Korean rice wine and canned Korean flavored hard seltzer...? What a conspiracy. Hard to get servers' attention although they have tons of people on the floor. Please stop using Korean culinary terms in your menu and making your staffs to say them incorrectly. It's an insult to Korean heritage. My Thursday dinner got wasted down the drain.
No comment

Worst restaurant - do not go. Ssam bar moved to a commercial building and the tasteless food reflects the loss of culture. It's known for the rice cakes and it is NOT a rice cake - it was uncooked pieces of dough that tasted like nothing. Only reason I can give 1 star is because the drinks had enough alcohol to slightly distract me.
Food and service were solid. The new waterfront location is beautiful, spacious and upscale - however it's missing the east side feel of the previous location...
No comment
No comment

The food was SO GOOD!!! We dined outdoors in the rain and it was warm and comfortable under the heat lamps. Must orders include: chicken wings, spicy scallop kimbap, and spicy sausage ragu rice cakes. The drinks were also amazing! We tried the spicy margarita and PBJ were both amazing.
No comment

This was incredible, as expected. We came with a group of four and got a lot: kimchi, sweet & sour ribs, popcorn shrimp, scallop kimbap, spicy pork sausage rice cakes, cacio pepe rice cakes, and two ssams: the skirt steak and the pork belly. I don't think there was a single thing I wouldn't get again, and it's hard to even say what my absolute favorites were. Gun to my head, maybe the pork belly, cacio pepe rice cakes, and the spicy scallops that came with the kimbap, but ask me again later and I could have a different list -- it was all really excellent. We'll definitely be back.
No comment
Great lunch experience.  Shared the green goddess salad, white kimchi, and pork belly plate.  Bomb.  All of it.  Cocktails were surprisingly excellent.  Best momofuku meal that I've had.

Executive chef left, the once we remembered are just memories now, the tenderness juicynezz of the wings and ribs are gone. No more rolls to accompany the bland raw apps. Although there are new entries that sparks some interest...its just not worth the trip into seaport anymore. But if u are near by i guess its a no brainer.
No comment
No comment

Service right on music great . It felt more like a restaurant that caters to a tourist crowd but after reading other reviews will give it one more shot since we only had the popcorn shrimp and the scallops.Shrimp was terrible PF Chang like except for the lettuce leaves. Scallops fresh with a lot of heat tasty but wouldn't order it again. Wine was good. Bit trendy with the dishes but didn't sample enough to give an overall assessment .
Minus the host ruining our surprise party by letting the birthday girl know "the rest of your party is upstairs"  the food was phenomenal and the drinks were strong.
No comment

The service was good, the food was not.  Everything was so bland, not much flavor.  I rather go to Ktown and have a full on Korean bbq meal over this any day.  I was exciting about the strawberry cheese shave ice, it was not bad but nothing wow about it either.   The salad was a salad, the popcorn shrimp was so boring, the pork belly was not flavorful at all.  I was very disappointed.
No comment
No comment

The bar is at Pier 17 with a nice view of the old vessel and Fidi. The short rib is really food, and the popcorn shrimp with Lettuce wrap is amazing! Cocktail is flavorful. A bit pricy for bar food though
No comment

Make sure you sit at a table and request a window seat. (If you don't, doesn't matter!) I got the prefix menu to get all of the experience. The food was great, atmosphere and service was top notch. Drinks were exotic, and tasted bomb. I would recommend for a date night or special occasion. The vibe was everything, will be returning!
No comment
No comment
No comment

The meal we had was good, it's just that we made a reservation about a month ago and all they had open was the "heated" patio. They stuck us in the corner where there were no heaters. The entire time there were open seats with heaters. Also when I went to the bathroom half the indoor tables were empty! And as of this was not enough, we got a blood orange "cheesecake" for dessert that was basically a runny yogurt parfait. If you've had Noosa or similar Greek yogurts, you've had this, only you saved a lot of money.

Momofuku Ssam is garbage compared to the noodle bar -- which imo. is 100x better. Ssam's quality is comparable to PF chang's. The fish was not fresh, the flavors fell flat, and nothing stood out. The view and staff are nice though.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Totally in love with the steak! Amazing customer service! Beautiful location by the water! Highly recommend!

Beautiful location right by the water! The pork belly & the wings were amazing. I am glad they have the Korean rice beer, Maekgolli. I have nothing but the best to say about all of David Chang's restaurants.
Incredible food! We got the margarita, the ribs, shrimp, cacio e pepe rice cakes, and the fish. All of it was incredible!!

Came here to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday last night. We didn't have a reservation (Thursday) so they put us on the wait list. We waited for an hour- nothing. Turns out that they had written the number down wrong and given the table to someone else. The manager was super apologetic and sat us almost immediately after that- literally as soon as another couple left and the table was cleared. We had the ribs, the American ham & baguette, white kimchi, and the steak. Let me tell you the sweet & sour ribs were the star of the show. Melt in your mouth juicy and seasoned to perfection. I would get a double order as my meal next time lol. Our server was super knowledgeable and attentive as well. Finally, I had to try the PB&J cocktail. I was skeptical but it really tasted like PB&J! It was actually so good. Highly recommend this restaurant even after the little fiasco with seating and be sure to book a reservation- half of that was our fault

Have to admit that I came with very high expectations, having been a long-time listener + viewer of Chang and fan of Chef Eunjo Park. To begin with, the Freisling was fantastic - ice cold till the very end with a delightful lychee flavor. The Hanami highball on the other hand was good but much more subtle than I expected. We had the popcorn shrimp to start and it was very good - a shrimp version of Korean sweet and sour fried chicken, with lettuce wraps and pickled daikon to balance out the grease. Delicious and fun to eat.  For the second course, we had raw scallops. It was a bit of a letdown to find out that they changed the kimbap dishes I've been eyeing to just crudo... Of course, it was a mistake on my part to make the assumption but really hope they keep carrying the kimbap :') And if they do I'll definitely come back for that. Finally, the steak ssam was fantastic - sizzling hot, perfectly cooked, with plenty of veggies and lettuce wraps to eat with.
No comment
No comment

What an amazing experience! The ambiance was great. It was a bit windy when we arrived. They lowered the windows/doors to make it more enjoyable. Our waitress, Clara, was very friendly and informative. Any questions we had were answered with confidence. The food was amazing! If you live in the area; GO. Ask for Clara.

Long time fan and patron of Momofuku restaurants including Noodle Bar, Ssam Bar, Booker and Dax, Nishi and Ko (my 40th birthday, a breathtakingly beautiful and moving experience). Painful and bizarre experience this evening in the Seaport. Arrived early to our dinner reservation at the bar. Waited a while for someone to offer us a drink but eventually bartender did so, and we ordered, happy and excited to eat at a restaurant we've missed in the pandemic, and had never eaten at since its move from the EV. Had the wine list and menus in front of us as we began to cheers our first cocktail and look at the menus. A person--server, manager?--came around to our bar seats in a nearly empty restaurant (there was only one other person there), reached over me and plucked away the wine list. I said in a friendly way: "I was planning on looking at the wine list for dinner." The person looked at me with deadlights, coldly saying: "Should I bring it back or were you planning on holding it for the duration?" with an edge. I looked around in confusion. "Do you need it right now?" Again, deadlights. As if I were holding open the train doors during rush hour preventing the world from moving. She said fine, keep it and brusquely left. Her attitude was the opposite of hospitable. It was provocative, and scornful and ad hominem. It's hard to convey the strangeness and the low grade contempt/rage of the person talking to us in this review. Who cares about the wine list? Not me! Certainly was happy to relinquish it if someone else needed it! But there was no one there in the restaurant besides us and this person's attitude was nothing but disagreeable bordering on hateful. My partner and I looked at each other in bewilderment. We debated what to do and agreed we had no desire to stay for a meal after such a strange and odious interaction. I paid the check for two cocktails and we left, abandoning a dinner we had been looking forward to for a week. I explained to the hostess the reason we were leaving on the way out. She seemed to intuit why we were leaving but didn't apologize, only said she hoped we found a place to eat that we liked, as if we were hard to please, entitled guests. Hard to imagine ever wanting to go back.

OMG, Momofuku Ssam Bar was definitely impressive. The atmosphere and staff are phenomenal. Every single thing that we ordered was incredibly fresh and delicious. The crew was really welcoming and service is perfect. Momofuku Ssam Bar...Check it out I say.
Saam Bar is one of NYC's great restaurants and I'm so excited for its new life in South Street Seaport.
Very disappointing experience at this restaurant. I would say just don't here so many restaurants in NYC don't waste your time going to this one unless you want to leave disappointe.
Popcorn shrimp was fantastic, a bit expensive but that's a given for the area. Great service and clean.

The relocated version of ssam bar is a shadow of its old self. It used to be one of the most creative restaurants in the city. It's all 'just okay' and doesn't do justice to the Momofuku brand. The mall-like environment in the new location also doesn't help.

Chef Jo is back!! Kawi was one of my fave spots in NYC but the location was dark and far. Well now it couldn't be brighter and closer to us in Brooklyn. Relaxed but attentive service. Lacking the pretense of other restaurants of this caliber but still you can tell the team was well trained. The salmon kimbap is a dream - especially as a NY Jew who loves a good bagel and lox. The sausage rice cake was one of the best dishes I've had in a very very long time. For the non-pork eaters, well and even if you are, the cacio is also crazy good. Shaved truffles on top?  Yes pls. And the namesake ssams- pork belly is to die for. Omg the ribs and the wings too!!  Can't wait to go back when it gets warmer and the glass garage door things are wide open. OHHH and the cocktails are awesome!!  Lightseed Champion is a star even tho I don't like rye. And the spicy Korean margarita is delish. And the wine list is stellar. Ok. Rant over. I love it. And I can't wait to come back.

I was a loyal customer at the now closed East Village Saam Bar.  I ate there at least 20 times.  The new version, now at South Street Seaport (the anti-East Village), is a deep disappointment. It has none of the energy or ambiance of the original. It's severely corporate (although the views from the outdoor seating are indeed fabulous), large screen TV's on the walls, & wildly overpriced; the small portions are barely share-able, and the service was lousy (we ordered one cocktail which was served after most of the appetizers had arrived and the waitperson had to be reminded, & one appetizer arrived after the main courses were served, again, after a reminder). The food itself was very good, but the menu is smaller and the variety was limited. Many of the menu items that brought us to the old location were gone and they refused to make anything that was not on the menu (which they would cheerfully do at the old spot).  Did I mention it was overpriced?  I would not go back.  David Chang lost a loyal Saam Bar customer with his move out of the East Village.
No comment

Very unique  relaxed outdoor dining on the Hudson. Really great atmosphere for summer outdoor dining. Limited menu, counter service, seemed a bit odd but worked out great. Views were fabulous. Casual atmosphere ,  burgers, fries, salads, even softshell crab on the menu. Some craft cocktails and craft beers on the drink menu, at reasonable prices. Great for outdoor dining, A very nice find on the water.

Pier 66 is still one NYC's unsung heroes for summertime outdoor dining. Located near Chelsea piers on the Hudson River, the biggest challenge may be location (it's tough to park and it's a far walk from the subways).  Different times of day (and year) determine the crowd; I prefer it for an sunny afternoon lunch. The food and drinks are solid, expectations in check, so if you expect pub/bar type menu with a few dishes a notch up, you'll be fine.  This is also a cool place to book a warm weather private party.

Great place to come and enjoy the gorgeous view! The evening that we went, it was kinda windy but we enjoyed it nonetheless. Food was alright and drinks were also alright. Honestly you come here to dine with a view. Also service was very attentive and I loved the bathroom!! Anyways I'd definitely come back!
No comment
No comment

We were here on a Friday. The view from here is great. Spent about 3-4 hours here. We ordered burgers and fries. It took about less than 15 minutes to get our food which was great considering how busy the place was. The drink here is expensive and wish they had more choices.
No comment
Hostess in the front outside at the pier (young, blond) is very unprofessional and not friendly at all. If you don't want to work, just quit? Instead of scaring customers away

Expensive food and drink on pier 66 Maritime but it is a nice place to sit and enjoy drinking and get drunk with your friends. I went to the place during the week that is why i have a chance to get in even that if i go on the weekend I cannot.
No comment

Great little spot for the summer with amazing views of the city. There are two levels and many areas for seating but everything is self-serve, there is no table service unless you are eating at the Frying Pan, the accompanying restaurant. I came here on a Sunday about 6:00 pm and at 7:00 pm a band came, it was really nice. Minus one star because there are no happy hour specials and everything is pretty much pricey. A bucket of beer ranges from $35-$45 depending on the beer and my boyfriend and I shared calamari, hummus with some fries. Tasty but expensive. The ambiance is lovely but come for the vibes and limit yourself on the drinks and food.
No comment
No comment

If you want to spoilt your romantic wedding anniversary with your second half by hugging the loo all night long and now laying in bed with a fever - order food at this place! I had mahi-mahi tacos and now my last 2 days in NYC are ruined. I wish I could turn back time and order drinks only :(( view is great btw and live band was super energetic
No comment
No comment

This place is a bit pricey in terms of what you get for food and drinks. It's also really crowded and hard to get a table. The views however are amazing and it's a beautiful spot to impress your date at sunset. It may be less crowded on weekdays?

Came here randomly on a Friday afternoon and was not disappointed. Fun laid back ambiance...drinks were fairly priced and plenty of space to stand or sit. We chose to sit on the top deck and we were able to  enjoy the views with the warm sunshine. The bartender was an absolute delight and had suggested spicy margarita which was great. I would definitely go back and try their cucumber beverage!

Most people know about the Frying Pan, but the bar at the pier may be even better (if you're not hungry that is). The drink selection is really great, but you come for the views of course. I came with a group of 6 and it only took a few minutes to get in. We originally sat "inside" because it was os crowded, but then a spot opened up right on the edge of the pier and we were able to collect a bunch of chairs around two small tables. Watching the sunset from the pier should be on everyone's to-do list! Great views of Jersey and great vibes all around.

Cool place to grab an afternoon beer and feel like you're on a boat. Basic bar food with a seafood flare. Nice beer selection too. One of the only places I know in New York you can drink on the water.
No comment
No comment

Disappointing from the beginning. We arrived with a party of 6 and we were not let in as only one of our friends was underage (20 y/o). The bouncer (large man with weird ponytail) was extremely rude and completely ignored us. We were not even planning on having drinks, we just wanted lunch. If you even have one person underage to do not bother coming here. This place doesn't care about its customers, and it just lost a few more.

Stumbled upon this place looking for a place to have brunch. I ordered the mahi tacos and fried chicken sandwich. Both were very disappointing, the chicken didn't seem to be seasoned much at all and the mahi itself didn't have much taste. It almost tasted like tuna. The atmosphere was fun though, if you're looking for a fun social brunch and are willing to sacrifice the quality of the food, this is a good place to go. Keep in mind it is on a boat, and this may depend on the day, but it was moving a lot when I was there. Maybe that could save you money on drinks, which aren't cheap, but the beer is about what you'd expect ($9 for about a 12oz pour)
No comment

I enjoyed this place a lot! It was fun! Bar and restaurant are on the liver and ship. Food is just normal American, but that's fine. This place is best for summer and movie night at the next park :) enjoy your beautiful view and hung out with friends, lover!

Great place for the summer, with a lot of outdoor space, awesome views, and a good selection of drinks and food. It's overpriced, which might be the reason why it was always quite empty every time I went there.

We ordered fish and chips, crab cake salad, and mussels. Fish-and-chips was so good. The french fries were covered with cajun seasoning and they went so well with perfectly crispy fried fish. The portion was largest out of all the dishes we ordered and well worth the price.  For crab cake salad, the salad was not enough even for one person so we will not order them again if we come back but the crab cake was delicious. Mussels were also very good. The boat shifts a little so I felt like getting seasick at first, but I was fine and we enjoyed our food on the second floor watching beautiful sunset!
The venue is great,  food is decent.  I recommend it more of a spot for drinks rather that food.  Food can be a little bit pricey for the quantity you get.  But I overall recommend this place.
No comment

What happened to this place? I used to like it. Our food was simply godawful as was the noise and occasional whiff of an exhaust stink. Even the hamburger tasted like mush--inedible. How can you ruin a hamburger? Fish and Chips were rubber. My daughter couldn't get past two bites. Everything way oversalted and overflavored. Just a miserable experience. Big loss.
I love this place for its awsm view of whole city...enjoy the food alot over here. Service is too good. Must go place especially in fall at evening tym...cheers

I swiped my card to pay for a couple of drinks here. I checked my bank account after leaving NYC and found that the exact same amount was charged at another bar at the same time. Are they sending my credit card info to two places? Scam - not safe.

Great spot on the water with amazing views if you can get a table or seat near the water. We went about 6:30pm on a weekday and it was packed. After walking around we waited and got a table by the water edge. Good food. Food must be picked up at the counter. Drinks were good too. The price was good with all we had. Would go back again!

Came here on a Saturday, but they appearantly close the kitchen sort of early so we just got drinks and appetizers. The food tasted okay but was very expensive. Everything is also self-service. The bartender was nice but the drinks could have used with less ice. The view is the only thing really worth stopping in for.
No comment

The people who work here are the WORST! The bouncers are jerks and aren't trained to handle the crowds this place attracts, so as a result they end up pushing and shoving customers. Last time I was there someone I was with was pushed down the steps by a bouncer who was freaking out about too many people being in the upstairs area. I've had my entire purse dumped out for no reason by security at the front and the bartenders are so rude, they act like they're working at a 5 star restaurant and freak out if you don't move fast enough or leave a huge tip. The view is great and it's a fun place to go in the summer, but I've stopped going back because the people who work there are so awful. I've never eaten here, but I know a bunch of people who have gotten food poisoning from the seafood.
No comment

I give one start because of the cold fried chicken. Not acceptable I didn't complain directly to the kitchen because  in general when you do that they throw the food so please learn how to do fried chicken

The greatest things in life and those that are unexpected.  While tagging along with some friends to stranger's birthday party at Pier 66, I discovered something I think I would have never found on my own, a pier/bar/restaurant in one.  There appear to be a couple of docked ships here (one of which is the Frying Pan) where people can dine as well as a Bar + Grill area that serves way more than just bar food.  My friend and I were starving when we arrived and were pleasantly surprised to find such an extensive selection.  We both ordered the crab cake, which was delicious and spicy, although the avocado on my plate was incredibly under-ripe, I will forgive them this one time, as my friend's was not and she shared some of her avocado with me.  It was plated beautifully, not at all what I'd expect from a "bar." There was music and pitchers of beer and a pretty awesome view.  They're open all day long (not just nights) so you can enjoy lunch out on the pier if you'd like, and only during the warmer seasons, but I'm so glad that I found this place as I'll be sure to return another time.
No comment
No comment
Food BBQ ribs were raw and very bland. soda from the machine no carbonation taste just like syrup. fried Calamari was very dry and over battered
No comment
No comment

Went on a beautiful afternoon. There was plenty of seating and the atmosphere was light. The food was mediocre and the drinks were alright. Lots of room, and a decent place to hang out by the water. The staff was courteous, but be aware that since the establishment is on the water that getting seasick or wet during high tide is a possibility.
Conveniently located if you are on the Hudson River Greenway. Really nice views from the top deck. Mediocre food and service.

The manager: Brent wouldn't let our out of town siblings come sit with us while we ate dinner! Even though they were underage this place doesn't accept any underage people... such a shame! Will not be back and highly don't recommend for a good time! Wish they could have accommodated us by letting the underage have "X's" on their hands to identify as underage.
No comment
No comment

Very cool atmosphere! I came here on a Saturday right as the clock hit noon and it was not busy - within 30 mins the place was packed, so let that be a tip! Get a seat right by the water and enjoy yourself. Good food, but overpriced as expected. I loved the hummus and crab cake was really tasty. My friends had the burger and lemon chicken sandwich (both decent).
No comment
No comment

Great river view..on the river experience.  We were just there for a drink on a hot afternoon, purchased the beer at the bar and seated ourselves by the water.  It is breezy, but it felt great.  Lovely peaceful place and a nice change from the tall buildings of the city.

Whatever you do dont ride your bike to this place.  Especially if its a fairly nice one.  My wife and I road our bikes, locked them right  in front of the 2-3 staff people that great you when you enter the dock.  We returned about 25 minutes later after eating a mediocre veggie burger and my bike lock had been cut with bolt cutters and stolen.  It's a bridge and tunnel money making machine.  If your a real NYer you will most likely not enjoy this gimmick.
No comment

Took my mom to ny for a late Mother's day gift. Once she got up the courage to walk across the mini bridge to the restaurant we were greeted by a very sweet lady named Tara. It was our first time so we ot a bit mixed up and went straight to the bar. As we passed another sweet lady, Stacey greeted us with a great smile and comforted my mother in being on the pier, since it was hard enough to get her there! All was well until we approached the bar. The day was so lovely so I couldn't understand what the "sour lemon" face she was making. I asked her for a menu and she points upward and keeps doing what she was doing. No "hello how are you what can I get you". Then I ask if I can take it dpwn because I couldn't see it. She spat out something about company policy and kept standing there like we would get the menu thru osmosis and hurry up and order and quit wasting her precious time. Then she unravels a ball of paper and hands it to us. Suprise, a menu. We thanked her kindly and her response to our thank you was silence. I said thank you again...silence again. Then she stood there waiting once more. As my mom begin to order and ask questions she rolled her eyes and looked down for the rest of the order...pursing her lips as though taking our order was the equivalent of being forced to clean a restroom. Beautiful restaurant. We were hot, starving, tired and just trying to enjoy the breeze; however an attitude plastered on the face of some bar chic quickly soured the mood and though we cpuld have stayed, there is PLENTY more food in new york city. Pier 66 Maritime ought to have a few more staceys and taras cause im not sure where that young lady came from. Still starving..but folks should know none pf us are obligated to it with your restaurant. ...fix your face and serve if thats what you signed up for....and I promise, we tip pretty damn well ;-)

We finished biking along the Hudson River Greenway bike path today and wanted to get something to eat. My daughter wanted a place by the water so we came across Pier 66 Maritime on Yelp. What a great discover for us it was! Casual atmosphere with a beautiful view of the Hudson River and the NJ skyline. you can catch a great view of the sunset here. Very romantic. However Please note this is a place where you order and pickup your food at the counter and find you own table type of restaurant. No waiter services. Also food is served on plastic plate and utensils(I would have give it a five stàr if they provide real plates and utensils). It was prefect for my family to relax and watch the sunset after a day of biking.
Had the burger and fries which was very good.  Reasonably priced and a good spot right on the Hudson.  Good place to go with groups but usually packed.
No comment

This place is a lot of fun in the summer, but if you go when it's crowded, the lines are crazy. The main bar is reasonable, but the mixed drink/frozen drink bar has some of the worst bartenders in the city, and I think I waited around 40 minutes or more for some overpriced daquiris. Also, when we asked a waitress if she could ask some people to stop smoking, she gave us an attitude about it (even though it's illegal). The best thing about this place? The view is fantastic and it's pleasant to sit in the sun even when it's hot, since there's a breeze. It's best when it's not incredibly crowded.
Mike and Rebecca are so nice - awesome service! And the cookies are the best in town.

This is the second Maman location I've been to and the second one I've been just a bit disappointed with. We ordered lattes and breakfast items to stay, but after we made our order, we were told that they couldn't be made in mugs if we sat in the front seating area. They gave us the croissant on a regular plate but the croissant sandwich came in a to go box, along with the lattes in to go cups. The food and drinks were okay, nothing spectacular, but the experience was marred.

After having a bad experience at another Maman, I just want to commend this Maman location for always opening on time, always having pleasant staff and always getting my coffee order right. These are the little things that I sometimes take for granted, but that keep me coming back to THIS Soho Maman location over and over again. Thank you for being so consistent and dependable!

Have been frequenting the Maman locations to get my iced match latte with oat milk. My husband likes the drip coffee here. Come for the drinks, stay for everything else. Also cookies are top notch here.

Sweet location for brunch gathering! Come early to secure your table. Came here with a dear friend and spent 2 hours eating and enjoying the vibe. The latte was super frothy and yummy for an oat-based milk. The vegan croissant was shockingly tasty. Definitely recommended for a Sunday breakfast/brunch. My friend had the bacon jam and thought it was amazing.

Coffee here was fantastic. $3.50 for ice coffee. Nice decor and customer service was attentive and good. The coffee was made to my liking and it was not crowded. Definitely coming back. It was also very clean.
No comment
Best bread best selection. Amazing amazing food that I highly recommend you go to asap if you haven't already!
No comment
Quite overpriced but good quality coffee. The jersey city location has lesser options though but the seating area is bigger than the Manhattan locations

Near the Whitney this is a great place to grab a coffee and some pastries.  Maman has an upscale vibe and the interior design has a cafe like feel.  The pastries were great and there are servers for the tables.
I really enjoyed the food here. Nice relaxed atmosphere and friendly staff. Brunch was great and honestly hard to pick from the menu.
No comment

Cute sit down spot to grab something to eat and drink. I loved the decor in the inside and the service was nice and helpful too. I ordered the Jessi Eggplant Caprese Panini with a hot chai latte and they were both really good. The food took a while to get to our table though, but it was okay. Overall it was a good experience and I'll be coming back.

Very nice place ... amazing ambiance and great coffee... don't forget the pastries  ... definitely a place to come back

As cute and aesthetically pleasing Maman was, my experience here was not the greatest. Coming on a weekend was a huge mistake because it was so packed. The storefront is where you would order and pick up your food and drinks and the space was small that everyone was just crowding around; it felt very hectic. There were a lot of tables in the back though, but it is a self service space. My friends and I did have to line up for a while to order, but it did not take too long for our drinks to come out. We got the iced honey lavender latte and it was just ok. It didn't have very strong honey, lavender, or espresso taste. None of the pastries we got were heated up. To be honest, not sure if they would've been willing to do that anyways. The banana bread was dense. The famous cookie was alright, but a little too crispy for my liking. The almond chocolate croissant was perfectly sweet, but it wasn't a light and fluffy croissant..it looked like it was squished and dense. I had really high expectations for this spot as there are so many good reviews, but honestly, it's overrated.

Such a cute little cafe. I picked this spot for my work from home and it exceeded my expectations. Everyone is super friendly inside.
Delicious. Beautiful interior. Wish I could have stayed and eaten but had to take food to go.
Store was cute and pastries looked tasty. Cute decor. Matcha latte was okay. Wish it was sweeter

The waiter recommended the Katie sandwich and it was soooo good omg. I haven't had a good sandwich like this in a long time. Nice and toasted, make sure you get the avocado on it as well. The ambience is beautiful as well, cozy and delicate vibe. I will definitely be coming back when I'm in the area.

I had an everything croissant here and it was really good!! Would def come back for another. Coffee was also good, but nothing crazy outta this world. It's a cute little place with a good amount of indoor seating. Not 100% if they have wifi but seems like a good place to go and work at. The staff was really kind, and helpful when ordering (:
Food is fine. Service is bizarre and dismissive. Would not return or recommend to friends

This spot is super adorable! Came in at around lunch and there wasn't much of a crowd yet. The staff is polite and the food is good! The only hiccup I had was that I  originally ordered a Valentine's Day latte which looked very cute and yummy. I asked if it were possible to substitute the almond milk with oat as I'm allergic and they said yes, later I had to change my order because they said it wasn't possible. Still over all a good experience and a very cute spot!

Super cute brunch! My salmon tartine was on THE BEST rye bread. Very happy with my overpriced aesthetic brunch!!

No comment

I went to this cute cafe two weekends ago when I was in nyc. I got the honey lavender latte and the pistachio chocolate croissant. Omg the croissant was amazing, I still dream about it. The filling was perfect and the outside was the perfect amount of crispiness. I really want to back here to try some of their other pastries and brunch dishes!

How have I not reviewed Maman? Maman is my happy place. I knew it the minute I walked in 7 years ago and that's why I decided to work here! Everything is so tastefully curated by Elisa Marshall. You don't come for the food, but if you're getting something the lavender hot chocolate and the nutty chocolate chip cookie would be my picks. They've also started serving alcohol and the happy hour is a great find. You can get a yummy cocktail for $8.

Stopped in here for a quick breakfast the other morning, tasty sandwiches and friendly service, but it did take a while for the order to come up. It was not a quick in and out on a Thursday morning.  The blueberry white chocolate chip cookie was definitely the best pastry they had, the pain au chocolate was fine, and the passion fruit cake while interesting in flavor was a tad dry.  The ham and cheese croissant was good, but it's that blueberry cookie muffin thing that I would go back for.

We stopped in for coffee on a Saturday afternoon and it was surprisingly pretty empty inside. We also grabbed a chocolate chip cookie (bc Oprah said so) and a Snickerdoodle. The chocolate chip was quite good; the perfect amount of salt to balance the rich dark chocolate chips. But honestly the snickerdoodle was an unexpected gem! Crunchy on the outside, doughy on the inside...and perfectly spiced. We were disappointed at how empty the pastry case was, but honestly what we had was quite good and we would come back for sure.

Must try in soho! Great espresso, amazing pastries, and such a cute cafe. I got the cappuccino with almond milk, the 3 egg omelette, and strawberry almond croissant. The omelette was looaaded with the 3 mix ins I chose (ham, tomatoes, and red peppers) and was very well made. The strawberry almond croissant was to die for- not too sweet & perfect amount of strawberry almond filling. I tried my friends pistachio chocolate croissant which was a lot sweeter and packed with pistachio cream. Great if you have a sweet tooth. My friend also had the breakfast sandwich which she loved. The bourbon fig jam made the sandwich and the flavors were very balanced. She had the iced honey lavender latte (with house made syrup!) and loved it. Aesthetic rating would be 10000/10. Love maman.
This cafe has such a nice aesthetic. I got the caprese panini ($14). I was pleasantly surprised by the portion and that it came with a side salad. The panini was super yummy and hit the spot.

Omg this cafe was SO cute. I felt like I was in a garden - wooden structures adorned with leaves and flowers and Taylor Swift was playing in the background, the whole atmosphere felt so ethereal. I stopped by for an iced chai latte with oatmilk. It came out super quickly and was one of the best lattes I've ever ordered. They also had a wide selection of pastries which I'll definitely have to try the next time I come.

My son got a sandwich and said it was really good! It was gluten free turkey sandwich. The service was fast and good. I loved the space, it was very inviting with a good amount of seating. 1 shared public restroom, which was nice to have access to. Lots of yummy looking desserts too!
No comment
Horrendous service, toxic energy. Every single interaction with the staff here over the years has been consistently rude and petty on their end. Never again!

Came in for a work lunch and ordered ahead. If you sign up for their emails, you get $5 off your first order! I got a salad and a cookie, and when I arrived at the restaurant they were both ready despite it being a very busy lunch hour for them. Overall would definitely recommend this location of maman for a healthy lunch (and an indulgent dessert!)

Hang out with my friend. Ordered the popular Camacho latte, large cup costs around 7 dollars. It looks pretty and taste great. Environment is also good.

We found Maman's at the new Moynihan Train Hall. My wife and I ordered a couple of sandwiches.  I had the Caitlin's Charcuterie and my wife had the Francine Ham and Cheese.  Very expensive for what you get. The bill for two sandwiches was over $30. I tried to pay with cash, giving the cashier a $50 bill. I was sternly told - No bills over $20 are accepted. I don't know if they are afraid of counterfeit or just don't like big bills. If it is the latter, they should reduce their prices. The bread was extremely tough and hard for both sandwiches. My jaw was so tired after eating the sandwich. It was really a work-out.  The only good thing about the place was that it wasn't busy while all of the other eating establishment's had long lines. I soon learned why that was.

the food is amazing but I waited over 25 minutes for 1 sandwich.   the place us busy but you can literally see 2 people in the kitchen area texting on their phones while people are waiting
Nice cute place.. cozy garden with good breakfast and pastries. Good for big parties and private events.
this chain has quality control. tried the soho and upper west side locations. perfect Cortados, croissants...pleasant ambiance.
I tried it cappuccino, regular milk, and it was delicious. I highly recommend this tiny spot for coffee, breakfast or a brunch. The salmon salad looks good, a friend tried it and recommended to me.
No comment
No comment

I really enjoyed Maman. Their pastries and sandwiches were delicious, and the setting was great for brunch. We got a chicken sandwich, a breakfast sandwich, and a lox bagel. We also got an almond croissant, a pistachio chocolate croissant, and a few of their chocolate chip cookies. The matcha lemonade soda was also great! Would recommend if ever in Soho for a quick and easy meal.

As delightful as it is to have more and more Maman locations pop up in the city, there is no beating the original.  With its relaxing patio seating and atmosphere, Maman is a go-to destination for a coffee/lunch break day in and day out.  The selection of speciality coffee drinks and snacks is consistently robust and high in quality.  The nutty chocolate chip cookies are delicious and gives Levain and Chips a run for their money.  You know that a spot is doing something right when the queues are constantly extended out the entrance.

The nutty chocolate chip cookie here is the best! We were searching throughout NYC for some of the best cookies and bakeries, and Maman consistently showed up on the list. This cookie made it to Oprah's Favorite Things a few years ago, and it's such a delicious cookie! I'm a huge fan of chocolate chip cookies, and the nuts in this one really complemented the chocolate flavor and texture.

Maman is a great coffee, food, and dessert spot located in the city. I have been to several locations and have never been disappointed. The coffee and food always seem very fresh and you can't beat the cute interior. If your ever looking for a location to "work from home" or get a pick me up - this is your spot!

Never really ate a cookie from Maman before or at least I don't remember I did. I went to the Spring Street  location because duh it's the original. For $4.60 the nutty chocolate chip cookie was divine. The best chocolate chip cookie in NYC. IMO better than Levain. The texture of the crispy outside and the soft inside made it a great combination. You can taste the chocolate chips and the nuts without it being too nutty. It's heaven in your mouth. I ordered 3 just cuz. No doubt you'll eat the best cookie in NYC at Maman.
It was a ling wait for have a table on Sunday. But the food was great. We ordered a papa's bowl which was a little much greasy. But the egg ratatouille was so good.
No comment

I have been wanting to try this coffee shop for quite some time and it certainly lived up to the hype. I had a regular latte which was the perfect ratio of delicious espresso and milk. The pastries were the real star, however. The nutty chocolate chip cookies are amazing, and the chocolate almond croissant is easily the best I've ever had. The chocolate latte cookie was also really good, and the chocolate hazelnut flan.
No comment

Maman is always wonderful. The look and ambiance is amazing. The lemon poppyseed cookie was a let down but the brown butter coconut oatmeal cookie is to die for. So good!!! The chocolate chip cookie has nuts, which isn't my thing, but other's love it.
No comment
No comment
Great breakfast sandwich and breakfast platter. Cute atmosphere especially in the back with two separate chique places to sit. Drip coffee and hot chocolate also great.

As soon as you walk in such a cute aesthetic, looks like a great spot to dine in but I did take out! There are a great variety of pastries but I tried the pistachio loaf cake and the pistachio chocolate croissant. Clearly I was in a pistachio mood . I'm not sure if they have the ability to warm up pasties (wasn't offered so I didn't ask) still great pastries, the loaf was a little on the drier side. I ordered an iced honey lavender latte but sadly, it lacked much of the honey and lavender part. My friend got the guava juice which was exceptional, super fresh, on the sweeter side but I think it's a great summer drink! She also got the iced blueberry lavender latte. It looked pretty but also lacked the lavender flavor. Overall I think the place was very cute but I wasn't the biggest fan of the coffee and/or the pastries. I think have to give it another chance though since they have so many options! BTW there is a QR code special out front (get $5 off your first order).

I came here for the first time. And I was excited to try this place. I ordered ICE blueberry lavender cappuccino. It tasted weird and I asked to change i didnt drink at all only try. It was sour and couldn't handle the taste. So I asked waitress if I can exchange to something else she went to ask manager and he came. He was not happy to exchange my order he said no one was complaining before and I explained that I don't really like it. The manager was not professional to handle this situation and said in-front of me to waitress that give her to change but it will be last time second he can't do it ( I understand but I am sorry I didn't like it but don't need to be so rude). The manager had attitude towards me that he really unhappy about it. The waitress was really nice. I feel bad for her to work with him.
No comment
No comment

Wonderful ambiance and great service. The pastries are delicious. I enjoyed my food, I had the breakfast bowl and the salad also looked really delicious. I would skip the avocado toast, it reminded me of guacamole.

I ordered lunch through Ritual and stopped by for the first time recently. When I stopped by, I also noticed a Little Paris sign near Maman. Never been here before, but it's exciting to discover a Little Paris in NYC! Maman is a cute cafe with sandwiches, beverages, and baked goods. The Ritual menu isn't the same as the cafe's in person menu though and I'm not sure why. Pickup process was a bit confusing since they didn't have a separate line for pickup orders (I had to wait in the same line as people ordering in person). Once I picked up the food, I decided to eat outside. They have a cute little outdoor dining area. The sandwich and salad were fantastic! Authentic French food, with high quality ingredients. I loved the crispy bread and the generous amounts of Brie in the sandwich. I'd totally order from here again! Hopefully next time, it's easier to pick up an online order.
Great yummy pastries! I feel like the quality of the food and drinks have downgraded since Maman became popular on Tiktok but nevertheless a nice bakery for a coffee meet up!

A bit more crowded than the other NYC mamans, but the quality is still the same. Their famous chocolate chip cookie never fails and I highly recommend it to all the first timers. I was also surprised how delicious the carrot soup is! The spices and flavor were blended together very well.
No comment
No comment
Perfect cafe to spend a calm afternoon. The pastries and coffee are divine and the multiple locations I've been to are all beautiful. My favorite is cookie in NYC is from Maman. Must visit!

Got the nutty chocolate chip cookie at a friend's recommendation and it was really good! Apparently Oprah named this cookie one of her favorite things and I can see why. The cookie has a generous amount of macadamia nuts, walnuts, and almonds that complement the chocolate really well. The only thing that could've made it better would be if it were served warm. They also seem to run out quite quickly so scoring a cookie is not guaranteed--we came around 11am as a group of 4 and got lucky snagging the last 4.

Such a great little spot!!! The decor is so cute, making it the perfect spot for a nice brunch or even a work meeting. For my fellow coffee lovers, their coffee is to die for! My fave thing to eat is most definitely their avocado toast. As soon as I tried this place I made sure to go back the next day. Def a must try.
No comment
No comment

The ambiance and food was great. I had a very good experience here. Although I was kind of disappointed because I thought the famous Nutty Chocolate Chip Cookie was going to be served on a nice plate, but instead I got it in a bag. They also did not have any quiches, which is what I wanted to order, but there are so many other delicious items to try instead. I would definitely come here again.

I ordered a pumpkin oatmeal cookie today that was overcooked /borderline burnt, very disappointed when I opened the bag but I was already on my way home and starving. At first I thought the pumpkin made it look darker, but it actually tasted burnt around the edges. Definitely expect better from this place, especially for the price you pay
No comment
No comment
No comment

It is with great sadness that I must deduct 2 stars from my earlier review. The deduction is customer service based. Staff messed up my order; unfortunately, I did not realize this until today--2 days later. As previously stated, I ordered 2 nut chocolate chip cookies and a slice of zucchini bread. I ate one of the cookies and the zucchini bread, saving the other cookie for later. When going to eat the second cookie today, I learned that there was no cookie. In its place there was some sort of lemon flavored pastry that I did not order. Very Disappointing. Please make sure to check your order before leaving.
No comment

Amazing food, painfully slow service. Stopped in for brunch with my family on a Sunday morning. No line, but it took a few minutes for the hostess to come out from inside and seat us. Took seemingly forever for a server to get our orders. The food itself didn't take long to arrive. We actually got our food before we got our coffees for some reason. We thoroughly enjoyed what we had. I ordered the papa's lunch bowl. My wife had the pain perdu and my daughter had a chocolate croissant. Maman is a true French cafe and it showed. Everything was great. Unfortunately, the server disappeared after we got our food and it took forever to get the check. Meanwhile, a long line started to build outside. If not for the slow service, that line would move much quicker. The verdict: As long as you don't have to be anywhere, it's worth a visit.
Big outdoor dining area. Very busy location. If you can, download the app and order online.

We were starving and cranky after a day of shopping and decided to stop in here for a quick cup of coffee and I am so glad we did! Although it doesn't look like much from the outside, this spot has delicious cookies, especially their famous nutty cookie. The barista even gave us a couple of the broken cookies for free when she noticed there were three of us. Although we weren't planning on eating them all, they were so delicious we couldn't help ourselves. Definitely stop by if you're looking for a good latte and a sweet treat!
No comment

Maman is absolutely fantastic for a quick brunch or snack. Their pastries are *chef kisses* and their quiche makes me full and happy while staying mostly healthy (enough to enjoy a cookie at least!) the one star is removed because their is typically a slow moving line to order, and the service is sometimes fantastic sometimes semi non existent. But none the less if you have time on a week day when they are less busy, a great try.
No comment

My order was late, very messy and missing items. When I called to talk to the restaurant, the man on the line was very rude and didn't try to help at all. It's very unfortunate to see a place that used to serve quality food and have good customer service decline like this.

This place is a lovely space where there's very limited technology use. People are generally catching up or reading. The space is dim yet well lit with a lot of (fake) greenery -- such a perfect place to study etc
cute place! food was anything special though but also nothing to complain about. they honey lavender latte was especially good though.
How can you not rate this 5 stars!!!!!  Pastries and cookies were amazing and my chia latte was made w love
Stunning and serene in its simplicity and elegance . If you sit in the back it's soothing as well on beautiful days. A nice place to chill with a morning coffee.

If you're looking for a cute little cafe with good food and pastries, maman is the place to go!The truffle croque maman was delicious. The cheese was perfectly melted, the sandwich was toasted to perfection and the truffle was just the right amount. I paired the dish with the mint tea - breakfast of champs!
No comment

cute!vibes! from the little tile tables to delicate plates & weaved dessert baskets...love it. but I came to eat with my mouth not eyes:') we got the daily assorted dessert basket which came with a pistachio pound cake, chocolate croissant, and regular croissant. and to be quite frank, the pound cake was dry & hard to swallow..the croissants very average - minimally flakey, lacked a buttery aroma, slightly dry - my high expectations (given the high reviews and elaborate decor) of this place were unfulfilled...definitely not bad food,  just not impressed!! the blue latte (forget what it's called) was also strangely watery and not really appealing to my commoner tastebuds:') service was quite slow but friendly, probably for the relaxing vibe. overall this place gives a great visual experience so I can't be too upset!!

Came for a coffee date and didn't plan on ordering food but we ended up ordering the farm gardens or something like that from the kitchen. It's actually pretty good, coffee was nothing special though. I'd return to try to some other dishes.

Hit or miss - some things were really good (grilled cheese sandwich was awesome and desserts were good) but others were disappointing. The feta quiche was ok - ton of cheese but not many other flavors, and the ratatouille was also okay but not anything exciting. I prefer Tatte close by!

Visited maman during my stay in the city on a snowy stormy morning. The food was phenomenal especially the breakfast bowl. Everything was seasoned well and packed a punch in flavor. I tried out their seasonal torched chestnut hot chocolate and it was beyond spectacular. A must visit when in NYC!
No comment
No comment

Loved the store very cute and clean . Service was okay the drinks came in fast but had to ask for croque sandwich as they have forgotten waited over half an hour. Cookies were great and the kids love them!

Maman was not bad, but nothing incredible. I had the dulce de leche hazelnut croissant and honey lavender latte. The croissant filling was good, but it wasn't light or flaky like I would expect a croissant to be, and it was cold. I was not a huge fan of the latte, while it tasted quite strongly of lavender I didn't think it was sweet enough and I couldn't taste any honey. The man who took my order was very kind though. It wasn't a terrible experience but I'm not sure if I would return since there are better places in the city.
No comment
Super cute, cozy, and well located. I really enjoyed the breakfast sandwich and my latte, which I was able to get in a to-go cup on my way out. Highly recommend!

I've come here once for the cookies which were absolutely fantastic (one of the best in NYC I've had), but I stopped by for brunch today. They have limited outdoor seating, but we were able to secure a table. I ordered the eggs ratatouille, which was a fine dish aside from the fact that the overcoating of tomato sauce made it so that the cooked vegetables weren't able to shine. While the ratatouille itself was average, I'll bump up the rating on behalf of how good their cookies are.
No comment
No comment

Perfect for a rainy day stop in SoHo all pastries were delicious specially the pistachio pain au chocolat and the Lavender Honey Latte is to die for the space is small but full of details with French vibes... it is awesome
Great Salads, coffees and pastries! Beautiful decor ! Friendly staff!! Great addition to the neighborhood!
No comment
Mike is absolutely an amazing server. He was personable, fun, and made sure we had all we needed! Thank you for making our time here amazing!
No comment

Be transported to France on this cute side street in a cafe designed for catching up with old friends, coffee dates that you hope to make more, and serious discussions.  Everything is better with chocolate and their cookies (loaded with nuts) show up and show off. I could not believe what I was tasting and needed confirmation. Surely they had not only gotten my coffee order perfect but someone in the kitchen had baked the PERFECT cookie. Whoa.... don't judge me. Like you have never pulled someone else along on your crazy just so you feel less guilty by buying them a decadent cookie and force feeding them on a Friday.  Nope... just me. Ok then judge away but when you are having this afternoon treat you will blame me.
Incredible first trip to Maman!  Amazing server, flavorful food!  Too bad we live on PA!

AVOID ON WEEKENDS! This review is based on experience ordering drinks through the app and does not reflect experience eating in: This is a cute spot but it is very small and often crowded.  I've had same experience more than once when ordering through their app:It takes over twenty minutes to get one drink from the espresso bar. I've usually been there in the afternoon and employees seem to be exhausted, drained and irritated. I will probably just stick to getting coffee from Starbucks and visiting other Maman locations in the city and avoiding this one until they expand to accommodate to the demand in the neighborhood.
Maman has really cute flower decorations and outdoor seating. I love this place because i can grab breakfast before heading to the office or snack during lunch break.
The Katie sandwich was delicious. I'll go in person soon to sit and hopefully enjoy the service.

I looove this cafe! Atmosphere is amazing, coffee is delicious, and the food I've gotten has also been delicious. Their chocolate chip cookie is bomb and I also really enjoyed their croissant! Overall, a go to cafe in New York that I will  continuously return to.
No laptop policy is weird and the drinks are overpriced and syrupy. Go anywhere else to get your coffee fix. Also no AC i think? It's hot in here

Found this place near our Airbnb and loved it, we went almost every morning while we were in town. The pastries are amazing and so is the coffee. Pricey but worth it imo

Top notch everything.  Fancier than fancy.  I'm impressed and the vibe is much more down to earth than expected.
Great Food!!! Been there a couple of times with different family and friends, and they liked it.

Terrible service - worst I have ever experienced in the city. Can't comment on the food because I'm still waiting. Waited so long for someone to take my order from my table that I went to the counter where they told me that I needed to order from my table...? Then someone came over and took my order, telling me that FYI the kitchen closes in 5 minutes (at 8:30 am? ). So it is now 20+ minutes later. Coffee is empty, food is nowhere. It's cute in here, but my advice is to find anywhere else.

Stopped into the cookie pop up they are having for Christmas on Saturday. The cookies are quite pricey but super yummy and unique! We got the Nutella stuffed cookie and the peanut butter caramel popcorn cookie. The Nutella cookie was absolutely delicious. Gooey and filled with a substantial amount of Nutella in the center. The caramel cookie was a bit overwhelming but still delicious! They have about 6 cookies they have everyday as well as one special cookie each day. Check their Instagram for the flavor of the day! Get it before it's gone for the season

Maman is more than just a pretty face! Everything from the coffee to the pastries to the mains hit the mark. I got the honey lavender latte and man did that hit the spot on a brisk fall day. It was like a hug in a mug. Staff was super friendly and accommodating as well!
It's a cozy, sweet, friendly place:) food is delicious, service is good, interior is cute, portions are generous. Definitely a great find:)
Super cute (check out the hidden garden in the back) with great food. A bit overpriced (for drinks especially), but loved my visit there regardless.
No comment
I went to 4 cafes to try to find somewhere to work, this came up in a list of laptop friendly cafes. That they are not.

I have always walked past here on my way home and it looks so pretty from the outside. I finally decided to go last week for breakfast and it was really good! My dad and I thought it was a bit expensive but after eating the food I felt that it was worth it. I got orange juice and the Katie sandwich which came with a side salad. I thought it was very flavorful and fresh which was just what I needed. My dad got the papas breakfast bowl which looked really good and I tried some of the bacon jam from him and it was SOOO GOOD. Recommend this place for breakfast but be ready to spend around $20 per person.

This is one of the best place for well-baked goods and a cup of coffee. The food is well-prepared and had smooth flavor and good texture. I like their croissant and Muffins taste really good and super delicious. The coffee taster really delicious too, especially the Cappuccino. Wonderful place and lovely setting.

Pretty sweet creme brulee latte. Also ordered a chai latte which was pretty decent - nothing special. Super aesthetic place and want to visit other locations for the aesthetics. Highlight of the visit was how kind the staff was.

I hate to leave a mediocre rating for a bakery that makes scrumptious cookies, but sit-down service was atrocious for Sunday brunch. I'd come years ago when maman had only this location, and it was nice experience then, but the restaurant is seriously understaffed at the moment.  The server, albeit nice, never came to our table without being flagged down or chased after. We had to ask for water twice, as twenty minutes after being seated we didn't even get tap water, just empty glasses.  We weren't the only ones waiting for service either. Other customers at different tables kept standing and looking around, waiting to tell someone that they wanted to order, or to pay, or to make corrections to their meals. The eggs ratatouille was good and the decor is pretty. The pistachio chocolate croissant was a bit too sweet and soft, the cortado too bitter. Overall I would not recommend sitting down for a meal. I've had the cookies on different occasions, and these are fantastic, and the main reason to visit-- but order at the counter and take them to go.

The pastries were good but the sandwiches were bad, my cousin and I ordered the "Brianna sandwich" and the food was cold. Also the juices kind of bitter and the staff did not give a good service, they just take your order to the table and forget about you.

OMG! probably one of the best croissant I've had in a while! The interior is so cute, everything is pretty much open; open kitchen for us to see what's going on. Their pastries are to die for! had the chocolate croissant, dulce beignets, pistachio loaf bread. It's fluffy, a little flaky and not too sweet! Pair it with a cup of coffee, and your morning/day is set.
No comment

Honestly wasn't my favorite. I ordered an iced latte and it tasted like burnt coffee, not even espresso. The interior of the coffee shop was adorable, though, but the drink itself does not leave me wanting more. I'd give it a 3/10.

Mmmmmmaman! Sweet garden dining area with Parisian ambiance. The food was delicious and the portions were certainly scaled up for American appetites lol. The "Un Deux Tois" was a satisfyingly light dish consisting of a variety of 3 spreads & tapenade and tasty crunchy toast. My husband ordered the salmon toast which I was happy to help him finish  coffees were perfectly prepared and got us going with just the right amount of energy to start the day!

Was trying to do some readings on my iPad, and was approached by a person worked here and told me that laptops are not allowed almost in a yelling manner. He could have asked me more nicely and told me to understand what they are trying to avoid. I wasn't the first one to use so-called laptop devices in this space (someone else was using their laptops before I came in, and he walked to me to yell at me), and I thought that was very rude. So laptops are NOT at all here. FYI. Prob also not self-dining, unless you are reading printed books or on your phone or just spacing out.

I haven't been back there on the weekends, got some lunch with my friend. They have full service this location only on the weekends. chai late was hot delicious. It's a very quiet block to sit down and enjoy some air outside. The Asian lady who was taking care of us was 5 star attentive and sweet and her friend was nice too. Always love it there;) I missed their back yard siting in the summer so much;)

Pretty good.  Try the ham and cheese quiche and the Nutty Chocolate Chip cookie. I would definitely go back.
No comment

Maman Soho is gorgeous and very insta-friendly if you're looking for that cute shot surrounded by flowers. But I'm sad to say that their coffee and pastries are just okay and their service even less so. The pistachio flavor on the loaf cake tasted very artificial, the pistachio & chocolate croissant had a better flavor. The strawberry croissant bun was okay too. Their iced americano was sour, but that's just personal preference.
Delicious pastries. Location is great. Will come again for more pastries. The omelette was okay nothing special. Portion is bigger than i had expected though so that's great

Searched around our hotel for a breakfast spot to pick up and bring back to the hotel.  Found this cafe on Yelp and decided to try it, but they are very short staffed.  Wanted to try a few sandwiches but seeing the lines and people in the back waiting for food, decided to just get coffee and a few pastries.  Got the chocolate croissant, pistachio croissant and zucchini bread slice.  The pastries were delicious although wished they warmed it up a little.  I would definitely come back and try if in the area, I can see the potential, you just have to go when you have ample time and not rushed to make check out time at the hotel :)
What a cute little shop! Everything was so yummy. Would definitely come again next time I'm in the city.
No comment

There were things we loved about our lunch and things that were not so great. Most of the food was fantastic. I had the best coffee--a honey lavendar latte made with almond milk, so good. My nieces split a raspberry rose white chocolate cookie and it was amazing. It's a good thing they split it as it took a while for our food. And then three of us were served and it was at least ten minutes longer before my other nieces chicken sandwich arrived--that shouldn't happen--food should all come out at the same time. And my other nieces food wasn't the way she'd ordered--a croissant sandwich with a well cooked egg and no mustard sauce. Hers arrived smothered in mustard sauce with a runny egg. They took it back and then a few minutes later brought a new one with an apology--but this time it was missing the cheese and the egg was even runnier! She didn't send it back again, just ate what she could. My salad with kale and rosemary grilled chicken was delicious and my sister's egg hash and potato was also very good. So it was mixed for us. Pretty surroundings and the bakery items looked insanely delicious. I would go again--maybe it was just an off day.

Such a great experience at Maman! We did wait a little while for a server to come to our table (less than 10 minutes) but she was very apologetic and service was timely after that. I had a hard deciding what to order because there were so many dishes that sounded amazing, which is always a good problem to have. I got the seasonal blueberry lavender oat milk latte, which was delicious and made with fresh ingredients. We also got a pastry assortment that included 3 different pastries of the chef's choice; ours included a plain croissant, a chocolate croissant, and a pistachio loaf cake. My brother and I both agreed the croissants were the best we have ever had and the pistachio loaf cake was phenomenal. My brother got a breakfast bowl while I went with the caprese panini, which was so incredibly good. The space and decor is adorable as well. They have a covered outdoor garden area that I would love to sit in the next time we visit. 10/10!!!
No comment

Great vibe, kind employees, excellent food and coffee. Ordered the Maman breakfast sandwich and Brianna sandwich and both were fantastic.
It is a wonderful place to spent your afternoon! A cup of coffee and a plate of dessert is all you need to enjoy a joyful afternoon.
No comment

I just think this place is so cute. I've been here several times and it's just such a nice little coffee shop in the area. The baristas are always nice, the coffee is good, the baked goods look amazing (I don't have a sweet tooth, otherwise I would have tried one of everything by now- and honestly I'm still tempted. They also have outdoor seating, just as an FYI!

Cashier is very rude and unpleasant. Visited shop for the first time yesterday, was asking for recommendations for most popular iced coffee as it was our first time. Cashier was very unhelpful and not polite. Unfortunately our communication/ experience with her put a damper on the whole experience.
Nice location and vibe. Ive been here twice. First time the latte was decent. Second time i had extremely sour under-roasted drip coffee.

Almond croissant was perfectly baked and coffee was 4/5. The restaurant was closed due to private event, but it seemed like to a good place to grab something light and healthy.

Stopped by during the pop-up they had for the holiday season. The wait wasn't super long and the store inside smelled heavenly! I tried the "miracle on centre st" and wow. Nice hint of spices and not super sweet. Hoping they bring it back in 2021!
cannot describe how good the croque madam was. the place is so so cute too. love the presentation of everything

I would definitely recommend this location the food is very sanitizing the location is extremely clean the staff is extremely nice but you will see the heat and the location is really bad is always extremely cold it makes me feel really staff writer
We only had bakeries and coffee there so this review is for that. They for sure have a ton of really good looking options. The ones we tried were good but I wouldn't probably crave to go back.

An adorable outdoor seating space! I ordered a specialty drink which was the creme brûlée cappuccino. I had never heard of such thing so I was intrigued. I was beyond glad with my decision the torched sugar top was so amazing.

Great food and ambiance, and this location had ample and comfortable outdoor seating in front and in a back patio. I had the quiche and soup and both were excellent.

I would give a 5 start but they lost it due to the matcha iced latte. It was so water downed ended up throwing it out. However on the bright side the bowl was so fulling and delicious. The hummus tasted very fresh and natural. Overall a good experience

The combo breakfast selection of choice is great. Their tableware collection is nice. However, we could not sit in the backyard during covid. The outdoor setting is not as nice as other cafe set up. I understand it is for temporary use during covid but they can do much better to attract more guests. No outdoor heating as well. Service is ok only.

This was a really nice cafe with very cute decorations and great food. I had avocado toast with a fried egg and I loved it. As well as the Katie sandwich which was even better. The iced matcha was really full of flavor and came with almond milk. I loved the chocolate chip cookie. I think it's worth it and fairly priced.

Delicious coffee!  Pastries are exquisite and fresh out of the oven. A must visit when in the city. Bring to LA!!!!
