I love Maman and this location didn't disappoint. Coffee was good, the staff was very friendly and there is plenty of outdoor seating. They now carry decaf espresso too.

The coffee and the pastries are amazing. But I tried the omelette and it was too salty and over cooked the side salad comes with a balsamic vinegar too thick and strong it feels like adding ketchup to your French fries. Overall after I finish with the acidity of the vinegar and the saltiness of my omelette my mouth and stomach felt like eating a large bag of extra salted lays.
Came across this adorable spot and was surprised by how delicious their pastries are and the staff was also very friendly.

Pastries are amazing! Cute little spot it's easy to miss though. Service was great too, I ate the homemade Oreo cookie and highly recommend that. The croissant was buttery and delicious will be back
No comment

It's just so... French. And that is a wonderful thing. Roomy spot with all of the right touches. Delicious Americano and made-to-order omelette. I wanted to eat everything on the menu. Just might next time. I'll come back for a quickie quiche...

I've been going to this place for years... so it about time I share how much I love this place.... The cookies and pastries.... Exceptional!!!!! Always fresh and always delicious.  Also I must say the nicest people work there. I've see how they help every customer with genuine hospitality!!!!!!!!A must stop and a convienent location.

I've heard so much about this place but sadly I was so disappointed! We went in on a Wednesday morning around 9:30am and ordered our coffee (cold brew and iced latte) and a chocolate chip cookie. We went to the back to sit and enjoy our coffee but all the tables had not been bussed yet so we sat down and thought it would get cleaned up soon enough. We waited 20 minutes for my coffee and ate our cookie at the dirty coffee. I ended up just getting my latte to go and leaving someone else's dirty table. It should definitely not take more than 20 minutes for a latte....There was another couple who had a similar experience. The cookie was great, albeit overpriced at $4.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Good matcha latte, their baked goods looked delicious I'd go back to try them. Indoor and outdoor seating is cute and comfortable.  However, the music was too loud inside for me to get work done.
No comment
No comment
No comment

3 stars for the cookie I had. Also felt like I was back in Paris, so that's 2 stars there for a total of cinco. Wish there was a place like this in Jersey City. We spent the day finding places with amazing cookies and this was definitely First Place for me. The vibe was cool, line to order and pay was a little too intimate but I definitely liked the place and we were in there for just 3 minutes. Will be back for sure. Better than going to Starbucks.

Always understaffed and service is always sloooooow. And I'm talking about orders to go.10 minutes to get a sandwich heated up as they are in the fridge. Can't possibly think about the waiting time if you want to be seated. Food is good, though.

So we spent the weekend at the city... although the city is not like it used to because of Covid.. but somehow we managed to enjoy our time. We found this little place and we had an awesome brunch. Hubby had the breakfast platter .. my little one waffles and I had this beautiful salmon over greens .. fried egg and sunflower seed Hasán brown. OMG YUMMY.. it was so tasty and healthy ... we sat in the back room which is nice and cozy. Prices are good and ppl are very attentive. I def recommend it guys if by any Chance you're in little intake.
No comment

Oat Cappuccino is amazing here- smooth and not too acidic. The temperature is also perfect of hei the coffee is served. We tried the classic egg sandwich and it wasn't great at all. Bread was below average and the jam is very underwhelming. Will come back for coffee but definitely not the food

Pistachio chocolate croissant is a chocolate croissant with pistachio cream inside and pistachio on top. The cream inside was very sweet for me. The croque tasted average and it's overpriced (a $12 ham and cheese sandwich...) They don't  have wifi and it's a self serve cafe.

just enjoyed the coffee and a cookie at the shop in the train station in New York, it was amazing, with a capitol A...the service by a cute gal named Africa was outstanding, I wanted to steal her to come work for me in Florida, she was the best service experience I had all week in New York...coffee fantastic, Cookie was to die for....come open one in Sarasota Florida ! can't say enough!

They suck. They take way too long for a cup of coffee. Wtf? Get more people on your team for a Saturday morning. An ice coffee with an espresso shot took 20 mins and they didn't even put the espresso shot in. They're beyond rude to their customers. Do not bother.

Lovely location, good coffee drinks and ingredients seem to be high quality.  The avocado toast could use a slightly thicker helping of, well avocado - it is mainly bread (but delicious bread) loaded with tomatoes.  The slow moving line is ok if you are not in a rush, but they do seem understaffed at times (not the employees' fault, of course).

used to enjoy coming here but ordered two drinks and was told i had to vacate my table soon because supposedly they're a restaurant on the weekend. for 9.50 i was allowed to sit for 5 minutes.  actually a joke

My roommate brought me back a chocolate pistachio croissant and a s'mores cookie when she went to Maman, both of which I enjoyed. After throwing the croissant into the oven for a few minutes, it came out delightfully crispy. I do think I would have enjoyed it more had they put less of the pistachio cream in-- it was just a touch too sweet for my liking and it made the croissant rather heavy. Also I didn't notice too much of a pistachio flavor. As far as the cookie goes, no complaints. Good flavor, lots of chocolate chunks included, and all soft and chewy on the inside.

Very weird experience here. Service was insanely slow and they brought out other people's food to our table three times as well as brought me the wrong meal so I had to sit with my friend while they ate and wait for mine (without apology). The sandwich I got was very dry but the presentation was nice. I would say come maybe once for the experience but would not return.
No comment
No comment

My biggest complaint here is that I ordered food in the front, sat down at a table in the back while waiting for my food to be brought over, took out my laptop to multi-task and a staff member immediately came order and informed me they are a "Laptop Free Environment".  Apparently, there is a sign on each table (with microscopic print), but my table didn't have one.  Further, there is no sign at the front or on the door to inform customers.  Not cool and multiple customers around me complained as well.  My lesser complaint is that with my $16 sandwich I was given one 3 inch x 3 inch cocktail napkin.   Thumbs down.  My sandwich was alright, but whereas from outside, this place looks like a delightful experience for lunch and to get some emails done, it is NOT welcoming.  I won't go again.  PS.  I did manage to get my hands on one of the microscopic signs a the table which encourages you to use your phone and make calls.  WTF?  I'd rather have someone quiet next to me with a laptop than overhearing loud conversation from a neighbor.

Customer service always feels unwelcoming and passive aggressive to the point where it felt personal. They also were not always the cleanest. The quality of the drinks and wait time (regardless of the amount of customers) varies dramatically from day-to-day. I wanted to make this my regular coffee spot since I'm in the neighborhood, but the last straw for me was when the barista stopped making my drink went to the lobby and moved the trash can around before returning to finish my drink without washing his hands.

Really good pastries, especially their unique loaf cakes. Cookies are also pretty good. I never sat inside for a sit-down meal but this place looked popular amongst females for intimate breakfasts/brunches pre-COVID. The cafe itself is very cute, and their flatiron location is also equally as delightful and picturesque. I've only ever picked up pastries and coffee to-go, and service was never great, but not bad either. Very authentically French, I suppose.

I absolutely love this French cuisine spot!! You definitely need to try their brunch. Everything was delicious from the pastries to their menu items like the waffles. Their outdoor dinging is adorable, but ask to sit out on their recently opened back patio. There are so many photo opportunities and it's so cute and quiet.

I came here for brunch on a Sunday morning with a friend.  The place was very cute and very French.  They were having a vintage pop up selling housewares and jewelry.  The table service side is on the left and the casual cafe with no table service is on right.  We each ordered matcha almond lattes and shared the pastry assortment (3 pastries from the bakery).  We chose the pistachio chocolate croissant, the lavender hot chocolate tart, and the blackberry vanilla beignet.  The pistachio chocolate croissant was my favorite.  It wasn't that sweet, flaky, and the pistachio cream had great pistachio flavor.  The tart was not that sweet and didn't have a strong lavender flavor which was ideal.  The beignet was fluffy but too sweet for me.  There was a lot of cream inside.  Service was fast and attentive.  I would come back to try their other items.

I went to the location on 48th St.  The pastries and coffee are fresh and good however they forgot to put milk in my coffee a couple of times and they weren't busy when I was ordering so perhaps the server was distracted. I am put off by the check out method because the card machine asks if you want to tip. If I am not sitting at a table and taking my order to go, I think asking for a tip is off-putting.  I would tip for sure if I was eating in.  Outside of that, it's an ok place and not bad.
No comment

I enjoyed having lunch on the patio in the back of this restaurant. The service was excellent and the food was really good for vegans. I had a salad. It took a 15 minute wait to be seated, and we 4 had to share a table with another 2 people. Prices are reasonable.

Would give this place zero stars if I could. just wasted an hour and a half for a $16 bullshit salad that literally just had lettuce, the tiniest bit of balsamic vinegar, basically a pound of smoked salmon, one sliced lemon, and four sliced cucumbers. That's it. That's the $16 Wilde Salad that took 30 minutes to come out. When I saw the salad and obviously knew it would not be a sufficient lunch I decided to add on toast to my order. Two slices of stale toast came 20 minutes later completely cold. The staff were really unorganized at this location and never apologized or gave any explanation for what took so long. Would not recommend since there's much better brunch options in SoHo

Best breakfast sandwich ever! It's loaded with flavors and yummy ingredients for a very reasonable NYC price point. A jammy sunny side up egg sits atop smoky, sweet bacon jam, mashed avocado, umami roasted tomatoes - all sandwiched by a delicious homemade bun. It also comes with a fresh green salad. It's super cute inside and very Parisienne in its vibe.
No comment
Small cute location. Grab and go coffee. Outdoor seating, but it gets filled up quick. I tried their lavender iced coffee and thought it was pretty good for someone who doesn't like coffee
No comment
No comment

Very rude service, they were not busy at all @11:45am. My cappuccino had pieces of espresso beans in it, when I asked them to remake it the barista just rolled her eyes at me.  My white choc pistachio cappuccino had no flavor. They didn't print out our receipt, when I asked for a receipt they ignored me.  Never coming back I paid $9 for a small size half of it was foam. Outageous

I've been here a few times (the last time was back in February), and each time I dined in has been pleasant. Their plates and mugs and everything are super cute, and their food is decent. Nothing really stands out, so I feel like it can be a little pricey for what you get. It's a cute spot to grab some food with a friend or two, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here for food.
No comment
No comment

The pastries all looked so good it was actually hard to choose. The service was very lacking. They took a long time to give us our pastries and the server just seemed very confused. We also couldn't get seats as there was a party going on that was reserved for them. The drip coffee was also pretty good. It was smooth. The chocolate croissants were amazing! So buttery , flaky and had the perfect amount of chocolate!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Absolutely loved it! Went there for brunch with my sister and got the Mediterranean platter all the ingredients were fresh and healthy and the taste was great! A must go. They also have freshly squeezed juices :)
No comment
No comment
No comment

My friend and I came here for the first time with her 1 year old dog. We called ahead and they were extremely accommodating and pet friendly. While they don't take reservations, we were kindly greeted and helped by such a lovely woman named Annette or Anita- she was at the front, but I believe also a manager. She was personable, friendly, kind and helpful. We ended up sitting outside as the outdoor patio was being used for an event. I got the PLT sandwich, which is pastrami, machego (I subbed for feta), tomatoes, pickled onions, mixed greens and a wasabi Russian dressing on ciabatta. It was delicious. Flavorful is an understatement. It is quite large, so you can definitely share for lunch, but my friend ended up getting the mamans breakfast sandwich which was good, but I liked mine better. Hers had homemade bacon jam, fresh avocado, roasted tomatoes and a fried egg on a focaccia bun. We both had bellinis which in my own opinion is hard to screw up. For dessert we ordered the Nutella brownie, which was just ok- wouldn't get again, and the nutty chocolate chip cookie which was good along with the s'mores cookie which was also very good. Their kitchen closes at 4pm, but we really didn't feel rushed at all, in fact, our server told us after paying that we could sit until closing time (6pm- in which we didn't, but it was a nice gesture). Would recommend highly.

One of New York's best spots for a great lunch that absolutely must include dessert. The avocado smash and any of their quiches will impress, as well as their lavender hot chocolate and other specialty drinks. The coup-de-grace, however, is closing your meal with one of their freshly baked cookies.
No comment

I was looking for a cafe where I could do homework because the wifi in my apartment is down today. I found maman and was excited to see that they had outdoor seating. I ordered an iced oat milk latte, and waited 15 minutes for it to be ready. The staff wasn't very friendly. It turned out that there was no wifi and when I sat down, a sign said "no laptops". I thought that since I bought an expensive drink, what's the harm in reading an article on my laptop. I had to use a personal hotspot on my phone because there was no wifi. About 20 minutes into my work, a member of the staff sassily told me that I had to leave because laptops aren't allowed. Definitely will not be going back, there are plenty of better options in SoHo.
Maman has some of the best cookies I've ever had, and I can't help myself from stopping in here when I'm in the area. There always seems to be a line, but it's worth the wait.

Amazing coffee spot, used to love to come here and work quietly because the atmosphere is top notch and the space is great. Recently implemented a "no laptop" rule however that took me by surprise (as there's no signs or notice and instead just an individual that comes and lets you know you can't have a laptop out). I would think it would be a better business plan to instead impose a time limit on tables
No comment
Great cute location  from all their shops. Barista was very welcoming and accommodating. His service made me return to this soho location.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place is adorable on the inside and out, but the food / drink left much to be desired. I ordered the onion leek quiche and drip coffee -  both were just okay. Would recommend Manan for the ambiance, but nothing more.
Fave spot by me. I want to keep this a secret so there won't be any overcrowding. Coffee is a punch n the face lol it's soooo good .
No comment

Private Party- I had my bridal shower at Maman Soho and it was wonderful.  Everyone on the team was so kind and accommodating on the day of, and the all of the food was amazing.  I highly recommend Maman for your private party.

Had brunch here. Husband got the croque maman and I got the hashbrown salad. Both delicious brunch entrees. But if i have to say the one thing that truly stands out here, is their almond croissants. Hands down, the best almond croissant i've ever had and it's mainly because of the crunchy topping they place on top. Perfect with a cup of coffee or tea, and it's a perfect size for 1 person.
No comment
No comment

I came here just to try the famous nutty chocolate chip cookie! It was delicious. I loved the gooey center, but crispy outside. I also appreciate the choice of chocolate. Not exactly sure what kind of chocolate, but it's not overly sweet. The nuts add and extra crunch, and it's just a tasty cookie! There is a lot of chocolate throughout the cookie though. Good news for chocolate lovers! Check this place out.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Great pastries and for NY, you get a lot for your money!!!  Makes you realize how overpriced the rest of NY and BKY is when it comes to baked goods.  Lovely first experience
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place seems to have many different names. You can call it Mache, or Jardon, or little rabbit place. Andrew and I had brunch in the garden of this boutique shop. I had waffles and he had hash brown salad. Both are fabulous. Everything is organic and they came in cute plates and bowls. You rarely get "lavender" and herbs in waffles and this place offers that. Andrew enjoyed the basils with smoked salmon in his salad and he has no idea what kind of herb this is :-P I like the store as well, love these cute little rabbits made from organic cottons. They remind you of coziness! I had matcha ice milk and Andrew had berry ice tea. There's no added sugar in either and I simply LOVE how close this place is to Mother Nature!
No comment

This place is great! Service was extremely quick and the servers are friendly. Food was soo delicious. They are taking covid precautions too. They take your temperature and are practicing social distancing.
No comment
Food was fine but not great. A pretty standard brunch menu. The service was nice enough but extremely slow and full of errors (eg charged for items we didn't order), so wouldn't go back

Super cute French cafe gem with dishes made fresh to order as well as a charming outdoor back patio. They are currently in the midst of some renovations, however there is seating indoors and outside which is a huge plus and you would never guess from the outside. Quiches, sandwiches and salads are the menu staples with typical pain au chocolate and beignets as well. The chai was also very tasty - not too sweet like many others. Perfect to stop by solo or with a friend or two. Note: no WiFi but it's a good thing to make sure people can get a seat to eat.
No comment

I've gone to NYC almost every other weekend since I was a child and frequented a beloved coffeeshop in Soho. When I came to visit recently, my friends convinced me to visit Maman. I am very particular about my mochas, preferring the taste to be a good balance of chocolate and coffee. Maman exceeded my expectations with their mochas. I have since gone back multiple times and ordered their other drinks with no complaints. They also have alternative milks for those who are lactose-intolerant and the substitution does not really alter the taste. I know that I  will be stopping by again when I am in the city!

def try their nutty chocolate chip cookies; you won't be dissapointd. it has just the right amnt of sweet n salty with a crunch of nuts in evry bite. sometimes, i'll brng them home n heat them up so they're nice n gooey n have them with some cashew milk.
Cozy seating and delicious food, definitely will be back soon. Seating didn't have much heat but on a warm day it would be just perfect
No comment

I've been here a couple of times & it's just one of those adorable coffee places when you need to rest & recharge. From the outside, the place looks like a tiny cafe, but there is more seating as you snake toward the back. The chai latte has the right amount of tea & cinnamon, blended well with frothy milk. The cup, bravo in the design. This latte has the looks & taste in one sip.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I went to Maman on a Wednesday at 11 pm and it was full. There were almost no tables available. It is a very small shop with no air conditioning. Because of the hot weather, I was almost not able to breathe inside. However, besides the crowded atmosphere, they have nice pastries. I have tried the croissant and their daily Quiche with roasted eggplant. The croissant was really good and the quiche was average. I recommend Maman for small pastries however know that it will always be very crowded.

This is a unique brunch spot. You can definitely go on a weekday for lunch as they serve salads and sandwiches. I had the breakfast sandwich when I went and it was delicious. I also tried the s'mores cookie. OMG amazing! Their coffee was very good and smooth.
No comment

Cute cozy cafe that gives you the feel of the 80s. My friend and I got their ham and cheese quiche, funky monkey 'muffin', iced americano and iced matcha latte with soy. Everything was good, nice ambience, will definitely return to try their cookies!

This place is so beautiful! I went for the restaurant in the back and tried the rabbit hole dish, which was great! As you can see from the pictures, it's a cute dish with pastrami, tomato, greens, etc inside with an egg on top. It was really delicious, but I have to say I'm a little disappointed of how little pastrami was inside. You are also given a salad on the side, which added well with the dish. My friend, however did not like her dish, which was the chicken Caesar salad. I did not like it either, primarily because of the bland dressing. It was basically an overpriced salad that's nothing special. Aside from the salad, it was a good experience overall- I thought it was really cute how they gave us our check in a book (see picture). I also heard this place has some of the best cookies so I would have to come back here and try them!

Maman is super cute and I am definitely a sucker for cuteness. It is near where I work so I visit quite often. I enjoy mostly their tea and their lavender chocolate drink--so yummy! I need to take a photo of their quiche next time but oh my lord.. so amazing. I also love coming here with my coworkers as a break time/coffee and chat type of thing. Maman is amazing and if I can, I probably might just sit there all day (I wouldn't mind).

5 stars for the vibe and ambiance, 2 stars for the actual coffee itself. The cafe is so beautiful and picturesque, but the coffee here was just okay. I would come here again just for the decor, but would skip the coffee. I'm willing to give the food a try, there were a lot of good looking sweets in the display case.

Loved this adorable place!! Came 3 times in my stay in New York. Loved the sweet and the savory food, whatever you order you can't go wrong!! And the decor is super cute, rustic farm house plus they plate the food really well if you're looking for a nice photo op in addition to yummy food!!
No comment
Pastry was dry and coffee was mediocre. Doesnt have too many options for pastries. Did not live up to the hype in my personal opinion.
No comment
No comment
Pretty good cookie. Thick and warm. Not the best in nyc in my opinion (so far Culture 36 is better), but a solid nut cookie!

A solid 4 stars! I came here for brunch and decided to try a few things off the menu. The breakfast sandwich was pretty good. I especially liked the bacon jam. The only thing I thought could have made it better was using a softer bread like a brioche or something, other than it was really good. I also tried their famous nutty chocolate chip cookie, which was pretty decent. It tasted good for a chocolate chip cookie. Not amazing and definitely didn't have the wow factor that I was looking for but it was a pretty good cookie, especially when warmed. The pistachio loaf cake is a hard pass. I love all things pistachio and this cake did not taste much like pistachio. It tasted more like a regular sweet loaf cake and the icing did not taste good. The real star of the show was definitely the pistachio and chocolate croissant. It was so AMAZING. I loved every bite and found myself wishing I had bought another one. You must get this if you go here. 10/10 would recommend!
i had the oprah cookie (chocolate chip with nuts) and the smores cookie! both very good! very soft and chewy. wasn't a long wait either. friendly staff as well.
No comment
No comment
No comment
I loved eating brunch and pastries here:) it's officially my favorite brunch spot. The chocolate cookie, croissants, white chocolate cake are all out of this world.
No comment
BEST warm chocolate chip cookie and vanilla latte. This small cafe has a seating area behind(might take few minutes to find a table) and is a great spot for their coffee and cookie!
This place was so cute!!! My croissant was so fresh, and my coffee was very good as well. We loved the atmosphere in this cafe!

Super cozy place to grab a hot chocolate at and chat with friends or family. The lavender hot chocolate was sweet and chocolatey, but the matcha latte was disappointing. It was extremely bitter and full of lumps of matcha-wouldn't recommend.

Cute place for brunch! I ordered the Nectarine waffles and pastry basket. The nectarine waffles were pretty good but I don't know if it's a dish I want to order again. The pastry basket is the one you need to go for. The blueberry lavender cake is a definitely a must try because it tastes like heaven! The almond croissant was also one of the best croissants I ever tried! It was way better than what I expected. For the Nutella beignets, I felt like there was too much Nutella. I think I'll want to try the pistachio croissants next time!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The ambiance is nice, but that's the biggest draw. The food is not bad, but nothing special. A place to catch up with a friend when the food does not matter as much. Would skip this place if you're looking for something special food wise.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Dear Maman Owners. This monring I warched as you lost 7 customers. And ive been sitting here for ten minutes. After waiting almost as longin line because even though its very busy there is only ONE person on cash register taking orders. and the  theres this poor woman that has to say to people, No laptops are ALLOWED in Maman. Bless her. She says it quickly, has had to suffer a debate with all seven who stood up and left. I know you will use covid as an excuse but really its greed isnt it. you dint wnat people camping out with their devices...like I am doing right now. Perhaps an enforced  time limit might be preferable OR join the 21st century and stop this nonsense. what is wrong with you. I have been coming here for years. sat in this dining room enjoyed meals and conversations but I see how ypu are. Best if luck. Butlers has better croissants and does not have some idiotic policy in place of hospitality. so but more plastic  flowers, youll sty busy but I have now been here twnety minutes and leaving. perhaps youve lost eight customers this morning.

This place was definitely clean. Also they met COVID standards as far as the seating goes. But their service was terrible, poor time measurement. I waited almost an hour for an breakfast plater. There was NO customer, but fully staffed. Never again
No comment
No comment
review is only for counter service. Pleasant counter service, prompt and fast. Love the baked goods and barista beverages! The breakfast sandwich is overpriced and too salty.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Never ever order from them. They absolutely forget to put items in, are unreachable busy phone, and I've "donated" more than I care to imagine. I order from the one on west Broadway and I'll never do it again which is very sad, because their food is great. Seamless can't even get thru to them.

Maman is always delicious, always cute, always a good idea. This particular day was no different, the food was fresh, tasty, and filling. I wish I left room for a pastry to pick up at the front. However I am deducting a star because the service was pretty bad. We came in during a weird time, so it was really slow, but we stood at the entrance of the dinning area while 5 waitresses stared back at us and no one made a move to seat us. Several people came into the store since then and they got the same treatment. Very unusual, but I will chalk it up to an odd day and continue to visit.

Thanks to Joanna Gaines and her Magnolia journal I discovered this place. It's so rustic chic on the inside, very instagram worthy photos happening here. The food was delicious also. Best almond croissant I've ever had. Their croque maman sandwich was so so good. We went to the soho location but all the other locations look just as good. Can't wait to go back and try other things!
No comment

column3: Long Island City, New York, NY
column6: No comment
No comment

Soho is a fabulous place to shop and eat but if slightly wore out and need a delicious caffeinated pick me up I would stop here. Now Pleazzzze get the cookies I repeat soooo good. Happy caffeinatations
No comment

Nutty chocolate chip cookie isn't bad - maybe a 3.5 out of 5.  Middle of the NYC pack (Schmackarys and Levain much better).  Nutella beignet was tasty, but prob not worth the $3.50.  Overall, food is slightly above average and service is fine.  Don't come here for the desserts - come here for the vibe.  It's a pretty cool atmosphere.  Be warned - they don't have their own wifi so you have to borrow from one of their neighbors.

column3: Hollywood Hills West, Los Angeles, CA
column6: horrible service. i came in before work and ordered two iced lattes, two plain croissants, a lemon poppyseed cookie, a hazelnut pastry, and a chocolate pastry. i stood around waiting for my coffee until a barista bothered to check the receipt printer to see my order. after receiving my coffee - it was another wait to receive my pastries. how complicated is it to bag up some pastries sitting on a shelf? i asked a barista about my order and she was clueless and asked when i ordered it and what did i order, i asked if she didn't have my receipt and she asked the cashier who said she thought she gave me my order but had forgotten. after finally receiving my order i walk back to my job only to discover i am missing one of my croissants and my chocolate pastry. if i wasn't already late for work because of how long the service took i would have gone back and sorted this out in person. the servers here seem really indifferent about providing good customer service and aren't friendly at all. super disappointed with this experience as i was really looking forward to trying this place.
No comment
No comment

Stumbled upon this coffee shop the other day. I was surprised by how many food and pastry options they had. They have quiche, pasta salads, breads, cookies, etc. I got a tea and the chocolate chip cookie (the one that was on Oprah's list). The tea was good and the cookie was delicious. I would like to go back and try their pumpkin bread and some of their other food items. There is a seating area in the back. It is super cute and cozy. It has the exposed painted brick, cute hanging lights, etc. It has a great vibe to it. It's a great place to go with a friend for coffee/lunch or even just read a book while you sip your drink.

This place is absolutely gorgeous with every detail! I looking at the mache after eating! The drinks are good and I loved the blueberry lavender cake. The sandwich I had tasted good , the bread was a little bit hard for my liking though. The croissants are absolutely delicious and look forward to them! It's a very nice experience and atmosphere that keeps me wanting to re visit.
No comment

We were visiting NYC for our anniversary and tried every cool spot we could possibly find. Every meal we had was thoroughly scouted out for best reviews, atmosphere and menu. We stopped here for coffee and a breakfast snack. Maman had the best coffee I've ever had in my life. Specifically, the honey lavender latte. Excellent.
No comment

They put my Uber Eats order through and did not deliver 5 out of 6 items that I ordered and did not adjust the cost of my order down.  I ended up paying $12 for a stale croissant and they didn't even bother to call me to check if I really wanted to pay that much for a single croissant to be delivered across the entire island of Manhattan - total absurdity.  Use your common sense instead of ripping people off.  If you can't fulfill 90% of the order, just have some common courtesy and cancel it.  I can understand 1 or 2 items missing, but not 5 out of 6, lol.  They are just scam artists.

Stopped here for a quick bite and a break from a shopping spree. It was around noon on a weekend and the place was pretty much full. I liked how the place offered about equal amount of seating for people with takeouts from their coffeeshop counter and those dining in. Although they had a relatively spacious area in the back, it still wasn't enough during the weekend - one group of customers in particular hogged all the seats so there weren't enough seatings, even though I saw some empty area in one of their big tables. Anyhow, I was lucky to get a counter seat adjacent to the front window. It didn't look so comfortable when I found the spot, but it was actually nice and cozy and I ended up staying for over an hour. Coffee is great. From my past experience, I remember their pound cakes were not so great, so get other pastries like their chocolate croissants!

Very cute cafe, love the ambiance. The price point is also very fair, I ordered a cup of orange juice and an egg and avocado egg tartine for a total of $16 which I think is a very good price because normally I around $16 for a slice of avocado toast. The food was great, however, when I left the cafe I ended up smelling like food because the kitchen is the open space. But overall, I would definitely come back!

Come here in the early morning on a weekday and enjoy the intimate french countryside interior at the back of this cute cafe before the breakfast and brunch rush. My twin and I stopped by right when Maman opened to get a couple of hours of work in and appreciated the quiet atmosphere before heading out to a busy Manhattan day. Both the hot chocolate and chai latte were delicious.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Bad service. Very ammature  staff / logistics. Food and coffee is good but pretty expensive and not worth dealing with the service. I'd skip it.
Coffee is really good - I tried an iced oat milk latte. Tried to get some work done here but there is NO WI-FI. Cmon it's 2018!!!!!
No comment
No comment

You can tell a lot of locals frequent this place just by seeing how the staff interacts with them. They say hello/wave like they've been coming here for years. Place is small and quaint. Has a cute barn door to go next door for more seating. Ordered the Mediterranean breakfast plate. The toast was so delicious. I can tell they make good bread here. Wasn't very busy at 8am but picked up quickly afterwards. Also got their s'mores cookie for fun. It's super chewy and chunky. Can't wait to try other pastries in the future. (Feel free to skip Balthazar)
No comment

A very lovely French style bakery and cafe. The design and layout of the place is very aesthetic and beautiful, especially the private outdoor seating in the back. There is limited seating, but it's worth the wait. I came for the Saturday brunch, which did not disappoint! Nothing was lacked flavor, and their coffee was great too! I recommend the lavender waffles, just the right amount of floral. The staff was also super nice and accommodating from moving from inside seating to outside!

I love this place! But I think they got rid of their free WiFi? (Booo :(, but maybe they didn't have it in the first place?? Forgot). The interior is super cute andddd they have really good cafe (French!!) food options. The Lavender HoT chocolate is amazing! Highly recommended and they also have oat milk!
Oh my - the tasty goodness here is heaven sent! I was so excited to walk to Maman and I'm not disappointed.*This was a draft from 2018!

Great atmosphere, and friendly workers. I ordered a matcha latte, but it wasn't strong enough for my taste, and it also wasn't sweet at all. Although they do have a station with sugar, I found it difficult to add sugar into my beverage. If i added simple syrup, the matcha would be diluted, and being a cold drink, regular sugar packets and honey don't dissolve easily into the drink. But other than that, nice place.

Care and details in the this cute, artisanal bakery! Intimate atmosphere with an interior "garden" area in the back. Tea party meets Noho chic feel. Small so great to meet up with a friend or two to catch up but not a huge group of people.

I wanted a treat while walking around soho and my roommate knew just where to go. If you want a cookie - Maman is the place. When we walked in they had just been cleared out so we waited for the batch in the oven to finish baking. It was worth it. The whole bakery filled with a delicious sweet aroma as we waited and we were able to get two different cookies as fresh as can be. While I was told the nutty chocolate chip was the best - I actually preferred the white chocolate pretzel. The middle was still a bit gooey (my fav) and the sweet salty combo was perfection.
No comment

The place feels cozy and it's really alignant ...friendly staff ....the orders didn't take time to come ....It's a nice place for friends hangout ....it's not kids friendly even though it does have infant chairs and some kids options on the menu....it's close to the N and Q train which made it easy to reach and get home

column3: Long Island City, New York, NY
column6: Maman Soho was super amazing and very affordable. First of all, the price is unbeatable. After trying out many items off their menu, I will need to say that Nutty Chocolate Chip is my favourite. And also, the service was great and the staff was super friendly. Definitely we go again!

Been here a couple times to try their pistachio croissant, but they were always sold out.  Finally, we got there a little earlier, before 11, and got to try them.   They are actually chocolate croissants,  but with a surprise pistachio cream filling.  Holy moly! Have you ever had a cream filled croissant?   What is this magical creation and how come bakeries all over NYC aren't selling them?  We got cronuts and croffins, and we finally got creamssants!!!  I should trademark this name!  They are rich and decadent, so you'll need a strong coffee to chase the sweetness.  If you like cream puffs and croissants, then you have to try this marriage made in heaven.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Beautiful setting to dine outdoors and yummy food and coffee! Inside there are various items to shop before and after your meal. Overall a lovely experience.

One of the worst breakfast experiences of my life.  I am an easy to please person in general, but this place ruined my day.  I tried to treat myself to a nice meal, ordered the rabbit hole.  The dish makes no sense how it is served it is super difficult to eat, a crusty tough bread bowl essentially which is not at all what I expected from the menu description.  I struggled with a butter knife to even break it into manageable edible bites while I waited for anyone to check on me and how my meal was going.  I needed water, a steak knife, and a different salad dressing in order to eat my meal.  The salad was drenched in a sickeningly sweet dressing.  I can't have that much sugar for health reasons so I asked for a different salad.  They brought me another dressing, also super sweet.  No salad. Had to walk to the counter to ask for new salad.  Then realized the dressing was also full of sugar.  This whole process took way too long until the bread bowl thing was cold and hard.  I was just over it and knew I still have to go buy breakfast somewhere else.  I asked for a refund on my food because I couldn't eat it.  The manager argued with me and told me they had offered me different dressings so they can't give me a refund.  Ok?  I have worked in many restaurants and I am polite, but in this case I was justified in requesting my money back.  The food was cold and I had terrible service.  And it simply didn't taste good.  That is enough to give any one in customer service the indicator that you need to make it right with the customer. I tried discussing this with the manager and he simply argued with me on every point and refused a refund which is what has forced me to leave this honest review. I don't like resorting to damaging a business reputation and writing reviews is an absolute last resort.  I always try to resolve it first in a calm and reasonable manner if something is actually wrong.  Every other restaurant I have worked in or been to is quick to respond to customer complaints and make it right as that is the best way to run a business and earn respect and even earn back a customer you would have lost.  Very disappointed and terrible way to start my day.
No comment
No comment

Beautifully decorated and crowded to the hilt. Snagged a seat at the communal table in the back where others were camped out but lasted just 20 minutes due to poor air circulation. V instagrammable but prices and lack of decent seating makes this place very overrated

Toyotomi Shibayoshi heard of a cookie that was Oprah's favorite in 2017.  A Shogun must sample this cookie to  see if it's great. Toyotomi Shibayoshi will judge since it is he and the Shogunate who decides if things are worthy of greatness. Upon entering the establishment Toyotomi was indeed pleased with smell of baked goods, the  sights do justice as well to blend the experience to your senses. Many options were in sight for the Shogun to  choose from, almond croissants , homemade Oreo, a white chocolate blueberry lavender loaf, a chai spice beignet, all looked tasty and worthy of a battle on the plains of snacking. But ultimately Toyotomi was here for the Nutty Chocolate Chip Cookie . The stage was set for a full on flavor battle here in SoHo. The Shogun went to the counter and ordered the cookie... The lady shopkeeper asked only One......, Toyotomi Shibayoshi likes this reply, make that Two kind miss. Cookies were gathered and put in a small bag and placed for the Shogun on the counter. Toyotomi Shibayoshi handed the lady a card which has many monies on it to pay for the services.. Toyotomi Shibayoshi leaves the 20% tip, for her quick hands on cookie approach. With bag in hand of one his trusted vassals the Shogun stops for a quick pic inside. More pictures would have been taken but the excitement had the Shogun ready for battle. Outside the Shogun takes his first bite...... after smelling the appealing scent of the cookie.  The moment of truth...................  It is as if for a moment you have transcended time and flavor, then your taste buds snap you back to reality for the indulgence of the Ambrosia you have just put in your mouth. The Shogun slowly eats his prize, this is a battle of taste that must last as long as it can. Heavenly deliciousness given from the Gods of Snacking have bestowed upon a mortal for a moment whaat it would be like to fly among the heavens. Yus you mere mortals, IT IS THAT GOOD. The Shogun of Snaxx, Toyotomi Shibayoshi declares here and now that this is the finest cookie in the land that he has tasted.  The Shogunate awards Maman of SoHo New York City the only 6 Katanas out of 5 on the Imperial Shogun Scale. Yus a 6 Katanas score... unbelievable flavor has risen up to push the scale overboard. Now.... we eat the Second Cookie
No comment
No comment

Quaint and delicious. Chocolate croissants and Nutella beignets are incredibly authentic as was the quiche. Make sure to try the breakfast sandwich too. If I lived nearby, I'd be splurging here every weekend for sure.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Cozy lil coffee shop that I stopped by to try their cookies yelpers raved about.  They are pretty good but at $4 a pop not levain worthy.  Still I guess for the area it may be your best bet.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Finally got a chance to check out this cafe that a friend of mine once recommended. I love the interior of the cafe, a cute rustic design. The place isn't big but my girlfriend and I came when there wasn't many customers. I ordered an iced americano and a chunky monkey brioche. We enjoyed the chunk monkey brioche a lot. I actually like brioche bun to begin with. It has chocolate chunks and mashed banana inside topped with caramelized walnuts. Altogether, it was not too sweet and the bread was very soft. My girlfriend ordered a quiche with ham. It was also very good with a generous amount of ham. As for drink she had an iced matcha late with soy milk. She enjoyed it. Overall, it was a very cute cafe, I will definitely come back here when I have a chance. It's super cute and they serve pretty good food and drinks!
No comment

Good looking place, nice decor and most important delicious food! I was amazed by chocolate pistachio croissants! Want to eat more and more:) Also I loved the salmon sandwich with beautiful name Andrea, tasty quiche with ham and eggs. I am sure other dishes and pastries are good as well! Definitely will be back!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I have been to Maman several times before and I had a normal, pleasant experience. When I came today, the man at the cashier was extremely rude and laughing. He not only didn't help me with my order, but also he made fun of me, especially with other customers behind me. In addition, my drink tasted especially thick - I think he used almond milk or soy milk in place of regular milk even though I didn't ask for it. Lastly, the back room (where customers can go to sit and enjoy themselves) was completely messy, with other customer's old and half eaten things on the table. Thus, my sister and I had no where to sit. I felt embarrassed because I took her to a cafe that I raved about but instead I felt bad for bringing her to a place like this.
Cute atmosphere! They have a nice seating area in the back where you can enjoy your pastry and coffee. Love love the decor

Hidden gem!!!  This is by far the best place for a lazy Sunday brunch fix.  I had butternut squash waffles and it was outstanding!!!!  The place is cute, cozy and tasteful.  Everything from service, deco to food is 5 stars!!!  By the way, they even serve coffee with oat milk.  How delightful!!!

The most famous cafe in SoHo, I was expecting the best coffee here from the reviews that I've read but in fact coffee was just okay not surprisingly as I thought and the other way round the bakery was so so good I would recommend that.
No comment
No comment

This location needs to work on the execution of their ordering process. When you walk in, you see the counter, menu and some baked breads, pastries, and such. The cashier is to the side, where the narrow hallway is. My friend and I walk in, and wait by the cashier bc we were only getting drinks. The cashier (Indian female) took a customer who just walked in the door after us, first, and then told me to move (so rude). A tall gentleman working in the back saw her rudeness and asked if he can help us. (He gets 5 stars for service). We order 2 lavender hot chocolates with coconut milk. While waiting to pay, the same female cashier told me to move again, like where do you want me to stand? I'm not SpiderMan, I can't jump on the wall and hang out there. The place was very packed and there were no empty tables in the back either so we took it to go. The hot chocolate is very rich and good, the lavender aspect is basically some dried edible lavender buds, which is fragrant at first, but after a while becomes too overwhelming. I would skip the lavender next time, as I ended up having to spit out (ladylike I know) all the lavender buds into a napkin because I couldn't stand it any longer. The cups are cutely designed and aesthetically pleasing. They should move the cash register to the front, and have people wait on the side for their order. The system they have now definitely is confusing and everyone is cramped in a tiny little space (fire hazard).
No comment
No comment

I came here today for the 1st time after wanting to check it out for a while. It's a very cute space that has a cafe in the front and a few tables in the back (and a few outlets if needed for laptop or cell phone charging). They have a good selection of tea and coffee along with a menu of pastries and bigger food items. They also have an adjoining space that has additional tables plus a little shop area in the front, where you can purchase French bath items, children's toys and clothes plus ice cream. I could see it getting very crowded here, but otherwise it's a great space and super cute, so would def if in the area and looking for a nice spot to hang out and relax.
No comment
Fav coffee shop next to my house. Chocolate pistachio croissant and chocolate nut cookie are the best! Always pretty around and the music which gives unique experience
No comment

It went from a pleasant first experience to a meh second time around. Why? The zucchini and mint quiche was not palate pleasing; the mint really threw me off. The prosciutto brioche was dry. And finally, the hibiscus rhubarb cake. My god, wth happened? Visually stunning, the outside that is. Post slice...that's another story. It fell into pieces when the knife went thru and the "cake" was very moist. Very. Moist. I'm grossed out remembering how wet this item was. Eck. But if you like wet cake then this is just the right spot for you!
No comment

I wanted a cup of coffee and a light snack and to enjoy it sitting down. When you first enter this place you see only a few bar stools in the window but in the back there are additional seating, not a lot but some.  I ordered the focaccia which had caramelized onions and kamal olives. The balance of sweet and tart was perfect. I also got the Nutella brownie which was pretty awesome. The salads in their display looked wilted and not appetizing that was the only thing I was surprised and disappointed about.
Absolutely loved this café! The chef must've been a magician because the pastries were to die for! Very friendly & kind waiter, had an amazing time. Would recommend 10000%.

Got an iced coffee with pistachio croissant. Both were terrific. The seating area in the back is secluded and offers a quiet place to hang out. Perfect setting if you need to get away from the hustle and bustle, recharge with a cup of coffee and various pastries.
No comment

I stopped in for a hot drink to escape the cold for a bit. I ordered a chai tea latte, but then later the barista told me they ran out of chai so I decided on the matcha latte. The matcha latte was just alright. It seemed like my matcha latte contained a milk substitute. Something was just off about the drink. The matcha powder strength was also lacking. They don't do their matcha lattes well, but I do want to try their other options. There is some window seating in front and a larger room to fit more in the back. The staff and interior are just so nice!
Love the place but disappointed to see that their natural image is thin veneer when they don't recycle or better yet offer reusable glasses for eat in guests in the cafe side.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

My sister and I stumbled upon this little slice of heaven while shopping around soho. All I can say is that it was the best chocolate chip cookie I've ever had. Maman makes levain bakery look futile. My cookie was the perfect combination of chewy but crispy, and the chocolate chips weren't too heavy which was excellent.
No comment
No comment
No comment

My friend passed by this place right before lunch and we decided to check it out after lunch :D. The décor of the cafe and display is very simple but inviting. The staff appeared to be friendly and quick with the orders. I got the lavender hot chocolate which imo, was quite tasty and not too overpowering. That can be attributed to the fact I had this similar drink somewhere else and was craving for it.
No comment
No comment

Love the vibes here, perfect place for a coffee date. Came here on a Sunday evening, super packed but they have a lot of seating. I had the latte but sadly it was just okay. Not sure if it's the coffee or how it was made, but it taste quite bitter and strange. I saw a lot of people getting their chocolate chip cookie, which smells amazing. Maybe I'll try that next time when I'm in the neighborhood.

Adorable spot for breakfast or brunch. They have a beautiful outdoor patio in the back that was a great way to relax and enjoy some coffee and snacks. We had the avocado toast with egg - very generous with avocado and overall delicious and light. The chocolate pistachio croissant and coffee were great as well.
No comment
Needed some warmth so came for a hot choc, gave me a lavender hot choc instead but it does the job. Good enough!
Very cute place. Oreos homemade were not good... but the croisant with pistachio!!! Omg. Amazing. You want to have that!

This is the cutest little french cafe / bakery! It's small and quaint, very easy to miss when you're walking by. The staff is very helpful and friendly. It's a great place to just come for a coffee and relax on your laptop or read a book. I had a classic chai latte and a Nutella beignet (absolutely delicious!). I wouldn't even hesitate to come back here again, it's super adorable and very satisfying!
No comment

I came in expecting one of the best cookies in Manhattan and was sorely disappointed. They were not carrying their regular chocolate chip nut cookie which is the one I went there for. Instead, they ONLY had a vegan version of this cookie. The cookie was extremely oily and the texture and consistency was not what I would have expected from such a well known bakery.

Maman is a beautiful cafe in Soho, filled with delicious baked goods, fabulous drinks, and really beautiful people. The seating area is generous for the neighborhood and the front window seats get the most exquisite sunbeam in the morning. I stopped in briefly for a lavender hot chocolate and some journal time. The hot chocolate is divine, with the scent of lavender and the richness of the chocolate providing a relaxing and decadent treat. The space had a few too many instagramming hipsters/tourists (I actually had one lady rudely and silently squeeze herself at the bar between me and another seated patron at the front window so she could take photos of her food.) Prices are par for the neighborhood (meaning, expect to shell out $4-5 per cup) but the quality and the beauty of the space make it worth it for a New York minute.

I've been here at Maman soho and had a great time. Perfect place to meet up with a friend or get some work done. Variety of spots from tables to sofas. But coffee is not the best. Helpful barista. What a wonderful coffee spot

column3: Town of Brookhaven, Long Island, NY
column6: Chef Joshua Snyder made us feel comfortable at the counter which overlooks the open kitchen.  I am a clean freak.  This place was very clean.  I have soy gluten and dairy allergies.  After discussing my allergies with the chef we decided to have the chicken salad over field greens with a mustard vinaigrette.   So cool having the chef service you.  The food was great.  I mean great.  The best chicken salad I have ever had.   And to sit there watching him artistically create all the lunch masterpieces.  I wish I was not gluten free and could of enjoyed one of those panini's.   Thank you chef Snyder for a memorable experience and food.

I went there at the dining. The shop is so cute. The staff is kind and food is good. And, the lavender got chocolate is great. But it took so long to get food. Although it was not busy, I waited more than 30minutes.  When I got a pancake, a hot chocolate had already gotten cold. It was not good.
No comment
No comment

I found Maman on Instagram and knew I had to stop in when I was in NYC. I miss Paris so much and wanted to find somewhere that would transport me back. When you walk in you're immediately met with the smell of a boulangerie - I squealed of happiness inside. They have a great selection of pastries and also sell a few cute candies, candles, etc as well. The croissant did not disappoint - it was probably the best croissant I've had stateside!

Last time I visited NY, I thought this place was awesome. The decorations were so cute, and the food was pretty good. When I stopped by, the place was kind of a mess. The staff seemed unorganized... Next time I visit NY, I think I'm going to pass visiting Maman.

Two words. Lavender mocha. It's not on the menu, but I was really interested in the lavender hot chocolate on the menu but needed some caffeine. The barista offered to do a lavender mocha and I was blown away. Also had one of their quiches which were delicious also. I'm in love with the look of this coffee joint. All of the decor and seating was very cute and welcoming.
The best chocolate chip cookies I have ever had the gastronomic pleasure of imbibing. Intensely. One of my favorite sweets ever. Yup, a cookie is that good. Merci, Maman.
No comment

Place is small so it's usually packed. But you can always order your coffee to-go so it's not bad. I HIGHLY recommend getting their Lavender Hot Chocolate! I've tried lots around the city but this has got to be the best.
No comment

The place is very cute, but small. The iced coffee was delicious and I didn't even have to add a lot of sugar, which usually I do. The music was a bit too load for reading, but overall a great little coffee shop (with food and baked goods available).
Stop by here since I was in the area the coffee was delicious so was customer service, though my avocado sandwich didn't taste as great. But will def give it another try.....

Aw man, I'll be honest that half my stars are for the decor alone. It's a bit pricey for cafe fare (or maybe I don't hang out in enough trendy coffeeshops to know the going rates) but the location & ambiance explain the tag. Perfect spot to impress a coffee date or just escape the cold for a while.

They make a really good lavender hot chocolate! I am giving four stars because I had to wait for long time to get my drink. They didn't know I ordered so I told them to make it. Then they made a wrong drink... so pretty long time but the drink was great and the staff was friendly and nice.
No comment
This place is a great cafe ... really cool atmosphere ... the coffee is excellent ... the pastry was basic ... but def a better place than starbucks
No comment
No comment
No comment

Way overpriced, disorganized and mediocre food, with no service to speak of if you plan on eating in at the rear of the establishment. Single wi fi users occupy tables for 4, prior diners food leftovers in the table. Not for me
No comment
No comment
No comment

This is a very cute cafe however the location in West Village is better. I highly recommend the lavender blueberry cake to pair with your lavender hot chocolate. This is seasonal so get it asap! It has lavender petals on top of the purple frosting and was really moist. Their most popular cake is pistachio but I found this really dry. It might have just been this batch. The cups are really cute and the bunny decor reminds me of Peter Rabbit. However, this is not a place for you to do work due to the dim lighting inside.

Frustrated about the service here. There is only one server，the server recorded our name wrongly even though we have spelled to her and we have to wait for a long time. We waited for an hour and we're told that we still need to wait for another 15 mins. We finally decided to go to a different place. This place is a waste of the time. Please improve the service otherwise won't come again.
No comment
i've been to the soho, greenpoint, and tribeca locations and they're all really nice. prettiest cups in the city and the almond croissants are dank
No comment

Awesome coffee. Can't go wrong with any choice only downside is the spot has no WiFi and the reception inside sucks. But the locations unbeatable coincidentally all the best coffee spots are within a few blocks of this spot so if it's packed you can go to a number of places in the area. I'd recommend the espresso or mocha if you want something sweeter.
No comment

Awesome place! We had the pear quiche and butternut squash sweet waffle. Wonderful atmosphere. Charming Francophone staff. Little boutique baby gift and handknitted woollens section up front. Highly recommended.
One of my favorite places in the city! Always fresh delicious and creative bakes and healthy salads! Love the backyard and the cutest bathroom decorating!

Absolutely loved the chocolate chip cookies here. Generous size, soft chocolate chips and tastes like homemade! The only downside is the price, at $4.08 for a cookie, it is a bit overpriced. When I look what I can get for less elsewhere (e.g A Dough Doughnut, cupcakes etc) it makes me question why it costs so much. However, it doesn't take away from how great they taste. Glad I tried this place.
No comment

Handsome and informative staff! Quiche with tuna, tomato and black olives-delicate, cheesy, a touch of briny ness to cut through the soufflé like richness. Delightful and Parisian! Lavender hot chocolate-try it iced!!! So delicious-and floral notes not overwhelming. Chocolate chip cookie very good...not the best. But I adore doubletree cookies so...  Pistachio loaf cake-sweet, great oral satisfaction in texture. Almost seemed soaked in something in regards to moistness. Wish it had that nutty aroma and punch of nutty flavor pistachio flavored things offer. Will be back for daily quiche and hot or iced lavender hot chocolate
Good coffee spot, the service is little slow but the food is good. I go there each time I go visit my daughter especially for their nut cookie

This place is really good (I rated it with 5 stars every time I came before), but their employees should work out their unnecessary rudeness. I walked in and got myself a coffee and a croque Madame. As soon as I payed this guy comes out of the kitchen saying: "you need to leave, we're closing". I understand that he wants to go home, but he insisted so badly that it made me wonder how committed is the staff with their business...

I am absolutely in love with this quaint SoHo coffee shop. I walked in half awake and the second I stepped foot in the door the smell of fresh coffee and pastries woke me up immediately. Not only is the smell divine, but also the interior of the shop is extremely homey and welcoming. I decided this time around to get an iced latte with skim milk since it was a bit hot outside, and it was extremely refreshing and delicious. If you're hungry make sure to pick up a quiche!

The chocolate chip cookie here makes me want to weep. It's soooo delicious and melted on the inside, flaky and crispy, mmmmmm....waiting in line sometimes seems like torture (and yes, be prepared to wait in line!). There are times where they will actually run out of cookies and you might need to wait for one of those as well, but the staff are friendly. It's not their fault the cookies are so good! If you're lucky you will find a spot to sit and chat or work at the back of the cafe. Pretty chill vibe, lots of people speaking French! :)

So delicious! The cookies, salads and coffees are all way above average. Really nice staff. Prompt service. My only gripe is I wish brunch was walk-in like the restaurant/ coffee shop is mid week. But small gripe. Really great spot.

The cafe has a really cute set up and is photogenic at first glance, but the pastries, brunch (had matcha waffles at the Broadway location), and drinks (tried their coffee and lavender hot chocolate) are mediocre. Come to snap a photo or catch up with friends who are not foodies, but otherwise it's alright.
No comment

Very cute cafe (this would be a cute spot to study in if you're a student), but it's overrated. The "famous" cookies are pretty mediocre. Not sure what the fuss is about, I still prefer jacques torres or levain cookies over these anytime. The chocolate chip cookie was a bit stale and bland; there was no depth at all. The savory food options looked good. I'll have to give this another try, but for now it's just ok.

The best croissant in the city, hands down! Excellent lattes and seasonal offerings. Their quiche is legendary as are their cookies. Maman has a warm atmosphere with an excellent staff to match -- highly recommend stopping by for a pastry and coffee!
No comment

$4.08 for an nutty chocolate chip cookie, which was chocolatey and studded with nuts, but clearly overbaked. Sadly, to add insult to culinary injury, Tiffany left it in the oven too long while helping others, and handed it to me scolding, detracting further from the experience. Only way I see myself returning is to duck in to the nice back area and try something else (TWHS)..
No comment

Such a shame this place has great drinks and pastries, but there is one particular employee that works Mon to Fri who is ALWAYS rude with every customer. Definitely not the kind of service you want first thing in the morning. I would recommend going around the corner to GASOLINE ALLEY or HAPPY BONES to get your coffee. They are very friendly and both places ask if you want room for milk (this is a plus for me as someone who doesn't add milk). Maman doesn't ask and will serve you a half cup of coffee with an attitude. No thanks.
No comment
No comment

Cute spot to refuel close to SoHo. Baked cookies were fresh out of the oven. Coffee and lattes were good creamy good. They have a few bar seats in front but a whole other section in the back with about 4-5 tables. Nice deco and quiet atmosphere.
No comment
One tiny croissant cost me $3.50. More than an americano. I used to be a huge fan of this place but I've got a growing suspicion that it's completely overrated.

The lavender hot chocolate is probably the best thing I ever tasted. At first sip, you literally are confused because it is such a different taste but by the second sip, you realize that you have been missing out on amazing hot chocolate your whole life. The cups are gorgeous too. I ordered a salad but I can not remember the name. It had apples, blue cheese, carrots, walnuts and some other items. I really liked the salad but my only problem with it was that I constantly found huge pieces of blue cheese and either I ate a huge piece by accident or was cutting it into smaller pieces. Besides that, it was great.
Very cute place, the lavender hot chocolate is a must try. The quiches were very tasty too.

Great coffee and ultra soft cookies. A little too chocolatey for me but still delicious. Americano was also very good. Very limited seating in the back but really cute decor. The area is perfect for grabbing a coffee with friends or even doing work.

I've been to Maman a handful of times when in Soho. This place is small but super charming and quaint. They always have a mix of varying pastries available, some being a tad eclectic. My favorites are the pistachio chocolate croissant and the nutty chocolate chip cookie (which could rival Levain's). I usually get the coffee, but the lavender hot chocolate is worth a try!
Quaint little French cafe! Pastries look AMAZING and the drinks are good as well. Seating is plenteous and the wifi and bathroom are added bonuses.

Such a cute store, bakery, and patio. There are some interesting food options, but the food was just ok. The service was great! We had 5 kids with us and they accommodated with high chairs, plastic cups, etc.

Great place for brunch! Chill and lovely! They had a lovely store outside and the restaurant is hidden behind the store. It took me a while to figure out where the brunch place is located. If you are looking for a place to chill and talk with friends on weekend, I think this is the right place.
No comment
No comment

Maman is a nice little bakery and lunch spot in SoHo that has recently received a lot of hype over its chocolate chip cookie. This review is for that cookie only. GrubStreet said it was "crispy enough on the outside -- like Blue Ribbon Bakery Market's excellent cookie -- with the kind of soft, melting interior that reminds you of Levain Bakery's famous creation." This is nothing but a bunch of artfully-phrased BS. The cookie that I received had an interior that was too hard and was nowhere near the soft melty goodness that Levain produces on a consistent basis. Yet again I find myself deceived by the restaurant industry hype machine. At least the size of it was substantial enough for the $3.75 price, but in my view, Levain is still the undisputed champ.
No comment
No comment
Love the branding, the design, execution and layout of the store but the drinks and desserts are just okay. The loaves? are very oily, not buttery, which is a downer but regardless. A pretty cafe.

(1) Awwwful service. Waitress tried to take away a plate when I was ACTIVELY EATING IN FRONT OF HER. After a half-hearted "oh sorry", she placed my friend's fork in front of me. Another waitress took away the water jug- I thought she took it to refill, but NOPE she never came back so we self-served water. (2) Food is mediocre. Baked goods and quiches were not bad, but FAR from impressive. (3) Their hot chocolate is way too hyped up. Cute decor, though.
No comment
Very enjoyable outdoor seating experience, friendly staff, adorable interior, great drinks, and lovely light and refreshing food! A good fit for a great morning. I'd eat here again no sweat.
No comment

Favorite NYC place. Quality coffee  (Toby's blend), delicious food, comfortable back room with an outdoor space and outlets. Cookies, coffee, and sandwiches all rival top NYC comparables. Quaint, cute, comfortable, and delicious.
No comment
One of the richest chocolate chip cookie I've ever had... right out of the oven! I was lucky... :-)
No comment

On a weekday afternoon, this is a great place to study or catch up with friends! It's super cute, totally ig worthy, but still provides the space to actually sit down and eat. I ordered the nutty chocolate chip cookie, which was huge and sooo good. I also got the berry iced tea, which was also amazing, although I was a little alarmed at the giant cup of ice the waitress originally had in her hand. The only reason I knocked off a star is because it's really pricey, and I got a little lost trying to find this place. I paid around $9 for just the cookie and the tea, and the large ice tea was about a grande in Starbucks sizes. Also, I walked into the restaurant section next door, thinking it was the cafe. The waitress had to stop me from walking any further, and told me to go next door. Awkssss...
No comment
No comment

It is such a lovely place to chill! Food here is not cheap but they all look delicious. The atmosphere here is really relaxing. Some people are sitting here enjoy their drinks or food. Some people are focusing on their laptops. I will definitely come here again. Next time I will try the Match latte. Besides, I love the music here. For some reasons, I cannot connect to the wifi here. They use the open wifi wework but not "maman". It is said that "Maman" is the private wifi. Still a good place to study, work, relax, or talk with friends.

This was a cute little find for a Wednesday afternoon meeting. I wish there were more seating options, especially with the weekly lunch rush. Their salad options were great. I wish that there were more gluten free / vegan options. Love love love their dirty chai!
No comment

This place is in the middle of my rating. They have a lack of options in the menu and they do not have the best quality of food. I enjoyed there basil chicken sandwich but their mushroom and thyme soup was not the best flavor. I definitely tasted the mushroom, but alittle too much. It tasted like if someone just bit into a bush room and mixed it with water. They also have a slow waiting time. There are only about 5 ish tables and it wouldn't take that long since there were two waitresses and 1 table asking for water. I just thought that it lacked some qualities but it was also very décoratives!

Best cafe in NYC. Everything on the menu is amazing, the bacon jam on the breakfast sandwich is 10/10. Their pastries are also some of the best in the city, you have to try their warm chocolate chip cookie and almond croissant. They also have a hidden back patio that makes you feel like you are not in NYC... a major plus.
No comment
No comment

My favorite place in the neighborhood for a morning snack and a beverage. Crochet Monsieur is excellent along with lavender cake and variety of salads they serve for lunch. Never tried anything I didn't like there. And how cute is the decor. LOVE this place.

Over rated, as someone mentioned there are way better cookies in NYC, not worth going out of way for 3stars. White chocolate cookie was basically an over priced sugar mixed in a lump of dough. Service cordial, ambience is what should get 4 stars.The petty annoyance was my $1 bill change that looked like it went through a few wars and washed over and over again, which I would have to take to the bank to exchange on my time; something the register person should do when they deposit their days cash, not try to get rid of it to a customer. Not kind, why I won't be trying to pass it along, no one deserves a badly shaped bill. That bill should be place out of circulation. No matter how good a cookie could have been that small action places a damper on someone's mood.

Such a cute, little, French café. Gets slightly busy during breakfast and lunch, but it is one of my favorite places to sit down and work. Their salads are delicious and very healthy. Their chocolate chip cookies are supposed to be amazing, but the one that I got was a bit dry, not heated, and I wasn't really into all of the extra nuts that they added. I do love their green tea though - so refreshing and nice (despite the higher price).

Adorable. Rustic. Chic. Oh my, I can't! Where do I begin?? Everything from the decor, to floor tiles, the the chairs, display, condiments was well designed. The staff was friendly, the seating in the back was not as big but cozy. All the succulent & hanging plants made it forget I was in the bustling part of town. The pastry?!? It was excellent, the fact that it was not overly sweet, I should ask next time if they use a lot of sugar because most pastries are loaded with sugar but when I had their peach tart & blueberry/lavendar pound cake and chocolate walnut cookie, I was like "this is what pastry should taste, just lightly sweetened like back in the days!" I can come here everyday & I want to thrown all my events here. Thank you Maman

I left my credit card here on a Sunday after I paid for breakfast. I came back on Saturday - realizing my card had been left there I learned that they THREW OUT MY CREDIT CARD!! In less than a weeks time.  They informed me they had trashed it and I should cancel it. I have lost cards in the past and always been contacted .  my name AND business were clearly on the card, it would have been such a simple and kind act to google me ( I would have showed up immediately ) and called to let me know I could come get it. Instead I spent 5 days searching high and low only to go back there and be told I should " just cancel it and get a new one " because they trashed it.  Anyone who has cards linked to purchases they need to return or automated charges and apple accounts knows that having your card unnecessarily cancelled is SO MUCH WORK.  Don't leave your card keys or glasses here because you can bet they will throw them out without thinking twice. I have a return that I needed to make linked to that card that I can likely no longer make without my card.

Very cute spot for a coffee and sweet treats. They also have some savory food but I haven't tried it yet. I looooved their matcha with almond milk and marshmallows on top! If you need a cozy place for a catch up with friend or to work or study, this is perfect. But it's not that spacious so hopefully you'll find the spot!
No comment
No comment
Loved this place for breakfast. Butternut waffles, quiche, and breakfast sandwich were all amazing. Precious atmosphere. Will eat here again.

Came here for the popular chocolate chip cookie. It was only ok, definitely not the best cookie I've had. The best part was that there was plenty of chocolate, some even melted. What I wasn't really a fan of was that the middle still seemed a bit under baked and somewhat soggyish. The edges was more baked and crispier. If only the rest of the cookie was like that. It was a pretty big cookie and for $4 it better be.
No comment

This has got to be one of the cutest little cafes that fits in so well with the young, hip, and trendy vibe of Soho! The rustic yet classic interior/decor that greets you the moment you walk in makes this cafe experience a one to remember. I love even the smallest details such as flowers and cup designs that Maman managed to execute so well - I sometimes order hot drinks just so that I can drink out of the pretty cups. The dining/sitting area is in the back through a small hallway, and that's the best part. There is great lighting created by both natural and adorable light bulbs, and the lovely art pieces and flowers that are placed all over the space makes the room a heaven for photographers or avid "instagram-ers" like me. Not only is the interior gorgeous, the pastries are absolutely delicious! I forget the names of the pastries we ordered, but they were both so good I don't even remember how long it took us to finish. I always go here for coffee and dessert, but I will most definitely return for the sandwiches. Every time I'm in the Soho area, I stop by because it's one of the best spots that can boost your mood.
No comment
No comment

MATCHA 100% love Panatea, this was my first try and it was absolutely delicious. The spot is so cozy and cute, and I might seem weird (I know) but I loved the bathroom. The design and how the place was thought of just reflects its location perfectly. I sat outside as it was still warm out but they also have a few couches to share inside. I didn't know about the back room, which I noticed when I was there and its a very versatile space for happy hours and possibly a pre-planned evening gathering.
