Ordered a turkey club and specifically asked for no tomatoes, add bacon (which normally turkey clubs have bacon and instead of ranch I wanted mayo. Got the sandwich 2 min after I sat down. They turkey was entirely too thick and tomatoes on the sandwich. Took the sandwich up and told them what I asked for. They told me they never charged me for the bacon so I had to pay to have the bacon put on. They took the sandwich back and just removed the tomatoes and threw on cold bacon. Couldn't even eat the sandwich, turkey was just awful. Iced coffee was brutal as well. Try another place, you are better off
No comment

For the Cookies and Coffee, only place that ever came close to Levain with the cookies. Since Levain is quite a trek uptown, this place does a fine job of being a good substitute to Levain. Coffee is also very good.
No comment
OK coffee (drip). I took a look at the food and wasn't particularly drawn to anything. Maybe next time
No comment
No comment
The cutest little coffee shop in soho. The decor really makes it a great place to read a book or just enjoy coffee alone. Plus, their coffee cups are beautiful. Will definitely be coming back here.
No comment
Best avocado toast I've ever had in my life. Kombucha was a little weird but I swear to god the avocado toast is so flavorful I'd lay down my life for it.
No comment
Love this place. Great atmosphere, inside seating area is super comfy and nostalgic. Got a nutty chocolate cookie and a latte, both delicious!
No comment

This was a really great dining experience. Like a true millennial I ordered the avocado toast and it was the greatest decision ever. I got salmon on top of it and I don't like cold salmon or called me in general. They were kind enough to warm it up for me and I inhaled it. My friends also ordered avocado toast but with fried egg and my other friend ordered something with chicken on it I want to say it was a chicken sandwich and she really enjoyed that. We all got coffees and a coffee's were amazing and very well-made. We actually didn't realize that the restaurant was half a shot and half a bakery so we didn't get to try any of the treats but the food was just phenomenal. I will say that having us eat right next to where they sell various antique materials was a bit quirky but I liked it and it was very quiet. I hate noisy places in general especially noisy restaurants and so it was nice to just unwind relax and will hear our own thoughts and just eat!!!  I wish I had photos but all I could see in that moment with me, my food and my friends and I'm not sorry!!
I've had better coffee but this cafe is so cute! Easy to find a seat at 10:30 on a Saturday morning - I guess because not so many people know about it yet. It'll definitely blow up soon though.

Cute interior. Lots of seating in the back. A lot of outlets as well but not at the large table where there is more seating. So if you want an outlet and planning to do some work, try and grab a seat during off peak hours. Typical NY prices for an iced coffee--about $5. Would come back if I was in the area often

The alain milliat juice is fabulous because of its rich nectar thick taste. I had the strawberry one. Also had their daily cake slice which is a lavendar cake. Very delicious indeed. mamans cookies comes with milk and the cookies are warmed to the right temp~ The environment seems a bit crowded as we had to share the table with others. Also it was sad they didnt have hot chocolate when we arrived:(

I wanted to go here to try their lavender hot chocolate and I was slightly disappointed. First it's a cute, unbeknowing shop and in the back there's more seats. But the lavender hot chocolate didn't have much lavender smell or taste. Maybe, I hyped it too much for myself, but I wanted more lavender. It was still a good hot chocolate, but nothing special.
No comment
Great croissants, quiche and coffee. Lovely atmosphere but service could be improved ;)
No comment

I don't know how anyone can give this place anything less than 5 stars. Probably the best chocolate chip cookie I have ever had in my life. Coffee is delicious. Quiche Loraine? Whatever I had before was cheap imitations of what it's supposed to taste like, try it here and you will understand what I mean. If you are in the neighborhood come in even if it's just for their cookies, you will not regret it.
No comment
Read reviews on the chocolate chip cookie- picked it up and was disappointed. I've had better cookies (like Dominique Ansel and levain)
A great place to get good coffee/baked goods! The back side of the cafe looks like an indoor secret garden.
No comment
Absolutely recommended. Smells like my grandmother's house.. Delicious pastries and excellent coffee. Cosy atmosphere and French design.
Stopped by for Saturday brunch. Food was exceptional but unfortunately the service was really poor. Long wait to order and long wait to pay.
No comment

Came here with a friend on a Friday afternoon to grab a quick bite to eat. We ordered the quiche christel ($6.5), the Claudia sandwich ($8), and orange juice & coffee. After ordering, we were confused about the system of the restaurant - we decided to go ahead and seat ourselves. However, when we went to sit down, we were told that part of the restaurant was for dine-in guests only. This was a bit frustrating, as we did not know that this was a possibility when we were ordering at the cafe. Had we known this was an option, we would have opted to "dine-in" and order off the menu and have our meal with service included. Luckily, they had other seating available. The ambiance of the restaurant is very cute and quaint, especially the "dine-in" area which is very unique. It is basically an antique store at the front and a tiny restaurant in the back. Food was pretty decent and its a good spot to sit and chat or to get some work done. Service could be more polite and they should probably tell their guests the difference between the cafe and the restaurant itself to avoid confusion.
Such an adorable spot.  Great coffee and beautiful pastries.  Love the quiche.  Everyone is so friendly - it's a really warm place. Like a big hug from your maman.
No comment

Deliciousness!! Good service and great food!!! The ham and cheese sandwich was wayyyy more than the name sounds like. Toasted and hearty, everything inside was great. The Nutella Babka is a must-have! Good coffee stop.
No comment
No comment

A great spot for a peaceful weekend brunch. I love the back room with the rustic wooden tables, potted plants, and small patio. For a place with such a cute ambiance, the food was very good, too. We got the zucchini noodles, matcha waffles (previously on the menu, they were pancakes), and "rabbit hole" sandwich. The zucchini noodles were refreshing, and I appreciated that they had a creative healthier item on the brunch menu. It actually has grapes and basil leaves, which both meshed really well with the rest of the salad. The matcha waffles were tasty, though they reminded me more of Eggo waffles as the matcha flavor was very subtle. Portions were just right - not small, but not enormous. I hope the weekend brunch doesn't become too popular because I would love to come back!
No comment

Maman is a good bakery creating some unique sweets--with hits and misses. It is dim lit, has plenty of seating in separate room in the back, but no wifi. However, guests can easily connect to the nearby WeWork's wifi. Lavender hot chocolate with almond milk is really solid. Lavender flavor is subtle but really comes through without tasting soapy. Nutty chocolate chip cookie ($3.75) with nutella is not good--do not fall for this as they try to upsell you on the cookies. A bit burnt tasting with more-than-crisp outside. and macadamia nuts taste kind of old. Olive oil loaf cake with grapefruit glaze ($3.50) and white chocolate blueberry lavender cake ($3.50) aimed high and fell flat. Flavors did not come through. Crème brûlée croissant ($3.75) is ultra soft. A little difficult to eat because of how soft it is and how generously they packed in the cream, which is done so by slicing in half and simply piling it up before reassmbling. Can be very messy and I actually wish the outside were harder and the inside with less cream. I still recommend trying it out.
Cute little place with s lot of good tea selections. Really cool decor with private space that can be booked in the back

Today we want to introduce you to Maman - our new favorite coffee shop in the city. It has several locations but we of course went to check out the one in soho(our favorite part of the city). The place is cozy and has a very nice decor(feels like at home).We have ordered a hot chocolate, chocolate mint tea,salad, pistachio bread and creme brule croissants. Everything was amazing! Especially we recommend trying their salads- they are very delicious and fulfilling at the same time. Creme brulle croissant were to die for. We think this is a coffee shop for everyone: for the coffee lovers, for dessert lovers, for healthy lunch people, for the artists,for the bathroom goers and of course for the bloggers!

This designers did a hell of a job with this cute as a button French bakery. From the blue and white patterned to-go cups to the custom made rabbit mugs, every last detail was dreamt up to delight. And delight it does- from the addicting leek quiche to the exposed kitchen, communal tables and magazine racks in the back. I can't wait to try more of their treats!
Love this place!  Cute atmosphere, delicious food, and good coffee. The quiche loraine  is fantastic, and the cookies are spectacular as well. Would definitely recommend.  Good prices, too.
Asked if they could warm-up this piece of Quiche ($7.00) , they nicely said "yes", and it was cold ..  Disappointed  :-(

The Cappuccino here was amazing. There was only one employee working while it was extremely busy and none of it seemed to bother him which was perfect. Everyone was getting their coffee in a timely manner and with great communication as well. Will definitely be going back here.
No comment

Small gourmet cafe, few tables in the back room with no good view, maybe 2 seats at their front window sill that has a better view. I went over specifically to taste their chocolate chip cookie to see if it's better than Levain's Bakery, since Maman's is usually listed on Top 10, as well. It's definitely not better than Levain's. Maman's cookies taste better cold. It was still good, though surprisingly, their white choc chip cookie with a pretzel on top, tastes even better than their traditional chocolate chip cookie! Make sure to call ahead regarding what cookies they have available when you arrive. It's an easy drive by if someone waits on the curb while u dash in and out of the place. I'd go back. Their sandwiches looked fancy and tasty. The cappuccino and fresh squeezed orange juice are good too.
Good quality matcha latte. One of the best in Manhattan.

Cute French bakery, but actual baked goods were stale and tasteless. The price for a cup of hot water and black tea bag was $3.50! Ambience was nice, but overpriced and food pricing was not commensurate with the quality of food.
No comment

The lavender hot chocolate is a must it has a unique taste to it. However, i am giving this place a 3 star because the last time I went there the hot chocolate did not smell like lavender and it also tastes just like the barista dumped a lot of syrup in it. The matcha green tea drink was quiet good, but they tend to put a lot of ice in it. Did not have a chance to try the pastries yet. The store is really cute, though. A nice place to work but it has a limit of I think 45 minute stay at the cafe chilling area.
Great chai latte and they have oat milk! Coffee is alsp very good. Cookies look great, and small bites for lunch. A little bit small so can get pretty busy.
Had the tuna sandwich which was great and had cranberries in it. Pastries are excellent, can get crowded.
Super cute place, great pastries and amazing caffeinated beverages!
It's just such a wonderful coffee shop! It's super cute, and has the best lavender hot chocolate! And just tried their peach tart! Sooooo good! It's the best! Love it!

The food was great but the service was one I've never experienced before. Went there this past Sunday and the waitress gave us all sullen looks as we ordered. Forget about being friendly, she made us feel like we were annoying her with our presence there. Then she would turn around and start laughing and smiling with her fellow coworker. It was very demoralizing and I would never come here again just from that experience. I would much rather visit a different Maman location!
No comment
NO WIFI - they have a network but refuse to give the password out.  So don't go there if you are looking to work! The pineapple brioche is great and ice coffee could be stronger.
Great salads and fresh brewed ice tea.  Staff was very accommodating.  Restaurant and bathrooms were clean.  I highly recommend!
Good coffee, but good grief are they slow. They also refuse to fix the door handle that is not handicap accessible. Someone with carpal tunnel or joint pain can not get into the building.

I am in love with this place. Best packaging, best environment, cute staff, amazing food. Just adorable place that you want to make you 'local' spot. My only advise would be to expand you menu just a little..

I absolutely love this place. I love to visit after a Saturday morning yoga class, but I also love to use them for work catered lunches. Everyone is always blown away by how good it is. They're sweet and savory items are equally as good. Their coffee is great. And the service is so warm. I'm thrilled that they opened a restaurant in Tribeca.
No comment
the chocolate croissant was not very flaky, chocolate was a little too sweet and not dark/bitter enough.
This branch of Maman is really nice! Maybe the best Soho coffee shop to sit in and do work. Had a great chocolate croissant and iced americano. Wifi wouldn't hurt, but it's one less distraction!
No comment

I've been here three times and every time I want to get one of everything. Amazing and unique bakery items that are so fresh and very tasty. If you are looking for something a little more, go for the quiche-- SO good and a very generous portion.
Cute Little Café with lovely furniture and nice salads. Expensive but good. Nice drinks and very friendly service! Lovely spot in Soho.

Stopped in for a latte and chai today. Service was awesome and drinks were perfect! We had hoped to sit and enjoy our coffee but we were told the back tables are just for orders in. Wish that was more clear and that they let customers know this. Other than that food looked great!
Love the place, very hard to find a seat on a Saturday morning tho!  I had the pears almond pie, smooth and sweet for any sweet seakers such my slef!!! Loved it!
this is my first time here for brunch I tried the de constructed and it is so good also the green matcha and cappuccino good
No comment

Definitely one of the most aesthetically beautiful coffee shops in the city. It has a distinct character- an almost rustic and traditional feel with lots of textured wood and floral decor. The cups are decorated like the fancy blue and white porcelain ones you see in tea shops. The coffee itself is great, and their baked goods are stellar. You have to try the chocolate chip macadamia cookie, it's so rich I couldn't even finish it in one sitting.
The famous nutty cookie. Good , but for this price I will still chose levain bakery over it anyday!

The place's atmosphere it really nice, but the food is probably the worst I've ever had in manhattan. There was a fly cooked into my doughnut-i don't like buggy protein. Their juice was too sour, the tea is very bland, the Croque Maman was soggy, their cakes look lovely but are under cooked, and two of our forks were rusty . Although the food was absolutely terrible the servers were very kind and apologetic- if they work on the food it might* be better (eventually).

Love this place! Stopped in for the first time this morning and was so happy I did. Rustic space with the feel of the French countryside. My mom and I ordered the lavender blueberry cake, a chocolate chip cookie, kale and butternut squash quiche, and coffee. (We loaded up...and it was well worth it!) Everything tasted so good and I can't wait to go back! Je l'adore beaucoup!
Unique decor and nice staff. Espresso was smooth as well. Make sure to sit in the back room, tucked past the display and register!

This restaurant was unexpected as we were to go to the restaurant right next door which happen to be closed. We are happy things worked out as they did as this was a unique, quaint place with character and much attention to detail. The smoked salmon, my favorite, was soooo good and on a rye I never had before. Great selection of teas and the presentation was exemplary. The place reminded me of a high-end Starbucks and country bed and breakfast. Definitely planning a return visit when back in NYC.

I can't speak for other locations but the atmosphere is really lovely here. There's dine-in seating and a restaurant. Long family-style tables in the back help create an environment where you can have a nice conversation, even with strangers. There's a few smaller tables and bar stools in the front if you're visiting solo. I had the blueberry lavender cake. (It was okay. I think the lavender made it a little oily.) I liked the pistachio chocolate croissant much better. The quiche with the pears, parsnips & gorgonzola was the most interesting (in a good way) I've ever tasted!
Good food and drink. Back area is nice to sit and eat. Pretty decor.
I love having tea and a pastry here and sitting in the back of the shop. It has the best atmosphere  what a cute place!!!

The red pepper & goat cheese quiche and pistachio cake were delicious.  Communal tables in the back.  Giving four stars only because we were kicked out shortly after arriving because of an event with no prior warning.

Cute and quaint spot, especially the seating area in the back.  Had a slice of ham and cheese quiche that I liked a lot.  I also had a white chocolate and pretzel cookie that was ok, definitely not one of the best cookies I've had - sounded and looked better than it was.  Seems to be a popular spot, pretty crowded on a Sunday afternoon.  Lucky if you can snag seats and hang out.
No comment
No comment
Excellent lavender hot chocolate and chocolate chip cookies! Got too crowded on the weekend. Seating area is cute and cozy. But unfortunately the wifi doesn't work :-(

my friends stumbled into maman after discovering a long wait at two hands. the decor is airy and welcoming. the food is also plated beautifully. i had the rabbit in the hole, which was tasty with a mix of basil, tomatoes, comte cheese, carmelized onions and pastrami. my only grievance was that the service could be better as our food took a bit of time. i finished my coffee before getting my food. otherwise a delightful brunch spot. i might be back to grab and go.
i tried the orange juice and cookie! at 4 bucks - the cookie was nothing special and levains cookie is much better - juice was good but i will return to try the vegetarian lasagna which looked good
I usually don't like overly cute place. The food is good but not great. I visited in the morning. Not crowed at all. NYC has too many overly cute cafés.

Cute & cozy new spot just between Little Italy & SoHo. Tasty bites and teas! I will be back to try their other offerings. Sweet service and reasonable prices for the area. There is seating in the back (all food/drinks are ordered in the front)... lovely decor, and they have wifi :)

Finally some decently priced salad in the area (a small is $6.53 including tax). Very cute and boutique, switches up the menu of quiches, salads, and sandwiches every day. Not your typical Chop't or Sweetgreens salad that is just a bunch of greens with a few toppings. Also have a lot of baked goods but I haven't tried any yet. The seating is very limited in the back so it's better to get a grab and go lunch from here on your lunch break

Lovely little bakery and cafe. Happened to stumble in one day while looking for an alternative to Starbucks. Seating is kind of limited, with about two communal tables in the back and some stools in the front, but the ambience is very nice in general, trending less on the hipster side of things and more towards cutesy without being treacly. Matcha latte is nothing particularly special, but the nutella-filled madelines are quite tasty. There are plenty of other food options too, a great number of which contain kale, for better or for worse. Outdoor patio area should be opening up soon.

A quaint little place with good looking baked good. I've had the goat cheese and red pepper quiche and the blueberry lavender pound cake on my last visit. The egg part was velvety rich and soft but the crust was not as crusty or even crispy. The cake again had great flavors but was more on the gritty dry side. There is only one unisex bathroom with a baby seat inside easy for diaper swapping. This is probably a good place to hit up if you have a kid with you and you're just done shopping off SoHo.
Lovely place. Designed with taste. Great food and atmosphere. I tried their chocolate chip cookie. It was very good. Their salads and sandwiches looked yummy. I loved the back dining room.

They have the best Nutella cookies. Always soft and gooey on the inside with that chewy crispy texture on the outside. Pretty decent pastries as well. Had a cappuccino that was pretty good too. But their cookie is really the thing to get!

I love this shop. Love the aesthetic, love the lavender blueberry cake. If you want to get lunch there during the work week, come early or else all the salads you want will be gone by the time you get there (i.e. me waltzing in at 1:30pm)

This is a a great spot to stop in for coffee or snack in SoHo. I loved the quiche, lasagna and cup and decaf coffee! Note that there's not a whole lot of room in the back to sit and it's first come first serve.
Loved the lavender hot chocolate -- so delicious and creative...the place itself was very classy as well...nice little French vintage coffee shop!
No comment
No comment

Stumbled on this place near my workplace. Decor is so nice and cozy and definitely Instagram worthy. That alone made me want to try the coffee and food. the quiche I had was really tasty but the salad left more to be desired. However the chocolate chunk cookie alone earned the 4 stars. So freaking good it's dangerous. I know they brew Toby's Estate which is an awesome brew (I work at a place that brews it). Take your SO or best friend here on a cute date :-)
No comment
Beautiful. Tucked away. I hope this stays somewhat hidden!

Came for the chocolate chip cookie and it was worth the trip! Melty, large chunks of chocolate and a cookie that is the right amount of done-ness. My mouth is watering just remembering it. We also enjoyed the pistachio bread and espresso. Cute little eating area in the back and bathrooms were fine. My only complaint was the service - not particularly welcoming or friendly. Great for lunch, breakfast, or just a cookie. It's small so not good for a group.

This place is fantastic. I found it on yelp to do some work. They had a good selection of teas, coffee and pastries. I ordered the mint chocolate tea and a croissant. The tea was minty and not too chocolatey but I wasn't disappointed. The croissant was flaky and subtle, just the way I like it. I went to the back to sit down and really liked the quaint space. They had a good deal of outlets and the tables were commune-like so I didn't feel embarrassed to ask a couple with the baby if I could sit with them. It was pretty loud in there from the people just chatting and catching up but it didn't bother me since I had my headphones on. I would definitely come back here.
My favorite french café in Manhattan. Very cool and cozy back room for seating. Shared seating that is not uncomfortable.
The drinks are OVERpriced. But if you're staying for a while to do your work, it's a dream place. I think it's overpriced for a reason.

Well, it was nice while it lasted. The food, service and ambiance were all quite good. Now that they've franchsed the brand their interests are elsewhere. No more food or table service and burnt coffee with scalded milk. Adieu maman...

Love the vibe of this place! Super cute coffee shop, and so well decorated (like pinterest worthy). It was a bit crowded and there happened to be a really loud group sitting near me so I wasn't able to study as I had hoped but this place would be great to get together with someone for a cup of a coffee

this is probably one of the cutest coffee shops in the area! and know that there are a ton of cute ones around. the setting is very chill and there's so many open seating so it's great to meet up and have coffee or tea with some friends in the back!

Maman is a great addition to the area between soho and nolita. The case of sweet and savory items is beautifully displayed as is the layout of the rest of the coffee shop.  I especially like the grilled leeks quiche. Great selection of teas and the service is welcoming, friendly. My one point of contention- why carry all compostable utensils and not have a compost bin?
love this spot.  good ambiance. free wifi.  except the study group on saturdays.

Wow, this place is just amazing, great food so tasty and beautiful people working there. I've been here a couple of times with my friends and every time I'm leaving happy and excited for my next visit. Somewhat pricy but over all I love this place, u recommend it to all coffee and pastry lovers.
Love this place! Stopped in for iced coffee and grabbed a croissant as well - heaven! Staff was friendly and helpful.
No comment
No comment

Lovely French ambiance and food. So glad this place opened near our office. Most of menu changes daily. I tried cauliflower salad and kale salad with honey vinaigrette last week and was not disappointed. A coworker oohed and aaahed with pleasure devouring her egg salad sandwich too:). Picked up their famous nutty cookies for the office which were immediately inhaled. Full sized macadamias in these chocolate chip cookies! Yum.

Great spot for a quick and healthy lunch.  I loved that they had a significant amount of options for vegetarians!  It's a small place but we got a table for 3 in no time.  The french atmosphere was authentically cute.
I wish I had something positive to say but I could only think of two things. The space is gorgeous and the music choice is pleasant.
No comment

VERY good quality coffee and bake goods!! However the service is a 1 star, if it was not for the bad service I would give this place 5 stars. The two girls that work Monday-Friday morning are very rude and also seem to be irritated.
I absolutely love Maman! I stop in for their hot chocolate all the time. The baristas are fantastic and the seating area in the back is cute and cozy. Definitely one of my favorite cafés.
Very friendly staff from the moment you step in.  Feels like france with all French speaking staff and customers.  There is a je ne sais quoi :)
Cutest cafe ever! So cozy and comfortable! Delicious lavender hot chocolate!! I love the decor of the entire place. I haven't tried their food selections yet but they look pretty delicious! :)

Delightful cute French cafe that will easily become a to go to place for me. The decor is charming with lots of whimsical details, that really make the atmosphere. The chocolate cookies with macadamia nuts are amazing! I'm looking forward to trying their much talked about Dulce De Leche bar and the chocolate fondant cake next time. Maman is a wonderful addition to the neighborhood!

Super adorable French cafe with great food and atmosphere. Came here for breakfast. Quiche Lorraine was delicious and tried my first ever pistachio loaf - also good. They have magazines available for those who like to read, eat and chill out.

This little French bakery in SoHo is adorable. We went for breakfast and each got a croissant and a slice of the lavender blueberry cake (which even though that might sound like a dessert it worked perfectly for breakfast). The croissants were fresh and flaky and buttery and delicious. The lavender blueberry cake was incredible! Such an amazing and unexpected combination of flavors. We also each got the lavender hot chocolate which was different but soo good. Chocolatey but not too rich. We sat in the back which was so charming with exposed brick walls, blue China in the cabinet, strings of lights above and rustic mismatched tables and chairs. Not many seating options but strangers were good about sharing space- 3 different groups can fit comfortably at the long table. Even the restroom was nicely decorated. We would definitely go back for the lavender blueberry cake- yum!

I ventured in just the other day for a matcha latte and was not at all disappointed by anything other than the fact that I had to stand up to drink it. The space was absolutely gorgeous, cozy, full of flowers and interesting decor. It was very cold and windy outside and it would have added to the feeling of respite to be able to sit down and drink, but unfortunately I wasn't the only person that had that particular idea on a Friday afternoon. Nevertheless, I really enjoyed this place and even though it's off the beaten path for me, I do plan to go back for another matcha latte in the near future. It was delicious.

Had the white chocolate pretzel cookie for the first time in this quaint French bakery and let me tell you that cookie was so sinfully delicious it left me wanting more. It was served warm and was so oozingly soft in the middle of the cookie it was like biting into a piece of heaven. I highly recommend people try that cookie.

Come early for brunch or else the pickings are slim. They make a mean chocolate chip macadamia cookie (3.50). Spend the money, its worth every penny. The quiche was very nice and the hot chocolate was a steep $4...shldve gotten a cookie! The decor is beautiful, rustic and charming French parisian. Not a lot of space at all. Also it gets very crowded with two people serving. The owners are in the forefront serving, beautiful couple, polite and friendly.

I used to love this place, for food, ambience, baked goods. However staff is so hard to deal with, they always give you attitude or make you wait forever to be served. It used to be my to go lunch spot, everyday, but not anymore. I'm tired of their poor customer service.
Great coffee and ambience with seating in the back room ideal for a quick meeting or work study. Great neighborhood gem

Their famous chocolate chip cookie was pretty good. I prefer soft baked, which these are not, but that's OK. The flour and chocolate itself was average, and it is the salted macadamia nuts IN the cookie that sets it worlds apart tbh. Without it, the cookie itself would taste plain and generic. Its the natural fat in the macadamia nuts that gives the cookie all the flavor. I like super dark chocolate chunks, so maybe a more bitter cookie for me. But its hood, a nice mild, sweet and savory cookie with surprisingly generous amounts of macadamia nuts. The nuts don't taste stale, like a lot of store bought macadamia nuts do. $3.75 + tax = $4.08 for a quite big palm sized cookie is worth the calorie and wallet splurge every once in a while. I suggest getting it fresh out of oven or have them heat it. Makes a big difference
Great and cozy deco, great food, great team, perfect spot! A little gem in the middle of Soho!

This place is a perfectly acceptable cafe for coffee or tea, pastries and lunch snacks.  The decor is very charming.  The layout is challenging with insufficient seating - open area in front with seating in the back down a long hall.  The food is fine but nothing extraordinary.  I had shepard's pie which was a bit bland and a pear chocolate tart that was fairly good but dry and the portion seemed larger than needed.  No need to go back but it seemed pretty popular with the younger crowd.
No comment

I ordered the cappucino, which was great! I had the croque "maman" with bechamel sauce. Divine! Also, I've seen Ewan McGregor twice in one week there, so if its good enough for him, its good enough for me! Ha! The seating in the back is heavenly, but try to go early, because the food runs low after 4pm.

Met a girlfriend here for a quick breakfast before work. Lavender hot chocolate is a must here. So delicious. The decor is so warm and special. It is so different than other places I've been. I am definitely a fan of the chic French decor and menu here! Will be back
No comment

Cute little coffee shop.  From the outside it appears there is not a seating area in there, but it's in the back!  Very trendy decor and a number of tables.  Very clean, comfortable and I felt at home in there.  Not loud or congested at all.  Coffee was good too!
No comment
Absolutely delicious pastries and one of the best dopio macchiatos I've ever had.  Can't wait to get back.

Walked by with my sister and we couldn't pass it up - very cute, elegant French cafe/bakery. The cookies here are AMAZING!! Highly recommend!  Will have to go back and try some of their regular menu items.  Looked delish!
Cute place! Good food, service and beverages. It has a great little workspace in the back -- keep in mind that it gets busy though!

The lavender hot chocolate is not overhyped. It's so delicious, I'm surprised more places around the city aren't infusing hot chocolate. If you are a hot chocolate fan, it's a must try. The atmosphere is also very cute and quiet, though I went on a weekday afternoon. If I lived closer, I would bring my laptop and work here because it's just so peaceful and nice.
Love this place! Best coffee in NY so far and delicious fresh food. Salads are amazing xx
It's super cute and the aesthetic is great, even love the cups but the music selection NEEDS to be changed - down right awful
Lavender hot chocolate was amazing and the atmosphere was really cute.  Food was super tasty too!
No comment
I had a latte and a slice of Maccha cake. Both were good and the atmosphere of the place was nice!

Ive been here two times so far and its a very aesthetically pleasing little 'cafe'. The staff is very pleasant, and their pound cake is delicious. I recommend the pistachio pound cake. Besides the pound cake I've only had espressos, so I cannot comment on their other items. Espresso is "ehh", nothing special. I would definitely come here more often, even just for the ambience and the pistachio pound cake, but it is over priced.
The best coffee I've had in NYC, seriously. Their quiche is amazingly cheesy, and their soups are super creamy. Great place to go when you get tired of shopping in Soho!
Excellent lavender hot chocolate, excellent egg sandwich, and very friendly service. Cool place to chill and have a bite.

Maman created the most special evening of my life!  We had our engagement dinner here and Elisa & her boyfriend (the owners) did everything to make sure everything was perfect.  The food was served to us family style with delicious tuna, and south of france inspired vegetable dishes.  They played our favorite music, had our photos everywhere, and created the most romantic ambiance I could imagine. I cannot recommend this place enough, especially for private parties!  They have a great space.

I recently started a new job and lucky me it's about a 5 min walk from Maman. I treated myself to their famous cookie the other day and I will definitely be back. The only down side is they run out if their lunch salads pretty quickly... guess I'll have to have a cookie for lunch instead. The cafe itself is adorable!
The place is so darn cute. My quiche was rich and creamy and I can't wait to go back and try more things.
Great food, awesome décor, friendly enough staff. I only went once but loved it and will go back. Only had savory stuff (soup, open-faced sandwich), will definitely have to try that cookie!

i. love. this. cafe. the decor is delightful and makes me feel like i'm in a little coffeeshop in the streets of france. the lavendar hot chocolate i had was delicious and aromatic, perfect for a chilly day. all in all this place is a little piece of heaven in the city, and i'll return every time i'm in new york!

Pretty cute. Red pepper and goat cheese quiche was to die for, silky smooth in a lovely crust. Huge piece which I couldn't finish. Love the to-go coffee cups with their blue and white toile look. They didn't have a lot of pastry choices when we were there (Sunday at 9:00 a.m.). I ordered the chocolate almond croissant, but it wasn't really a croissant. The consistency was more shortbread like.  Delicious, but not a croissant. It didn't look like the chocolate and plain croissants that were still in the case as we left. Somewhere else on Yelp, you can see a picture of it. My husband wished the quiche was hotter, but the slightly more than room temperature was fine for mine. I also didn't really like the tan cardboard container the quiche came in, but now I'm getting picky. We had the back to ourselves. Not sure when we'll be back in NYC, but I might like to try some of their other pastries. I'll have to see if they are as good as Standard Baking in Portland, ME, our favorite in our home state.

Great little place in the middle of a busy neighborhood. Their baked goods are amazing and I can never wait to go back just so that I have an excuse to try something new. Coffee is very good, and I love the decor. Perfect place to go read a good book or meet a friend !

After a visit to New York City and hearing much praise about this wonderful new bakery I just had to check it out! I was presently surprised about the politeness of the staff and the amazing quality of the food. The quiche and salads were fresh and delicious and those desserts.....I even went back to take some more to go! Place was perfectly decorated and was enjoyable to spend time in. Well worth every penny this place and we will be back for sure

Cannot say enough good things about this place. The food is absolutely delicious, from the pastries to the sandwiches to the homemade salads. Everything is very fresh and the ingredients are excellent. It is moderately priced for the area as well. Seating is a little bit of an issue but the staff is very friendly.

A true gem in Soho! Travelled from Montreal to New York and fell on this amazing place. Can definitely feel the French and homemade touches from the decor to the food. I was there the weekend and went there twice while I stayed in NYC. Absolutely loved their famous cookie and food on the menu ... Ie quiche red peppers and eggplant and tartinette prosciutto and goat cheese. Delish! Service is personable and friendly felt like I was home. Definitely coming back when I'm in town, our new stop in NYC!
Excellent food, friendly, professional service and neighborhood gem. Never a bad meal; especially good the game specials and Mrs Mud Pie dessert.
No comment
so overrated. I lived in new york for 13 years and came here twice. the food is so overpriced and isnt even that good. When i saw my bill i nearly fainted. Good, but not worth it.

I've been dining at Henry's End since the early 90's. The food is always delicious despite the menu never really changing. It's always busy so make a reservation. The Steak Diane is probably the best dish on the menu. A close 2nd would be the Walnut  Encrusted Chicken Breast.
No comment
No comment

It's really a nice little spot. Overall the food was good and the service was great. We had the crab cakes to start. Then my wife had the roasted vegetables and I had the fried chicken. Her dish definitely won out. Really flavorful. The breading on my chicken was burnt that I couldn't taste the spices. Desert is smaller portions but tasty.

A bit pricey, so I only come here for my birthday. Service is great. Food is excellent. Serve duck, elk, and chicken. Dishes are trendy. For example, I ordered chicken with fig jam. Doesn't sound appetizing but it was absolutely delicious. Portions are small. Parking is somewhat difficult to come by. From the outside, doesn't seem like a great place but it is! Schedule varies so call before heading over.

This place is super cute and the food is DELICIOUS. The staff was attentive and personable, the space is inviting - they were reasonably busy on a Tuesday night, and I could see why! I had the "spinach and goat cheese stuffed chicken breast with fig jam" and it was AMAZING. I cannot recommend it highly enough. I'll be thinking about that for the next week!

Henry's End has such a warm charm about it. Definitely feels like your in England at a local pub... but with really good food! I enjoyed the ribs with a side of mashed potatoes, and we split the chocolate banana bread pudding for dessert. Yum, yum, and yum!  Thanks for provided a cozy and delicious spot during this randomly cold, rainy day in May.
Always a fabulous meal, great service. Varied menu. Love this place!

If I could give it more than 5 stars I would. This place is FANTASTIC and a total neighborhood gem. The veal lemonese is literally one of the best things I've ever put into my mouth and I consider myself to be a huge foodie. Their seasonal offerings of game are also not to be missed.
No comment
No comment

Came here on a Sunday evening. They had indoor and outdoor seating with either socially distanced tables or plexiglass in between. The menu is pretty extensive allowing something for everyone. We wanted to order a bottle of wine and asked for recommendations for a not dry, closer to sweet red wine. The waiter said he couldn't think of anything that fit that and brought some of their house sangria to try. It was obviously too sweet so we picked a bottle on our own and they allowed us to try it and it was good. I hit the mushroom ravioli appetizer and my date got the West Indian spiced bbq shrimp. The ravioli was a little salty but it kinda worked. The shrimp was good but I wouldn't call it West Indian spiced. For main dish I got the NY strip with sun dried tomatoes topping. It was SMOTHERED and I was not expecting that for what should be a good cut of meat. It was good but lacked what you expect from a New York strip. I also got the truffle fries which were good and abundant. My date got the veal chop lemonese which was very crispy but very thin. We finished with the tiramisu which was good. All and all it was ok but priced at a higher quality than was provided.
Food is fantastic. Penne w lobster. Chicken w goat cheese & jam. Brussel sprouts are so good. Don't get me started on the Caesar salad and the focaccia bread. Love this place. Outstanding food
No comment

Very welcomed restaurant in a historic Brooklyn Heights. Very well spaced distance between tables, attentive server and bus boys - followed all the distance rules. Food is amazing. Unique elk chops, soft shell crabs - this is what you have to come for! Salad was great too. Perfect portion size. Definitely must try.

A date night to remember :) This place oozes classic old New York ambience. The yak dumplings with bean sprouts are an amazing appetizer and everything was fantastic. I emailed ahead and told them it was our first date night after we'd become parents (nine months prior) and I feel like they pulled out all the stops. Highly recommended.
No comment

The outdoor dining was nice and cute with the lighting in a pretty quiet neighborhood. We had the octopus and crab cake as our starters. The octopus was tasty and el Dante inside. This was my first time ever having elk chop! I was blown away! The seasoning was great and the elk was cooked perfectly. The elk also wasn't too gamy paired perfectly with Turley Juvenile Zinfandel. What a little charm in the neighborhood!!
The food was exceptional especially the elk chop , definitely worth the wait for the dishes to be served !
No comment

Had dinner here with friends for "exotic game night". It has the feeling of one of those restaurants where if you've lived in the neighborhood for 30 years you go there frequently. Food is good, but a bit heavy. Would go back and try another menu item (I had the duck). My friend had the mixed game platter and said he liked it.
The crab cakes were great and so was the wild boar gnocchi... for sure going back. Restaurant had a nice vibe and would say it's a good date spot. Staff were friendly.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I feel so bad leaving this review because Henry's used to be one of my favorites! They have a great menu and this place has been a neighborhood gem. Unfortunately I had a disastrous dinner last night! We waited 45 min for our food. The bread was super weird, undercooked doughy and it even had a weird taste to it like it lacked an ingredient, it was gross! We ordered steak and duck which both came out so dry we couldn't eat them either. Not sure if there's something wrong with the oven or if there is a new chef but how do you mess up even the bread ? My guest who was extremely unhappy compared it to sizzlers. All in all a super embarrassing experience.
No comment

First a move to a very unwelcoming interior.  Then a price raise all over.  Then no more vegetables with entrees.  Then a liquor raise.  All before covid.  Not good.  Also food quality has gone downhill since the move.
No comment
During these tough time this place delivers! They are doing "Take Away" and it is great!
No comment
Amazing food. Very traditional dishes and cozy ambiance. Anything you ask for is delicious. Wine list has plenty of great wines. Love the truffled French fries.

column3: Long Island City, New York, NY
column6: No comment
No comment
No comment

They've lost site of their customers over the last several years.  They recently charged us $45 dollars for chicken wings and fries for my children on Mother's Day. We were trying to support a local business during the pandemic and got price gouged in the process. yet when we complained, they stammered an excuse about the seats having value ... while the restaurant was empty.  Wake up Henry's End -- your local customers matter. We'll gladly take our business right down the road to owners who support the community rather than exploit it.

Really a 3.5 --wish we could give half stars. Very cozy, small establishment , just wished the food was a little better. Both of us ordered the prix fixe. Scallops were good, sole was nothing special, but soft shell crab linguine was delicious. The desserts were underwhelming -- apple cobbler was very mushy on the inside.
Such a neighborhood gem. Really unique dishes and meats. Great drinks. Also really good as delivery too -- but no matter how you experience it -- just experience it!

I have been going here for around the last 15 years. A great restaurant with great service and even better food.  I have never had a bad meal here- the steak au poivre is to die for (I often like to order a side of mushrooms with it).
This is a bold statement... but Henry's End may have one of the best menus in all of New York City.  Just go.  The end.
No comment
No comment

This penne lobster is good. The steak Diane was good too. The mash potato was not the best. We sat outside by a heat lamp that kept us very warm. We did not order any wine or alcohol, the waitress never offered a refill we had to request it. Over all it was an okay experience not really worth the price though.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Nice setting and outdoor dining. Pretty good cocktails, and the octopus was well cooked. However, the entrees were lackluster. The salmon with mustard three ways was very exciting on the menu, but on the plate was just fish with some mustard sauce and garnish. The duck with mushrooms was disappointing - the mushrooms were basically stewed in a sweet brown gravy that I would expect to see in a cafeteria more than a restaurant.

A new friend in the Heights suggests that we eat local so I immediately scan my trusty Yelp app to reconnoiter the area.  We lived here in the mid-80's but by now, things have changed!  She's not a big fan of tomato-based Italian food, in an admonishing tone, says "it's the nightshade family!" It's fine. Anyone who reads my posts knows that I'm an Italian food junkie, but I'm in a mood for something different.  After hemming and hawing, we walk up to Henry Street and decide on Henry's End.  Charlie the dog is lying near the entrance and gives us a friendly greeting. I ask him if he'd like a martini and he jumps up and wags his tail. My kind of dog!! It's a fairly nice evening so we decide to sit outside. My friend's been under the weather but agrees that we should order a nice bottle of red wine. Matthew our waiter suggests a montepulciano and it's superb. We share a walnut vinaigrette salad with mushrooms. It's a perfect starter. The menu has two duck entries, we each order a different one.  My duck is Asian style honey ginger, Crisp skin, not fatty at all,  almost like Peking duck. I love it.  My friend's duck is more ragu style, with mushrooms, equally delicious. The conversation is animated and flowing.  But wait, something's missing! We realize there's no side dish. We signal Matthew who apologizes and offers to get us sautéed asparagus on the house.  He also offers free dessert. Wow what a nice gesture!  We top the meal off with apple cobbler and tiramisu. Coffee and espresso. Gee what a great meal!  We'll definitely be coming back!  Good night Charlie wherever you are!

I used to live in Brooklyn Heights about 30 years ago and ate there. It's still as good (and popular) as it was then. Food is excellent as is the service. Whenever I go back to NYC, I make it a point to stop in. Three times ago with my son, two times ago with my daughter, and last time with my new wife. Can't recommend Henry's End highly enough.

awesome food, terrific service under the toughest circumstances. went out for dinner last night (38 degrees) because the few times we've been here before we loved the food and the warm, comfortable atmosphere. they cranked up the outdoor heater, and served a delicious penne and lobster appetizer followed by a honey ginger duck that i could eat every night for the next week or two. hats off to these folks and the food here - great food served by a top notch group of pros!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Outstanding! Very talented chefs they have create an outstanding, robust menu. Not a lot of tables and, filled in on a Wednesday night. People like atmosphere, I like food.....this is the place for the latter. I heard they were moving to accommodate more guests after 40 + years. I hope they bring the charm this place had.
Welcomed very quickly and sat immediately. Felt the servers were a little inattentive once our order was placed. Food was amazing! A bit loud for good conversation but overall a great experience
No comment

Our friends from Brooklyn brought us here for dinner last night. My husband and I were blown away! I wasn't even hungry but the food was so amazing I cleaned my plate! The four of us all ordered completely different dishes and everything was so good! I had the Scottish Salmon which was cooked to perfection and melted in my mouth. My husband had the Steak Au Poivre which was also cooked to perfection and had such delicious flavor. The food is very fresh and the service is great. This will be a regular for us when we travel into Brooklyn!

If you want a brilliant dining experience, be pampered with great service,  all while enjoying amazingly prepared food...Henry's End is for you. So many restaurants in NYC...and we've been to this restaurant twice in two weeks...it's that good! Our first meal we enjoyed sharing the Kangaroo Potstickers, and the Duckling with Wild Mushrooms, shallots, thyme, and lingonberries. With this we enjoyed a bottle of Tempore Joven 2004, from Agagon Spain. Everything was amazing. Our second trip we shared the Buffalo Hanger Steak with Housemade Steak Sauce and Truffled Fries. Oh WOW...Tender steak! This night we opted for beer and enjoyed "Two Roads "Road 2 Ruin" Double IPA Stratford Connecticut," and "Oskar Blues "Old Chubb" Scotch Ale Brevard, North Carolina." They complimented this meal well for us. Our server, Mike on both nights, was exemplary. And the little inside scoop...the restaurant name is because this restaurant is where Henry Street ends. Go figure...So Very Clever!

Have given it a very good review in the past and some of the things I said then still hold. Good food, very good service.  But there hasn't been an inflation and my income has not increased, but Henry's End now fancies itself high-end and has raised its prices such that prices start at $28.00.  Since then, I have gone to the great semi-outdoor restaurant two or three doors down when I can get seating or walked over to Montague St to eat at Armando's which is on a par price-wise of Henry's End but has *really* good food and far less noise!  Sorry, but I ended my thirty-five year advocacy of H.E.

A terrific, old school vibe and good service in Brooklyn Heights. The spicy margarita was a bit too spicy, even for me; aside from that, dinner was warm, cozy, and tasty. The crab cake appetizer was a winner, as was the unique cold sour cherry soup. The sole citron entree was the lightest offering from the prix fixe and was nicely citrusy and a large portion of fish. My last visit to Henry's End was about 40 years ago.  It is still keeping up.  The menu has changed somewhat, but the quality is still high.

If you are looking for the hottest, flash in the pan restaurant, on the bleeding edge of Brooklyn dining, this probably isn't your spot.  Come here and you'll sit amongst locals of all ages, you'll find a 30years of excellence award on the wall and newspaper reviews from 10 years ago. If you are looking for great food and an authentic experience that can stand the test of time, make a reservation now.  Well known for it's game dishes (try the charcuterie!), Henry's delivers on the exotic (kangaroo potstickers) and the staples (ribs).  Even the rye cocktail was amazing, and my glass begged to be refilled... ok, maybe I really wanted to keep refilling my glass, but you know what I mean.  Not trendy, but won't disappoint. *late addition* after consult with my fellow diners, I do need to note that while we all loved our meals the ribs we quite dry and a little too drowned in sauce.

My favorite restaurant! I come here every year for my bday and this year my hubby forgot my bday coupon, but since this place is top notch they honored it anyways! Great customer service & great food. I love wild game and this is the one restaurant I found that serves it and is so tasty! Can't wait for the next wild game festival!!!! You make my bday dreams come true!

Wanted a nicer meal near the river while staying in Brooklyn and stumbled upon Henry's End. The exterior does not do the interior justice. A nice, intimate spot with a friendly wait staff. Great little spot that has only been in its new digs for 3 weeks! We did make a 6pm reservation, thankfully we did because we would have been waiting for a bit. We were greeted by the owner, who sat us on the patio! We were out celebrating our anniversary and they delivered on every aspect of the meal. Nice "Crisp" brew to start off the meal. Crab cakes, Shrimp app with some delicious combo of flavors. But wait there's more...Chicken, spinach, goat cheese , fig jelly...mic drop, pick it up; Steak Diane that you could have drank the sweet flavor that blanketed the fine cut of meat. Side of asparagus and real buttery mashed...there is no way we can do dessert, but we do coffee. The special anniversary dessert was delivered which was a nice touch, much appreciated! A slightly eccentric restaurant with a strict reservation policy, my expectations for Henry's End were sky high. I had been told about interesting cuts of meat and a menu that will raise your eyebrows. Honestly, besides a few unique steak cuts, I was disappointed how contemporary the menu was. I don't know what Henry's End is. It lacks the complexity and depth in flavor of high end cuisine, despite being priced like one. It honestly feels like the menu could do with a modern refresh towards fresher, more exciting ingredients. As it stands, it reminds me of something out of the 90's. That's not a bad thing but again, at what they charge, it should be better.

Henry's End just opened in a new location, so this review should be considered with that in mind.  The food was tasty. My major issue is with the atmosphere and the noise level.  The space is very plain, and I had to shout at my dining partner across a very small table.  Likely operations will improve, and perhaps atmosphere with some design work. Table was a little rocky because we were on a slant but manager fixed it right away. Service was impeccable - manager and all servers were quick and friendly and knowledgeable. I liked the soft shell crab but he didn't love it. Ribs were supposed to be sweet and spicy but they weren't spicy at all. Before I decided on the sole, I asked many questions about breaded dishes and didn't want any of them. But when I got the sole, it was entirely breaded. I have to dole out a 5 star for this amazing place. Not only is the food excellent the waitstaff are extremely courteous and sensitive to every diner here. This place functioned like a well oiled machine, our courses came out with such perfect timing. We started with some Crab cakes, whoa, utterly amazing. I could have just ordered these....... just kidding, because for my entree I had an amazing mixed gamer grill, which included quail, elk chops, and elk sausages. This was superb, but the standout were the perfectly cooked elk chops. This is perfect meat, better than any beef I've ever had. It was superlative food. My family ordered from their regular menu, tortilla flour crusted shrimp (amazing) and stuffed chicken (also amazing). Another very special aspect of the restaurant is the beer list- it's thoughtfully curated with many nods to local breweries, but with some great beers from all over the country. You can see that whoever put this together really believes that beer deserves the same emphasis as wine at fine dining establishments. Henry's end is a special place. It's unpretentious, yet in my opinion it can stand up to any NYC michelin starred restaurant. It's a place with great food, great service, and simply put authentic charm. If you're going out for a splurge or special occasion, it's my advice to consider this place. I can't wait to return.

I came. I ate. It was fantastic. Got a table right away on a tuesday night, had a super nice waitress who gave us the skinny on what to order off the wild game festival menu. Between the perfectly cooked antelope, the bodacious mixed grill and the pheasant, I was in carnivore heaven. All the sauces were perfect, as were the delightful side of mashed potatoes, rice and snap peas. A great, well priced bottle of wine topped off this absolutely fantastic meal. If you wanna mix it up and try some really superb meats you can't find elsewhere, I'd have a hard time believing many NYC joints do it better than these guys.

In spring of 2005 I was dating a girl from Brooklyn Heights. The romance did not work out but one night we dined at Henry's End and I can say that this restaurant is the best thing that came out of that relationship. I put my name on their mailing list and every year around my birthday I get a voucher in the mail for a free entree. For the past six years I have dined at Henry's End on my birthday weekend and it has been an affair to remember. Chef/Owner Mark Lahm began his career at Henry's End in 1981 as a dishwasher and busboy. He eventually became a waiter, then manager, then chef. In 1986, he graduated from the Culinary Institute of America and took over the restaurant and Henry's End has become one of the best kept secret foodie destinations in Brooklyn to this day. The 2006 Zagat awarded the restaurant a score of 26 for food and an earlier edition stated "this is why they built the Brooklyn Bridge". In 2002, Mark and his staff hosted an event at the prestigious James Beard House. The restaurant has a cozy cabin-like feel but with taller ceilings adorned with fans and neon lights. The spacious open kitchen allows for diners to watch their meals come to creation methodically. Tables are a little tight together but in this environment it adds to the dining experience rather than detracting. The staff is very friendly and treats you like family even if it's your first time at Henry's End. Chef Lahm crafts entrees like chicken with pears, walnuts, and blue cheese, and blackened lamb sirloin over garlic mashed potatoes. Warm up with his New Orleans turtle soup and sherry. Make sure to visit Henry's End in the fall and winter (October-March) for their famous Wild Game Festival, where exotic game dishes like the herb-crusted elk and pepper-crusted venison and roasted wild boar are legendary. As an appetizer, the restaurant does offer an Assorted Wild Game Charcuterie of which, on this visit, included buffalo sausage, partridge sausage and Muscovy Duck pâte. Antelope, bear, kangaroo and python salad are also among the ferocious fare available at this white-tablecloth Brooklyn Heights standby. The restaurant is also known for its great duck dishes. The ducklings are braised in their own natural juices until they are flavorful and fork tender. Then they are boned and the fat rendered until the skin is delightfully crisp. The accompanying sauces include raspberry, or honey and ginger with soy and scallions, or a wild mushroom lingonberry sauce with shallots, thyme and brandy. To entice recession affected diners, Henry's End has been offering a $25 three course prix fixe on Mondays thru Thursdays with wine pairings for an additional $14. The restaurant also features an award winning American wine list. Chef Lahm carefully selects an eclectic wine menu for his offerings. On this night a 2007 Amador Rose was paired with scrumptious al dente crab and lobster ravioli. Diver scallops faired well with the grape tomatoes and a 2006 Dr. Frank Rkatsiteli varietal. Moroccan Grilled Salmon topped with a compound butter made from cumin, cayenne, mint and scallions and served over garlic mashed potatoes was a wonderful healthy option. "Drop-your-fork" delicious spinach sautéed in garlic went great with cauliflower, capers and cranberries. With the main courses, we indulged in hearty sides of arugula and roasted beets paired with a 2007 Van Ruiten Chardonnay. My Duck with Wild Morel & Portobello Mushrooms & Lingonberries Sauce, shallots, thyme and brandy melted in my mouth as I swirled my aromatic glass of 2005 David Bruce Petite Sirah. The meal crescendo included a Valrhona black and white chocolate mousse and an apple golden raisin cobbler covered in a light and flaky almond streusel crust. Our diligent server Nate paired our desserts with a satisfying glass of Fonseca Bin 27 Port. Dinner for two with birthday discount, tax and tip was $120.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Love love love this place.  If you're into game, go.  If you're not, there's still a ton to chow down on, including numerous adventurous chicken dishes and lovely fish dishes.  Do not miss the ribs.  Incredible.  Also amazing: the wine list.
No comment
No comment

This restaurant was a great find.  Atmosphere is very quaint  and intimate. My boyfriend and I were feeling adventurous and went during their Wild Game Festival. The waitress was very helpful in describing the items and giving recommendations.  We had the Gnocci with wild boar and the Mixed Game Grill which came with rabbit sausage, elk chop and wild boar belly. The Wild Game Festival is definitely fun for those that enjoy exploring the unconventional cuisines. Overall,  a combination of quality and exciting food choices, with great service and ambiance makes this place a win.
No comment

What  a great place.  Yes, the menu is a mecca of game and interesting meat.  The wine list is excellent, with several big, bold fruity wines and smoother New World wines.  I had a terrific mustard-crusted tuna steak that was perfectly medium rare with a crusty, crunchy coating of stone-ground mustard.  They used pan juices, wine and more mustard to reduce down an intense and thick mustard sauce.  It was lying on perfectly steamed bed of fresh spinach with soy and mustard oil.  It was just excellent.  The waitress was fantastic, friendly and using terms of endearment and she is absolutely Julia Child's doppelganger. No kidding.  That unique side-of-the-mouth diction as well.  The dessert of layered crepes with custard was velvety and light.  The only weak point was the espresso.  Tasted more like brewed drip coffee to me so had I been expecting that it would have been perfect.

Service = okay. Atmosphere = quaint & romantic. Price = Overly expensive. Food = minimal & typical. Boy, was I disappointed with this place. My major complaint was with quantity of food served. I ordered their short ribs, which was certainly a mistake-- the entrée consisted of 3 small, half-dollar sized pieces of beef served over a half cup of mashed potatoes and 3 pieces of broccoli. Did they think they were serving food to a toddler? For $22.95, I expected ALOT more. As for the meat itself, it was tender, but the gravy tasted like packaged instant gravy. The mashed potatoes were typical but served mixed with wasabi or horseradish, which really added nothing special to the mix (in other words, they were bland)... plus, they weren't even creamy. We did order the crab cakes appetizer with our meal, and it was flavorful, but, again, they were quite small. Note that if you order them, they are deep fried and not pan fried or baked, so they aren't really flaky like you find in most restaurants. Nonetheless, they tasted fine. Vinny ordered a strip steak smothered in a mustard sauce. The portion size for this was a little better than the other items we ordered, and he said the steak tasted fine.  All in all, our experience was mixed, with Vinny liking the restaurant more than me. But, oh how I wanted to fall in love with this place b/c it's close to our house... but I was mostly disappointed.
No comment

My husband and I have been enjoying this restaurant for nearly 35 years and the food is getting better and better. Last night, our darling waiter, Isabel, even put in a special order for me: fiddlehead ferns and morels, sauteed in butter and beyond delicious.
Great ambiance, not pretentious at all. Packed full house. Ate the duckling with mushrooms and lingonerry sauce. Good,  but would not pay $25 for it.

Henry's End is the special-occasion place for my girlfriend and me. The service is friendly and accommodating; the food is excellent and interesting (not what's on offer everywhere else); and the bourbon and Scotch flights are a perfect end to dinner.
No comment

This place is amazing!  Great atmosphere and surprisingly has various delicious options for a vegetarian.  I had the sour cherry soup and heirloom tomato salad...was better than any vegetarian restaurant in the area.  I had roasted vegetables with polenta as main dish and that was perfect as well.  I can't speak for the meat dishes but everyone I was with raved about them.  The best part....dessert. The 21 layer crepe is to die for!  Do not leave without trying!  Also service was amazing and very kid friendly.  Love it here....we come from Boston but this is our #1 choice when in the area.

I truly enjoy dining at this "feel at home" intimate restaurant with soft lighting and quiet reserved table conversations.  The service is wonderful and the food is fantastic.  I tried the fried chicken with mashed potatoes.  Amazing!  My brother frequents this restaurant (for about 10 years now), and he loves the Lobster Ravioli, Lamb, Soft Shell Crabs.  They have an excellent wine list, and this is a great place for a first date or just to catch up on time missed with old friends.  Make sure to try the dessert with the icecream block and caramel (can't remember the name) and some coffee!  You are treated very well by the hosts/hostesses/servers here.
No comment

I went here looking for good American cuisine in the Brooklyn Heights are. FYI -- this is not really BH, it's closer to DUMBO. Nevertheless, the food and service were both excellent, if not a bit expensive. The atmosphere is very old fashioned. I enjoyed my meal but I wouldn't go out of my way to come back.

this is the restaurant i love best.  they have a great menu, you can find just about ANyThing on their menu--everyone in your party will be satisfied.  I LOVE the servers--you don't often say that in nyc but these folks are wonderful!!  and!!! you get birthday treats, if you register for their birthday club (or whatever they call it) within two weeks of your birthday (within 7days before or within 7 days after) your entree is on them!!  love love love henry's end!!
My go to Brooklyn Restaurant.  I live on the Upper West Side and happily take the train here when I want an amazing meal.  Totally recommend the Mustard Tuna and Mud Pie.
Bar none - my absolute favorite restaurant in Brooklyn Heights. The manager is terrific, the wait staff is friendly and helpful and the food is wonderful.

OK.. first let's start on the service. it was mediocre and hence her full $4 tip. I appreciated the person who bust my table, he got $6.. now the food.. it was good.. my mom ordered the duck, which was soo fatty.. which was weird.. she didn't love it. I got the lamb which was great.. the shrimp n guac was amazing though. Amazing. my dessert. OMG. O.M.G. the 21 layer crepe is to die for. it has to be the best thing on the earth. so food overall is a 4.6ishh.. that service def dropped it to a solid 3, but that dessert brought it up to a 4..
No comment
No comment
No comment

Henry's End is a small place with intimate lighting. I went on a Tuesday evening around 8pm. The atmosphere was okay. The crowd was full of "mature" white Americans. Not much diversity in age or race. I had the pre fix meal. I wasnt quite fixed though. If you get the Honey Ginger Duck its 3 dollars extra. The duck was average. It tasted like high-end Chinese food. Sweet and sour duck. I wouldnt recommend it. My bill was over 80 bucks for 2 fixed meals, and it wasnt worth it. My date had the Veal, and he liked it a lot. The food is not awful, just quite average for the price you pay, oh and its BORING in that place!

Wow! Crab corn cakes and Bar-b-que shrimp appetizers, off the charts duck and lingonberry sauce, shrimp and grits and amazing chocolate desserts. Yes, I know that that's not a complete sentence. Whatever you grammatical snob, this place is a gem.

Excellent ! Have been visiting for years Mark a perfectionist overlooks every detail . Service makes you feel at home. Pear walnut and blue cheese chicken ,soft shell crabs garlic basil sauce and if you like  sothern fried chicken try it here . Henry's is a favorite try it you'll like it. Tell Mark Charles The Realtor sent you.

This place is a little pricy, but perfect for a special occasion or date night. I had the $30 pre fix menu, but my appetizer and entree choices cost more. The crab cakes were pretty good, but the swordfish was some of the best fish I've ever tasted. It came in a flavorful, tangy sauce that was great to dip your bread in. For dessert I had the mud pie, which was great but my husband got the Mrs. Mud Pie which was even better. I'd definitely come back to this

To be brief. Had high expectations. None of these met.  Food was gloppy, overcooked and way over sauced. Of 5, only one thought food was good. Also, we were near the open kitchen and it was unacceptably hot, like sweat-inducing hot. Not pleasant. From chicken, to crabs, to steak, the food got a big meh.  Would not return.

We had a lovely evening at this place. The restaurant is very cozy and comfortable. The wild game menu was interesting and there was a good wine selection. I had the stuffed quail and my husband had the veal. Both were delicious. Our service was excellent.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I went to Henry's End after having heard about it for years.  I used to go to the restaurant they had in Soho called New Deal.  I remembered the Game menu they had once a year in the 80's.  So I decided to try the game menu on this visit.  First I have to say the service was good and the food tasted good and was well cooked.  Unfortunately I didn't find the game memorable or exceptional.  I am not sure what I was expecting, I had the Charcuterie and the Danish Venison Stew.  while it all tasted fine it could have been any other meat.  Judging by the way everything was prepared I can tell the overall cooking is wonderful.   I would definately go back for the regular menu but I don't think I would make a treck to brooklyn for the game menu.
Overall best restaurant in Brooklyn Heights.

We were visiting from California and looking for a place to eat in Brooklyn Heights.  We found Henry's End on yelp and decided to take a look.  We got there around 20 minutes before they opened and while taking a look at the menu posted outside just about every person that walked by told us we had to eat there.  We weren't disappointed.  We all had the wild mushroom soup and it was awesome.  I had the elk chops and they were right there too.  The service was perfect.  It made for a great finish to the day.
Never had a bad meal here!  My husband loves the game menu.  The duck is delicious, as is the chicken stuffed with goat cheese.

My husband and I have been looking forward to trying this place for a really long time, but we were a bit underwhelmed by both the food and the service.  We had to wait a long time for the waitress to come around and take our drink and food order, even though we were there when it was still fairly early and empty.  We also ate with our toddler and it's always a pet peeve of mine when the kid's food comes last.  It shouldn't take longer to cook pasta than it does to make a sole with lobster and mushroom sauce.  Overall though, the food was pretty good, but many of the dishes are drowned in sauce.  Personally, I enjoy a lot of sauce but it can be a turn off for some.  I would give this place another try during their "wild game festival".
No comment
Perfectly cooked steak. Interesting ingredients and selection. Great service. Good date spot.

Had Moroccan Salmon and it was amazing!  The fish was cooked perfectly - pink & moist and the skin crisp & crunchy.  Tasted the Lemonese(?) Veal - yum!  Beer selection was ok but could be better.  Server gave our table a couple free desserts to sample which was very nice.

Went for "exotic game meats" dinner. Elk was great, Kangaroo was not impressive, Venison Stew was flavorfull. Mashed potato, and other sides were pretty tasty too.  Unfortunately we just cant "rave" about it because we did not feel a spark of energy from the interior or staff.  Every single one of the staff was pleasant and efficient.

2 friends and I went to eat at the wild game festival.  We had the charcuterie plate (venison pate, rabbbit sausage, bison sausage), a delicious soup with bacon almonds (I believe it was a rutabega apple soup?) and then I had the wild game grill which had boar belly, elk chop, venison sausage which was delicious.  They first brought it out with breadcrumbs on the elk chop, which was never stated, and I had to send it back because I am gluten intolerant, but they were VERY accomadating, and got a fresh plate quickly without the breading.  Very very god food. Also they had a lovely Oregon Pinot Noir that was amazing, a berry flavored Pinot, not too dry, which went very well with the wild game! I'd definitely go back!

Mediocre, particularly at these prices. We had 5 dishes and none... really, not one, was interesting. We started with a salad and moved on two chicken dishes which were just bland. The dessert (perhaps called the Mrs Mud - second down from the top of the dessert menu) was honestly TERRIBLE. It was a rock hard block of Heath bar ice cream and absolutely not worth it. I never return food, but I should have returned it in all is icey, flavorless splendor.  I want to like Henry's End. I've always hears great things about it but for this price,they need to do better (like a lot better).
A restaurant with such an enticing menu that it was hard to make a choice. It's a lovely, cozy small restaurant with a good wine list- perfect for my first visit to Brooklyn.

The food is amazing! The only reason I'm giving 4 stars is because we sat at the back, closer to the kitchen. Considering its a small, local bklyn heights place, the closer to the kitchen you are, the hotter you're going to be.  But I definitely recommend this place!
No comment
No comment
I had the prefix with corn crab cake, duck and chocolate mud each with 3oz of wine pairing. Tasting sensation was unexpectedly good. I got more than paid for.
No comment
Great food, great atmosphere, waiter put our whole party on one bill, two different tables. I guess that's a New York thing.

My BF and I went to Henry's End for the Wild Game Festival.  They had some really unusual things on the menu.  We had the turtle soup, which was good with a little kick.  I had the mixed game grill, which had the elk chop, venison sausage, and wild boar belly.  The wild boar belly was a litle more gamey than the regular pork belly, but that was my favorite on the plate.  My BF had the kangaroo...very gamey.  The BEST part of the dinner was dessert - I had the mud pie and he had the 21 layer crepe.  He still thinks the 21 layer crepe is the best dessert he's ever had.  I think he might even dream about it every now and then.  LOL.  We'll definitely have to go back for the regular dinner menu and see how that compares.

Bonnie our waitress made us feel like we were family!  The soft shell crab was incredible, the pecan crusted shrimp  the spicy ribs were great too! We got veal, steak, and chicken all of which were incredible suggestions from Bonnie.  Definitely recommend this hidden gem!!!
No comment
All I can say wow.  One of the best steaks I have ever had in my life.  Great service and nice little spot.  We loved.

I found Henry's End accidentally, trying to find a good restaurant to visit with my parents.  If I lived in Brooklyn Heights, I'd eat here once a week!  Despite the wild game menu that everyone raves about, I usually get their salmon.  Whether it's salmon with lentils, salmon crusted with crabmeat, or their salmon moroccan (my husband's favorite,) it's always perfect!  Their weeknight prix fixe menu is better than any deal you'll score during restaurant week -- $25 for three courses, and well worth it.  Their persian lime pie is a great way to end the night.  In addition to their fantastic menu, one of the best parts of Henry's End is the staff -- always welcoming, friendly, and accommodating.  We've visited several times over the past year and feel like we've been regulars for years!

What's a veggie girl supposed to do when all her friends want to do is eat meat? Nay, not just meat, but WILD GAME? Well that girl can eat the most delicious platter of grilled vegetables and goat cheese polenta with a very tasty glass of syrah. All if omnivores in my party were please with their food, especially the pheasant ravioli and the mixed grill. The waiter was a hoot! Very attentive and personable!
Great night spent here on a cold January evening. Good beer, good food, great waiter.
