Took my mom here for her birthday once.  I remember the food being really really good, but also pretty expensive.  Food worth the price though, basically the standard I judge things by in NYC.  You'll get what you pay for here.  From what I recall they didn't take reservations, was about a 30 minute wait maybe.
No comment

From start to finish, a very pleasant experience.  The staff was wonderful and the food delicious!  We had the Caesar salad and turtle soup to start and both were yummy.  My boyfriend had the platter from the wild game menu featuring the Elk chop, Wild Boar, etc.  He loved it!  And my veal was amazing.  We were too stuffed to try the desserts but they sounded great and will have to try them next time around.  Great beer selection too!

We moved away from Brooklyn Heights 30+ years ago and despite frequent visits, have not been to Henry's End since then.  Back then our principal gripe was glacially slow service.  We gave it a try last night and were pleasantly surprised to find the service much improved.  The food was excellent.  I tried the gnocchi with wild boar ragout while my wife had walnut crusted chicken.  Both were fine.  There was a good number of reasonably-priced wines by the glass, too. Happy to be able to recommend the place.
Went here with local friends. Great service and wonderful food. I would gladly go again.

Customer service is always how I guage a business of any kind, because nothing is more important than how you are respected as a customer. Whether you are a first timer or eating there for maybe the 300th time (I think it's about that) the owner Mark and the entire staff do everything possible to ensure you have a great dining experience. Yes the restaurant is cozy, I prefer to see it as charming- but the food is 4 star, the wine list varied, excellent and reasonably priced. Oh and the customer service? The reason I have been patronizing this place for 30+ years. Henry's End is everything you look for in a neighborhood restaurant.
No comment

I like game.  If you don't, this probably isn't for you.  Cozy, small, intimate.  The kind of place that doesn't have to pretend about anything.  Great wine list, and attentive, unannoying staff (sime might mistake this for snootiness, but I never liked a server saying, "Hi, I;m Amber and I'll be taking care of you tonight...").  Yes, the desert choices are skimpy, but you don't come here for desert.  Love it.
No comment

I am addicted to the Chicken with Walnuts, Pears, and Blue Cheese. It's nearly impossible for me to order anything else, but when I do, I'm never disappointed. Going to Henry's End is always a treat, and on my dining-out scale lands between local standby and special occasion. It is consistenly the best restaurant in Brooklyn Heights.

The only word that comes to mind when I think of Henry's End is 'mediocre'- decent food, in a decent atmosphere, with decent service, although a bit over priced. I was surprised that there was such a crowd as the quality of food was not worth the money being spent. I ordered off of the Prix fix ($30) and had a salad of 'mixed greens' (literally a plate of mixed greens, aka different types of lettuce, with three cherry tomatoes) to start, the duck with honey and ginger (an extra $4 for mushy sauce) as my main, and the mud pie (not a mud pie at all, but rather an ice cream pie) for dessert. In addition, the bread sticks in the complimentary bread basket were a bit soggy, obviously stale from having sat out. On second thought, maybe this is more of a 2.5 star kind of place? Despite the downfalls however, it was a pleasant enough experience and the flavors made up for what the (at times questionable) texture was lacking. I do not plan on returning although judging by the packed dining room, Henry's will be around for awhile... All in all I wouldn't recommend this restaurant as there are better, less expensive, options in the area.

Love this little place! Great atmosphere, space is a little tight but hey that's NY, everything in NY is vertical. My wife and I came here with another couple and we were all raving about our meals for the next couple days. I lived in BKLYN Heights for ten years and never ate here, moved away and came back for a visit and now I wished I had tried it out while living here. Highly recommend to others and will be visiting again the next time I'm in BKLYN Heights.

The only thing that attracted us to this place was the early week wine tasting  menu. The wines weren't bad if had ever found out what they were. The waiter grumpily threw them at our table. When we asked what they were, he shouted something back indiscernible from three tables away. The appetizers arrived. We got the West Indian BBQ shrimp and the scallop salad. The first seemed like frozen  shrimp, canned corn and a jar of BBQ sauce, the later included only 2 tiny scallops despite the price. Our mains were even more disappointing, poor cuts of meat, blandly prepared and overcooked. The desserts weren't bad but he service never improved. The highlight of the evening was a night cap in the Henry st alehouse a few doors up.

I've been going to Henry's End for close to 20 years. The steak diane is one of my favorite meals in the world. Henry's End also has great specials, great appetizers and a great wine list. The place is small but not cramped. The wait staff used to be top notch. They had all been there for years and were friendly and extremely knowledgeable. I had a waiter that I had never seen before. He was rude and seemed to want to be anyplace but at the restaurant. The food is too good to let a tard like my waiter ruin the experience. I just hope he is gone next time I come.
No comment
No comment

After asking for some restaurant suggestions from some long-term Brooklyn Heights locals, I was steered to Henry's End.  The restaurant was packed, and the tightly-packed tables made one an unwilling participant in dinner conversations at the surrounding tables.  The lady next to me was wearing a lovely perfume, but, I didn't really feel like experiencing it.  With this in mind, and the rather poor air conditioning on a blistering evening, I was pleased by the friendly service and delicious food.  The Steak au Poivre was delicious, in a delightful sauce and my dinner companion's soft-shell crab was excellent, albeit a bit too much butter/garlic, which overwhelmed the crab.  I look forward to going again to see if it lives up to the first impression.

Great little place for a delicious meal! The food is amazing and great service! The Pears, Walnut and Blue Cheese Chicken is incredible. My husband really enjoyed the Blackened Lamb Sirloin. I will definitely come back here when in New York again.
This place is amazing!. Great food & service. I can't say I have had a bad meal here. Try the chicken lemonase. Best dish by far!!

My son picked this restaurant for his birthday. We made reservations for 11 adults and 2 children. The food and service were very good. However the host (owner) was quite rude. We didn't ask for our check but it was delivered to our table. The 20% tip was included which I didn't mind because service was good. I almost forgot our table was by the bathroom and so I got to see who came and went to the bathroom. I asked our waiter to serve one round of drinks before we were ready to leave. He asked the owner if he could serve us and was told no and that people were waiting for tables. I did see about 3 or 4 people waiting. I did drop a significant amount of money on this dinner that did have small portions and thought the owner was quite rude. We were there from 5:45 and out the door by 8:20. I can't imagine that dinner for 11 people could possibly end less than 3 hours. Sad to say I would not return to this establishment.

We went to this restaurant with friends. The food was above average in New York standards. Crab cakes were delicious but can't say the same thing for the main course. It is decent food but for the price I pay for it, I know way better places. (But then again, I am from Paris, I might have high expectations). I guess the ambiance and the attitude does not help. The place looks dirty and, avoid the tables in front of the restroom, because, boy it stinks. I guess they make enough money to renovate. Also, both waiters were plain rude. I won't return to place where I don't feel welcome.

We have been coming here almost weekly for 26 years, and the food is always excellent. Marc, the owner, works most nights, and greets his customers like they really matter. He has a happy crew working for him, some since the restaurant opened. You can not get a meal that is not wonderful here.

When I looked online I was not so keen on the wild game festival but once there I couldn't resist the waiter's explanation of the turtle soup nor the description of the gnocchi with wild boar ragu. They both surpassed expectations as did all the other dishes around the table that I tried.

A rare gem in every way. Perfect. Food...ambiance...Proximity to the promenade. This place has "date material" written all over it. Shared a few dishes: Fried chicken, lobster pasta, salmon and crab cakes appetizer. Everything was AMAZING. Caution, the fried chicken dish is big enough for two people. It's an insane amount of food. I already can't wait to bring people back.

Absolutely one of my favorite carnivorous haunts in the city. Henry's End is a cozy, intimate, typical Brooklyn Heights neighborhood place; it almost feels like a hunting lodge with its wooden interior. They make fresh stocks daily, and you will taste that in their very rich sauces that they serve over their meat dishes - the last time I was there, I had a hangar steak au poivre dressed with a mustard cream sauce. Another recent highlight was a bourbon glazed rib eye topped with a corn salsa. These subtle riffs on classic main meat dishes are what really sets this place apart. You may also find wilder meats on their menu, like elk chops and venison, but that varies seasonally. They tend to have many seasonal specials on their menu, and those can change week to week too, but they are all good! They also have excellent pasta dishes - everything is rich and hearty and great here. The service has all the charm a Brooklyn neighborhood spot should and then some - they have a loyal clinetele from all over the city that visits them regularly, and you will see the patrons hugging and kissing the waitstaff on entry. This and Noodle Pudding and Brooklyn Heights' contribution to the best kept dining secrets in NYC. If you are into good meat dishes, you will be thrilled you came. Not to mention they have Sam Smith's beer.

My husband and I came here last night for my birthday and the food was absolutely delish! The first time we ate here, I wasn't too crazy about the dish I had ordered. I believe I had gotten some kind of duck but it was very fatty and gamey. My husband had gotten the 3 mustard salmon and he said it was amazing. Last night we came back so that we could try out their wild game festival. My husband ordered the Elk, I ordered one of their specials, Canadian Salmon with lobster risotto with a champagne vanilla sauce. Both dishes were outstanding! His elk was soo good. Not gamey, not an ounce of fat on it and cooked to perfection. The sauce which was made with wine and the natural drippings from the elk itself, was so delish. My husband soaked it up  with his bread once he was done with his chops. My salmon was perfectly cooked and the skin was so crunchy. The lobster risotto was also cooked perfectly with big chunks of lobster in it. The champagne vanilla sauce, although a little on the salty side which made me drink about 3-4 glasses of water, was outstanding. When I eat out, I hardly ever finish my meal. Last night, my plate was empty. The only downside was they didn't bring us any sides but truthfully with the amount of food that was on my plate and the size of his elk chops, we didn't really care. We are definitely going back in October once their game festival starts up again!

Honestly, Henry's End is very average.  Great atmosphere, wonderful and knowledgeable wait staff, but the food was just meh.  Based on reviews and the recommendation of the waiter I ordered the caesar salad  and duck with wild mushrooms and lingonberries.  The duck wasn't tender at all (actually quite tough for duck) and the sauce was good, but nothing spectacular. The sides served with it were just simple rice and sauteed snap peas. I honestly expected much more in the way of flavor and quality.  I have to give props to the place on their wine selection - nice (albeit brief) wine list with some nice reasonably priced selections.  Would I go back - maybe, but I'd be inclined to sample some of the other great restaurants in the area first.

Come for the wine.  Stay for the meals.  Excellent for both.  Even the shaved salad was 'the greatest salad I've ever tasted' according to my mother in law.  Great steaks and seafood.  Highly recomended

Lovely neighborhood place that has always been pleasant and comforting in a sea of pretentious crap. Steak is great, but so is the game, the fish, and the service. The birthday post cards always bring a smile to my face. I make the trip to the Heights just for Henry's End.
No comment
Love this place! Great food, great service. By far the best restaurant in Brooklyn Heights.

We had a delicious meal here. We came during the week and took advantage of the price fixed menu (M-TH). Service was fantastic, the food was even better. I think the appetizers were the highlight of the meal. I had macadamia nut crusted shrimp in a peanut sauce with some kind of apple/pineapple/cranberry mash, and he had braised short ribs in a wonderful BBQ sauce. We will definitely return to try some of the other fantastic looking menu items.

Ok, talk about a very interesting menu for the adventurous spirit. This restaurant lists seasonal game on their menu. From duck, to venison. Came here one night looking for something different than the usual. The menu itself is very interesting, even if you decide not to go for the seasonal game options. The space is small and a bit cramped, but cozy none the less. The waiter was very knowledgeable and attentive to our questions about the menu. The STEAK AU POIVRE was a very good option to select. It was cooked very nicely and the sauce was not overpowering but complemented the dish.  Appetizers also were on point. I cant describe it all as it has been some time since i visited Henry's End, but it was very good experience which I'd like to venture again sometime. This is a little jewel in Brooklyn heights and the locals seem to be very fond of it, but the looks of the crowd and the wait to be seated on a Tuesday night. Be adventurous... Henry's End will not disappoint.

column3: Long Island City, New York, NY
column6: Fantastic food- the fried chicken is nuts!!!!!!! Tables are a little close together but makes it cozy.  Great for the winter as they have very hearty food.  But great variety on menu for entire year.  Make a reservation they are packed every weekend.

Went here because it was one of the only Brooklyn Restaurants open for Thanksgiving. The service was disorganized, with food coming out at different times without the promised sides. Although the service OK, we had to keep asking for the sides, drink refills, and other service. The food was hit and miss -- the buffalo steak was tasty, but the turkey dinner was fried, not roasted as promised on the menu, and our steaks were overcooked. Finally, the prices were no bargain, although they were not out of line with city prices. But charging for refills on the children's sodas was a little over the top. Don't recommend this place, especially on holidays.

I would not go back to this restaurant.  We ordered the BBQ shrimp appetizer which included only three shrimp for $12.  The BBQ sauce was good, but nothing special.  My husband ordered the duck with mushrooms and lingonberry. Not too good. Duck is usually quite tender but this must not have been a good piece or something because it was chewy.  I had the fried chicken and it was good.  Our dishes came with rice pilaf. I wouldn't go back because the menu items are boring - the duck is prepared the same way with a choice of three different sauces, the same could be said for the veal, and the random rice pilaf that came with both of our dishes didn't go with the meal at all and obviously did not require any thought from the chef.  While it is a cozy restaurant the custom neon sign has probably been there since the restaurant opened and probably nothing has changed since then including the menu.  I'm glad I can check this place off my list, but I will not return.

This is the only really good restaurant in Brooklyn Heights.  Try the grilled vegetable, polenta, and balsamic vinegar appetizer.   The fish is always fresh and well seasoned (although the sauces are a bit too heavy and rich for my taste).  And the service is amazing -- personal, knowledgeable, and full of character.  When it gets crowded, let them take you the wine bar down the block.  The appetizers there aren't any good yet, but they have a good wine list and the bar is very pleasant.
No comment

After reading reviews this sounded like the perfect neighborhood spot to take parents visiting from out of town. The restaurant itself has a great small wine bar feel to it, nice lighting, good amount of space (no sharing conversation with the next table), good attentive service and solid menu. We started with the charcuterie- great array of a pate, and some other cured meats that were all yummy. A few of us did the $25 three courses- great deal! Between the table we had a few different salads the favorite was the brussels sprouts salad YUM. My husband had bufalo short rib ravioli to start- quite the starter with a rich sauce, amazing but a little rich for an app. I had the salmon with mustard and  lentils- always a fab combination, it was cooked perfectly, well seasoned, perfect temp, I was very happy. Other dishes at the table included a veal entree, chicken with shallots and tuna, everyone was impressed by how well everything came out. We were also not short on wine, that's for sure :) By the time dessert came I could barely breathe but do remember something chocolatey and delicious. So glad we finally discovered this spot in our neighborhood and will definitely be back!

I went here once for my Dad's birthday. The food was great, everything was fresh and delicious. As a main course i had the black pepper crusted new york strip. It was very tasty and flavorful. The sauce they put on top was also really good. My dad had the same steak as well and he enjoyed it. My girlfriend ordered the duck. It was average, not bad but not great. My brother had the fried chicken which was pretty good. Overall we all enjoyed the place and thought it was worth trying. The only negative is the price. It's quite expensive - especially if you plan on having a few drinks.

Been going for the Wild Game Festival for over 13 years now. Elk chops invade my dreams!  A friend even got them for dessert one year (me - never... Need to save room for the Mrs. Mudpie). But the hidden gem?  Maybe the best (and by that I mean both quality and most reasonably priced) wine list in NYC. Go. Have a great time.

atmosphere was great and the menu offerings were entertaining.  wait staff somewhat slow but very accommodating to my gluten-free guest.  tuna tartare and turtle soup were disappointing. tuna was covered in sweet thai chili sauce that could have been from a bottle.  the turtle soup with sherry topper was mostly interesting as an idea - the flavor was mundane  it seems this place caters to the palates of the regulars, not what is hip in terms of cuisine flavors and preparations.  however, the menu was intriguing enough to merit a possible future visit.  Boyfriend will love wild game options.

This is an intimate place that has an air of competence without pretense. It has served delicious seasonal food since way before that was the "in" thing to do. The prolific, small kitchen is within view of the diners. My salmon was cooked perfectly, & the wine suggested by the waitress was a fine complement.
incredible dinner--they have a wild-game feast from October thru March. Their snapper-turtle soup with Sherry? DIVINE

So so so good. I felt so warm and cozy at this place. Looks like a log cabin. Wine list is excellent, and surprisingly well priced. Chicken wrapped with goat cheese and fig jam was the best chicken dish I think I've ever had. Juicy, tender chicken breast rolled around flavorful soft goat cheese. The fig jam complimented it perfectly. My boyfriend got the mixed game plate which he licked clean. Our waiter was informative and patient (we had a little trouble deciding what to order due to the extensive menu). My favorite place to eat in Brooklyn Heights!

After reading reviews on Yelp and Zagat, I was psyched to try out this restaurant.  We ordered the bbq ribs, veal with garlic, and crab cakes.  Except for the ribs, everything was kind of bland.  The veal seemed overcooked and the crab cakes seemed like they had crab filling.  We had the apple cobbler for  dessert.  It seemed like it came out of a jar.  I was a bit surprised because the prices were on the high end of Brooklyn Heights.

Upon browsing the menu as a new and cautious patron, there were some things that looked fantastic and some that made me want to vomit just a bit in my mouth.  Ended up with the elk chops and it was wonderful.  The portion size seemed small but really filled me up.  Nice atmosphere.
Funky, friendly, and cool. Family-owned since forever. Go only for the entrees and the wine- the rest not worth consideration.

This is my favorite restaurant in Brooklyn.  The food is always amazing.  They don't rush you at all, they let you savor every course.  The desserts are to die for.  The only problem is how close all the tables are to each other---but that's New York!
No comment

Oh what has happened?  This used to be so fine.  Is it the chef problem?  Chefs are coming and going.  Is it the economy?  Portions are small which is almost ok because they are mediocre.  And the vegetables are a joke as is the pilaf.  Pilaf?  It's white rice and ice cold.  The prices however are up but the quality is down.  What can I say the service is excellent, but sigh it is an old dowager down on her luck.

One of my favorites in the city - LOVED their pan roasted vegetables - and butternut squash soup, and their fried chicken - which is much memorable than some of those high-profile southern restaurants that serve fried chickens.  Their food makes me happy afterwards.  And I can't say this about many restaurants.

Food was hit-or-miss, and menu items could have used more descriptions.  Also, the prices were steep and didn't justify the quality of the food.  Two bright spots:  extremely convenient to the A/C train at High St.; the Mrs. Mud Pie dessert was phenomenal
Upscale food in a casual atmosphere.  The tuna tartar and bbq shrimp are delicious.

Bustling little restaurant allows one to eat and see the kitchen at work. Inviting wine menu, including several selections by the glass.  Waitress allowed us to sample one before choosing, admitting that it was a "bit diffierent."  While my wife sticks to her staple pear/walnuts/blue cheese chicken entree, I enjoy trying the game options.  Last time tried the wild mushroom & lingonberry duckling. Incredible!!!  In the past ordered a steak MR and came MW. The chef agreed and cooked me new one.  B-day special is a plus.

Just had an incredible dinner at Henry's End...first time my husband and I been there.  30 min wait..not bad being you're  ask to wait at their wine bar...when our table was ready the maitre d just came and scooped us up..we had the goat cheese salad...and the tortilla crusted shrimp...excellent...then we had the lamb  sirloin and the sole with lobster .....my my...what an incredible dinner...the wait time in between meals were incredibly short, the waitress was nice and the cleaning staff was on point...I just had to go and compliment the chef on one of the best meals I have ever had in Brooklyn...he was very nice and of course invited us back again....see you soon chef.....Good job Henrys end.....

Went to Henry's End to kick off my BD celebration. My friends and I were treated so nicely by the staff.  The meal was super delicious. My compliments to the chef for a wonderful dinner.  Looking forward to coming back.
came here for a friend's birthday. tried the venison on their wild game menu. it was delicious!

Made my first visit to Henry's End a couple of weeks ago. Perhaps, after hearing so many raves about it, I had unrealistic expectations, or perhaps I just hit it on a bad night. The cozy, rustic, atmosphere is wonderful, and the bartender can mix a mean cocktail, so compliments are due, I found the menu exciting (albeit a bit pricey for a neighborhood haunt) and was torn between a couple of different dishes...always a good sign. I started with the wild mushroom salad, which was really excellent. As a main course, I opted for the sole with the lobster and tomato cream, as another member of our party ordered it before and raved about it. When the fish arrived at the table it was clear the it was not fresh fish, as there was a slight tinge of odor to it...not awful, but still noticeable. Also...I have my doubts about it being sole; if it was sole it was the thickest piece of sole I've ever had.  At first bite, I was inclined to believe the fish was also frozen, and not fresh catch. Trust me, I know my fresh fish...I grew up by the sea. I ate as much of it as i could, but just couldn't get through the mushy, grainy texture of the fish to finish the meal....disappointing at best. I then ordered a banana pudding that arrived in a martini glass. Without exaggeration, there was two inches of pudding topped with five inches of whipped cream....nice presentation, but it took three tries to reach the pudding through the mountain of topping. With that said, I will give it another try; every restaurant has a bad night. Thumbs up for atmosphere, and service.  Here's hoping the next visit is a better one.

I've been eating at Henry's end for a little over 10 years, and the quality has steadily gone down over that time. Their winter game festival is still kind of OK, but overall, the level of cooking is now mediocre at best. For some reason they've taken to grossly over saucing everything - perhaps to mask the declining quality of the raw ingredients. A recent filet mignon had quite a bit of sinew in it, and rare tuna was slightly funky - not outright spoiled, but not that fresh. You might be tempted by their Prix Fixe menu - don't be. In a display of complete lack of graciousness, they remove the vegetables from their prix fixe offerings, then offer to return them for an exorbitant price. Aside from the stinginess (potatoes cost pennies!), it makes for a very poor plating, and casts an unpleasant pall over the meal. Really guys, if you can't afford to throw a vegetable on the plate, don;t offer the menu! Their desserts are huge, but at the level of a decent diner. This used to be a place to go for a treat, but it is sadly no longer worth the price, even if someone else is paying.
cool vibe, good people, food wasn't even close to worth it IMO, but i'm not expert in wild game

we all had the prix fixe menu it sounds good for 30.00 3 courses but entrees do not come with anything you must purchase sides if you want, the chicken was very good with apples and blue cheese , the salmon with herb crust was also nice , but my duck with the honey glaze the skin was not crispy the meat was well done and swimming in sauce , the truffles fries were very nice, i will give them another try maybe get something off the regular menu and see if it comes with any accompaniments
No comment
No comment
No comment

Cute little brunch spot with yummy food at a good price point. I was really hungry so got the cheddar brekkie sandwich although the other sweet breakfast options sounded so good. Staff was friendly. I wish they had smoothie/acai bowls though :( I think they used to but not anymore. Definitely want to try the chelsea location too
No comment
Love the menu here. It's a great neighborhood spot. The biscuit is worth getting and all the coffees are delicious. It's a trendy, cute breakfast spot.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Decent spot and a nice atmosphere for a casual meal (I've been for brunch and lunch) but I personally don't think the menu is special and the portion sizes are not very filling. I've stopped by for drinks which are decent but expensive for what it is. Still, a solid choice if you're in the area and looking to catch up with a friend.
No comment
No comment

Had delicious brunch at Citizens! The staff was accommodating and eager to recommend their favorite dishes. Choosing just one dish was difficult because everything on the menu looked incredible. I tried a new menu item: Shakshouka and it had great flavor! Would 10/10 recommend and will be going back
No comment
No comment

I've been here a couple times and despite what appears to be a limited menu, there's something for everyone, and at a very affordable value. The staff is also very pleasant to interact with. So far I've tried the Banana French toast and the brekkie platter and they've both been very tasty. Their lattes are also pretty quality. Space inside can be limited at times, especially at peak brunch hours. Love this cute little spot and will be frequenting this spot as much as possible!
A staple for our family when we visit Manhattan. Food is good and ambiance is informal but the wait might be long.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Went here for brunch. The mimosas are a little sour and so is the margarita. The burger is as dry as it looks and doesn't come with condiments. The side dish is a SALAD!!? which, to be fair, you can swap for a side of bacon (seen here).

Disappointing. A friend and I had lunch here a few days ago. We both chose the Belgian Waffle which I had eaten before and remembered it fondly. What came was a far cry from my memory. A small waffle, burnt underneath one side and served quite cold. Food prices have gone up in the City and around the world but charging $15 for what is a much smaller size of the waffle is thoroughly disappointing. We both had coffees with the waffle. Neither of us are keen to return.
No comment
I can literally eat their Bircher muesli everyday and still left craving it. It is honestly so yummy and absolutely addictive. Overall, a really nice place, the waiters are always very nice.
Quick easy pick up everything was great. Got the chorizo breakfast wrap and an oat matcha latte. Def wanna go back for a dine in experience. Looks like a nice chill spot with friendly staff

I've lived in Gramercy for years and always wanted to check this place out. Finally tried it and it's just okay. Very simple lunch items took an hour to come out and were fine but nothing special. Okay food, slow service. Other better options around.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Very confusing menu at this restaurant, however, it was very cute inside and the staff were very friendly. The "french toast" banana bread was more bread - like then french toast. It was also rather small. The breakfast sandwich was also very small, and was served with a side salad which did not taste good. The cappuccino reminded me of a Nespresso pod- very bitter. Not a favorite in the area and there are def better places to visit that are more worth the money.
Great food. Whole family loved it. The BBQ pork bowl was especially nice. Good service too. Nice local find
A new seasonal favorite has made place in my heart: the coconut milk overnight fruit mueslis
No comment

Solid breakfast spot for the usual items, but even better for several imaginative dishes. The banana french toast is excellent: could easily have it for dessert. Also really good bacon! We are from out of town, and lucky find: thank you!
Very famous reastarunt and loves up to the hype! Has multiple restaraunts in the area. The waffle was delicious. It doesn't look like much food, but it definenetly filled me up!
This restaurant was incredible. The lattes were fantastic, the breakfast wrap was unique with salmon in it, and the lavender latte was out of this world. Highly recommend this place.
No comment
No comment

column3: Greater Pinellas Point, St. Petersburg, FL
column6: Great food!  We originally came here just got the coffee, but we tried the cafe menu and everything was delicious.  And we love sitting outside!  The tables are on 21st Street, facing South so sunny and bright.  And they have plexiglass dividers between tables.  We really enjoy coming here.  We bring our sweet old dog when we sit outside.
No comment

This is a quintessential brunch spot. The first time I went to Citizens of Gramercy was right before COVID-19 lockdown. We ordered the Belgian waffle and BBQ pork bowl. The waffle was different than what you would normally get at restaurants, with nut butter and fruit. The bbq pork came with poached eggs and was cooked well. I would order both dishes again, but would skip the matcha latte, as other cafes make it better. They now have a few tables outside for dining with a limited menu.
Yummy brunch I had the banana bread French toast with bananas it was so good. I highly recommend this place.

Of all the Australian style brunch places around this one was just okay for me. Nothing stood out or really has me going back for more.  Sauces could have had more flavor and my chai latte a bit more pizzaz and flavor.
No comment
No comment
Absolutely INCREDIBLE place to eat and grab some coffee. Beyond words, the service, the quality, and environment are beyond Wonderful A+++
No comment
They don't take reservations but so worth it! I've been dreaming of this meal ever since I had it. Service is quick, food is tasty & staff is nice & friendly.
Such a cute spot with awesome food. I loved the chicken sandwich but need to come back to try the rest of the menu
No comment

Solid Australian brunch spot, cute interior friendly service. I like that they have a good assortment of egg entrees, waffles, burgers, avocado toast here (something for everyone). My boyfriend loved his cast iron dish. It's more of a quiet, slow morning vibe then a party atmosphere also.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Very busy spot and the latte is spot on. No cafe can rival their coffee within a three block radius.  Sometimes you can be overlooked when waiting online so be patient or make yourself known that you are waiting to order or to be seated.  The food is delicious and every dish you see on someone else's table will make your eyes pop out.  This place does have a wow factor for the neighborhood it resides in.
No comment
No comment

If I could I would rate this place zero star. Service was horrible. My sister ordered a veggie burger that was suppose to have beyond meat instead the server brought out beef. When my she ate her burger (1 to 2 bites) she automatically knew it was beef. She told the server and he responded with "idk let me go ask the back". Then he confirmed it was beef and said sorry. My sister is a vegetarian for 12+ years. This is a big deal to her and they just laughed it off and said we don't have to pay for the meal, which btw we only had a bite of. Just keep in mind if there was someone with a religious or medical issue to certain food they won't know what they bring out. They honestly suck!
No comment
No comment

The food was beautiful, clean and hearty. The kiwi margarita was delicious even though it came out after the food when we ordered it long before we put food order in. Sadly I wanted a couple more brunch drinks but once the food came they never came back until they brought the check that we didn't request. Mind you it was Monday morning and the place was mostly empty so it wasn't a busy problem. Just a service problem. Or a judgy problem because we were drinking on a Monday morning. Would definitely return because the food was fantastic and the staff was really friendly and cool when they were able to get around to us.
No comment

When we were in the area for picking up a dozen from Ess-a-Bagel, we were looking for brunch place with outdoor seating.  Luckily, we passed by this place and we had a simple brunch in the morning.  First of all, not only their service was good, but their food was also great for brunch.  The iced coffee was more on the burnt side, but still good nonetheless.  The chorizo and egg breakfast burrito was pretty good, stuffed with a hefty amount of chickpeas, eggs and chorizo.  Also note their "Smashing Avocado", their spin on the avocado toast, topped with feta, sunflower seeds, pumpkin seeds, watermelon radishes with a hint of citrus, coriander on a thick slice of multigrain bread.  Even though the price is kinda steep for avocado toast, it is still worth it for the quality.  Overall, if you are looking for a good brunch spot, I would recommend this place, as well as their other locations.
No comment

My neighborhood hookup! Service is attentive and straightforward. Best value no frills yet still classy brunch with options for everyone and delicious cocktails. The only complaint is that the space is tiny and gets busy all the time so come early to claim a spot. Often I have to come put my name down on a list and get a to-go drink back to my apartment and wait a few mins before getting seated but it is all worth it.
No comment
No comment

The quality of the food has gone down a lot since this chain opened. More than once, I picked up to go orders where the quality and freshness of ingredients was meh. The coffee isn't good and the pastries are terrible. I went there for the last time this week after I was sold a piece of banana bread that was dry, hard and slightly bitter tasting. I took 1 bite and threw it in the garbage. From now on, I'll walk an extra block to 3rd avenue and go to Think Coffee which is superior in many aspects. Citizens has a cute corner location and a wider food selection but I've been dissatisfy once too many times lately so I'll be spending my money elsewhere.

Another level of friendly. I came in alone which is something I don't usually do but the staff here made my whole experience a positive one. They have a cute little counter space if you're dining alone and tables that can accommodate larger parties. They have delicious pastries that can be ordered for grab and go or can be enjoyed at your table. My egg skillet was AMAZING and came with fresh bread that was just delicious. My waitress brought over a beet jam for me to try and I was pleasantly surprised at how tasty it was. I can't say enough about the service here. Everyone was friendly, willing to have a conversation and make my experience the best it could be. I look forward to coming back and enjoying more items on the menu.

Amazing! Just moved to the area (like right around the corner) and there is a serious lack of good restaurants around, so nice to find citizens of grammercy. Entire menu looks great, and the shakshuka was delicious! Will definitely be back
No comment

Went to this spot after experiencing Citizens of Bleecker. The menu and the quality of the food is the same - it is very tasty and the prices are alright. The Gramercy location is smaller than Bleecker but the outside area was very aesthetic and clean. Would recommend for some great breakfast!

Love this place!!  My boyfriend and I come here regularly, love the muesli and yogurt plates.  Their velvet latte is delicious.  A calm, casual vibe, but sometimes closes earlier than listed (hence the four stars).
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Citizens of Gramercy is a cute cafe with brunch options for everyone. We came on a Sunday around 10am and didn't have to wait for a seat. I got the avocado toast, they typically mix the avocado spread with cheese so they were able to modify it and give me plain sliced avocado with pickled onions, toasted pumpkin seeds, and beet hummus. I loved how much avocado I got for the $15 price point.
Been here twice now because my gf lives above. Muesli is ok. Overall, it's a reasonable pick if you live on the block.  Better places nearby; FERNS and sunflower gramercy, to name two
No comment

Good brunch spot in a neighborhood starved for places like it. Not as good as its sister Citizens of Chelsea - there's less seating and the traffic doesn't flow well by the counter - but still great. (Menu is also more or less the same.) I had an apple turnover pastry to start, then the farmers bowl. Both were very tasty. My boyfriend's bbq pulled pork sandwich was also delicious.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Dang. This place had no business being this good. My wife & I used the Puls'd app to lock down a great deal. I got the BBQ Brekkie and my wife the Biscuit Sandwich and they both slayed. I will absolutely be here again.

This place is a little more expensive than average, but not too outrageous, and also worth every penny for their delicious chicken and veggie burgers with salad. I also enjoy their wellness bowl and herbal teas. Yesterday, the service was a little uncoordinated with another waitress asking me for my order when a waiter just did so two minutes ago. They still take COVID-19 precautions seriously.
No comment

The waitress told us after we placed our order that our food would take about 45 minutes to prepare which seems absurd for burgers and a side salad but that really wasn't the issue for me. We were not impressed with the quality of the burgers once we finally received them. The were very bland and dry...mediocre at best. We left feeling disappointed and cheated out of time and money. I rarely write reviews but this place really needs to step up their game.
Avoid at all costs. OK food. Terrible service. A pick up order took an hour to prepare and was incorrect.
No comment

Obsessed with our waitress Emma! The food here was delicious. I got scrambled eggs and salmon lox with a latte. It came with pickled onions and lemon. Super refreshing brunch with my college friends complete with a Michael Jackson soundtrack playing in the restaurant. They were able to accommodate all 6 of us with ease. Will definitely come again.

Cute and trendy brunch spot complete with neon signs and lots and lots of plants. Is usually always crowded so be prepared to wait a little bit. I had the avocado toast with poached eggs and bacon. It was pretty good, but pretty pricey.
No comment
Absolutely delightful. Great brunch spot with clean, healthy food. And you can't beat the $5 beer/wine/prosecco special. We will be back.
Finally had breakfast here this week after having their lattes and espressos for a few months. The kale salad, and the salmon eggs, were very good. Recommend.
No comment

Citizens of gramercy is a small cafe/brunch place in the city. It's great for a late breakfast and just to chat with friends. The venue is nice, some tables are with stools and some are with chairs. This place isn't meant For big parties but I came with 7 other people and luckily we got seated with no wait time. I ordered the salmon eggs and a mimosa. I thought it was okay.

What's better than an Australian brunch?? Nothing! Citizens of Gramercy is an adorable place to grab a healthy meal with friends. I had a yogurt and granola bowl and shared a pitcher of mimosas with friends. The atmosphere is cute and trendy. The food is delicious! I really enjoyed my yogurt and it was beautiful!
No comment

Stopped in to get some breakfast/brunch this morning. This place is pretty close to my apartment and I've been meaning to try it for a while. Being a weekday, it wasn't super crowded. I sat at one of the high top tables. The waiter was really patient as I decided what I wanted. I ordered a flat white with soy milk and the banana bread. The flat white was absolutely amazing (not to mention pretty lol). They were really quick to bring out my food as well. The banana bread was so delicious! It's plated very nicely and has a great taste. It comes on top of Greek yogurt (which was perfectly sweet and not at all bitter which was my feat when I ordered it), red grapes (I wish it had more), a sprinkles of granola (also wish it had more, it was barely any) and a drizzle of caramel (added an amazing flavor). Although it was super tasty, you don't get a lot for what you pay for honestly. My total bill was $15 without tip and I left a little hungry still. There are other amazing things on the menu as well that I would like to try, but don't come with a big appetite.
No comment
Stopped in for brunch. Had a power bowl and mimosa. The staff is friendly. The service is great and the food is delicious. I'd recommend and I'd go again. Healthy food that's filling.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Solid brunch spot. Not too crowded with great coffee. Food is also on the fresh and healthy side with generally generous portions. Only docked a star because the day we came was the heat wave and the AC was either not working or not sufficient. When they brought water for the table they also brought a pitcher room temp. I'm not one to complain but gimme some ice in your sauna of a restaurant PLEASE. We had to separately ask for ice and were brought one medium sized cup which promptly melted in 10 minutes. We sweated all through brunch.

I came here for lunch with a friend a few weeks ago. We came here during the week, so it wasn't too busy and we were able to get a table easily. My friend ordered the Charred Broccoli Bowl and subbed chicken instead of tuna. I ordered the Miso Chicken Bowl. Neither of us were super thrilled with the food - it was fine, but definitely overpriced at $16.50. The other menu items were also quite expensive, and the menu wasn't very expansive. It's not a place I would probably go back to for food.
No comment
I have been to a BUNCH of these citizen cafes and they're all great but I have to say the staff at this location are some of the loveliest waiting staff in NYC. They couldn't be kinder :)

Got here around 1pm on a Friday, wasn't pack at all. The setting of the restaurant is pretty cool. Service and food were both good. When I first saw the fish serve at the table I was thinking to myself, the portion size wouldn't be able to fill me up. However I was wrong, portion size just enough to satisfy.

I am here to happily put in yet another well deserved 5 star review for Citizens Of Gramercy. Can not talk highly enough about Citizens Of Gramercy. The reviews helped me choose, I have ordered BBQ Pulled Pork Sandwich and it was fantastic. Team is extremely helpful and will certainly help you with everything. Glad to see a place like that in this area.
No comment

Such a great cafe! Went here on a triple brunch date and we all loved it. We needed a place that fit a bunch of needs: healthy options, vegan options, coffees (lattes), mimosas (and other drinks), etc. And this place had it all! Great, friendly staff as well.
No comment
i come here everyday for coffee but this one gentleman was extremely rude this am. I will NOT be back

This place is great! I happened to pass by here one day and to our surprise we really enjoyed it. I ate their croissant French toast and eggs with cheese and avocado.  I loved the eggs with the cheddar cheese on them. I would go back just for that! The cafe is usually busy, but there's plenty of tables. The service is good, the toast was delicious and we really liked the coffee. We are glad we found this little spot!
No comment

I went here on a Sunday for a late breakfast, and we were seated right away. I got the berry waffle, my 2 friends got the pitaya bowl, and the pulled pork eggs Benedict. The waffle was good, the eggs Benedict was great (I had to try some) and my friend liked the pitaya bowl. I also had a golden latte which was good, but expensive for what it was. Overall it was fine. I would get the eggs Benedict next time, or spilt the waffle and the eggs with someone!!
No comment
No comment
No comment
Awful awful awful, dirty nasty staff, food is subpar. With plenty of other places in the neighborhood I would not waste my time or money here.
We went for brunch on a Saturday. They don't take reservations (as much as I searched) but they were able seat us right away and served us super quickly. Super friendly staff and great food.
No comment
No comment

column3: Downtown Jersey City, Jersey City, NJ
column6: Stopped here for a quick brunch on my own and i loved it! Definitely will go back again and try their other items on their menu. Love this place!
Great food, good staff and reasonably priced. We tried their Salmon eggs, (definitely one of the good ones I had in NYC) Shakshuka, PBJ with waffle and a cappuccino. We liked them all.

Citizens is a very cute coffee shop and the staff is always enthusiastic and friendly. They have oat, almond and soy milk but no vegan pastries and very limited vegan options on the menu, which is my only criticism. It's still a great addition to the neighborhood though!

Had the loveliest Father's Day brunch here today. Everything we ordered was delicious: Muesli, Banana Bread, Cast Iron Baked eggs, side of eggs & avocado, coffees, and the best fresh squeezed orange juice I think I've ever had in my life. Love that they offer brekkie all day. The fresh, yummy food was so nicely complimented by it's presentation and pretty plating. And the staff was exceptionally nice and accommodating. Not to mention the adorable decor. They're nailing it on every level!
No comment
No comment

First things first, why are there flies in this restaurant? I don't like having flies flying around me or my food... The food was okay, I order the Pulled Pork Benny and I liked it. On the other hand, my friend ordered a Salom Eggs and she didn't like it at all. She also ordered a cucumber mint limeade and she didn't like that as well. The drink just tasted like a limeade, didn't have any cucumber or mint taste to it. The service was okay when I asked for my food to go the waiter just gave me a box. I had to box the food myself and he didn't even bother giving me a bag... It was literally pouring outside and apparently, I'm supposed to just hold this little paper box in my hand and hope it won't get wet in the rain.

The pulled pork benny is a MUST! The best breakfast in nyc it's just too good! That sauce doe! Love this spot, trendy, super bright and airy and great lattes! This place is always packed though and theres a bit of a wait..
No comment

While in the area, we found this place for brunch. The experience was superb over all. The restaurant itself was very tastefully decorated, to start. The coffee (I got an oat milk latte) was of excellent quality, rich & smooth. The food was also very enjoyable. I got the pulled pork benny, and did not regret it whatsoever - in fact, I enjoyed every bite! Must try Australian joint.
No comment

Best coffee shop in the neighborhood. Really affordable coffee, free WiFi, really friendly and helpful staff. The shop itself is beautifully designed and there's a great vibe to sit and work or meet friends for food or coffee. Definitely coming back for the food!
No comment

Great place for brunch with friends and decently priced brunch food. Have gone to the one in Chelsea & Gramercy and appreciate the bohemian decor in both. Filled tummy's & happy smiles leaving this place overall!

So happy this place opened in my neighborhood. Great vibe. Fun staff. Food was excellent- I had the pulled pork bene and my friend had the avo smash, both were excellent. Coffee was great too. They have a coffee bar to go area if you just want to pop in for a coffee drink.  Can't wait to come back!!

Was so excited after seeing this place on Instagram but unfortunately the food did not live up to expectations--my friends and I agreed it was just mediocre and nothing special. Coffee is fine. There are better brunch spots in NY.

Very pleased with my experience here. I came for lunch on a weekday and it was quite busy. I would imagine the weekends are packed. The coffee was great, they had oat milk which is a plus. I ordered the avocado toast, which can be quite pricey if you add all the toppings. $20 is just too much to pay. Presentation was beautiful though. Would potentially come back.

Lovely brunch place! I will recommend the classic latte and shakshuka. The yogurt bowl only has peanut butter taste after I mixed everything. You will prob love it if you are a big fan of peanut butter. Besides that, I thought everything was really good. Definitely will recommend to my friends.
Wouldn't let me sit down since I was waiting for someone....even though the restaurant was empty. I just said screw it and went elsewhere.

Super cute coffee shop and restaurant with lovely staff working. If you are plant based/vegan their health lattes, I.e matcha and golden are already served with almond milk. Their yogurt and granola is good too. Bring a friend and chill out.

The team here is really great, friendly and attentive. The food was really good, clean and healthy. I had their spiked ice tea and it was fantastic. We're definitely coming back to Citizens of Gramercy!
Had hot/cold Latte from their outdoor seating and takeout, and it brought back a piece of Heaven with their amazing latte during this challenging time.

Came because first location of choice was packed, I had the banana bread and it was tasty and affordable, just a bit burnt around the edges though. Friend was brought the wrong meal at first and had wait a bit longer to eat... service was fine though :) overall 4/5

I just went to New Zealand this summer and brunch there is so delicious. So when I heard about Citizens Of Gramercy, I invited my friend to come with us. Have to say the service here was pretty good, although there were a lot of people in the restaurant. I ordered the salmon egg with avocado and it was pretty good. The salmon and the poached egg were both light and delicious. And my friend ordered the pork Benny. We didn't really enjoy that one because it was too sweet and a little greasy. Overall, Citizens Of Gramercy is a perfect place to hang out with friends.
The environment is wonderful. Love the decor and feel of the place. The staff was very personable and friendly. My friend said it was the best mocha she's ever tasted. Would recommend to anyone!

This isn't a place to bring your parents because they're not going to get the aesthetic to genuinely good food ratio. Anyways, I was very much enjoying myself. We waltzed in around 1-2pm (?) on weekend and there was no wait. I got the coffee and the smashed avo. My mom got the salmon eggs. I loved it! The coffee cup was the biggest I've seen. My mom thought it was just ok. Regardless, I loved it. This seems like a great place for bankers to come chill during the day with a date/gf when, sorry not if, they're working on the weekends. There were some people in suits there so that's what I assume was going on. Will be back!!
Great coffee and service. Got a double espresso and loved it. Haven't tasted the food yet, but smelled nice.

Decor and plating is IG friendly but Citizen Gramercy is all bark and no bite. Had a waffle that was sickeningly sweet and the wellness bowl which was underwhelming. I was pretty disappointed since there are so many positive reviews of this place on Yelp. It seems like another instance of insta fans leaving positive reviews for free meals. If you're in the neighborhood for a medical appointment (lots of doctors offices around this area) and are looking for a bite, this place will be fine but the food is not a stellar experience as the reviews claim.
Great breakfast spot. Amazing fresh choices prepared beautifully in a quaint setting. Weekends usually line speaks to the quality. Brew delicious Partner coffee, from Brooklyn.

Had high hopes. The pork dish was amazing, must order; waffle was amazing as well. Besides that....avocado toast tastes super sour, I think the avocados they used that day went bad....we also ordered a smoothie bowl that just tasted beyond weird...so pick your dishes carefully!!

Very meat and egg focused.  Not super healthy or plant-based (unless you count avocado toast...eye roll). They don't permit working on laptops or tablets most of the tables.  I needed to sign a document and respond to an issue mid breakfast and felt like I couldn't because of the off putting sign on the table. My husband loved his breakfast sandwhich but my coffee was so bitter, I couldn't drink it.
No comment

Citizens of Gramercy replaced my local coffee shop but it's okay because now it is a cute little brunch spot. I came here on a week day for brunch with my mom. The space is small but cozy. The staff are all very nice, when you walk in they greet you almost immediately. We started off with a large coffee which was served in a little pot and enough for 2 people to share. We shared a waffle, the waffle was a bit dense and hard in my opinion, I wish it was more fluffy and soft. My advice to the restaurant would be to not sprinkle it with the powdered sugar because I personally like my waffles plain. Other then that it was good. My mom got the avocado toast, she did not want the feta or cheese, Since the smashed avocado already has the onions mixed in they offered to slice fresh avocado on top which worked out really well. I got the pulled pork benedict. It was very good but quite overwhelming so it is a good item to split with someone. Overall the food was good, the service was great, and I will be back! Oh and a A+ for plating!

Great, friendly service! The decor was bright and fun, with a diverse coffee menu to go along with it. The Golden latte was deliciously decadent. I had the pulled pork Benny, which was delicious. My boyfriend ordered the acai bowl, which was underwhelming. The consistency was incredibly watery and the flavor was suboptimal. Everything else, however, was lovely. Worth the visit!

We stayed at Freehands hotel few blocks from here ended up coming twice for breakfast! Great atmosphere and friendly servers, I would recommend the golden latte and the avocado toast with a poached egg!

Cute spot with great, attentive service. Love their peach smoothie bowl for a sweet treat. For something a little heartier, grab one of their savory bowls or shakshuka. And best part? WIFI! Don't tell anyone my secret work spot!

I liked my meal, but for the price, proportions, and service, I feel like I could have gotten a better meal either at home or at another breakfast place. The waiter was extremely transactional, and made it seem like he really just wanted us to leave him alone. I ordered the poached eggs served in a cast-iron pot, and it wasn't bad, but served in a really tiny bowl and I was still hungry afterwards. It was also quite loud and busy inside - there are certainly better breakfast places in and around Gramercy that one could try as opposed to this place.

The service here is incredibly slow. I've eaten here a few times and the food has been OK albeit a little overpriced. However today 4 people who were seated after me (2 separate tables) got their food before me and the only reason I ultimately received my order was because I asked about it. The place was not crowded. And no one seemed to think this was an issue and the manager was nowhere to be found. I think this place has become popular with college students in the area so the staff is probably a little jaded from serving that crowd (which I am sympathetic to). I live in the neighborhood and was hoping for a quick bite after the gym but never again. There are plenty of other casual spots in the area for a quick bite.

I went to this café for a late breakfast. We were seated immediately  We ordered the pitaya bowl and pulled pork eggs Benedict. The pitaya bowl was great and the eggs Benedict were delicious. The food was very good, and the portions are huge so it's a good idea to go with someone else. There were also some really interesting plates on the menu. I will definitely be back again to try! Totally recommend this place!

Came here with a few friends and didn't have a great experience. It was noon- asked for Prosecco only to be told 5 minutes later they didn't have any. Couldn't make mimosas and also didn't have any Rosé. My friend ordered the fall bowl which came out without Brussels sprouts or grapes. So he had to bring it back. We'd also ordered lattes which took over 20 minutes to come out. One person had asked for it cold and he brought her a hot one. Wouldn't come here again cuz... why bother. Tons of other better places in Gramercy.

This restaurant is not that great. Our waiter was incredibly rude and stand offish. They have smoothie bowls on their menu but not smoothies. The food was slightly overpriced given the proportions and my food was not hot. At all. In fact it was almost cold. The interior is cute and the cappuccinos are very good. Otherwise incredibly mediocre and overall disappointing.
No comment
Really enjoyed this place. Good food. Lighting in the back is a little hatch but I get it, trying to be trendy with neon. Would definitely come back.
NY classic, go-to place for a guaranteed good brunch. Smoked salmon toast w the dill spread more flavorful than your average salmon benedict

I've had breakfast here twice with a friend and we both loved the avocado toast. I have had the velvet latte and it's by far my favorite, which used to be the matcha. Definitely will keep this place in my rotation.

I came with a group of 4 girls and we were seated within 5 mins on a Saturday morning. We got Shakshukas and the Brekkie sandwiches. For the prices, the portions were so small (we all agreed we could eat two plates each) and it just wasn't worth it. The food was just ordinary too, we had high expectations since this place had such high reviews on yelp. Staff weren't particularly nice either and we had to wave down our waitress several times for water. Sadly we won't be back :(

LOVE this cute place. It is only open for breakfast and lunch, which they do really well. I've had a shakshuka and avo toast with poached egg and both were equally as delicious. I sat at the bar, and both the servers working there were extremely friendly and pleasant to chat with. The ambiance is cozy and trendy! I believe they will have wine or liquor soon too.  It's definitely a neighborhood gem and I highly recommend it.

OK I understand there's a pandemic but you should let your customers know that you're serving your food in Tupperware when you're expecting a nice meal. Also we sat in the seat where it was literally drenching us from the air conditioner and she told us oh sorry we're trying to get that fixed she should have told us that the air conditioner was going to do that before letting us sit there. Bad customer service. Not coming back.

Quite a good place. The coffee is meh but overall good. The portions are huge though. I barely was able to finish my plate. Not a lot of seating especially during the weekend and in winter the condensation on the window and the ceiling is quite gross.

Best brunch I've ever had, period! Quality food, amazing taste, beautiful presentation, and decent price. Loveee the interior design, and surprisingly not a very long wait. Have your next squad brunch here & thank me later.

Live in the neighborhood and walked in early on a Sunday morning to have a quick breakfast and since I was by myself wanted to use my laptop. I was looking forward to trying it out and was willing to sit at counter and/or bar. I was told I was not allowed to use my laptop on weekends. I wasn't going to linger - just wanted to eat quickly. Pretty ridiculous rule - not even sure how or why they can do that. Walked out without even getting to try it. Disappointed.
No comment

This used to be my favorite place to splurge on brunch. Today I ordered and waited at a table for 30 minutes watching all the other patrons get served before me while the staff chatted at the bar (and one had lunch!). When I walked up to and approached the staff (no one checked on me), he mumbled, "oh, I'm sorry. I didn't place your order" half-heartedly. Now being out of time, I left with no food and feeling like a bad day just got worse.

Come for the coffee, stay for the food! Came here for weekend brunch and coffee. Loved that the service was quick and the food came out after a few minutes. The coffee especially the espresso drinks are on point! There are alcoholic drinks too but we did not get to try them (mimosas, bloody marys, beers and wines), though will definitely be back soon! The breakfast items were very tasty and not too expensive. The brekkie sandwich came with beetroot chutney, eggs, bacon on a cheddar biscuit served with a side salad. It was a very filling meal and was only $14. Most of the breakfast/brunch items start at $14 and can add avocados/eggs. Definitely recommend if live close by or in the area.
Absolutely incredible, the pulled pork Benedict is a must have. This is my new go to place. I love how small and local it is. Food came out fast and fresh, best brunch I've had in months.
Super cool Australian-style shop with excellent food and espresso drinks.

Nice aesthetic, not super crowded. The people who work here are super friendly and nice. My only complaint is the food portions are small. Definitely check out the pictures of food beforehand (the waffle was just one singular waffle with a scoop of peanut butter). The food was okkkk. Not filling.
Excellent.  Food is great and Andrew, the owner was cool and welcoming.   Will be back.

This was such a cute place!!! Michelle, our server, provided helpful answers to our questions on the menus. She checked up on us to make sure everything was going well and overall was so kind. The food was a great way to start off my friends and my NYC trip. It was filling, tasty, all of the above.

this place has seriously gone down hill over the past few months. A go to place during Covid they have dropped their standards to below the acceptable Covid guidelines. They are not disinfecting between customers , their menus are  reused and they serve the milk pitcher in the coffee cup so that they don't have to make two trips . . The cook had on gloves but did not change in between tasks so he was cleaning and touching food with the same gloves . The food has gone down hill and is overly spicy . I could not eat my biscuit today as it was too spicy and and drowning in butter . A few months ago it was garnished nicely today it was not .  Is there new management or staff , because the change is so obvious . The coffee is terrible and they bring it in a glass pot and it is ice cold before you can pour your second cup, they need insulated pitchers . The staff does not care and there was one waiter who looked like he had not washed his hair in a week . If they don't go back to their old ways they will not last much longer, they lost a regular customer today. FYI I did not eat my breakfast and no one asked why !!!!!      They just dont care
Fresh healthy food great for the neighbourhood top notch friendly service been to the Chelsea spot and this is just as good
No comment
Amazing brunch, to go coffee, fun chill vibes, a welcome neighborhood spot. Pulled pork benny, breakfast sandwhich and waffle are my favorites, but everything is amazing.

Citizens of Gramercy is a great new spot in the neighborhood! The ambiance is very warm and inviting, the decor is really cute, the food is incredible and the staff is so friendly it made for a great experience. This place is a gem and I'll definitely be returning!

I live in the building above COG and really wanted to support the neighborhood place but the waiter told me my iPad, which I use to read books, is against their policy. Meanwhile, the guy next to me was reading on his iPhone. I can understand if I brought in a laptop and set up shop. But I intended to read while I ate. Like the guy next to me on his iPhone. So I left. It's too bad. I wanted to make it my local breakfast place.
I love their Muesli. Their avocado toast is elevated and delicious. I had a few misses here a couple of times but overall great food, fresh and clean. good service.
Other than the environment is good. I enjoy the salmon eggs. I would prefer to sit near the window next time.

The food was absolutely delicious, up there with my favorite breakfast places in the city. My only complaint is that there were no free refills on a regular cup of coffee. Maybe the transition from being a coffee shop is throwing them, but it is bizarre to not get a refill in regular sized coffee mug accompanying a $15 breakfast dish.

Hard for me to give a great rating because the place is just smashed by terrible service. Cappuccino is terrific, basically what you'd have in Italy or France, good foam, and strong italian taste. I also had the Pulled Pork Benny which was not bad but : for 14$ you get a child portion and the speed of service (and what I saw from I was) tells you that they run a service buffet (warmed up food - ready to serve), not a made-to-order kitchen. But on a saturday morning with plenty of free tables - the waiter rudely tells me "we don't allowed tablets on week-ends" - thus implying I'm about to stay an hour, just because I've pulled that object out (but phones are ok - no one can dwell on them forever in their minds, it seems). Children are ok - and if they eat at the same pace as mine... I'd accept myself with a tablet. Anyway, a sign would be welcome and a lot of things are acceptable when said nicely... That wasn't the case. I would have given 1 star if it wasn't for the coffee.

As other reviews have said, the food is delicious, large servings, and super friendly service! We got the avocado toast with added egg & bacon and the brekkie sandwich topped with avocado. Each bite was packed with flavor and freshness & really unique tastes. I love brunching as much as anyone, but the brunch dishes here really have a flavor of their own. I can't wait to come back time & time again to try everything on the menu. So happy about this spot opening up in the neighborhood!!

This place is absolutely amazing. Super delicious food that comes out really quickly and great service. What more could you ask for!? I am someone that believes less than 10% of nyc restaurants are truly worthy of a 9.5-10 rating out of 10, but this place definitely deserves it!
Love this place!! Such a great addition to the neighborhood. The food, service and ambiance are all awesome, and I will be coming back regularly

This popular little brunch spot was light and tasty, but the service and the staff were less than impressive. They offer several vegetarian and vegan options and I was happy to see matcha tea on the menu! I wanted to order their Fall Bowl because I love brussels sprouts, but our waiter informed us, after we'd decided to order, that they were out of that as well as their bubbly. The portions were small but everything was very fresh. I'm almost positive they forgot the vinaigrette on my miso chicken bowl, but once I asked for it, I ate every bite. The wait staff also forgot to bring our side of banana bread and after asking three different times, someone finally brought it out as we were paying the check. The worst part though was when my friend asked for cream for his coffee and the guy replied: "there should be enough" as he pointed to the tiny pitcher of cream somebody else was using. Overall, the questionable service outweighed the delicious food, so I'm not sure I would go back.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Decided to check this place out for weekend lunch; the line was long as expected but we got seated in 20-25 minutes. The servers were attentive, refilled our hot teas as often as they can. We ordered various dim sum plates, and beef Lo Mein, which were flavorful and filling. There are a lot of options nearby, but this is definitely one good options to consider when you are debating about which one to check out!
No comment

I recently dined at Dim Sum Palace with a group of 2 and the wait time was 45 minutes on a weekday. While the wait was a bit long, all the food was fresh and well worth it. The restaurant has a unique ordering system where you can mark off your food choices on a menu at the table and then give it to your waiter or waitress. The prices were a little more expensive than other dim sum places I've been to, but not too bad for the quality of food. The atmosphere of the restaurant is good, and the service is friendly. All in all, I would recommend Dim Sum Palace for fresh, high-quality dim sum, but be prepared for a wait during peak hours.

Dim Sum Palace definitely does not live up to it's name.  Most things on the menu were mediocre and overpriced.  On top of all this, they charged us for a bunch of items that didn't even come.  I would not return.
No comment

This was my first time at this location and I took my family who loved it. It felt very welcoming and homey. The service was quick and efficient. The food is authentic. The best dim sum we've had in NYC. There's so many to dim sum options to pick from and I love that the menu has pictures and you write how many orders you want. Our favorites include bbq pork bun, soup dumplings, taro buns, and sesame balls.  Definitely will be back to try them all.

We tried the Peking duck here and it was a fun experience. They come out with the duck and cut it in front of you, and then they have buns with scallions and hoisin sauce. They made 6 buns with duck for us and then gave us a separate plate with the rest of the duck. The skin was very crispy and the meat was well seasoned and flavorful. We also tried their soup dumplings which were decent. I don't think this place gets too busy since we were immediately seated for dinner and there were a lot of open tables around us.
No comment
Everything you want and more. 10/10 recommend for a classic dim sum experience. Pricing is fair, the soup dumplings were great, but my favorite was actually the cold sesame noodles.
No comment
No comment

We were in NYC for a mini vacation and couldn't leave the city without going to the dim sum place.  I searched on yelp near dim sum, and this place kept coming up.  It seems that they have a variety of locations throughout the city.  This was not the typical place where they come around with the cart (or at least when we went on Sunday afternoon), but you order at the table.  We ordered our usual, but I will mention a few here.  The turnip cake was too floury not much turnip.  The shrimp shumai was ok, and the shrimp hakao was good.  Sticky rice with bbq was good but the rice wasn't sweet or sticky rather tasted like regular white rice.   Overall the food was mediocre to good and service was ok.
I was a little sad they didn't offer the shrimp noodle during the week. Was shocked to find out how delicious every dish was! Definitely authentic dim sum! Can't wait to go back!
Friendly staff, really top quality dim sum. Several types of tea including pu er and chrysanthemum. Prices are reasonable, service was prompt. All in all we will definitely go back!

Darn good dim sum and Chinese cuisine establishment.  Authentic dishes and lots of choices.  Air conditioned and comfortable.  This is one of the few places that has both Shanghai soup dumplings AND bbq pork buns.  Obviously, the dim sum is delicious, but do yourself a favor and order the sautéed Chinese broccoli with crispy garlic - an extra special, vegetarian treat!  Overall, a top notch dim sum establishment.
No comment
Unfriendly staffs. The guy was very rude, made us feel unwelcome. Not like the one in Chinatown. They have much nicer staff and food there.

We came here on a Sunday afternoon and only had to wait about 10 minutes for a table. The bad: They didn't check our vaccination status, the first glass of water had a fly in it, and overall they seemed a little rushed. The good: dishes came out fast, prices were good for the serving size, and the food overall was very good. Best dishes were the buns and spring rolls.
No comment

Came here for a quick bite with a friend. This restaurant and the bathrooms were very clean, which is always appreciated. Service was great. Food was awesome! Loved the assortment of dishes we ate. They give a heaping portion of lo mein. Overall, great experience!
Quick service, huge selection of yummy dumplings at reasonable price. A must go to place.
No comment
No comment
Incredible place. Exactly what we were looking for. Very well priced as well. I am thankful we came here. We will be returning.

Absolutely recommend this place for dim sum. The food is reasonably priced (especially if you go with a bigger group) and authentic. The only thing I wouldn't recommend on their menu that I've tried is their shredded duck wonton soup - the soup had almost no flavor. DEFINITELY get the pork and 1000 year egg congee, that may be one of my favorite dim sum dishes here.
No comment

Loved this place! Everyone needs to try the fried milk things. We got thirteen different dishes, and for the most part everything was flavorful and delicious. We were a bit disapointed in the BBQ Port buns and the taro buns, but otherwise this was solid and we'll definitely be returning.

The normal dim sum options were available and everything we ordered was delicious. The place is really clean and orderly, but the staff is a little rude. You have to stop people to get more water and to order more food. I recommend the sticky rice with pork wrapped in lotus leaves. This dish comes with two portions, but they're kind of small.

We were a party of 9 for lunch. The service was outstanding, the owner/manager was very friendly and went out of his way to welcome our table and talk to the teenagers at the table. We overordered (our fault) and although it was not inexpensive, it was worth it. And we have some picky eaters. Plus we then had leftovers to bring home. It was all delicious - the dim sum platter, the soup dumplings, the shumai, egg rolls... The staff was also very patient with us while we decided and we did not feel rushed at all.
Went here for my second time after a few years, and it's just as wonderful as I remember - there's NOTHING on the menu I wouldn't recommend. Their dumplings are worth coming back for every time.
Highly recommend the "chicken juicy bun" soup dumplings. Large portion and great value at $10.95. Table devour is fairly basic. Outdoor seating available
No comment

Gorgeous restaurant, yummy food! I found this place last minute. Family was visiting us and wanted dim sum. When we arrived, I was a little hesitant about eating here because it was so clean (lol). I know that sounds strange but like all the amazing dim sum places I ever been to were chaotic and messy! Anyways, immediately we are greeted with the man who wears a UCLA uncle hat. He knew Filipino dishes so the first thing he offered my entire family was lugaw  (congee). The family couldn't say no - so they got some and they liked it. For our meal, we ordered the chicken juicy dumpling, pork dumpling, shrimp shumai, chicken feet, Peking duck, pineapple fried rice, and this beef noodle dish that I didn't catch the name of. Everyone enjoyed the meal taste-wise! I had ordered the pineapple fried rice, hoping it was going to come in a pineapple like the photo, but it didn't. That was the only upsetting part. Other than that, we're definitely coming back to visit! When I come by myself, I will definitely be ordering more than we did during our visit.
