I think the food was tasty for the most part, but I do feel like a big part of the hype for this restaurant is simply a result of them only having limited spots / reservation-only. We got the chu chee, kao tod, and tom kati. I thought the kao tod was my favorite bc it had so many different flavors and textures in one dish and the perf amount of spice (aka more spicy than most thai restaurants I've been to). My bf liked the chu chee the most but I thought it was okay (other than the curry which was delicious). However, I did love the kao lam bc it's the exact kind of semi-sweet asian dessert I crave with coconut flavor. Overall I think the food was good but not something I'd rave about.
No comment

Booked well in advance, so was really excited to try Ugly Baby, which I had walked by several times. We were a bit intimidated by the warnings of spiciness, so landed on the five spice pork belly, parang curry, and the jungle curry. The Pork Belly was cooked perfectly with a deliciously warm sauce that was perfect for cutting the heat from the rest of the meal. Penang curry was also a hit and not overly spicy, but the jungle curry was not our favorite. The service was super friendly and helpful! Overall, really appreciated the divergence from the standard NYC Thai menu and would definitely come back!
No comment

Went here last night , I knew the reputation for spicy but boy was the duck salad dish spicy , we had a seafood dish that was amazing the shrimp and squid was so tender with a spicy balanced flavor, the brisket so up was also a delicious flavor the brisket was also a little tough there . Dick salad was my least favorite due to the minced duck which I couldn't taste because I was on fire burning ,
No comment

It's a tiny little restaurant and I enjoyed the ambiance (it's small and bustling, which may not be for everybody). We ordered five dishes, of which the only real knockout was the Khoong Muk Kai Kem. The others were all solid. Also good was a crab cake type item. We had a chicken curry that was good and a pork rice salad that I didn't love. Lots of items were also out of stock.

Such a hidden gem. While it might be a challenge to find a dish on the menu that doesn't pack a spicy punch, the staff are cheerful and friendly. They will guide you in the right direction. The ambience is simple, colorful and lively. The focus is on the food! Definitely worth checking out.
Cute restaurant. They are known for their spicy foods.

Five days later and I think I still have heartburn from the spice but you know what? Worth it! I looked around and ordered with my eyes so I could have balanced out that spice, but again, no regrets! Such unique flavors, not your usual Thai takeout stuff (not that there's anything wrong with that though). We had the Khoong Muk Kai Kem, which if you are looking for that spicy/sweet/sticky flavor combo here it is, and was the favorite between my friend and I. We also had the Hor Mok Pu which was a blue crab patty with a coconut custard - incredible and I have had few dishes where I can really taste and enjoy crab the way I did here. We had one other item, it was almost like a salad and it comes with and egg but you mix it all up - can't find it anywhere and I ordered it because I looked over at another table and said "and that!" to our waitress. I can't find the name and their menu changes so no amount of research helped, but I added the picture and it was yet another phenomenal dish! Also, they will bring you white rice to no end - go for it.
No comment

Terrible service. I am here waiting for my food. All I wanted was a bottle of water. They said they don't have it. I tell them I can go get it. They said policy is they do not allow outside drinks. Ok. Please get me a bottle of water outside. Charge me. It's ok. They said they cannot do that. Wtf???  You piss me off over a bottle of water??? Customers nearby next to me was like omg. Wtf is wrong with them? You really gotta be kidding me. I don't care how good your food taste but this is the last time I'm coming here. I even explained to them that my stomach reacts to tap water. They just don't care and all they care about is their policy. Go shove your corporate company policy is where you need to. Now I asked for coke. I said straw in a can. Brings over with coke poured into a cup of ice. Smh. Finally they got it right.

My wife and I had been waiting to eat here during our NY vacation. I already checked their hours of operation before going and it said they're open Sat 12pm. We get there today around 1:45pm and the whole place is closed and the chairs are all stacked. Wth is that all about?

Tiny space but the food is so good.  Not for the weak stomach or low spicy tolerance. Most dishes are excellent, absolutely love this place.

Came here for the second time after a few years, and it was almost as good as I remembered! It wasn't quite as spicy as I remembered (which is a good thing, also perhaps because I got a Thai iced tea this time to help with the spice). The spare ribs we got were amazing. The meat was tender, the broth was flavorful with just the right amount of spiciness and it was delicious to eat over rice. The squid with shrimp and egg yolk was also good, but I thought they overdid it with the fish sauce and it was a little bit on the salty side. The flavors were great, but I thought needed to be toned down a notch. The egg omelette was also good. The spicy sauce that it came with was delicious, a perfect mixture of spicy and tangy. The egg I thought was just a little bit over fried (edges were brown and just a little bit too crispy). Overall, our experience the second time around didn't quite live up to par as the first (although everything was still delicious). I think the ordering system they have where you have to order a few days ahead of time makes it hard because you might not be in the mood for what you ordered a few days ago, and they don't let you make adjustments to your order. I would still come back for the spare ribs!

Most of the dishes we ordered were very tasty, although we were recommended a dish by the male waiter that was really quite horrible. It was a veggie and sausage dish. The sausage was sour and tough. We got an additional 5 plates that were all very very delicious. Perfect spice level. The waiter was very sassy and somewhat pretentious trying to recommend what spice level we should get. Not welcoming by any means. They must have named the restaurant after him.

The food is good if you like something super hot and spicy, but the service was rude. We had to wait outside for the food and not inside. We were rushed out and told to wait outside for our to go order. We are not for sure if it was because we were black or in costume for leaving a convention??  We would not come again, it was not worth our money. This is sad since we love Thai. If you are looking to clear your sinuses this is the place to go, especially if you want your butt hole on fire later.

My favorite Thai place in NYC! I ordered the Khoong Muk Kai Kem, Laab Ped Udon, Khao Soi Nuer, Kang Hoh, and the Kang Prik. My favorite is their spiciest dish on the menu - the Laab Ped Udon (duck salad). All of their food is very spicy so proceed with caution! They do give you cucumbers to help neutralize the spice so definitely take one when you need it.

If you love extremely spicy food this is heaven. If not, you will be in lots of pain.

I was really excited to try Ugly Baby. Driving in from Queens, the plan was to get takeout and eat in the car. I think the rating would have been higher if we had eaten at the restaurant. We ordered the khao soi. The broth came in a soup cup, the noodles in a paper box and the veggies, sauce, crisps, lime, etc. in another paper box. It was really hard to assemble in the small cup they gave. The broth was delicious, but it was really spicy. The crisps managed to stay crunchy and feel light and not greasy, which was definitely a plus. The beef was super tender. Each individual component was pretty phenomenal. I just wish I was able to mix it the way it was meant to, in a proper bowl. I'd definitely want to try some other dishes from here and also try this dish again when I'm back to in-person dining.
YESSSS.... love this place so good! Definitely a good spice level. Although  its spicy the you taste all the traditional Thai flavors! Its absolutely  yum.

I'd give it 3 stars. It was okay overall and a bit overpriced. For the price and high difficulty of booking a reservation, I wasn't really wowed. The Kang Hoh was amazing (5 stars). The Kao Tod was okay (3.5 stars). The Pla Tod Kamin was bad, poorly fried, and dry (2 stars).

I debuted this place w three of my friends tonight. Expectations were high. Plenty high.  Waiter's spiel about spice levels and balancing dishes out was unintelligible.  Sad as he was our Sherpa. Highlight was this squid shrimp dish. Unassailable and worth coming back for just that. All the other orders were just okay and they actually left this white guy wanting for less regional authentic in favor of just some dope pad Thai. Durian sticky rice was nice ending. Beers and wine were oddly expensive almost felt like typos. Ugly baby try harder.

Very small restaurant but delicious if you can handle spice.

I could not love Ugly Baby any more. Bringing those , funky flavors every damn time. Ugly Baby is no casual experience! Their menu is limited and curated. They have dishes ranging from "not spicy" to "very spicy" and it took a few times through for our waiter to explain this to us. We ended up getting two dishes, one "mild" and one "moderate" spicy. Both dishes were good but not for anyone sensitive to spice - we felt the effects of the spice through to the next day! This place seems a tadddd bit overrated. It's pretty cramped inside, but seems like a good place to eat alone if you sit at the bar. The waitstaff tried, but their explanation of the menu was confusing at best. We're still not quite sure what we ordered. Anyway, at the end of the day we would go back just because it was a fu experience! The artwork is cool too.

I really like this place but some of the food items are out of my spicy tolerance range. The servers are nice and warm you if you ask them about the spicy range. I really enjoyed the food that we go, especially their curry dishes even though it was super spicy. They have a few items (one of them a fish) that is not spicy and the way they make it, it's really crispy and flavorful. I would definitely recommend at least trying the place out. They also have really good Thai iced tea and I always enjoy getting and it helps can your tongue's pain from the spice. All in all, I enjoy bringing new friends to this restaurant to try at least once.

I will be dreaming about this meal until the next time I get to have it. The staff is super helpful, and made sure to warn my table when they thought we had too many spicy dishes in our order (they were right!) Don't miss the tue ka ko (unique and surprising coconut milk cakes), Kan Kua supparod (mushroom pineapple curry- as long as you like spicy), and my #1 stand out: khoong muk kai kem (shrimp and squid dish).

Ugly baby is one of a kind. They pride themselves on serving authentic Thai food not your usual pad thai or drunken noodles. The waiters are very patient and will walk through the menu with you. They give their advice on which dishes to get and what to pair with what. They also inform you the spice level of all their dishes. I had the Khao Soi Nuer and the shrimp curry (I don't remember the thai name). The Khao Soi is beef shank with egg noodles delicious but SPICY, and just in case it's not spicy enough for you they give you some spicy paste for an extra kick. The noodles were stretchy and soft. The shrimp curry was my favourite. It was mildly spicy but it was the sauce of the curry that I enjoyed. It tasted like there was a hint of coconut milk and maybe basil. Paired well with the rice. Excellent overall.The decor itself is quirky and fun with lots of colors and colorful menus as well. I would come back to try more dishes!

First time here over the summer! I had heard through my Asian friends about how spicy the food is -- this Baby definitely did not disappoint! Really appreciated that the menu was not the typically Americanized version of Thai food.

What a find! They have an expansive menu of deliciousness. We were so overwhelmed by the menu that we just decided to put ourselves in the hands of our server. He ordered for the entire table. The staff will recommend things that are less spicy if needed. There's a large beer and cider selection to cool you down. Food was so incredibly spicy that we could not eat it, and this comes from a person who grew up eating spicy food in Mexico. We were willing to order something else from the menu but the waiter never come back to check on us. In short, be careful with the levels of spice they handle as "mild, medium, and hot" is very subjective and get ready to hunt your waiter down.

Food is authentic and spicy as expected. There isn't a lot options on the menu, but every dish is a hit! Food here are mostly spicy and only 2 dishes are not spicy in this menu (they do change the menu quite often though). The staffs are very friendly and helpful in explaining to us each dishes. I would highly recommend the restaurant to mark the spicy level on their menu in the future though!

I just ate the spiciest meal and survived the heat . The khao soi was 10/10 spicy on an authentic Thai scale.  Though it was on the spicier side, it was super flavorful.  After a few bites, I lost feeling in my tongue.  The squid with shrimp and salted egg yolk was one of my favorites, although my tongue was burning after a few nibbles.  The fried tumeric seabream was crispy and delightfully not a fiery mess.  The teeth were a bit scary though!  Don't forget to order some Thai milk tea to cool down your tongue!

Went a few months back and haven't stopped craving everything we had. My friends and I went on Friday afternoon and it was quite hectic but the host made sure to grab us when they were ready and the service was pretty quick for how packed they were. The food was absolutely nuts and spicy in the best way possible. Stop by when it opens back up!
The food at #uglybaby in #gowanus was fantastic; everything was fresh and beautiful prepared but beware of the spiciness of some of the dishes!!

Excellent cozy place with delicious Thai food.  The playlist and the friendly staff made the restaurant an absolute joy.  The pork belly dish was so rich in flavor that for a moment I felt I was back in Chiang Mai.  !

This was a great restaurant and the service was the best. Our waiter was super friendly and was there to answer any questions. Overall, the staff pays a lot of attention to details. The table where we were sitting seemed to be unbalanced and without us asking they immediately came to fix it. The food itself was also delicious. I ordered the fried sea bream. It was great but I expected more flavor on the fish coming from a Thai restaurant. Also, it was overpriced. It was the whole fish for $28. My husband ordered the Tum Kanoon and the flavor was amazing as well. It was the very spicy and tasty. To finish off we ordered the Kung Kua which was a curry with coconut, pineapple, and mushroom. It was a great way to end dinner with a sweet touch that felt almost like a desert. I would love to come back to this restaurant to try something else!

Our dinner was full of flavor at ugly baby but the spice factor is NO JOKE. When they say 10/10 spice they are not kidding. The Khao Soi Nuer was by far my favorite- so creamy and spicy!

I really enjoyed this restaurant. My husband and I love South East Asia - the people, the food and the sight. We are always looking for a way that takes us back to our travels.  Ugly Baby does that for us! The freshness of ingredients, uniqueness of the dishes (stingray tastes like crab meat! Who knew?) and the authentic flavor profile (the spicy level is incredible but spicy is flavorful spicy - if that makes sense! Not mouth burning lack of taste).  We ordered the coconut muffins with beans, stingray, curry beef soup noodles and the braised beef.  They were all amazing - will post pictures of this food adventure!

I wanted to love this place. The spices are authentic and delicious but the meat and fish were so dry they were tough. The service was good and I appreciated the server's advice re heat levels for a mixed tolerance crowd. Would give 3.5 if I could. 4.5 if the meat hadn't been overcooked.

Ugly baby is so damn delicious! Never thought you'd hear that sentence, but this authentic flavorful Thai experience in Brooklyn is as fun as it is yum! The pork shoulder curry in vermicelli is so hearty and tasty (left); seafood stir fry has a nice savory kick at the end (top right) and the taro cakes are fluffy like home style biscuits (bottom right). Beware, it is spicy and leftover microwave friendly!
Fantastically authentic Thai in my 'hood! I love you Ugly Baby! The service is amazing and the food is fresh and fragrant and so beautiful I would go back anytime!
Really yummy Thai place, the food is different from the other Thai places.  Everything was super flavorful, and spicy which I loved.  Would def come back again!  T

What an ugly baby you have, says me pretty much every time I meet a baby. So I was a bit confused when getting here as there's no ugly baby. Space is a bit tight and people had to slide tables around for people to get in the bench area. They have beer now, and are all kinda crafty. Food is spicy, and that's the first thing they warn you about. Order whatever because it's gonna be delicious. Only complaint is extra rice is $, and it's a smallish bowl.

Yeah don't come here if you can't tolerate spice. These dishes were "medium spicy" or the least spicy items so we got them for my sisters sake but she basically ended up eating plain jasmine rice the whole meal instead hahah. My brother and I thought it was delicious, we have a moderate spice tolerance but still low key sweat so maybe don't bring a first date here unless you're into that kinda thing... The shrimp and squid dish (Khoong Muk Kai Kem) was my favorite the shrimp were huge and whole so be careful and the spice level was just spicy enough. I know the beef shank is the most popular but I didn't like it that much. The beef was flavorful tho. My sister liked the pineapple mushroom dish it was very sweet but still had a kick.

Tried this place a couple of days ago! Although most of the things we got here were spicy, they were packed full of flavor. The vegetables we got with some of the dishes really helped to balance the spicy and of course the Thai iced tea helped as well. Rarely do you have a restaurant that has a lot of spice but still maintains the flavor. This place really did it justice. If you enjoy spicy, I definitely recommend this place! My favorites have to be between the Kao Tod Nam Klook and the Khoong Muk Kai Kem.

Ugly Baby is authentic Thai food not your average "American-ized Thai". Their menu is unique in the sense that the dishes they offer were not "typical" but they were interesting and unique. The waiter helped us decide what to get after we let him know what sounded interesting to us. There was no rating scale on hotness but certain dishes he referred to as an "18 out of 10" so we steered away from those. We like spice , and got the pork shoulder, which was definitely very spicy but not unbearable and we enjoyed it. The red snapper which the waiter said was more authentic - something his mom and grandma make- was good and less spicy - but very "fishy" in hindsight I may have chosen differently but it was still good. The space itself is very cool looking - bright beautiful colors painted on the walls that coordinate with their brightly colored paper menus. Their beer list is amazing. Expect to wait at least a half hour to be seated - but there's s cute wine bar / coffee shop next door.

If you appreciate "Thai Spicy" then do this spot right away. Avoid the long waits and come on a week day.  Food is SO GOOD (as in as good as it was in Thailand good) and they are offering a variety of dishes you cannot find elsewhere. Service was also great. I will totally be back.

We went late in the evening and had an hour and half wait. The restaurant itself is small. The food was spicy even for us (we like spice). I would say it's not for the faint of heart. Recommend the red snapper and prawns. If you really want spicy try the duck salad, be warned it's really spicy. For beverage the restaurant only serves beers and wine.

Doing some advance scouting for a future group dinner, I dined solo to check this place out. I am restraining my excitement, because I only tried two of the dishes, but if they are any indication of rest of the menu, I would rank this restaurant as equal or better than any Thai places in NYC. Flavors were robust, well balanced and addictive. Besides serving delicious food, their menu is filled with dishes not commonly found on Thai menus around the 5 boroughs. The Kao Tod Nam Klook, a curried rice dish, was so good, I'm still savoring the pleasure of eating it, a day later. Can't wait to go back and try every item on the menu.

This is my favorite Thai restaurant, period. Have been here countless times in the last year, more than any other restaurant in my "regular" repertoire. This is the restaurant I bring out-of-towners to in order to show off why I love this city so much. I cannot overstate how special this is among NYC Thai places. The menu is quite off the beaten path compared with top-rated Thai restaurants in Manhattan (Wayla, Uncle Boons, Up Thai) or Elmhurst (Ayada, Lamoon, etc.). Although the menu changes modestly often, the staff is friendly and happy to help you balance the flavors of your meal. Before Ugly Baby, I didn't know anything about the G or F train, but now I'm grateful for MTA's sprawling coverage.

We dared how spicy they could go... they went there.  Started with tue ka ko -- yummy mini fried coconut cakes.  Next up spicy noodles made vegetarian -- so spicy, so good.  It's BYOB, so come prepared.

There is a great craft beer selection and the rice pudding desert with durian tastes like nothing I've had before. Flavors dance around and the servers are friendly and helpful. Great combination of textures and flavors, but be ware: super spicy food! Almost every item on the menu is spicy, so before ordering you may want to ask the waiter what dishes match your spiceness tolerance. Once you do that, I'm sure it will be an awesome experience!

I had a fun date experience here on New Year's Day, after checking out the newly-opened Nitehawk Theater in Park Slope.  Unfortunately I waited too long to write this and totally forgot what we ordered, but we split three menu items and each got a beer, which I 100% recommend to help cool your mouth down! All the food was delicious, but yes, very spicy! The space was painted vibrantly and had a lively, convivial atmosphere. No "typical" thai takeout style items here. Great experience!

This is below average food. In all seriousness, it's the ambiance and the hype! Food is really really hot and that's ok, but you won't taste anything underneath all that, it's just low quality food, mostly fried and with lots of sugar.. Went there twice, once to check it out and 2nd time because someone really really wanted to go, because it's trendy.. Both times had stomachache and cramps and well into the next day and so did my companion.. Its all hype, like everything else these days, especially brand Brooklyn, it's ridiculous!

This food was so good. If you like spicy food this is the place to go. Be aware- here will be a wait! We came at 5:30 on a Sunday and still had to wait more than 30 minutes. The service leaves something to be desired but the amazingly delicious food more than makes up for it!

It's good to not fear the heat. Accepting spicy food transcends your body another level - just have tissues and cold water nearby. You'll be fine. I call this stuff happy food. If you're afraid of flavor, don't come here. You're lame. This place is totally awesome. Running back for more.

Let me start with the good thing: the food was great and the service was standard. BUT the music was unbelievably loud, poor choice of soundtrack, and when I asked to turn it down a little the chef refused! Health issues due to loud environments is more than proven, why do we need to shout across the tables! I couldn't here my friend! Ridiculous and sad.

One of the best restaurants I've ever been to. So much flavor, and a lot of heat. I love very hot food so it was perfect for me. The crispy fish was a great non-spicy option as well, and I recommend getting alongside the shrimp and squid chili dish, which is OUTSTANDING. The spicy noodles with the beef shank was delicious, and I suggest squeezing some lime on top of it as well. The big intestines are a great appetizer. All in all this restaurant is an incredible experience and truly a culinary adventure! Be sure to order plenty of rice to go with this food.
One of my favorite restaurants in the city. So spicy, so delectable. Get the salted egg yolk w shrimp and squid. Or actually, don't even go because I don't want to have to wait longer for a table.

Lots of fun and definitely a place I will go back to and try other things. As mentioned everything is spicy. I didn't try the spicy dishes but we tried the milder stuff and it lit us up. Ask for extra cucumber!
I really enjoyed the food here. It is imaginative, spicy and filling. Great drink selection too. I will be back next time I am in NYC.
No comment

this whole eating experience was a dream. the staff are wonderful and the food spiritually moved me and my taste buds. we tried a few items on the menu with a side of sour beer and wine. very authentic Thai cuisine with incredible flavors.

This is as good as the reviews promise you. cute decor, amazing and authentic Food, you will not find pad Thai here. They warn you of the spiciness with a scale of 1-10 for the dishes but in all honesty if you're Asian and have familiarized your taste buds with mala Xiang Guo etc it won't be as spicy as they warn you. That doesn't take away from the deliciousness though, the squid and shrimp dish was an assault on your tastebuds at first bite, salty,sweet and slightly spicy it's one of those dishes that can make you finish a bowl of rice. Personally it got a bit too salty for me so it's a good dish to share. My fav was the pineapple mushroom curry, it has layers of flavor, the end note is a sweet pineapple ginger taste that works great with the mushrooms. I loved this dish. Their award winning Khao Soi looked pretty enough, smelled amazing too. Drizzle with fresh lime and mix it all up together and there's a party in your mouth. Service was very friendly and it seems family run, loved the cute animal cacti on the tables and the walls are splashed with reds and other bright colors , an assault on your eyes if you will, as their food will assault your other senses.
No comment

This was really solid authentic Thai food. I don't understand the fuss, it was crazy packed, cramped, and super bright. They were sold out of half of their beers, and the wines weren't that exciting.  Really a missed opportunity here. Excellent friendly service, but there's tons of other Thai places serving similar food. I'll return in 6 months after nyc has moved on to the next hottest thing and has long forgotten about this solid neighborhood spot.

The best place ever for authentic Thai food. This is not your average Thai restaurant. This food is prepared by a Master chef and his crew. The staff is unbelievably friendly and give you plenty of attention. They are a great team and it shows in the service. There are some really spicy menu items but if you're up for it they are truly delicious. 5 stars all the way.

I had a very enjoyable experience here. The staff helped me in choosing my order - the ribs and the curried fried rice with salad. The dishes are quite spicy/chili hot but I was forewarned - the other flavors of the dishes come through and the chili heat complements them. The menu is non-veg heavy and I look forward to trying the other dishes in the future.
No comment

WHOA! So...we've all been in that moment where your really basic friend wants to eat something "exotic" and says " I know! Let's get Thai food!" and you try your hardest not to roll your eyes? Why is that? Well...I'm glad you asked.  It's because, let's be honest:  Most Thai restaurants are good but not all that different from each other.  The same old Pad Thai next to that boring Green Curry.  If you're lucky, the basic friend you're with might be willing to venture over to Pad See Ew or a Massaman Curry.  The point is:  UGLY BABY IS NOT FOR BASIC PALETTES. I walked in here on a Friday night, waited for an hour (they don't take reservations) and it was so worth it.  Sting Ray curry, coconut milk cakes with black bean and taro,  and Hung Le with braised pork are just a few examples of the type of exciting dishes you will get here.  The food took my breath away, the service was great, and this little Chicago boy slept in the cab all the way back over to my hotel afterwards #foodcoma.  :)

Went at 6pm on a Saturday and the wait was 90 minutes, exactly what the hostess quoted us. After eating the food I'd wait twice that. Be sure to get the curried rice with pork skin. Next time will try the snapper.

Thai food with a twist. The menu is different from what you find at most Thai restaurants and that was a welcome change. I wish they had more vegan options. I liked the mushroom pineapple curry. The entree that everyone liked most was the spicy prawn with peanut sauce.
Very authentic Thai food. The food can be spicy so unless you can handle major spice, stick to mild

First off the service was great and the staff was very attentive. I am a thai food lover, but this place was not for me. EVERYTHING  we ordered was so spicy you could barely taste the food. We ordered quite a few items as well. I guess maybe it was authentic Thai, I'm not sure, but I didn't enjoy it for this reason. Was the first time I've ever been to a Thai restaurant in NYC and had this experience, been to many. If super spicy is you thing though, then this is your joint.
No comment

Delicious authentic and totally unexpected for Carroll gardens ! Loved everything we got and can't wait to return. My friend I went with doesn't really love spicy so we didnt try any of the more popular dishes but I have heard great things. Can't wait to go back!

Best Thai food in the city!  Came highly recommended and finally got around to trying it out.  The spare ribs, kao soi with beef shank, and shrimp and squid dishes in order of spiciness from most to least were all really tasty.  All three of us were sweating and tearing with running noses, but couldn't stop and finished everything despite spice level.

This restaurant is a very cool flavorful adventure. expect await,  you will sweat out of your eye lids,  but the staff is amazing and they make sure your waters are full and get a Thai iced tea. Get the duck salad you have too!

The food was only OK.  We love spicy food.. so the spice and heat was not a problem.  It just isn't tasty enough. The dishes we had included - pulled pork shoulder, beef curry, mushroom and pineapple, and a couple of other.  The dishes were not bad.. but I would definitely not revisit.

Never have I ever had spicy food at this level. Boy, you have no idea. I came here on a Saturday for lunch with my boyfriend. Waited for about 20 minutes for a table to open up. Pretty small restaurant so limited seating. It has a nice tropical feel to it with its bright colorful painted walls. It was quite busy when we went, so service overall was quite slow. We ordered the khao soi nuer and Kang ho (red curry paste with shoulder pork, spare ribs, and thin noodles.) everything was pretty much sharing portions. They served us the khao soi first. I had it before in Bangkok and in the city, but never had it this spicy before. It didn't even look spicy, but the first bite literally taste like fire. The waiter said spicy, but had no idea it was going to numb my taste buds. Overall great dish, but would just ask them to turn the spice level next time. By the time the 2nd dish came out, our mouth was already too numb to taste anything. For someone who loves spicy food, this was definitely a whole new experience for me. Worth the try, but be prepared and make sure you can handle it. My boyfriend actually got quite a bad stomach ache from the spiciness. And we eat a lot of spicy food day to day.
No comment

There's a reason why this restaurant is always busy... best Thai food I've had, easy. Cozy seating, modest/artsy decor. They don't play around with the spice factor, so I highly recommend ordering Tue Ka Ko to offset the heat. Get here and be prepared to wait. Worth it.

New York's a mecca when it comes to Thai restaurants so you've gotta be pretty extraordinary to standout in this crowded field.  We had the Kang Tae Po Pla Sala (queenfish), Kang Ho (pork shoulder + glass noodles), Pla Tod Kamin (fried tumeric sea bream) and another pork dish, plus a bottle of dry riesling.  Apparently the spice levels at Ugly Baby can  reach extreme levels so although we enjoy some heat on our food we appreciated the waitress's advice and recommendations in selecting a combination of medium to less spicy dishes this time around.  We could probably have handled adding a high heat dish, in retrospect, to the mix.  All the dishes were extremely flavorful in true Thai food fashion but unfortunately we found all of the meat to be overcooked and dry.  The fried fish gets a pass because it was cooked the way it typically is but for the other dishes it was a disappointment.  I don't think I'll return because it was pretty ordinary and somewhat just fine.  We tend to try new Thai restaurants these days unless there's a reason for us to go back (like outstanding, maybe unique food, close proximity to where we are at the time).  I feel that there are definitely better in the area.

Totally get that Ugly Baby offers up something unique compared to the standard Thai food you get at many places. That being said, at what cost? Although the fried sea bream and the pineapple mushroom curry were very good, the other dishes were nothing to write home about and seemed tortured with spices and textures just to be different. And sorry, biting down on random pieces of bone fragments or cartilage in a noodle dish is unacceptable (kang hoh) as well as charging $25 for a plate of three prawns with zero flavor. Cozy spot but not worth the wait and don't get stuck in the back tables as we did where the ambiance is staring at the register and a discolored orange wall.

Phenomenal and authentic Thai food! Made my day, made my year so far. Each and every dish was well balanced, rustic and quintessentially Thai. What tops it is the passion with which the staff interact.

The food here was soooo spicy. I'm fine with spices and usually don't have to complain, but this place was simply too much. I told the waiter my tolerance level with spice and he said that the three dishes we ordered were mild spice but 2/3 were insanely spicy. It's a bummer because the food wasn't bad but we just couldn't eat it obviously due to the spice. The staff was oddly not accommodating to the situation and were pretty rude and were making us pay for the two dishes that we couldn't eat (literally took 2 bites), but ended up taking one of the two dishes off the bill after arguing. As mentioned, the food wasn't bad- just be aware!

If you're looking for delicious authentic Thai food look no further. This place has a mix of northern and southern Thai food, but you can't go wrong. The staff is also super friendly and helpful, and all of their recommendations were superb. Definitely going back!
No comment
Just the best, and everyone we've sent here says the same. We've been lucky every time we've gone and never had to wait. So happy it's in the neighborhood now.

The food is probably amazing for meat and or fish eaters but they have so few vegetarian/vegan options that you can't really have a Party or diverse foodies.. they also don't switch things up to accommodate and most things have fish sauce in them anyway so this place is an A for meat eaters and fish eaters but Vegans and Vegetarians beware that you will basically have a pineapple mushroom curry. Not very creative :(

Finally, an authentic thai restaurant in the neighborhood. Really enjoyed the fried turmeric app and khao soi, the latter being the best variation of that dish I've had. Just a five minute walk from Other Half, so perfect spot to hit after standing in line for beer.

The flavors in the dishes are awesome! My favorite is a mushroom pineapple dish and I normally steer way clear of sweet and savory dishes. My compliments to the chef!!! Really enjoyed the creativity of the dishes -- made this a far cry from a regular NY thai restaurant where there are five types of pad thai! The wait staff was also really great in providing recommendations.  Would definitely go back.  Also, always appreciate an open kitchen.
No comment

The best Thai restaurant I've been to outside of Thailand. So much flavor, so excellent. Been there four or five times. Just had the fried rice. Amazing. Firecrackers of flavor bursting in your mouth. And the staff is fun, friendly and helpful. Be warned, when they say hot, they mean it.

This is about as authentic as Thai gets! If you like spicy food then look no further! This cute little spot in Carroll Gardens is something special. We arrived around 9:30 for dinner on a Wednesday night. The space is narrow, but not claustrophobic, with bright splashes of color and murals painted on the walls and cute wooden communal tables for diners to sit at. Our waitress was knowledgeable and incredibly helpful as one of our party had a soy allergy and was wod. Not only were they helpful but they also made small adjustments to accommodate us. As for the food, the plates are low-key perfectly plated and family style. The Khao Soi Nuer (curry and noodles is a must have, as is the spicy duck, if you can handle it. It's a slow burn that eventually takes its toll but is worth it in every way. Will definitely be back!

Ab.Solutely delicious. We had dinner there tonight and the service was incredible, and the food was even better. Not your average Thai joint-- this place is gourmet in the best way. So so so flavorful and expertly cooked.

amazing thai food. i wish we could've tried more things than we did but we'll definitely be back. We tried the kao tod (crispy rice salad), laab (duck salad), and Tom Som Pla (red snapper in soup) and they were all excellent (the first two more than the soup). The khao soi also looked great on other tables but we didn't try that. The wait is long, as everyone else has mentioned, and the service was wonderful.
It's just not that good. Not great value for money. They ask everyone if they can handle spicy.
No comment
Menu needs a few chili peppers to help us out but delish food, some if it's super Thai spicy. Wait can be crazy long after 8PM but weekdays are pretty chill.
The place is exceptional...  but be careful, and listen when they tell you spicy (lots of water needed). The food, and the people made this a great meal.  I will return next time I am in Brooklyn.
I'm glad they aren't whitewashing the spice level. This is how it's done in the motherland so let's keep it that way. But wow get ready for sticker shock.

Food is really good, as well as the service, but the waitstaff was wearing Teletubby costumes, which was really bizarre. I found this to be a bit over the top, and it all also made me feel bad for them. How humiliating.
No comment

Warning!! When they say a dish is hot, they're not kidding. Very interesting dishes that are not commonly seen in other Thai restaurants. We had the Tue Ka Ko (fried coconut milk cakes) which were just the right amount of fried and sweet, mushroom pineapple curry (my friend LOVED), and the Kao Tod Nam Klook (curried fried rice) which was tasty and made me go through over 8 glasses of water. Definitely a place everyone needs to try at lest once!
Amazing place in Carroll garden! Servers are always nice. Exotic taste in every dish. Big warning if you plan to try super spicy options. Must must get the durian sticky rice as finale.
I thought PokPok was great food but this place blew PokPok out of the water for out of the way northern Thai cuisine. Definitely come early or be prepared to wait. This place fills up quick.
This place is awesome! Authentic Thai food and very tasty. If you like spicy, try the Laab  Ped Udon. The scor is pretty cool too, with abstract paintings from local Thai artists.

The seafood here is not as fresh as Asia, but in terms of taste, it is as close as it gets. Dining here reminded me of the time I spent in Asia. That to me is the highest level of cooking. The staff here was also very kind and efficient. This is the spot to go to if you're looking for some great Thai food in NY.
My favorite Thai restaurant ever! Everything is SO flavorful and spicy in a fresh, complex way! Worth a 40 min train ride from Manhattan and average 2 hours of wait all the time!

Unfortunately, the other reviewers are right. Ugly Baby makes zero accommodations for vegetarians. There is one appetizer that's vegetarian - the coconut cakes. I had them tonight and they are very sweet, more like a dessert. First they said the Mushroom Pineapple Curry was vegetarian but if you ask about fish sauce they admit it does have fish sauce and they will not make it without. I live nearby and have been curious about this place because it gets such great reviews so I wanted to give it try knowing I might not have many options. But I had to come home from dinner out and make dinner at home. It's a bummer they can't whip up one vegetarian entree. I had better luck finding great vegetarian food in Thailand.

Dont take their words lightly when they tell you that a dish is spicy. We ordered two non spicy and two spicy dishes. The pork ribs came in a red sweet sauce were a little disappointing, they were a bit dry and lack of flavor. The popular fried coconut cakes were ok. Khao Soi was good, although I can handle the spiciness, the dish was definitely spicier than I expected and my friend couldn't finish it after a few bites. I love spicy food and see myself as someone who can eat spicy, so I ordered the dry spicy beef (Kua Kling) despite the fact that the waiter gave me concerning look when I insisted on ordering after he advised me against it. After I had their Khao Soi and before this much anticipated dish arrived, I immediately knew it was going to be an interesting experience with the next dish. When our Kua Kling arrived, all I saw was strings of peppercorns, peppers and more peppers (lol).. It took me a good minute before I found the bits of beef. The dish was real Thai spicy and i didn't know that they would cut the beef into such small pieces. I later learned that this is the spiciest dish in Thailand!  Overall, I think this place serves up a few special dishes that cannot be found elsewhere in the city. I will return to try some of their other dishes in the future.

Nice and relaxed atmosphere, delicious food, and great service.  Staff were good at making recommendations, and honest about their menu items (e.g., you should probably get their "brutally spicy" dish only if you are sharing with 6 people or you are someone truly committed and able to handle extremely spicy food).  BYOB right now; looking forward to additional items being added to the menu, particularly a few more appetizers and vegetarian friendly dishes.  (True vegetarians probably will have a bit of difficulty finding something on the current menu.)

Our table had three different dishes, each very spicy with totally different delicious, complex flavors. The server did a good job guiding us through the very spicy menu. I thought that all of our "medium spicy" dishes (we hit 8 out of 10 on the server's spicy scale) were good and palatable. I can only give 4 stars because of the limited options. Although I'm sure the food is very authentic, this isn't a good place for a group with a picky eater. Do yourself a favor and have a Chang with your meal--it's the cheapest beer and did a good job relieving my taste buds from the spice!
No comment

column3: Roma Norte, Ciudad de México, Mexico
column6: I came seeking Khao Soi after spending about 10 days in northern Thailand and falling in love with the regional dish. So, you can find anything in NYC and I sure did. The Kaho Soi was only beef based, not the chicken leg I was expecting, but I was still into it. The coconuty broth, spicy ick, pickled things and fresh onions bleneded really well with the noodles. The flavor overall was pretty on par with my favorite rendition in Chaing Mai. However, two small misses here-the dish was more nooddle heavy than I was expecting. In Thailand this was more of a soup with some noodles, here it was a noodle dish with some broth. Also, I ordered and was immediately told by the staff that it was very spicy. I said I preferred the spice level to be whatever the chef thought it should be and I like spice. It was almost a small argument that I should ask for it more mild, it I refused as I love a good spice. If your eyes almost tear up and your nose just starts to run, it's the right amt of spice. Which, is exactly what is was when I ordered as prepared. Don't let them talk you into less!!

Came here for the second time today and my mouth is burning AGAIN...but, the burning is worth it. Warning you now, these dishes are spicy! There are a few non-spicy dishes on the menu and the waiters/waitresses will warn you when you order. I don't typically eat spicy (more of a mild/medium girl) but will endure the tingling and swollen lips for the delicious meals at this cute, authentic Thai restaurant. For food recommendations: the bf really likes the Khao Soi (he got this dish for the second time in a row) and I got the Shrimp and Squid w Salted Egg (delicious!). Luckily we never had to wait for a table but this place is always busy. Recommend if you want some authentic Thai food.

We had the best experience at Ugly Baby. This is by far the most authentic Thai food we have had in New York. Brings me back to my trip to Chiang Mai from two years ago. I hope business picks up and we can enjoy the delicacies like dry pork curry for years to come. Well done the celebrated chef in this neighborhood!

Great! Highly recommend the Khao Soi Nuer. Definitely spicy but not painfully so. The rice was good as well and great way to offset the spice of the former. Got the red snapper soup which was OK but probably will try other things on the menu.
No comment

Awesome hole in the wall spot. There is always a wait there. Sign your name with the host before you browse the neighborhood. Very authentic thai food. Staffs are friendly. Listen when they say their spicy food is a super spicy. Not just a sprinkle of jalapeno. Buy a milk base drink to calm down the kick lol. They have a few non spice options available.

Tucked away in a quiet block is this sleepy gem! If you can't take the heat, get out of the kitchen! This is one of reward LEGIT THAI restos in NYC! Many Thai places over the years have "American-ized" to suit the American palate. But I believe true Thai food should not have to compromise it's identity. This place focuses on food from different regions and uses curry plays and powder, peppercorns, chili's to reflect that properly. Here you won't get glorified spicy sweet pad thai, pad see ewwwww that the average American is used to. Here you get it the way true Thais eat and I loved it for THAT! The wait was 45 minutes on Friday evening at 7:45. So we took a stroll up and down Smith while waiting. We got back at 8:25 and our hostess said or table was paying and would be ready in a row. Perfecto! The tiny restaurant only seats maybe 25 people between its tables and bar seating. While we were waiting folks that walked out seemed happy and had burning mouths! Good sign!!! We were seated and ordered pretty quickly. At first we were worried that food would take forever because two large party tables just sat before us but we were pleasantly surprised. Another plus at the moment is its BYOB. We brought a bottle of bubbles and that complimented the food very well. The Laab Ped Udon (Spicy Duck Salad) was simple with its chunks of duck that were generously dry marinaded with HEAT! There wasn't a whole lot of sauce which led you to believe it wasn't too hot. The cucumbers, cabbage and string beans that it came with were great to scoop up the duck. After two bites the heat started building. The mushroom pineapple curry came just in time.for me to need to quench the fire in my mouth. When I thought the coconut milk in the mushroom pineapple curry would help calm the fire in my mouth it actually added to the fire!!! But the taste..the taste was Oh so amazing between the tofu which soaked up the sweetness of the pineapple and the actual curry sauce being just sweet enough for it to be fragrant but not too sweet!  But as the heat intensified I found table loving it more and more. The Tom Som Plaza Kra Kong (snapper) came just in time before I stuck my whole face in the mushroom pineapple curry and slurped up all that sauce! The snapper was simple but reflective of the basic flavors of ginger and tamarind. This actually helped calm the fire down a bit but it had a more subtle heat. The soup that it came with was clean and refreshing! My mouth was burning up but I still wanted more. When the Kang Ho (northern dry Hung Le and red curry paste with pork shoulder, spare ribs and ming bean noodles) came out, that was a nice finisher. That had some heat too but the sticky rice and pork rinds helped! After having all that and then going back to the spicy duck salad, and rotating all over again between the various dishes, the flavor and spices in these dishes made us almost finish everything!! Normally when I have champagne I get buzzed but with last night's spicy dishes, this was the perfect combo!!!! We def want to go back to try the other dishes soon!!! Stay true to your identity!
Spicy!  We had a great time at Ugly Baby.  Great service, friendly staff, and really adventurous spicy food :). A few dishes were not as spicy as well and it was all tasted really great!!
Hype is worth it. Incredible flavors! Make sure to take the waiters recommendations. Also the squid dish is phenomenal!!!!
Oh yeah. So good.  Spicy and tasty - extremely hot but never overpowering the amazing flavors.
Legimately the best Thai food I've ever had. The spice level is extreme, but the underlying flavors are extraordinary and balanced. The food lives up to the hype!
No comment
It's refreshing that places like this exist. Pure Thai, without conforming to westerners style Thai food.
Legit Thai food, helpful and attentive staff...an absolute gem of a place to have a unique experience.

This is the best Thai food in NYC.  If spicy and authentic is what your crave, Ugly Baby is going to deliver.  A good selection of wine and beer to compliment the food.  This is my new go-to spot in Brooklyn. Excellent, and highly recommended.

Get there before 5 if you want to wait less than an hour! My boyfriend was a HUGE fan of Chiang Mai - the last iteration of the chef here and Ugly Baby did not let us down. They turn up the dial on spice and flavor. Good portion sizes and flavorful, complex, spicy delicious food in a cool Brooklyn atmosphere with good service. Thank you for blessing our neighborhood again! The jackfruit and red snapper dishes were perfect.

I love Thai food and I loved Chiang Mai when it was open for that hot sec in Red Hook so I had to go to Ugly Baby when I read they were affiliated. The great ratings from others are accurate! The food here is so flavorful, perfectly spicy and portioned well. There was a little bit of a wait on Friday evening when we went and it was a little hard trying to get someone's attention to get on the list bc there's no host stand but once we got seated service was quick and good. We ordered the black bean muffins, the turmeric fried fish, the pork shoulder and the ground pork in peanut sauce with noodles. The fried fish was crispy and well seasoned, served with lemon to squeeze over the top. My husband's pork shoulder with glass noodles was spicy and flavorful. The pork was tender and not too fatty. I loved the ground pork and peanut sauce dish. The noodles are the perfect vehicle to the thick peanut sauce! I wasn't sure if I would like the black bean muffins (my husband's selection) but they came out hot and with a sweet and sour sauce that made them a great appetizer. We brought wine bc the restaurant doesn't have their own liquor license, others saw and made runs to the store while waiting for their seats. Highly recommend!
Thai as it gets.  So delicious and the dishes,  the flavors, the burn... Have not experienced this anywhere else.  Pok pok,  you lost me a bit tonight.
Took food to go. A little bit of a long wait but totally worth it.   Good prices as well.
I don't like to offer bad reviews but I went here because of the great reviews. Very misleading. Sorry but don't waste your time or money.  Had an MSG headache right afterwards.

Bring your friends who brag about eating raw ghost peppers. When the waitstaff tell you that a dish is very very spicy and ask if that's ok, say yes and swallow your ego when your nose starts dripping and your tongue numbs. The duck salad did me in but was still super flavorful. I appreciate the fresh herbs and cooling raw veggies to help balance the heat. This place gets busy even on weeknights but waits aren't too long.

Delicious authentic Thai food.  It's a small, modest restaurant, but the food is dynamic.  Service was good.  Reasonable cost.  Definitely recommend. Warning: when it says spicy, spiciness is next level spicy.

Intense and delicious. Noodles in a variety of flavors that even New Yorkers aren't used to. Authentic Thai cuisine amidst bright colored walls reminiscent  of Jackson Pollack. Not a typical  Thai restaurant and we will be back!

Yum yum yum!  This is the best Thai meal so far in the USA! It made me want to go to Thailand a lot sooner than March!  We only had two people today for lunch so couldn't try as much as we wanted to but will def go back again to try more dishes!  So full!

Spice and taste galore with flavors that exceed beyond your average Thai palette, Ugly Baby is hands down the absolute best Thai food I've had in the US. BYOB without the corking fee, the service is warm and friendly and the darting smiles in the kitchen as they prepare your delicious meal is infectious. Go there tonight and go back often.
No comment
Ugly Baby's Thai food is spectacular. The duck salad is incredibly spicy but delicious. Even if you have a high spice tolerance be careful. They have very long waits so get there early.
Incredible food. Authentic and very friendly. If you are lucky enough to be there when the durian sticky rice is offered - get it!!

Authentic, aromatic food, not the watered down garden variety dishes typically served up in neighborhood Thai joints. The curried rice with the pork skin, peanuts and ginger was sumptuous, as was the shrimp, squid and salted egg yoke. We also enjoyed the fried turmeric sea bream, the fried little coconut milk cakes and the spicy chicken green curry. Be forewarned that the dishes are spicy, but that's half the fun. The service is warm and friendly. Looking forward to trying other dishes next time!

I came here twice , love all the foods here especially Larb Ped Udon very tasty and delicious!!! Also Tom som fish is really good. Foods are use a lot of herbs and very fresh. Love everything about foods here and it's a new hip Thai restaurant:))

Way too spicy and wasnt worth the wait. I love thai food and am a lover of spicy food but not burn my mouth and cant taste anything food. I was just barely able to eat some of the most mild curry they have and my girl friend who doesnt enjoy spicy left hungry although we informed our waitress prior to ordering and asked for the least spicy dishes for her. I would say by authentic they mean you wont recognize anything on the menu which would be great if it could be made to order for your level. Unfortunately my experience did not live up to expectations set by the reviews here. The food is interesting but inedible, the wait was long, the door person not hospitable, the menu was not understandable. Anyway, the biggest disappointment and the thing meriting this 1 star is the $70 thrown away for food we could not enjoy. If you can never find food that is too spicy only then should you come here and join the 5star club.
Really awesome and tasty, spicy food. 5 stars for that. But it so loud and the tables crammed so close together that it's difficult to have a conversation. 3 stars for ambiance.
No comment
No comment
Great new spot. Loved the dry beef - super spicy, but great flavor. My companions loved the coconut cakes. Overall a great spot - little out of the way, but worth a trip.

My experience at Ugly Baby was nothing short of spiritual. My buddies and I split the Laab (spicy duck salad), spicy green curry chicken with vermicelli, and the sour and spicy yellow curry with sea bass (3 of the 4 spiciest dishes on the menu). It was the spiciest meal I've ever had and it was probably the best meal I've ever had. At one point I think I blacked out from the pain and overwhelming spice in my mouth, but I could not stop eating. After a couple minutes of continued eating, I came to peace with the pain, I accepted my new reality, and I felt myself transcend to a higher plane. Upon coming to peace with the spiciness, I unlocked all of the flavors hidden deep beneath the spice. I could suddenly taste all of the depth and complexity in these dishes. In my state of heightened perception and understanding, the green curry was so rich and complex it was unlike anything I had ever tasted. I emerged from this meal a new man.
This place is outstanding! Food is absolutely awesome! It's super busy and fast and loud. If that's not ur thing try to go on off hours. Cause the food can not be missed.
The food is delicious, the lighting is bad, the service is great, the wait is long, the prices are right.

The best food of this kind that I've had outside of Southeast Asia. Everything was delicious. As a side note, they do not modify spice level for dishes. Some of them were quite hot but not to the point of masking flavors.
The restaurant just opened in carroll. I ordered The lab ped udon (Duck salad) is very real thai taste and Great service.

Best Thai food ever had in NYC. Had a great experience last night. So good I have to write my first ever yelp review. Food is so flavorful, alive, layered, unique -- yeah it's spicy but so? That's the point. Menu doesn't compromise. I've never been to Thailand, but for the first time in NYC, after years of eating Thai food, I feel like I have. Great service too. Worth the wait!!
This is REAL Thai food!!! Mostly spicy dishes packed with layers of flavor. Great staff and service. Hands down the best Thai food I've ever had.
No comment

The food here is very tasty but I'm not sure I'll be returning because of how spicy it is. I am Korean-American, which means my spice tolerance is generally higher than that of white people, but this is pretty next level. It's spicier than Som Tum Der and definitely spicer than Uncle Boon's. I mean, have you ever had curry noodle soup that puts your tongue on fire in the first spoonful? I was sitting next to a table of South Asian people who were just picking at their pork shoulder, which our server warned us was "10/10" spicy (we didn't order it). That should give you an idea of how spicy we're talking. We all left with holes in our stomachs. The beef noodle soup was practically inedible, to be honest. That said, I loved the shrimp and squid with salted egg yolk, which was also very spicy, but bearably so, and our non-spicy fried fish was very good. Uncle Boon's is still my favorite Thai place in the city.
Excellent, flavorful food. Fantastic amount of spice. Attentive, friendly service. Favorite Thai restaurant in the city.

The Khao Soi and turmeric fish were the clear winners of the night. The Khao Soi was VERY spicy, but in the best way. I've been here about 3 or 4 times and the food is consistently great. Highly recommend!
Food was amazing, especially the whole fish! Warning - a lot of it was very spicy and there's always a wait but definitely worth waiting for!!

A menu you would think there would be something familiar but literally there's nothing you've ever seen before and that is a good thing that being said you need to rely on the waitstaff to help you out ? Not at this slightly full of itself bare  bones hipster hole in the wall. Our waiters only explanation of the menu was spicy more spicy a little less spicy very spicy very very spicy not to spicy when pushed with direct questions he rolled out the spicy very spicy very spice not to spicy really spicy chatter again. So frustrated with the lack of any direction we ordered and yes our little waiter from a far corner of I'm sure a very lovely and exotic country was correct..........f'ing spicy !!!!!!!! Have no idea what I was eating just    and I love heat but not to the point what I'm eating is unidentifiable. Please hipsters stop look around and say do I need a fire extinguisher with my meal ? Go to a Thai restaurant that you understand the message & menu.
Authentic thai food, like no other, and low key location for a peaceful dinner date! Nothing else like it and true to the thai culture!
We need an Ugly Baby cookbook - outstanding food and really lovely service - drove 2 hours each way to eat there and would do it again in a heartbeat

I have been meaning to try this place for a long time, and have been turned away several times. Finally made it in today, and what a disappointment! The food was unusual but not that good after all. Plus extremely uncomfortable seating and layout - hole in the wall ambiance for quite non-hole-in-a wall pricing. Meh.

I went to this place after reading the interesting write-ups.  I was very disappointed in much of it.  I love exotic food, the more different usually the more I love it.  I wanted to order two things, grilled pork tongue and this pork belly dish that they are known for.  The young waitress told me right from the get-go not to order the pork tongue because it takes 15 minutes, she would not order it for me.  My question is why is it on the menu?  I ordered another dish which was some kind of grilled intestines.  Then she literally fought with me and insisted I would not like the pork belly because it would be too hot for me.  I have no idea why she would think this?  My guess is she is a bigoted millennial who thinks people with gray hair cannot hack hot food.  I became very angry and insisted that is the dish I came there for and wanted to order it.  She never came to my table again after this very bad encounter.  I like hot food but not when it is the only flavor, I want to be aware that I am eating fish, foul meat or vegetable.  Hot for the sake of only hot to me is not quality prepared food.  The pork tongue was okay but really just hot and the pork belly was hot and very greasy to the point it made me nauseous.  I think it would have been helped if there were some absorbant vegetables or noodles in the dish to cut the grease.  So all and all to me this place is just a novelty to prove that hot dishes can be made in all forms.  I have had plenty of Thai food both bad and very good and this place is not up there on my list because the service was horrible and the food was nothing to write home about.  For the small portions of food that kind of all taste the same (hot), in a divey type of atmosphere with terrible discriminatory service and a long subway ride from Manhattan it still cost me over $40 which is ridiculous.  I have no craving to return.

Overpriced overpriced overpriced..most expensive Thai food I have ever had and that's saying alot. The dishes are very flavorful and spicy which is great but you have to search for the protein ..not a good feeling for $18. The location is bright and open. The service is friendly.

I used to work at a Thai owned company, and we'd have regular meals as a company, so I have some sense of what authentic Thai food tastes like. You'll find that here. The prices aren't cheap, but the food is  delicious!!  Since the food here is authentic, some of it is spicy as hell, so be warned. The waiters do an excellent job of explaining and steering on this. It would be nice if the menu itself was a little bit more specific on the degree of spice in each dish, though.  Pro tip: sticky rice is an excellent antedote for the burn.
Absolutely one of the best restaurants I ever went to.  The food is amazing and extremely tasty.  I always recommend this place to friends.

Very rarely do you get to go to a place that lives up to the hype. Well, Ugly Baby, which I had very high hopes for, actually exceeded my expectations. The restaurant itself looks like an abandoned rectangular space with a kitchen installed in the back. Only about 12 tables, you'll most likely have to wait when you come here. But trust me, it is most definitely worth it. The Tue Ka Ko (which are basically coconut cakes) are sweet and a have a tiny kick to them, great way to start your meal. Get the Kao Tod Nam Klook (fried rice with pork, peanuts and ginger) as an appetizer for everyone to share. This dish definitely has a little kick, but luckily, all the waiters are on top of their game with water, knowing your mouth is bound to burn at some point. We then had the Mee Kati Isan (Noodles with Curry sauce). This has to be the mildest dish on the menu. It still has a little kick, but nothing compared to everything else. We finished with the Khao Soi Nuer (curry noodle soup). This dish was excellent. Yes, I was breathing flames while eating it, but if you eat it at a reasonable pace (not an animal like me) you realize the spice makes it so tasty, and is not there to try to intentionally burn your mouth off. Saw a bunch of people order the pork leg, which looked incredible. Will be going back not only to order that pork leg, but to try other dishes. Easily the best new restaurant in NYC, but definitely not for the faint of heart.

Had family dinner here last month. Thankfully, we were able to find a table for 6 people. Place isn't that big but the food is very homey. Tried the Kah Moo Palo, Pla Tod Kamin, Kanom Jean Kiew Warn Gai, and Pad Tua Ngok Rau Kao. The fish and pork leg was really good. The place was byob but there's soda and thai ice tea which is nice. Be careful with the spicy food though if you have a low tolerance.
Tasty and very different from typical Thai food in America.  But very, very spicy, to the point of a stomach ache for the next next day, so be prepared.

4 words: listen to your server!!!!! Especially when it comes to heat level. This is THAI hot not American hot. Absolutely delicious food, super unique options & many amazing classics elevates. Thenduck salad heat is NO JOKE. I douse my food with hot sauce and this was FIRE. Amazing prawns, taro cakes among other things. But fireeee spice.

Tough to get the Thai iced tea if you don't arrive early enough. Definitely order it, it's delicious. The chicken skewers are are great and my favorite entree is the fried fish which is perfectly fried without being dry. I would avoid the kua Kling, it's all spice and not much flavor. Opt for the duck salad instead. Super spicy but tons of flavor
So authentic and so spicy. Felt like I was back in Thailand.

The food here is not just HOT, it's hell spawn! I told the waitress I liked "spicy but not too spicy" and I wanted to try the duck salad based on glowing yelp reviews. I'm so glad she deterred me away from the duck salad because the least spicy dish was on fire! Even though it was a flavorful spicy and I wanted to finish the dish, I seriously couldn't do it. (Good portions btw, which was like a catch 22). Anyway, I will most definitely come again as the staff was so friendly and accommodating and I'm determined to get my taste buds used to the heat - the foos is so good. And it's byob!
Off the charts. Phenomenal food and great service. Worth the trip. Be careful though that it's very very spicy.

Everything I ate here was perfection and thank goodness because I have been having some mediocre meals lately. The place is low key (despite the crazy paint job) yet stylish. They keep it simple, but not dingy, and focus on the food. It's very spicy and amazing quality. I went with a number of friends and ate about half the menu. Nothing disappointed. The only thing I wouldn't reorder is the duck. Too spicy for me, which is relatively hard to accomplish. It was fun to try a little as a group, but it makes it harder to taste the other amazing things, like the snapper. Oh, how I dream of you. The only thing that was strange, and maybe I was just unlucky or reading into something, but all of the people dined with were white. I am not. It seemed they were better served. The server would fill up their waters and leave mine empty. They would ask everyone if things were well, but never me. I had to flag them down to order another dish and have my water refilled (multiple times) and it took forever despite the fact they kept coming to the table, just not to me. It was strange and as usual with these things, couldn't tell if it was because I am black or not. It was consistent throughout the dinner, so I am giving one less star. 5, for me, is reserved for perfect food as well as service. I would have preferred hands off service to being ignored. Other than that prices are incredibly reasonable for this quality food and we ate like kings.

So my initial experience when i walked in was iffy. The hostess was a bit short and seemed hesitant that we were here to stay. Not sure if this had anything to do with us being the only black couple in the location but we accepted our 30-45 min wait time. Over an hour later, we were seated. We knew they didn't take reservations but geez. Our waitress was incredibly knowledgeable and helpful in ordering and explained the differences between dishes. Our food was flavorful, spicy, and delicious. Additionally, our sever was attentive and friendly. The menu wasn't the run of the mill Thai menu and although the reception was icy, the meal was good.

Excellent food and excellent service. Favorite dishes included the coconut milk fritters; shrimp and squid in salted egg sauce (just the right amount of smoky heat); mushroom pineapple curry; and durian coconut rice for dessert. My one recommendation is that they add a few more vegetarian-friendly dishes to the menu. I can't wait to go back!

The food at this place is amazing! But take heed: even for me, a self proclaimed spicy food connoisseur- Kua Kling, the spicy beef dish is REALLY spicy, but OUTSTANDING! And the Mee Kati Isan (ground pork w vegetables over rice noodles w spicy peanut sauce) is delicious. The ambiance is quite lacking however (plain tables and chairs, bright overhead lights, and very very cold in the winter when the door opens), so not a destination for a romantic date night, but absolutely a must-go. We went on a cold late December evening, waited about 10 mins for a table (a record short wait I've since been told), had an amazing dinner and then hit the movies. So excited to hear they deliver! I've been craving the food since we left and can't wait for our next visit! I hope to work my way through the entire menu. I pray for them to open an outpost in Park Slope!
If you love authentic thai food go here. Great food choices, friendly staff and great prices.

I was here earlier with a coworker, we discovered this lovely little hole in the wall at work right here on yelp and went for it after work. I love Asian food, but I'm not too familiar with Thai so I was hoping for the best. I honestly had a great time here, the food was unforgettable and the ambiance is really cute. My spicy duck salad was definitely worth taking pictures of and posting on Instagram, and I enjoyed every bit of it. This isn't a large place so be prepared to feel squeezed in when you're eating here, it's packed. The parking situation here is also a disaster, but it's worth it, trust me.

I was here earlier with a co-worker, we discovered this lovely little hole in the wall at work right here on yelp and went for it after work. I love Asian food, but I'm not too familiar with Thai so I was hoping for the best. I honestly had a great time here, the food was unforgettable and the ambiance is really cute. My spicy duck salad was definitely worth taking pictures of and posting on Instagram, and I enjoyed every bit of it. This isn't a large locale so prepared to feel squeezed in when you're eating here and it's packed. The parking situation here is also a disaster, but it's worth it, trust me.

Finally, a fantastic Thai place in our neighborhood. We tried 3 different dishes for lunch and each one was delicious. I loved the casual service and beyond reasonable prices. It was still BYOB when we went, but we were told that they are working on obtaining their license. No more reason to treck to PokPok (although we still love you!), we've got our own Thai now in Carroll Gardens!
never had anything like it, very unique and cozy place. great for the family, fast service and not too expensive. will come again :)
food was so good, and as somebody who loves spice i ordered everything HOT and i was sweatinggggggg. literally. but great food
Delicious! Always authentic and flavorful! Really good atmosphere and friendly staff.
Really good randomly went here and the fried pork was perfect - really nice and tender, kinda like beef. Yeehaw.

My bf recommended me this place. It's not lousy simple interior setting. The food is neat. We ordered pork cutlet fat cut. Pretty solid dish. It takes more than 20 mins to get the food. Hope they can be a bit faster.
Always a great atmosphere when we come for dinner! Come for the amazing quality of meat like the pork fatback tonkatsu. Def a great find outside of the Motown madness.
This place is excellent! Your missing out if you don't want to try it. The food was on point and delicious.

Amazing ambience and vibes!!! Curry katsu is so yummy. It was just what I was craving!

Coming in with a craving for Katsu Curry, Rokko delivered with flying colors. The addictive cucumbers were exactly that - addictive. Super crunchy cucumbers with a savory and flavorful dressing. The kakuni was tender and melted in your mouth. The katsu curry came in as a big portion, bigger than I thought it would be. The katsu was wonderfully tender and the curry was gone in a flash with the rice it was served with. The service was impeccable and the atmosphere classy. 5/5 stars - highly recommended!!

I got the beef curry during lunch time and the flavor was immaculate. The chili powder was absolutely amazing and complemented the soup that came beforehand. I'm not a coleslaw person at all but I really enjoyed this one. The side dish of the pickled radish went very well with the beef curry. My friends got the duck ramen and absolutely loved the broth. Overall, this spot is definitely an experience that I would love to do again.
Great food with clean taste and love the ambience. Hard to find a restaurant this calm in NYC!
Ate the sirloin and duck breast tonight. The sirloin texture was phenomenal and the duck flavor was unbeatable. Going to come again soon and try the pork fatback next!
The 8 pork fat back was great, though it was a bit rubbery and I would've preferred them to sous vide it for a bit longer. Everything else was on point and just like how I had katsu in Tokyo.

FYI, their happy hour is 5-7pm everyday I believe and you can get $4 drinks/wines along with your order. If you crave high quality and delicious Tonkatsu, check this place out!
Ended up dropping in since there wasn't a line, and I was really craving for some curry. Ended up coming with two friends, and solid portions for really good quality food.

Curry is very unique, not as spicy as the Thai's or the Indian's. It has a very special sourness in it. The cutlet is so soft and flavorful. The fat mixed with rice equals heaven!
We love all the dishes here tonite dinner. Especially the roasted beef salad. Love the hot sake too

My friend and I came to Prime Meat Rock for a late dinner. By the time we ate, they already ran out of things I wanted like the wagyu and tenderloin. In the end, we ordered the prime meat ribeye for two and pork cutlet curry rice. All items were breaded thinly and crispy and the meats were very tender. The curry was more tomato based than compared to typical japanese curry. Overall not bad but definitely want to come back to try the wagyu!

I ordered the tenderloin and loin pork tonkatsu. The meat was cooked relatively tender (which requires some good skill I guess) and the flour coating was crispy. This goes well with the housemade tonkatsu sauce (the sauce to me was a bit on the salty side). Miso soup in the rice set was super tasty. The cabbage was free flow, I loved it! This restaurant is authentic I guess because there were a lot of Japanese customers.
The breaded deep flied pork cutlet donburi was amazing. The ambience was wonderful and staff was super nice and courteous. 10/10, would come back again

I love their Oyako donburi while my husband is obsessed with the Kurobuta pork cutlet fatback. The food has been consistently delicious since they opened. Definitely our favorite Japanese restaurant in Hell's Kitchen!
I am big Tonkatsu fan and this place is a good option if you are in the city and have a craving. Would come again.

Very disappointed! The pork was chewy and fatty and the coating wasn't crispy at all. It made it very hard to eat. Out of the small portion I couldn't eat two pieces being that one was just completely fat. I paid $30 for the lunch set, totally not worth it. I had high hopes

Prime Meat Rokko offers different types of katsu. Beef, chicken, pork, and even duck. I do think the pork was better than the cuts of wagyu and ribeye. I wasn't a fan of the way this restaurant does their katsu though. It wasn't that crispy and fell off the meat pretty easily.
Service was excellent and the food was tasty! There is too much to choose from so will definitely be back to try other things on the menu!
A+ pork, and A++ cabbage. The food was great, service was quick! the meat was juicy and not dry - foes not disappoint! Would recommend this to people who like to eat.
Pork loin was good, a little fattier than expected but paired well with the oroshi ponzu. The rice set is good to share with two people who eat light on carbs.

The menu offered a variety of options, including creative raw and cooked options. The service was top-notch and the atmosphere was intimate and cozy. Overall, I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a high-quality, unique dining experience.
This is the first time I came here. We ordered a lot of food, salad, cucumber, fried eggplant, fried chicken, and pork loin. They are delicious!! Will come back!!
