Amazing service with one of the best meals I had in NY. Hand made pasta (especially squid ink) is divine. Every dish was amazing. Parfait type dessert and Marcus' service was also unforgettable.

Ate here for dinner late on a Friday night while visiting an old friend. The restaurant was very crowded, but everyone was really friendly, so it made the crowding easier to bear. We had a 10:15 reservation and arrived around 8:30 to see if we could be seated earlier, and we were (around 9:30) - but we were in NY! We shared the lamb meatball sliders and the ricotta appetizers - both were delicious. We also both had the spicy seafood pasta which was excellent!

I heart this place.  I've had fantastic lemon ricotta pancakes for brunch, and a satisfying porchetta sandwich for dinner.  Can't wait to go back and try some more goodies!

I went here with a friend on a night I was feeling a little fancy.  I am glad I splurged because the food was excellent.  We started out with the blue crab crostini, which was AMAZING.  I was sad we had ordered it to share because I wanted it all for me.  We also had the Arugula salad which was made more interesting with figs and asiago cheese.  For entree, I had the Pappardelle with lamb bolognese, ricotta and mint.  It was delicious.  The pasta was fresh and the lamb had excellent flavor I won't soon forget.  The service was impeccable.  Overall, worth every penny.

Let me say I have been dying to eat here for a good five years. After all the hype all the recommendations, omgs, how great it is etc etc umm all I can say is No thanks.  Maybe this place is already dunzo maybe it was just a place that was only good because it was in the past a place to be seen and say you have "been there." But in the words of Miranda priestly: "why is everyone so disappointing!"  That is how I can sum up this restaurant.  Not terrible but most definitely unable to live up to its foodie god like status.  Everything was sub par from the appetizers to the gamey bland tasting lamb ragú to the cheese platter that tastes like it was fresh off kraft's assembly line. Nothing here was memorable nor worth what you paid for. Had it been a mid-level no name local neighborhood family restaurant, I would say it was good.  However for the "status" this so called "amazing" restaurant has it falls under carrabas/Olive Garden status. Generic, bland, unmemorable, and most definitely not a second try. #sorrynotsorry #byefelicia.

Omg how have I not written a review for this place? I'd give it 10 stars if I could. Hands down my favorite brunch place in the city that is actually worth the price of the items. I've tried the sheep's milk ricotta for starters and the lemon ricotta pancakes, the soft scrambled eggs with prosciutto over crostini, and the Uovo. My faves are the sheep's milk ricotta and the Uovo. Very unique and flavorful. The uovo is slightly on the saltier side because of the meat but you can eat it with some crostini to even out the taste. Very chill ambiance, nice place to catch up with old friends.

Came here on January 5th for my friends birthday. Had a fabulous steak tartare to start, and then we both ordered a pasta dish. They came out in unique colors respectively and mine (the white veal bolognese) was delicious.  The food was spectacular it just was not a big portion of food. Definitely a great decor and delicious food! Would definitely recommend for a nice night out.

We had a wedding rehearsal dinner here on April 8th. What a wonderful night!!!! Excellent food, a great atmosphere and everyone of our guests were very well taken care of. Kudos to Nasi and his very caring staff. This evening set the stage for a memorable wedding weekend.

So OVERRATED. everything was just ok. definitely not up to par with other restaurants that are 4 stars in New York City. We walked in and the wait staff told us that it would be an hour and a half wait at least. We then walked to the bar to find rude bartenders awkwardly yelling over the people eating at the bar asking us what we wanted, only to then have the rude bartender spill the drink all over me. When the rest of our party arrived, the rude waitstaff suddenly realized we could be seated right away. Wow. Next the most important part, the food. Mediocre at best. The salads were OK. The crab crostini lacked flavor and was large enough to feed a bird. The pasta and ravioli was mediocre at best. I don't understand the hype of this restaurant and hate to see others fail while this one remains on the top of lists.

Overrated and overpriced. Dishes ordered included the squash crostini (nothing special), beetroot carpaccio (fine), tagliatelle (luke warm when served and zero flavor), bass (also luke warm and very "fishy"), and the dark chocolate rice pudding (tasted lovely but horrendous presentation - the kitchen needs to reconsider how to plate this dessert or take it off the menu). Upon review of the bill, I noticed my aperitivo was a shocking $42. When I questioned the charge, our server sent a smug, condescending manager to confirm the charge was correct and perhaps I just wasn't aware of what I ordered; the mansplaining was neither appreciated nor helpful. What would have been helpful would have been a heads up from the bartender that the drink I ordered was going to cost $42 so I could have enjoyed a good laugh at the asinine pricing and ordered something else instead. This was definitely the first and last time I will be eating at this restaurant. So many other wonderful options in NYC that blow this place out of the water. Don't waste your money.

it's a sexy restaurant. you want to save it for something special, something worth celebrating.  the dining experience is wonderful, but i didn't love the menu selections.  we had a lot of small bites we shared as a table and everyone enjoyed, but i wasn't over the moon like i thought. we had dessert, but it wasn't worth having.  order an espresso or latte, maybe another cocktail.  it's still a great night out.

It just never fails.  Dining here is always a delectable experience. Started off with the blue crab crostini & sheep's milk ricotta.  Moved onto the lamb meatballs & grilled octopus special (which was DIVINE).  Dining companion had the pappardelle with ragu, while I had the duck, which has changed a bit since my last time ordering it, but nevertheless, still delicious.  I'm a huge fan of their Gothic rose.  Can't get enough of it!  It's not cheap, so if your wallet isn't feeling the sucker punch, save it for a more celebratory occasion.  Decor is lovely and the host & service staff is quite kind and accommodating.  Recommended for a good night to decompress or a special celebration!
No comment
No comment

LV offered the most interesting brunch menu, best reviews and early opening time within a short walk of our hotel. The food, service and decor thrilled. Ricotta starter was creamy and sweet enough for dessert. Frittata was made with paper-thin sliced veggies and topped with garlicky sauce. Coffee was strong enough to get old man winter moving again.

Sheeps. Milk. Ricotta or die.  Runner up: Zucchini Frittata. Best I've ever had. Fresh green/orange juice on the menu and the lemon pancakes were definitely above average, but probably more of a one time thing personally. & the French toast is just average - but great, great bread. Worth a 2nd visit definitely, specifically for the ricotta and egg dishes. LV didn't disappoint.

I don't know...I didn't love it.  I had the duck and it wasn't spectacular.  The skin was still soft, not crisp.  The seafood pasta was really good, but again, not mind-blowing.  Very good service, drinks were solid.  Maybe it was hyped up too much or I just didn't order the right things...?  I'd be willing to try it again if someone else pays!

Started off with the burrata salad and was a lovely presentation. The cheese was delicious but think out of proportion with the only few beets on the plate. Also, I found the salad a tad bit salty, which was unexpected given the typical saltiness in the cheese and beets themselves. Still, good overall. For my entree I chose the Black Sea bass which was sweeter and creamier than expected but a great cut and perfectly cooked. Notably, the accompanying vegetables - squash and zucchini - stood on their own and were just the right tenderness (no small feat). I tried the Sassafrasso house cocktail, which is rye based. Nothing offensive but nothing special either. Wanted a light red with dinner and grignolino was chilled and a great complement to my fish. They slightly chill it, which I wish more restaurants would do with light reds. The atmosphere is excellent and I was pleased to see it jumping on a Wednesday night after 9 (I realize that's more customary in NYC than in most Chicago neighborhoods). Finally, the service was strong - I sat at the bar so perhaps that's a more likely outcome but a handful of competent male servers behind the bar who knew the menu and were sufficiently but not overbearingly attentive. I'd consider going back because there was nothing wrong with the meal but a) there was nothing stand-out about the food and b) there are too many other restaurants I'd try with a $125 bill (one person, drink, salad, entree, glass of wine, dessert and espresso).
No comment

Just had a $55 lunch here today. I was so excited to try this place since I've had multiple people tell me it's great. Not my experience sadly. The special crostini was very odd. Salty apricots, hmmmm? The eggplant sandwich was a disaster. Hard, old bread and so messy and watery from the eggplant it was impossible to eat. Served on a small board so you couldn't come close to using a knife and fork. I tried and failed miserably. The waiter just frowned and shrugged when they picked up a messy full plate. I'm very sad about this one :(

Locanda Verde is such a beautiful space. 4 of us went here over the weekend for brunch. I would say their crispy waffles, ricotta cheese with honey and the sausage grinder are standout dishes. We also tried the lemon ricotta pancakes and the zucchini frittata, they were both good but nothing spectacular. The coffee and cold pressed juices are also pretty good, my favorite was tre stelle, my friends swore by the Capuccino and expresso. Overall I would say its the perfect place to hang out with friends in Tribeca.

Great cuisine! Our family of 5 ordered several dishes- the fresh ricotta, lamb meatball sliders, autumn salad, grandmothers ravioli, frutti de marre, lamb bolganese, eggplant sand which, pasta with prochutto, and a gelato dessert. Everything was delicious! If i has to be critical, the frutti was a little fishy, but we gobbled it up despite that. Would return in a heartbeat!

Large open space and laid back ambience. The ricotta spread with burnt orange toast was light and flavorful. The French toast with oranges and grapefruit was fresh and had good flavor, too. The lemon ricotta pancakes were super fluffy and light! Everything tasted really fresh and clean. Service was good.
Great food and very friendly staff. Love the location and the aesthic. Very underrated for brunch!
I come here all the time. Ricotta with honey and truffle oil appetizer is delicious! Pick any pasta dish and you won't regret) This place is appropriate for hanging out both with parents and friends.
Everything was good. Had a few items that seemed a bit over done, too fussed over, but otherwise a nice meal. I cannot even remember what I ate.

Finally got to try this place out after months of failed attempts - definitely worth it. The wait staff can range from good to terrible (don't expect a smile from the hostess) but on the whole they know their stuff. We got the ricotta (amazing), asparagus (yum) and tartar for appetizers. My friend and I both ordered the seafood spaghetti, and I have to say it was disappointing. The prawns didn't seem fresh, the pasta was overcooked and the sauce was nothing special. But everyone else loved theirs (bolognaise and special ravioli). For dessert we got the lemon tart and it was EXCELLENT. Very fun vibe there and you'll likely spot a celebrity or two. Definitely go to Smith & Mills over the road for a pre-dinner drink, very cute wine bar. I liked it enough that I'm willing to overlook the disappointing main dish, will definitely return.
No comment
The food is pretty good, but the staff is not that friendly (pretty snooty). Great drinks, though.

More trend than food.. We had unprofessional service. The food was ok. Overpriced. My wife and I wanted to share 2 pastas so we recommended to what turned eventually to 2 dishes which were almost the same.
Favorite primo is the pappardelle with bolognese ragu and solo di bruna, hands down. The fresh pasta was spot on.

Must make a reservation. Presentation, taste and quality of the food is incredible. Andrew Carmellini's dishes are just flat out fantastic!
No comment

We tried Locanda Verde on the spur of the moment last Friday night and we were able to get seated relatively quickly (50 min wait) which in NYC is not too bad. The Sheep's milk ricotta appetizer is amazing. The Sommelier was very helpful and we enjoyed the wine quite a bit.  The only downside is that we were rushed through our meal to the point that we finally had to ask them to stop taking things off of our table.  As an example our appetizer came out and less than 5 minutes later our plates were whisked away and our dinners were delivered at the same time.  We had barely sipped our wine and were on to the 2nd course.  We were not trying to sit there all night, however, it would have been nice to relax a minute and enjoy our dinners which were quite delicious but unfortunately we were done eating in less than 30 minutes and had spent over $300!

went there last night with two of my sons...food is great and place is flooded with the young 1%ers... service is very good....This being said I'm tired paying nyc prices for such small portions. with a decent appetite i could have eaten all 3 entries.  the malfadine verde, the atlantic halibut and the berkshire pork....Enough of getting not enough.

One of my favorite TriBeCa italian spots. The tagliatelle with lamb ragout is amazing and don't leave without trying the ricotta with honey...delicious. They also have a great sparkling rosé if you're in the mood for a light, crisp one. I would say, however, they can be a little snotty (even for NYC) about waiting for tables. They won't let you leave a number for a call when your table is ready, but the bar is so small there's no where to sit and wait times can reach over two hours. That's the only thing I wish they would improve upon. Otherwise, one of my favorite spots.

Went here for dinner last night - no complaints! The Sheep's Ricotta and Burrata were delicious. So was the house foccacia. The pasta was very flavorful. We are vegetarians and they were happy to make modifications to the pasta for us. None of the desserts seemed appealing to us so we skipped them. Service was great. Definitely will come back!
No comment
Great portions.. And good brunch place. They have some interesting drinks as well. Would definitely recommend for brunch!

Great decor, nice place to grab some breakfast with friends.  Serice was good, but since the tables are small, they should do a little better when it comes to busing the tables.  Our table and the one next to ours was full of plates when they brought the check and there was no offer to remove the plates.  The goat cheese and toast was the highlight and their fresh pressed juices were very nice and refreshing.
Excellent food.  Service was a little bit too brusque ... made you feel like a school child with all the rules and regulations and the way they were conveyed.  The food did make up for it though ...

Amazingly delicious with top notch service. This is my favorite restaurant in the downtown area. They always have an inventive menu, and the food is to die for. Great atmosphere for dinner with a date and/or friends.

The pappardelle for lunch was delicious! I came here for a client lunch, and the restaurant was his pick. The service was pretty good, and the steak tartare appetizer was particularly toothsome as well - perfectly seasoned, not too salty, not too sweet, and not a bad portion size at all for 2-3 people.
Lemon ricotta pancakes with blueberries on top were just about as perfect as a breakfast can get. Superb!

It's great. It's big, the service is impeccable, the meal is delicious, you will have a good meal here, gauranteed. To me, it feels a bit impersonal. The space is maybe too large. It's an obvious first date spot (maybe too obvious). I'll eat here when I'm all out of ideas, it's raining and I'm right around the corner. And I'll be perfectly happy with that.
No comment
No comment

I need to go back to Locanda Verde as soon as possible.   My lunch experience only scratched the surface.    Sheep's Milk Ricotta was amazing. (and served with toasted bread - nice touch).   Creamy, tasty, and full of flavor.   For antipasti we had the Finocchiona Salumi.  This was also really really good.   For my meal I ordered the Rigatoni with lamb bolognese, ricotta and mint.   This was awesome and I cleaned my plate.   I can't wait to go back so I can sample some more items.   Service was great and atmosphere was casual, lively, pleasant.. everything you'd expect.

Perfection. Sheep's Milk ricotta is a must at dinner. Brunch fave are the lemon ricotta psncakes. Great service, extensive wine list and nice ambience. Have been there about a dozen times and its always wonderful.

Great menu, amazing wine selection, cozy, warm room and wonderful service. Could not ask for more.

This place did not disappoint. Delicious herbed ricotta, truffled polenta, seafood soup with perfect scallops, clams, shrimp. Incredible wine and cognac + desserts of pumpkin semifreddo, coconut gelato. Great service and very attentive though struggling a bit with the volume of clientele. Won't knock em for it, however, as they went out of their way to make up for any delays.

We started with truffled honey & ricotta. It was lite and airy and fluffy. For mains we had the crostino of the day with smoked salmon, the shaved porcetta sandwich and the uova modenese. All were great. The waitress Mila was terrible. She took forever to put our order in and then made excuses. We heard her do the same to her other tables. I had to go find her at the waitress station and she was drinking coffee and talking to another waitress. The bus boy for her did all the heavy lifting. I recommend this place for brunch if Mila is not your waitress.
No comment

I have no idea how a Tribeca four-star rated store can provide such an unsatisfactory level of food. The good thing about this restaurant is the decoration. Other than that, it is surprisingly disappointing.
Wow! Locanda Verde exceeded my expectations in every way!  Everything was delicious and the service was top notch. Check it out!
Too many things I love to start writing but I could live off of their Ricotta app...

Had high hopes for this place as it came highly recommended by several friends but was let down.  The food was good, but not good enough where I would come back.  My friend's lemon ricotta pancakes were very good.  My poached eggs with sausage scramble were ok.  The garlicky potato sides were very tasty.  French toast was ok.  All in all it was just ok.  The tea selection was nice though!
No comment

YUM!!!  Must get the Burrata!!! Came here for a business lunch so that always puts me in a good mood when I'm not paying :) The decor was neat: dark and rustic with really high ceilings.  The service was friendly, not stuffy at all, and very helpful with recommendations.  The italian food was outstanding: mouthwatering focaccia to start, and all of our dishes were delicious.  Wish I lived closer and had an unlimited corporate card to enjoy Locanda Verde every day!

The food was good; just not mind-blowing! The sheep ricotta appetizer was disappointing ... I couldn't really taste the herbs. However, that little piece which had enough herbs tasted great! As a main dish, I had a monkfish with red cabbage and apples which was very good. It reminded me Central European cuisine - my favorite. It was good just not persuasive for all the buzz...maybe we should come back for brunch... We shall see.
Delicious farm to table fare every time. Great place to have a business lunch, then stroll the streets of Tribeca afterwards to walk some of it off.

This place has a good vibe! Lots of staff... attentive service. Cocktails and food were top notch. Note: Restaurant and bar have separate waitlists.
Great pastas and brunch dishes, especially the lemon ricotta pancakes.  Even my toddler was able to finish a whole pasta dish.  The atmosphere is also so lovely.

One of the best Italian meals I have ever had. I had the veal Ragu, lamb meatball sliders and ricotta. The veal Ragu pasta was absolutely incredible. So savory and delicious, and the pasta was really unique. The ricotta was incredible, and tasted fresh, and the sliders, while a little excessive at 9$ per bite, were also very good. Service was great as well.

I've been here many times, usually a four star experience, sometimes a three star, and often a five star. I typically sit at the bar where you don't need a reservation and where the service is awesome. The bartenders are great. I would give it five stars if the reservation system wasn't as painful/annoying and if the quality was a touch more consistently great.

Came here for a date, and was completely amazed by the service, food, and atmosphere. I had 5 courses and all were to perfection!

Absolutely love this place! The courses were perfectly sized and the food was delicious. I usually never finish a meal and I ate everything! It's a very romantic place also. I can't wait to go back!!

We went there last night following a recommendation- certainly not disappointed. The service was attentive without being intrusive, the food was delicious and the wine , although one of the less expensive bottles - perfect

Locanda Verde is one of my all time favorite spots to go for cocktails.  They make a delicious champagne drink with rose water--absolutely delicious.  I also love love love their sheep's milk ricotta with sea salt and herbs crostini and the blue crab with garlic cream, jalapeno and tomato compote!  For dinner, I've tried just about everything, but usually continue to get the same thing-- the fire-roasted garlic chicken (for two ;).  Andrew Carmelleni knows what he is doing! Staff is great, service is great and the library/study (while for hotel guests...unless you know particular people ;) is the most charming--super adore! I had my birthday dinner in the library one year and it was the best! It's also a great location to take a romantic stroll in the area.

We came here for brunch after a friend recommended this place, specifically for the sheep's milk ricotta dish. In a nutshell, orgasmic. We had that and the ricotta pancakes, both dishes were out of this world delicious. Service was really friendly and prompt and the atmosphere was really nice, classy yet relaxed, perfect brunching place. We didn't make any reservations and were seated quite quickly despite the place looking busy.
No comment

This is by far my favorite brunch spot in the city. I have been here numerous times considering I do not go to a single restaurant twice. I cannot speak much about their dinner but the brunch is the best. Firstly you have to try the sheep milk ricotta even if you are not a cheese person. It is creamy and just amazingly mouth watering. I usually go for the Uovo modonese which is poached eggs with meat, spinach and hollandaise sauce. Amazing again. I have tried the ricotta pancakes and they are good too. You will leave very satisfied if you decide to go here.
No comment

Squid Ink Linguini and Blue Crab made this an unforgettable experience.  the wine selection was top notch and the atmosphere was fun and friendly.  Staff was professional, friendly, and knowledgable.  I know nothing about wine and they gave me some great options.  10/10 would dine here again.

Went for brunch. Had a reservation. Once our entire group arrived, we were seated without delay or any hassle. The food was delicious, though a bit overpriced. Atmosphere was pleasant, but not the greatest scene for a brunch (obviously, the bees knees for a romantic dinner). Overall, a positive experience, but not one that eclipses other brunch favorites throughout the city (Rose Water, Jane, etc).

We tasted one thing from each part of the menu. It was all fantastic. Great wine selection. With readable prices. Service was super. We'll be back

Just the best - steak tartare, sheep's milk and love the rotating entrees. A must for any NYC who loves food.

This restaurant is despicable.  My wife made a reservation for Father's Day brunch several weeks ago to which they could not find.  They would not honor a legitimate reservation.  They ruined my Father's Day by their ineptness and lack of care.  There are too many great restaurants in New York than to bother with such a poorly run establishment.
No comment

Yes yes yes! Great food and nice service. There was no room on the table for my camera, so I asked them if they had a place for it. They stored it at there office while I was eating. Good solution. Spaghetti was genuine good pasta, and I can tell cause I lived in Rome for half a year.

A 'last week in New York' bucket list quickie - in a Celebrity-chef-casual-upscale-trattoria-housemade-pasta Death Match, Locanda Verde is easily better dressed, better looking, better served, tastier, trendier and Tribeca-eier than Osteria Morini.
Loved sitting at the bar having dinner. Bartenders were fantastic with service. Great atmosphere and menu very creative.
No comment

This restaurant fits perfectly in TriBeCa. I had the fire- roasted garlic chicken and was very pleased. Waiter was very nice and accommodating. We sat in the front area which seemed to be a little cafe during the day. Great people watching.
No comment
No comment

Without question one of the worst dining experiences of my life. It must have been an "off" night, but from the moment we walked in the door things did not go well. The hostess was rude, making no effort to greet us or even look at us as we were checking in for our reservation. Upon being seated, we noticed that something had been spilled beneath our table and when we informed the person directing us (in case it was a hazard or they had missed it) we were treated like we were making a scene. Our first appetizer included a hair, our first drink without alcohol and our dishes were bland (except for one dish which was salted beyond being edible and we were told was made by the chef himself - as if to say it could not be bad). Were it not for our waiter (who was gracious and amazing beyond belief) and the bar tender who kept us happy with a seemingly endless stream of hot toddys we would have left quite upset. Luckily, the manager did exactly what she should have done and comped all of our food. I may consider giving the restaurant another go simply because of that, but I do not have high hopes.

I cannot say enough about the experience. Every course elevated my impression. From the service to the execution of each course. Hard to pin point one thing, but if something stood out to me was how incredible the steak tartare was . AMAZING, and i havent eaten meat in 1.5 years.  Its a manhattan experience so id recommend it to everyone. Thanks to Reed, very kind and accommodating.
No comment
Excellent brunch! We ordered the Ricotto with honey appetizer, frittata with egg whites, arugula salad, eggplant sandwich, and pancakes. All delicious!! Definitely a must try for brunch.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I had a wonderful lunch experience here!  Great service, gorgeous rustic decor and the best part was the food!  Went for restaurant week and everything was amazing.  This was a couple years ago so I don't remember everything I had.  I've been meaning to go back for dinner, and once I do I'll write an updated review!
Spectacular. One dish is better than the next. The meet  station is amazing. Thanks Danielle!

An elegant italian restaurant in Tribeca with a delicious menu. The baked ricotta is incredible. The pasta selections are full of flavor. Reserve far in advance if you plan on having dinner here on a weekend.
No comment

I went to Locanda Verde because my friends were visiting NYC for the first time and staying in TriBeCa. LV came high recommended from my mom who visits weekly so we decided to check it out for a drink at the bar. Unfortunately, we had a terrible experience. The female bartender on Wednesday afternoon was miserable, didn't say hi when we sat at the bar, and didn't crack a smile the entire time we were there. Then we ordered the Crostina Of The Day and she forgot to mention that it had a fish spread on it along with raw salmon. Neither myself or the three ladies I was with like raw fish and when we told her that she didn't even apologize or offer to take any cost off our bill. We decided to tip because we aren't bad people but she truly didn't deserve one. It's a shame we had a terrible experience because the atmosphere was cute and drinks were good. I told the hostesses as we were leaving but am not sure if they ever relayed the message to the manager. Unfortunately, I won't be back.

We walked in at noon on a Sunday and were promptly seated outside--no wait.  My companion declared the lemon ricotta pancakes the best pancakes he had ever eaten.  The savory dish we had, eggs over a sausage hash, was also delicious.

I get cravings for that goddamn ricotta. Like, late at night I'll be thinking about that herby, creamy goodness spread on top of that charred crostini. I would lick the plate clean if it was socially acceptable. They also do the ricotta in a different way for brunch, with orange and honey, and that is just as stellar. The rest of the meal is also very, very good - tasty pastas (although yes, they're a little on the small side if you wanted to just get a pasta) and the chicken is outstanding. The servers are super friendly and it's very relaxed. One thing that I really like, that's sort of weird....the hand soap in the bathroom is amazing.
Fantastic service! Sheep milk ricotta and lamb meatball sliders were amazing. Pastas were rather disappointing after all the hype: tried the parpadelle and ravioli; they were delicious but too salty.

Like grunge? Grunge likes LV. More precisely, Matt Cameron, the seminal drummer from the NW not named Dave Grohl, currently powering Pearl Jam seems to like LV. Sat at the table next to Mr Cameron this weekend and he seemed v happy with his meal. But I cant speak for him. I can say I loved my breakfast of  espresso, a shared hot cocoa with the wife, the sheep's milk ricotta cheese with honey opener and the shared plate of lemon berry pancakes. LV is a striking space with a great staff and inventive menu. We spent the rest of our weekend comparing other spots we visited to LV and none quite measured up. We'll be back.

My friend and I came here for lighter fare sans booze and were happy to be full off of a couple salad appetiziers, namely the Insalata Rucola (arugula with black mission figs, speck, and asiago) plus delicious dessert.

Went for Saturday brunch and everything was wonderful. The food and service were second to none. We had the goat milk ricotta with honey, the shrimp and grits(polenta), and the french toast. The ricotta was by far our favorite.

I am in disbelief that I am giving the restaurant one star.  To start off with my husband and I live two blocks from the restaurant and have been consistently going here for more than 6 1/2 years.    Food is always great, restaurant is buzzy and service is generally quite good.  Last night we had a friend who came in from Rome that we were taking for dinner.  You know we are confident in the experience here to be taking an Italian there.  Our reservation was at 9:00 PM.  We were sat around 10:15 PM.  This was after the hostesses informed us upon arrival they were running "a few minutes" behind schedule We were told to have a drink in the hotel lobby which we did.   Each time we went to the hostess and maitre d' for an update we were told things from two tables just asked for their coats and you are the next table; to it is an extraordinary evening with people lingering at their tables.  We dine all over the world and there is normally a set time for a table.  We were told some people had been at their table for over 3 hours.  After the consistent misinformation given to us finally the general manager came to where we were sitting in the hotel lobby.  This was after an hour wait so far.  He was apologetic and did not offer a solution until we pushed for one.  We were FINALLY seated.  The music was absolutely blaring and the choice of music really took any sort of sophistication the restaurant once held.  Our starters were good.  The main courses came except for my sister's fish.  We waited about 5 minutes until we said something.  Our Italian friend asked to speak to a manager and everyone seemed to be hiding from us and waiting for the fish.  One of the managers finally came over with the fish when it was ready but it was about 11:45 PM at this point and my sister decided she did not want it any longer since we were basically done with our meal.  Our server told us that the entire bill was paid for by the general manager.  The gesture was the right thing to do but this experience left us quite baffled, embarassed and questioning whether we return to the restaurant again. The one star goes to the server who was not at fault at all and was very kind and tried very hard.
This place was just ok.. Don't see the big hype. Had the roasted chicken with some greens.. Nothing special. Would not return. Service was ok.
No comment
No comment

Ricotta and grilled bread. I'm not sure if there is anything better than this in the world to whet your palate. Andrew Carmellini does EVERYTHING right at this restaurant. The world would be a better place if it was easier to get a table here.

Great ambience and pasta, and it a fun neighborhood for a drink afterwards. Really lovely dishes, though portions are a bit small for the price. Definitely get a pasta dish and try the tartare.
No comment
No comment

This spot is just trendy...trendy for no particular reason.  Even though we were only a party of two, I weren't seated until my party arrived and had to find a spot at a bar with the housewives, ugh. The pasta dishes we ordered were both incredibly salty., so salty that I couldn't even finish (and I love salty food) The mains were overpriced, and short of what we paid for them because the pasta was so horrible. Dessert was obviously prepared off-site. Overall, I was pretty disappointied, but I should have expected such from a "hot" place, those are often overrated.
No comment

I was super excited about this place, as it was highly recommended by my foodie friends. Aside from the delicious sheeps milk ricotta with honey truffle, everything else we ordered was woefully mediocre. We had the hazelnut-crusted french toast and the eggplant sandwich. This place is overhyped and overrated.

I think this is one of the best restaurants in TriBeCa. I had a trout meal and my husband the monkfish special - both were astonishingly delicious.  I had not expected to like this restaurant as much as I did.  I thought it could be a lot of hype.  But no, it is beyond excellent.

There's a lot to like here: buzzy, hip downtown atmosphere, open kitchen (in which you can see chef Andrew Carmellini, a rising star in the food world), and very good non-Americanized Italian food. Recommended: sheep's milk ricotta crostini, chicken liver crostini, sardines, the salads, lamb sliders (he won an award for these), the pork. I would go much more often if it weren't in Triberia - but for that same reason, it's not hellishly crowded.
Pretty solid Italian joint in Tribeca. The brunch here is also very good - I had the crispiest waffle I'd had in a couple of years.

Beautiful space and I was really looking forward to taking my family out for a much deserved meal. I suppose because I am somewhat bedridden that I expect more but after waiting 50 minutes for our food and seeing several tables being served already I was losing my patience. Once the food arrived there was no "I'm sorry " in fact the plates were put down in a road side manner way and I half expected to look up at a gum chewing server with a pencil behind the ear. The food was very disappointing and certainly not worth a second visit. However, we must return because it was paid using a gift card and we're not allowed to use it to tip. We are a big fan of the chef and it pains me to give it two stars but the ball has been dropped.

I had a couple of friends come into the city and we went here for dinner on a very very hot Thursday evening.  We did not have reservations but came for an early dinner and the hostess could not have been more accommodating.  The service was really great, but the food ... aahhh the food.  It was excellent.  The ricotta appetizer, fire-roasted chicken, scallops all wonderful and perfectly done and the desserts were perfect.   We laughed, shared stories and had a wonderful time.  One of the best meals I've had in many months and can't wait to go back again.

Would be 5* but the prices are quite high & even if you have a reservation it can be a bit of a wait to get seated. Do not walk in without a reservation unless you are OK sitting at the bar. Top class food, you are safe trying anything with the ricotta because it is all mouth wateringly good. Great wine list.

What a wonderful dining experience. The host of the evening was Sean Print (super smooth) along with the food, drinks, and atmosphere he made the entire evening a memorable one.

We had the pastry misti, a selection of any four pastries you want and they have many to choose from. The raspberry pistachio donut is a must-try. We also each had eggs, potatoes, and toast. The breakfast potatoes are delicious and the bread they use for toast is great-hearty and tasty. Prices seemed reasonable given the location. I loved the ambience as well. I definitely plan to return next time I am in the city.

Though a little pricey, Locanda Verde is definitely well worth the visit.

After what seemed only a 10 minute wait we were ushered to our table. The steak tartare for entree was divine and the pasta dish I ordered a pappardelle special - hit the spot!!! Good choice :) will b back
I love the speakeasy/industrial feel of this place. Thought food was amazing the first time but I think the first time was the best experience for me.

We had a wonderful seat that was comfortable and offered a view of all the action in the restaurant. I'm positive it's tough to get into this restaurant so I suppose I recommend you go earlier in the week.

I normally would not write a restaurant review based on a brunch experience because I do not feel that a restaurant is fully represented menu-wise on Sunday from 11am - 3pm. But, if the food I had the pleasure of sampling at brunch is any indication of the items on the regular dinner menu, then I must make a return evening visit to Loconda Verde. Opened last year in the former Ago space at the swanky Greenwich Hotel, this Robert Deniro - Ken Friedman- Josh Pickard redux is the absolute quintessence of Tribeca chic. Meyer Davis Studios came in and completely renovated this vaulted cathedral to Italian bistro cooking. The room is loud and lively, features high ceilings, large windows, plush leather banquettes, and dark wood, giving it a very cozy airy atmosphere. A massive granite-topped, brasserie-style bar has been installed to promote a casual, tavern like feel. Mala and I had a 1:30 reservation and after a brief delay, we were seated in a corner banquette that gave us a glorious vista of the main dining room and its classy and fashionable clientele. The walk-in wait for a table is unfortunately long, partly in thanks to the reputations held by the kitchen's award winning chefs. Leading the charge is Andrew Carmellini (A Voce, Cafe Boulud, Le Cirque). He has assembled numerous gourmet treats to awaken the senses on a lazy Sunday morning including updated egg classics and new variations on pancakes and french toasts as well as hearty fare like Fire Roasted Garlic Chicken ($19). I ordered the Citronata brunch cocktail ($12); a refreshing blend of Aperol, Lillet and Aranciata. The warm focaccia presented as a starter was out-of-the-oven fresh and well balanced in earthy flavors. To drink with my meal, I ordered the Tre Stelle ($7). It is simply a blend of pomegranate, blood orange and Valencia orange juices. The taste was ultra sweet and robust and just what the doctor ordered to brighten my demeanor. Earlier, while waiting for our table, we saw an alluring bowl of pasta on another patron's table. After perusing the menu, we discovered it was the Bucatini with Pancetta Marinara ($17). I suggested that Mala select that as her main course and was she happy that I did so. The sauce was so authentically Italian that it transported me back to Calabria, dining with my cousins at the family table. Mala devoured it down as if she had gotten a tip on a pending famine. The service at Locanda Verde is exceptional. Our server Sarah was very pleasant and also quite patient as I had a few questions about the menu and the drinks. I ordered the Shaved Porchetta Sandwich with Grilled Onions and Provolone ($16). The pork tasted like it had been braised for months; so tender, savory and juicy. I think Chef Sara Jenkins (Porchetta) across town should start worrying about some serious competition. For dessert, there was only one simple choice to make. Pastry Chef Karen Demasco achieved fame from her tantalizing sweet creations at Tom Colicchio's flagship, Craft. Recently her Maple Budino with Candied Pecans and Apple Butternut Sorbetto ($9) was awarded Top 10 Things To Eat/Drink In NYC in TIME OUT NY which stated "the creamy pudding, rich with cooked syrup flavor and topped with toasted, candied pecans, tastes of Autumn itself." This dessert is, in a word, transcending. New York Magazine praises, "Many a restaurant pastry chef dreams of opening up his or her own cozy bakery one day, far from the fast-paced restaurant fray. Karen DeMasco almost gets to fulfill that fantasy at Locanda Verde, where, in addition to sending out elegant plated desserts like her lush Maple Budino, she stocks a marble counter in the street side café with all manner of mouthwatering breakfast and afternoon muffins, scones, tarts, and cakes. There's a menu-appropriate Italian cast to confections like crumbly Nutella cookies and moist streusel-topped fig muffins, but happily, DeMasco hasn't reined in all the homespun-American impulses that made her name at Craft. Want proof? There's her dense, aromatic pumpkin-spice bread; her delicate, barely sweet toffee-date cake; and, most compelling, her tender glazed apple-cider doughnut, a paragon of the form." I could not agree more. Brunch for two with drinks, tax and tip was $90.
No comment
Awesome Brunch with my babysis during my winter trip to NY

Ricotta ricotta ricotta! After perusing other's Yelp reviews as well as the Locanda Verde mention in Travel & Leisure Magazine I knew immediately to order the ricotta crostini with truffle honey, orange, and rosemary, but i was not at all prepared for just how amazing this would taste. Cheese is normally dense and heavy, but this was no ordinary cheese. The texture had the lightest airiest sensation on my tongue and it was smoother and creamier than any ricotta that I've ever tasted before. The presentation was delightfully simple (just a sprinkling of rosemary, a shiny drizzle of truffle honey, and the beautiful dark char marks on the perfectly toasted bread), as were all the other plates. My zucchini frittata was a vibrant yellow circle, minimally topped with a 3 flashes of unbelievably sweet plum tomatoes, and hints of green from the zucchini skin. But I couldn't finish the frittata as I kept going back for more helpings of that ricotta. until I had polished off every last little smug of ricotta left on the plate. I loved the decor too. It made me feel comfortable without being bland or country. The pastry display looked ready for a food photo shoot, while the large windows allowed for ample sunlight to highlight the beautiful dark wood tables. With a constantly refilled cup of coffee and some excellent conversation with a new friend, my perfect Saturday brunch was complete.
Locanda brunch FTW. U come here for the lemon ricotta pancakes...period.

Lovable Steak Tartara Piedmontese. Nice hot chocolate with FRESH marshmallow! Never had meals sitting down in the restaurant... always ordered a take-out... So cannot say more about the service. Expensive place though...

Good but not great. Decor is very pleasing and the place is very friendly. Met great people at the bar; the wait staff is very pleasant. Nothing negative to say, but the food, in my opinion is just average. Portion sizes are fine, just that taste or imagination in the kitchen is lacking. My wife liked it, but don't think I'll return anytime soon. If one is willing to pay the fare at a place like this, it should really stand out; it blended in with all the other average+ places. The 3 stars are more for the design and the people, not the food.

Very good experience. Highly recommend the ravioli followed by Porchetta Toscano.  Prices quite reasonable, though the sommelier recommended wines are priced on the high side. Attentive service.

It is a pity that the staff at this restaurant are so snooty because the food is actually quite wonderful (if the staff was nice, I would give it a higher rating). Don't dare try and walk in without a reservation - even if half of their dining room is free, they won't seat you until after 20 minutes at the bar has passed, and then you will be placed in the very back near the kitchen and garbage cans. If you make a reservation, you'll be treated very well. Try their frittata for brunch. It is really delicious and fresh. For dinner, the roasted meats are great. Don't bother with desert. It's not their strong point.

Locanda Verde is a gorgeous, enchanting place with serious, solid Italian food. The lighting is beautiful. Decor is warm and market-bistro like. It's quite a scene. Lots of students at the bar and a mix of older people, hipsters and tourists at the tables. I would suggest going on a weeknight for the best crowd. I personally liked the older people and hipsters. Wine and beer is fairly priced but not the biggest pours. Food is unpretentious, with quite a few dishes made for two. I highly recommend the chicken. It is amazing... large, moist and flavorful with a nice sear on the skin. I know everyone does Brussels Sprouts but these are insane... a real standout. Servers are unpretentious and casual. My only complaint was my pumpkin ravioli could have been slightly larger and had more Sage and been even more decadent. Pretty damn good, though. If I were ordering pasta as my main, I'd get a double order and ask them to pump up the sage! Anyway, this is fine food in an uber sophisticated, dreamy atmosphere.

Good ambience, though fairly loud. That has to do with the lack of any sound absorbing material including bare tables. The Ricotta crostini is a must have. The Blue Crab crostini was ok. This is definitely a pasta place. Both, the Cavatelli and the Paccheri were good and flavorful.  The striped bass entree was average. I would pass on the desserts. Great wines, though a bit overpriced (even for a fine dining experience of the ilk of Locanda Verde). Service is very good and unrushed.
The food is excellent.  It is a tough reservation, but well worth it.  The pasta ragu is a must try.

been to locanda verde before and was super impressed, however, this time i felt that it was average and the waiter wasn't that attentive. we ordered a special pasta that had little flavor that we asked to return. the food was pretty heavy on the salt, as well. so sad to feel that inconsistency when i had an amazing meal there prior.

They need to get over themselves. Slightly better than average food at luxury prices you can tolerate in Manhattan but find a place that doesn't think they're doing you a favor by allowing you to eat there.

Locanda Verde is now on my list of go to places for good food and vibe. We shared the ricotta cheese crostini, blue crab crostini and lamb sliders to start - all of which I highly recommend. A friend and I shared a meat pasta dish that just disappointed after having such a great start with the apps. The pasta was too al dente for my taste and wasn't as savory as I expected a ragu to be. We had no room for dessert, but will definitely be back to try more of the good eats at Locanda Verde.

The only thing we liked was the ricotta crostini. The octopus was overly cooked and too spicy. The carbonara was terrible, one of the worst I've had ever! So disappointing. The Pacceti was okay but a little salty. I had been to locanda about 6 years ago and loved it. Came back to the city and was looking for the same experience. What a disappointment!!

I enjoyed a pleasant, late lunch at Locanda Verde just before moving away from New York City. In typical fashion when I dine alone, I arrived well outside of the lunch rush and brought a New Yorker to read--no eyebrows raised. I ordered the Steak Tartara Piedmontese, with finely chopped walnuts and truffle essence incorporated with the impeccably tender meat, two slices of crispy guanciale, and lightly grilled crostini. Feeling a bit fancy, I paired it with a generous pour of Castello di Ama Rosato 2009. Even the complimentary bread was impressive -- soft, almost under-baked focaccia with lemon zest and fresh dill sprigs.  I only wish I hadn't had to ask for it.  The meal was pricy, and worth it.

We had a 10pm reservation for 4, on a Wednesday and they sat us right away.  After we ordered our wine they brought us these amazingly delicious rolls.  They were super soft, really warm and had a lemon flavor to them.  So yummy!  We started with the crispy artichokes, which I was a HUGE fan of, they were very lightly fried, not greasy at all.  Then we had the Orecchiette, I really enjoyed the duck sausage in this dish.  For my entree I had the Roasted Sea Scallops, which was good, but I've had much much better.  My date had the Grilled Branzino and that was much better than my scallops.  We finished with a lemony dessert, which was the perfect ending to a fabulous dinner.  I'll be back for sure!

This is a place I want to like because of the location and the format.  But the experience is so inconsistent and the staff have a lot of attitude.  We had a private work function where the food was good and they were fantastic about food allergies.  Lost a star as the private room was way to hot but other than that it was in top form.  But been their personally and found shells in my seafood risotto and had terrible wine pairing recommendations.  So if your in the area - worth a shot.

I'll keep it short because we all know just how great this place it. The food was all perfect and appealing and more delicious than the menu even made it sound, cocktails and wine were all reasonably priced and lovely lovely lovely and the ambience is everything you want from a night out in new york. It's a great place to take out of towners, or anyone really. Our server wasn't particularly knowledgeable but it wasn't a huge deal - that would be the only slight complaint.

I would come here just for the sheep's milk ricotta.  Omg, I still have dreams about that cheese.  that cheeeesss.....oh oops, sorry.  And the drinks are amazing too! Not worth $14 IMO but at the rate I drink I need to find cheaper places.  The drinks are on par with Minetta Tavern both quality and price wise.  The place was BEAUTIFUL (not to mention star studded) but very unpretentious which was great. Oh my god just go already!  But only if you're cool dropping some cash.

I had an incredible dinner here this past Friday.  The burrata is incredible - Burrata with peperonata, escarole and fried rosemary.   I highly recommend the Warm Mushroom Salad with a poached feather ridge farm egg   - it is to die for!  Pumpkin Agnolotti with brown butter, sage and amaretti is really good.  The only thing I did not love is the Wood-Fired Broccoli Rabe Sausage with fagioli stufato.  A friend had Spaghetti alle Vongole which was really tastey.  Carmellini is doing a great job!

My girlfriends and I came here for brunch.   We ordered several dishes to share which included the Sheep Milk's Ricotta,  the crostini of the day, Soft Scrambled Farm Egg Crostino, and Lemon Ricotta Pancakes. Everything was good, but my favorite was the Sheep Milk's ricotta.  It was creamy and delicious.  I will definitely have to come back for dinner.

I was a lucky enough to get a reservation on my first try but make sure to book well in advance. Goats milk ricotta was to die for...perfect texture of gooey yumminess! Skip the entrees and opt for the cooked to perfection pasta. Parpardelle with lamb and ricotta was excellent. Scallops and duck were just ok nothing special and forgettable. Service was pretty slow but it was PACKED and our wine was comped without any complaint from us...impressive for New York. Seems strange to give a four star rating on cheese and pasta alone...but it was that good and enough to return.

Wow, what an amazing meal.  I can't even begin to describe how good everything was.  My group ordered about 5 appetizers, all of which were AMAZING, and then I ordered the shaved porchetta sandwich.  I did not know that there could be so much flavor in one sandwich but this was it.  To top everything off, I ordered a coffee. I just wanted something to settle my stomach after eating so much food but the coffee was an experience all to itself.  I cannot wait to go back to this place!

I went there for a business lunch, its a must if you like meatballs. Duck meatballs are a must try, ambience and drinks are good too. Cant comment on economical value because i didnt pick up the check :)

I didn't much like your eggs Benedict, but that riccota with the burnt toast? Wow. I didn't bother saving room for the blueberry pancakes, which were also good sure sure but, that ricotta....? Seriously good.

This is a place where it's probably better to not hear anything about before going to.  The good and bad thing about Locanda Verde is nothing stood out, good or bad.  We ordered the Blue Crab crostini, Sheep's Milk Ricotta crostini, and Steak Tartare.  All three were of good quality.  In particular, I enjoyed the Blue Crab crostini.  However, none of it was all that sparkling.  As my entree, I tried the Girandole with Duck Sausage.  I was a bit disappointed by the flavor of the dish.  It was cooked well for the most part, but  the parts were better than the sum.  I just never got the feeling that the ingredients meshed together.  It also could have used more seasoning to bring out more flavor.  All in all, it was a decent dinner that was supposed to be much more.

I definitely wouldn't go back to this place, I'll say that much. We ordered the grilled bass with shrimp scampi sauce. The fish was bland, small and the shrimps on the side were tiny and out of a can (I'm not kidding). This was what the snooty waitress described as a very flavorfill dish -bland. We also had a special ravioli with veal, rabbit and sausage, those were good not amazing. When we complained that the fish was a small piece of fish the waitress simply reply well order more food. If you do go, people on either side of us order the chicken for 2 which is 19 per person and that looked delicious. But I definitely won't be back to try the chicken.

I went last week for dinner with a bunch of friends.  I was expecting a lot more out of this restaurant.   The lamb sliders tasted funky (and I'm not talking gamey).  The ricotta was creamy and pretty tastey.  There was barely any wild boar in the pasta and Mama's Ravioli is definitely not even close to the ravioli my friend's italian grandmother used to make.  This place needs to step it up...way up.  I give Bobby De Niro a close to zero.

One of my top 5 fave restaurants in the city. Lamb meatball sliders and the Sheeps milk ricotta are must haves! A great brunch with great bloody Mary's as well.

Let me start my saying I've dined here before with my family several times and aside from the most uncomfortable chairs in NYC it has been a pleasant experience. That ended today however when I had made a reservation a couple weeks in advance for 4. When we arrived we were sat at a table that could not and should not seat 4 adults. I asked the server for a possible relocation, to which she replied 'it'll be the same table somewhere else" . This was a lie. We asked about a 4 top next to us and another and also 2 2 tops. She was dumbfounded.  They were all empty. This was my daughters birthday and to be sat at a 4 top that couldn't accommodate 3 ppl is an embarrassment.  There was no remedy by Mitch who apparently couldn't be bothered as he said nothing as we left.  I spoke with Peter, who apparently was the manager, after we'd left and appraised him of what transpired. He was kind enough but we had already had a birthday brunch ruined. There was nothing I wanted except to relay to him what occurred and maybe retrain his front office staff how to accommodate in his absence.  In my opinion it was an easy fix that was overlooked by a server and Mitch that didn't feel the need to make a simple change on our behalf. Alas, we went to another establishment but I wanted to share our experience and maybe you would consider somewhere else before you book this restaurant.

Loved it.  Went for lunch with colleagues.  Sheep's Milk Ricotta and Lamb Meatball Antipasti were so good.  Spaghetti All' Amatriciana and Porchetta Sandwich Secondi were great.  Pear & Ginger crisp was to die for.  I haven't been out for a meal where I really liked all of my courses in a long time!  Hip bistro-ish vibe in Tribeca, but cozy and relaxed somehow.  Good service.  Definitely would go back.
Heavenly. There is no doubt you will leave this restaurant in a spectacular mood after having a phenomenal meal. Come hungry, leave happy. Great pace, great service.

I just had lunch with a client at Locanda Verde. I was blown away! After viewing the menu online I can't say I was too excited. Well, once I tasted the Pumpkin Agnolotti I was in heaven. It was the perfect amount of sweetness... so goooood. I'm definitely coming back. I hear you have to book dinner reservations weeks in advance so I recommend you do so immediately!

Had the blue crab appetizer, the special halibut entree and a side of broccoli rabe.  Everything was amazing.  Service was great.  Ended up being around ~66 incl tax and tip.

Very trendy restaurant, nice atmosphere....it was packed full on a Wednesday night. Food and service was great and everything is homemade right there. Started with the arugula salad and had the halibut as my entree, which was delicious! The mint and vanilla bourbon gelato was also great.

I met some friends here on my last visit to New York and I was pleasantly surprised.  I can be a bit picky when it comes to Italian food but this place was amazing.  The decor was beautiful in a warm and elegant way without being stark or pretentious.  The server was friendly and professional and helped me pick out the perfect wine to go with my meal.  The food was delicious and it was an all around great experience.  The hotel it's in,The Greenwich, looks lovely as well.  Can't wait for my next visit.  Still thinking about my meal.

Great ambience, food, and service. We sat at the bar for look brunch and our bartender was awesome! We ordered the uova modenese, lemon ricotta pancakes with bacon and potatoes as sides. I ordered the campagnola which was a refreshing drink.

Great food but small portions for the price. But it is a nice experiential type of place. Friends invited us- they're into these places. I wouldn't recommend it though unless you're into these types of places.
I recently came back here for lunch, and I just want to say that the sheeps milk ricotta is worth all the hype... pretty sure it's ruined all other ricottas for me

Came for brunch, without reservations..had to wait quite a bit. The food was good, I normally do not love pancakes but the Lemon Ricotta pancakes are a MUST! they are kid friendly. Everything we ordered was quite fresh. I would like to come back for dinner.

we came here for breakfast during a recent trip, and it was excellent. My boyfriend wanted to go back everyday! We got the polenta waffles and hazelnut french toast, as well as the pastry sampler. The olive oil coffee cake is SOOOO good- a must try. The hazelnut french toast is also pretty amazing. Everything was pretty tasty though. And the decor was nice as well- an excellent breakfast/brunch type place. Next time I'm in town, I'm sure I'll be back, but in the meantime, can we get one in LA??
Love that the menu changes daily. Amazing foccacia bread. Pretty good ricotta and awesome lamb sliders. Ordered the eggplant ravioli which was fresh and tasty, but small.

Loved it for dinner this fall, went back for breakfast this week. The pastries are 5-star and that ricotta with truffled honey and burnt orange toast was phenomenal. Husband's frittata was a good one, but not as amazing. Sticky bun wasn't the one I'd heard all about, but was good. Cider donut was incredible. For breakfast, I'd go back and eat more pastries and coffee.

With the incredible choice of excellent restaurants with great service in the city, I don't think myself and my fiends will come again to this one.... The quality of the food was not out-of-ordinary, the service was impersonal and slow (with lots of mistakes) and generally the young staff had a very bad attitude and poor manners.

Definitely your prototypical expensive, trendy place with borderline yuppies ordering "whatever grosses the most revenue" - true quote overheard. But the food talks the talk. The ricotta, sweet Jesus the ricotta. Get it. The only thing that sucks about this place is you have to order so many plates of food because the pickins are slim, and each plate is outrageously priced. I'd give it 3 stars if I had to pay for it.

Loved the food, energy and decor. Modern and fun although just a little loud. Trout was amazing. Service was a little rushed but more likely because it was Xmas eve.
Definitely liked this place a lot.  Friendly service.  Good pasta!

I am a steak lover.  That being said, I would come here for 2 things, the garlic chicken and the tiramisu gelato dessert.  Their garlic chicken is so amazing.  It's a whole chicken butchered to be flat and cooked with a brick I think.  Eat bite was so juicy and deliscious.  The only thing I think would improve it was if the skin was crisper but that is such a minute detail compared to the overall entree.  The second reason to come here is the tiramisu surprise.  It's tiramisu re-imagined as a gelato dessert and it will blow your mind because it's so good.  Here's a hint... mascapone gelato...Go.  Maybe I'll bump into you because I'm going there much more often now.

Such a charming Italian place in Tribeca. We loved it. My wife and I visited NY recently from San Diego and stayed in the greenwich in Tribeca. Locanda Verde is attached and what a lucky coincidence. We had breakfast here 3 times and dinner twice. Oh, and a lunch. We had several of the pasta dishes, they were great. The decor is just great. The staff very friendly. Nice wine list. The first night, we had just flown in, sat down at maybe 10. The waitress helped us pick a lovely Italian red to go with our meals and our wonderful week in NY was on.

Friendly staff and nicely prepared Italian food makes this a good place for lunch. Although a little pricey for a mid-day meal the ravioli was delicious and the broccoli raab sausage grinder with ricotta was a surprisingly nice sandwich.  It was a nice late lunch/early dinner. Beware the drink prices though, they were outrageous (8 oz glass of Coke was 5.00 and there are NO free soft drink refills). Overall it was probably our best meal In a weekend trip to the city that consisted of 3 sit down meals.

This is based on sanitary. While i was almost done with my spagetti, i found a piece of scrub sponge inside my spagetti......i told my waittress about it and they handled nicely. They gave us an apology and spagetti was on them along with free dessert. The food was good but i am not sure if i want to go back though..but the service was great

My wife and I went here for her 30th birthday and we were not disappointed. The ricotta cheese was absolutely amazing! The blue crab was very good as well but we kept talking about the ricotta cheese. The environment is very exciting and a drinks are quite tasty. I'm hoping to get back here in the next month or so.
One of the best restaurants in the city. Great vibe. Delicious food. Good location. Well priced and creative wine list. Helpful staff. Love the duck entree and ricotta appetizer

I had a work lunch here recently, and enjoyed the entire dining experience. The waitress was extremely attentive. We also added an extra order of the crostini (they were so good), and it came quickly, so as not to disturb the flow of the meal. I ordered the pappardelle for my main. The serving was perfect for lunch-I felt full, but not sleepy, a delicate balance when we go to Italian restaurants for lunch. For dessert, I got the pistachio cake, which frankly was a little dry. Next time, I will try the tiramisu, which looked amazing!
