It was a windy, raining, bitterly cold day when I trekked down to TriBeCa for brunch @ LV. The restaurant was a warm, aromatic cocoon, and so we indulgently lingered over the check a little longer. Speaking of check, this place ain't cheap. Yes, you're getting top notch ingredients, prepared by skilled chefs and served by professional staff; but you may feel that your portions are a little skimpy for the price, and you aren't alone. That said, the tomato sauce in my scampi and grits brunch entree (which should really be called poached eggs with sausage and tomato sauce) occupied my thoughts for the rest of the day...they should sell that stuff by the gallon. All I lacked was a piece of crusty bread to sop up the last puddle of sauce -- next time I'll ask for it, but better yet, they'd anticipate the need and serve some bread with the dish.

We kicked off the meal with the Sheep's Milk Ricotta crostini, which was multiple thumbs up good! The sea salt, herbs and oil really provided texture to the soft cheese and bread. Locanda Verde also gave us some bruschetta which had thin tomatoes and pesto - it packed a lot of flavor for not looking like it did and was fluffy to the bite. And for the piece de resistance I split the garlic chicken for two, which had vegetables and potatoes. If a restaurant can do chicken well it is an indicator to me that they can do everything else and boy did Locanda Verde deliver. The garlic was still on the skin of the chicken so the flavor and moisture were contained and the chicken was effortless to cut into. The house wine was fantastic and we drank it up like water. No complaints on service and for NY the price wasn't so bad for the high caliber of meal we had.

From the crostini to the pasta and then for some, the duck, all were very pleased with the food.  Our waiter was very nice and the sommelier helpful in choosing a great crisp white. If I have any "criticism" it would be with the quick, uneven service. Waitstaff did not seem to care who ordered what and in what order......the plates arrived and placed "wherever" and not necessarily in order but seemingly what made sense to the kitchen and not the guests. They were also very quick to remove your plates when some were still eating.  Being a native New Yorker - I get its about turning the tables, but when you are spending $500 on a meal - they should better align the quality of service. If I want quick, I'll go to a diner.

Robert De Niro's Italian eatery but despite the celeb factor, the food is surprisingly good, very cool décor, and casual trendy scene for all ages. Family style sharing - plates are good sizes but not too huge as some reviews led me to believe. Among four people, we had the Sheep's milk ricotta crostini and wild mushroom crostini, burrata, lamb meatball sliders, smoked duck terrina, Fonduta Ravioli, Wood-Fired Pork Chop, and Grilled Branzino. Sorbet flavors were unique... all very tart though, preferred gelato selections
Best dining experience I've had in the city in quite some time. Fantastic service and food was solid. Sheep's milk ricotta, highly recommend it. Great coffee.

Went for lunch and was pretty impressed. The ricotta was good, but I think it is a little overhyped--not mind-blowing. I had the orata and it was really good. The skin was cripsy and had great flavor. Had an order of potatoes that was huge, and I thoroughly enjoyed the seasoning and crispness. While everything was good, it was overpriced for the portions and glad it was a work lunch. Derek Jeter was there, which was cool as well.

The restaurant itself is absolutely superb. Amazing food, great service, and nice decor..can't go wrong! Only downside of our night was that we sat adjacent to the bar area which is a totally over-hyped bar scene full of pretentious matchy matchy necktie pocket-square dudes trying to pick up girls. Although we did overhear some pretty memorable conversations, the crowd could be obnoxious at times, but everything else is rock solid 5 stars.

Had breakfast here on a Saturday morning, and it was OK. The food was tasty - had some poached eggs with a tomato hollandaise and sausage hash - no complaints on the dish at all. But overall the restaurant felt dark and depressing - which isn't how  I want to start my day but perhaps it suits some people? The service was on the minimal side. Overall, nothing here was terrible but I can't find a compelling enough reason to go back for breakfast or brunch. Maybe dinner is the way to go here...
Love the area. Really nice restaurant and  food was great.  Cool to hear this was Robert De Niro's place.
No comment

We arrived at this hot spot for brunch with a party of four with doubts of getting a table. After a short wait, we were seated in this lively, beautiful space and were greeted by our lovely waitress. The menu had many options from brunch items to sandwiches. I ordered the prawns, poached eggs and grits. DELICIOUS! My son ordered the same as I. Our friends each ordered a magnificent salad. The wine list is great as are the selections for "brunch like" cocktails. Great people watching.

We came here for brunch and it was a fantastic meal. I tried the breakfast stromboli, which I've never had before. It was phenomenal. You could taste a hint of sourness in the dough from the yeast which complemented the egg, sausage, and spinach perfectly. We also had the lemon ricotta blueberry pancakes which were amazing, though they were served without maple syrup (but it was provided when we asked). The servers were pretty aloof as others have mentioned, but once they put the bread down in front of me, I stopped caring. Can't wait to go back.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Maybe it was over-hyped for me...but I've been told by several people that this is their favorite restaurant in Tribeca. I was expecting to be wowed. Eh. It was definitely over priced and SO LOUD! I went with my mom and we sat directly across the table...we could hardly hear each other. They also seated us on a table that was sort of on a corner where waiters and people would knock into your chair as they passed. There were so many people at the bar, the noise was way way overboard. I had an arugula salad and ordered a fish dish (it was a while ago so I forget exactly which one). Both were good but I just wasn't blown away, especially for the price. AND the service was very slow..probably because it was so busy, but still. I give 2 stars because the hype needs to be drastically corrected....not a showstopper.

It took me forever to get a decent reservation at this restaurant. This place must be phenomenal for it to be that difficult to eat here. The restaurant is a nice, classy establishment. The service is extremely professional, and the food, while not phenomenal, is good. My lamb looked like it was severely undercooked. I usually get my steaks rare, but I didn't know if eating lamb this rare was safe. I ate it anyway, and it was moist, tender, and quite tasty. That was last night and I'm not sick yet, so yay! Overall a good experience, except at the end of our meal we felt really rushed. They wanted to herd us out quickly to make room for the next guests. The waitstaff was cleaning our table before we were even able to get up and leave. While it was a nice dinner, we probably won't come back.
Spectacular food, perfect service, excellent wine selection. Perfect for special occasions, that's for sure .... recommend making those occurrences happen on a frequent basis .... fun place to be.

Locanda Verde translates to 'Green Inn'. This is *not* my favourite place for brunch, but it's okay. I had a latte, poached eggs on a bed of sausage hash with toast and a side of bacon (very healthy...not!). This place is a bit on the pricey side, but the venue is very nice and the service is swift and courteous. I have only ever eaten here at brunch so I can't comment on it, but everything looks good quality - the coffee beans are Illy.

Total disappointment.  Terrible service and the food was awful.  We waited nearly 45 mins for a medium rare NY strip and when it was finally served it was rare and inedible.  The crab crostini tasted like watery frozen crab meat and was flavorless, and the asparagus side dish we ordered was nothing special and something I could whip up at home in minutes.  Very pretentious place and it struck me as one of those restaurants where everyone pretends to like it because they think they should or because they are following the crowd, when in reality the food really stinks.  It is a pretty place though, that much I will give them.  But the food and service were very poor and we will never go back.
No comment

Was there two months ago for dinner and was actually impressed.  Lots of times I find that restaurants in Manhattan are overrated and overpriced.  Portions were perfect, flavors were unique and service was friendly.  I have recommended it to friends ever since.
No comment

Came here during the middle of the week during happy hour and it was already filled with suits.  The restaurant is nice and has a dark brown rich tone to the decor.  We ordered the sheep's milk ricotta (yummmm), papperdelle pasta, and wood-fired pork chop.  We were all def satisfied.
No comment
No comment

Been there for lunch a few times since my last review and I have to note that they make the greatest eggplant parm hero of all time.  And that's really saying something in a city full of great eggplant parm sandwiches.  They add an egg on top of it which makes it just incredibly creamy.  A must-eat.
No comment

My meal here was without flaws, which is very difficult to accomplish! Such a great neighborhood joint...Mario Batali and his family walked in when we were dining, and they seem to be whisked away to a private table...
No comment
No comment
No comment

Pretty good Italian food, except there seemed to be something just slightly off about everything. The appetizers are very small, and when my bolognese arrived, it was pretty lukewarm andthen got cold quite quickly. Was fine, but I wouldn't necessarily come back.
No comment
No comment

Love the italian food and restaurant space! All the food I've ordered was excellent and delicious! Great ppl watching in trendy TriBeCa. I've benn here 3 times and the food has always been a hit! Always busy so get there early or get reservation.

Beautiful space, food I had was ok but very filling. The pasta my cousin had was pretty good and it looked like the steak tartar was good too that my friend had!  I think we had some type of chocolate dessert that was also delicious.

I love this restaurant.  It's great for special occasions and so far I've been very impressed with both brunch and dinner.  It's beautiful inside, and it's nice and spacious because of the TriBeCa neighborhood.  The menu changes seasonally but also keeps some of the winners always on.  The sheeps milk riccota is a must order, along with one of the pastas.  It's a little difficult to get a reservation, but I've most enjoyed my experiences for an early brunch or weeknight dinner before the crowds get too intense.

Great for brunch or dinner.  They do both their savories and sweets very well.  I've never been disappointed with their spaghetti all'amatriciana, ricotta pancakes or soft scrambled eggs, but my favorite by far is the fire roasted garlic chicken.  It's so good that I think I can eat it for breakfast, lunch or dinner!

Incredible brunch if you can get a reservation.  Come with one friend and grab a bar seat.    If you are an eggs Benedict fan, the Ouvo Modenese is simply the best you will have.  This is the place I go to in NYC if I'm craving an eggs Benedict - pretty scene is just an add-on with the food as the star attraction.
their bloody mary is a meal in itself. That and some european style scrambled eggs and i'm set for brunch!!!
No comment
Excellent  service, wonderful food and great Tribeca location.   Perfect business lunch or happening afterwork setting.  My new Tribeca go to.  Expected hype and instead got superb!
No comment

The reason why I give this place 4 stars is because the service was impeccably good.  We walked into this place with no reso and just decided to get some food at the bar.  The bartenders were very quick to ask us if we needed anything even though the place was packed!  The wait was kinda long but it was worth the wait.  The blue crab crostini was awesome.  The lambsliders were melt in your mouth good!  The mushroom ravioli was slightly salty but nonetheless delish.  It was a pleasant experience considering that we just walked in on a friday night.  Would def go back

Everything here is delicious! I would write more but my mouth is watering just thinking about my last meal here.  Really just go here and if you cant get a reservation, go at lunch or go when it opens on the weekend to enjoy their delicious brunch.  (getting reservations is almost impossible, my only gripe).  Also a shout out to Amy who's been my waiter a few times there, she's very nice!
No comment
Omfg...Best steak tartare I ever had. Scampish pasta was light and really good. Beets were incredible. Complimentary foccacia bread sprinkle in lemon zest was delicious.

I went to Locanda Verde couple of weeks ago.. I was very impressed..Its a gorgeous space. Ambiance was great...Now, the food,.. I have to say that ricotta crostini was great, so was salumi..the lamb sliders were very good.. Now, they bring you this delicious bread.. the only bad thing is, is that it was very oily and so was the salumi.. maybe thats why it was so good.. the lamb sliders were two tiny sliders for 12 dollars, a bit too expensive. The chicken for two was very good.. garlicky and oily but very good.. so were the roasted potatoes.. the wine list was very good and very affordable. The dessert was great too.. it was Fantasia, I think.. chocolate gelato with trimmings.. So, i will be back to try some pasta...

Five stars across the board. You walk into this place and it's like you walked onto a movie set. Yes, I understand that DeNiro is involved in the ownership, but this place rocks from the appearance to the food and to the drinks....I intend to visit this place on my next visit to New York.

A must go to on any trip to NYC.  All four people at my table thought it was one of the best brunches we have ever had.  The ricotta is really that good and worth being written up so many times.  The decor is also what sets this place apart from many other.  Such a good classic, yet sophisticated vibe.
The pasta is some of the best in the city. More inventive recipes than just traditional style.  Solid date spot.
I went for brunch and it was great.  The Pastry Mista was amazing.  Only complaint is that the coffee was too small.....I needed more it was so good.

You talkin' to me?  This place is SERIOUS.  I felt like DeNiro was eyeing me (and his super-professional wait staff) from some distant corner.  It's dark and moody, definitely an A+ atmosphere though it can get crowded.  Food really good, wish I had the ricotta appetizer vs. the so-so crab appetizer.  Pasta was perfectly cooked, delicious, and well-portioned.  Wanna come for brunch next time, it looks awesome.
Amazing on all fronts, I just wish  the menu offered more things, but well worth.
No comment

I agree with the other reviewers that the ricotta is exceptional!  For my main lunch course, I had the lamb sandwich which was just ok.  I didn't think the lamb itself had enough flavor, but the chick pea fries that it came with were delicious!   I recommend the very delicious toffee date cake for dessert.  The cookie sampler plate was a lot of fun too.   I really liked the atmosphere of the restaurant, our waitress was awesome, and to top it off super cute Jason Bateman was at the table next to us.
No comment

great food for brunch and for dinner. Love the ambiance. Favorite dishes are ricotta cheese with olive oil and bread, the chicken to share, and all the pastas.  Good selection of wine.  Well trained staff and management, which I would expect in a hotel restaurant.  The only frustration is how difficult it is to find a reservation for dinner.
No comment
No comment

I think I'll stick to dinner at LV, because brunch was a little off.  Most of the food was tasty - the pastries were nice, and the ricotta was stellar - but it didn't have the "punch" of the items I'd previously enjoyed.  Plus, our server was so obviously hung over that getting milk for coffee or our check or a fork was as difficult as getting legislation passed.  I'll definitely be back, but maybe not in the AM...

Review is for brunch only - which is good to excellent, but pricey.  The tre-stelle juice, for $7, is expectedly delicious.  Pancakes were huge, over the top, and very good.  My friend's egg dish was average.  For the excellent part - the ricotta appetizer with truffle oil.  I'm not sure what they do to it, but it truly is worth the visit alone.

Spacious relaxing place for brunch, was able to walk in on a weekday.  Ordered the sheep's milk ricotta per yelpers' suggestion and it was creamy but yummy, worth a try.  Had the pumpkin agnolotti, which was very good but was small portion.  It was just enough for me though since I don't eat a lot in one sitting.  The cappuccino was a bit better than average.  Would go back.
Loved this place! Great food, nice vibe and friendly service. I especially loved the sheep's milk ricotta with fresh oregano and served with crostini. I would definitely go back!

Purpose of visit: dinner with colleagues. We were 15 minutes late for our reservation but the hostess was very kind in accommodating us. Atmosphere was lively with the dining and bar area packed. We ordered appetizers broccoli rabe and mozzarella side. The mozzarella was silky smooth and delicious. Also tried the calamari with fried jalapeno peppers. Very nice and not as spicy as you would expect. Main course was branzino with spinach. Very light and seasoned very well. Service was attentive and unobtrusive. Excellent meal and atmosphere. Bring your expense account.

Honestly, had trouble understanding why this is such a hyped up place. I went for brunch on a Sunday and it was already bustling with people who seemed pretty local. The clientele was on the older side. Although the servings were large and the food was okay, I didn't think it was anything special. Maybe I just wasn't getting the right dishes.

Yes, order the lemon ricotta pancakes. They are really interesting, not too sweet, not too heavy. Perfect for a girls' brunch. The atmosphere is sophisticated and very Tribeca. I didn't like the super high ceilings... Made the whole place feel impersonal. The decor is almost too perfect and grand for my taste. Food is so good though that I would definitely return.

Really solid food and prices that will be slightly lower than you thought.  Definitely a trendy place.  I didn't see De Niro or anything but spotted a couple recognizable faces.  Lucked out and walked prior to a Tribeca screening and even though they were booked up she found a spot for me!  I felt very lucky.
No comment

Overall, dinner here was a great experience. The atmosphere here is really wonderful. The food tastes fresh and well seasoned. I started off with the sheeps milk ricotta. It was light and fluffy but I'm not as crazy about it as everyone else was. I had the chicken for two, which was moist and given in a sizeable portion. I would definitely come back to try some of the pastas.

As good as it gets for Italian in NYC. Service is always impeccable. Wines are well chosen. Food is consistently better than most Italian in NYC. I am a food snob, but this place rates. I only wish it were easier to get a table.
No comment
Alyssa is the most amazing waitress! The food was phenomenal but the service was even better!  Request Alyssa for the best experience of your life!   Alyssa makes the food worth while
i forgot how delicious their ricotta spread was! it was my first time back in several years and the quality was still as great as I remembered.   and their desserts are always a must!
Went back again and got the malted milk chocolate or rice custard gelato.  Insane. Perfect.
No comment

Good atmosphere and service. Beer selection wasn't spectacular. Started off with the mozzarella crostino with eggplant & pesto - very good. I then had Grandma's ravioli, also delicious. Topped it off with a side of brussels sprouts for those how at least want to sound healthy. Prices were NY average, portions were on the small side.
No comment
No comment

Despite a few minor things that I think are normal at a popular location (waiting a little long for our reservation and a busy bartender having a bar-back make my dirty martini, which he had to then make over) we had a stellar experience here. The appetizers were delicious and inventive and the meal was fabulous. I love the atmosphere and the staff is experienced, friendly, and knowledgeable about what they serve. The wine list is very unique and our wine was one of the highlights of the evening. After we were seated, everything was flawless. Next time I'm in town, this will be on my list.

Amazing! Amazing! Amazing! This place really does have it all, great food, location, super friendly staff and a really good vibe. I treated my parents when they came to town as my dad is a huge De Niro fan and both are lovers of all things Italian so check check on both fronts. The restaurant did not disappoint. The wine list is phenomenal and they have a killer menu too. Here are a few reccos: blue crab crostini which is to die for, buratta, lamb ragu and for dessert the choc pistachio tort plus the lemon tart. That place is simply delish!

Go! Enjoy! We did! It was late brunch at the bar. Cool and elegant. Tripe was rich and satisfying. Scampi and grits (for my date) was very good (we asked for toast to complement it). However the gingerbread dessert after our meal was divine and I think there's no point in even trying a bloody mary at countless other venues if you've tasted the spicy, balanced, mortadella-garnished Mary here.

So the food here was actually really good. I had the citrus scallops which were cooked perfectly. The goat cheese antipasta had no flavor. My big problem with this restaurant is the snotty service. The maitre d' was an uber b-tch at the beginning and end of the night. The ambiance was cozy and well decorated, but they need to hire new staff and train them to be stewards of good customer service.

The food here is superb. I had the halibut special of the day, and my vegetarian friend had the pesto pasta dish. Only fresh herbs were used in the dishes. The decor is truly unique. I would say it is an industrial, masculine, New York version of a Tuscan villa, if that makes any sense. A lot of stainless steel, tufted leather banquettes, and pendant hanging lamps. The service was prompt, efficient and knowledgeable. My only complaint is that it took us an hour and a half to be seated on a Friday night. Word to the wise: a reservation is needed, especially on weekends.
No comment
No comment

Love this place- dinner is great- good solid food, breakfast is nice but they really need to make a better coffee--come on guys, get good quality coffee from Italy or a better machine or a better maker or all three- Been here three times and got a double espresso latte and the coffee is just blah- no aroma nothing extraordinary - very disappointing :(

I went to dinner here, and after a pleasant experience, I decided to try brunch. The service was apathetic and the waitress did not even know what polenta was. Hello, you work in an Italian restaurant! The baked goods sampler was delicious, but overall, I was underwhelmed.
Really spacious and good ambiance, but didn't think the food was worth the price.
Fabulous - great atmosphere and amazing food.  not cheap, but really delicious.
Grandma's Ravioli is first rate. Spiderman Andrew Garfield sighting makes it a five plus.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Food was really great, we had a pasta (lamb ragu I think)... delicious, as was the tartar! We were there at the start of lunch, so it was quiet, which was actually nice for us right of the plane.  My only issue was service, our waiter was nice, but for as quiet as it was, not very present (like when you want another glass of wine & nobody can be found!) and then didn't check on us before he got started with a larger table, which took quite some time.  We'd go back, it was perfect for what we wanted (the food), but the wait staff could be more attentive!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Enjoyed appetizers and wine at the bar on a Monday night - decent sized crowd and attentive bar staff; will try again with friends or customers on a Wed or Thursday night.

1pm Saturday Brunch. sat outside. Great day Sat 1pm Waitress was uninterested and not at all helpful when trying to chose from the menu. plus it took about 20 plus min for us to be noticed! Remember I had dinner 2x here and absolutely loved it!  Probably still myt fav dinner place in the city but defiantly NOT brunch. Had the sheep's milk ricotta & honey spread with toast as other yelpers recommended- that was fab! ordered the zucchini frittata- there was barely any zucchini and one tiny dime size drop of goat cheese. Barely satisfied and extremely plain tasting. I was disappointed. I could have made that at home. My boyfriend ordered Uovo Modenese - and he was not that excited about it either. I would say save some $ and go for dinner.

Best Brunch!  Best Service!  Simply the best.  I went to Loconda Verde for the first time last week while I was in the city and I can promise that it has now become my brunch place of choice when I am visiting.  Every details was amazing--the food, the service, the seating, even the restrooms are great!  It was a little slow before noon, but it quickly filled up.  I can see why.  Once we arrived, we didn't want to leave...it's one of those places to linger all day.  Our table shared the lemon ricotta pancakes, the egg crostini, the muffin/pastry platter and the potatoes.  We also ordered a side of sausage...everything was delicious and worth the price.  Now I must try dinner there!
No comment
No comment

We recently attended a wedding dinner here and what a wonderful choice it was for a celebration. The dinner was held in a large room at the back of the restaurant. The lovely room held the 50 guests comfortably at two large tables. The food, served family style, was absolutely delicious and included a wide variety of choices. The servers were very attentive and pleasant.

I went here for my most recent birthday and was really excited about it. The food was very good, but it didn't blow me away, which is what I was expecting. My parents and I shared a lovely autumn vegetable salad, a grilled prawn appetizer, and one other that I know forget (I really need to start writing this stuff down!). For my main course, I had delicious rigatoni with lamb bolognese, mint, and fresh ricotta. My dad had duck, which was delicious, and my mom had pasta with clams, also delicious. I would like to go back sometime and try their roast chicken, which they are famous for.

The sheeps milk ricotta is unbelieveable....this really is my favorite brunch/dinner spot at the moment and the Deniro run ins never hurt ;-) They have incredible wines and the mixologists are very good at putting together amazing cocktails. Its a fun scene and you can't go wrong with pretty much anything on the menu!

I know this place is supposed to be a scene...and it does that pretty well. It's a beautiful space. It's family style with individual size portions. However, I've had better meals. I ordered the Casarecce with spicy shellfish, toasted garlic and lemon - sounds good but (to me) it was an odd blend of flavors. The Gigantone (giant rigatone) with sunday night ragu and provolone picante is apparently the 'house special' and it was tasty. The mango upside-down cake topped off the meal with a crown...loved it. My dinner partners did not like either of their desserts though (lemon tart with buttermilk gelato, limoncello granita & chocolate budino).

This is my favorite spot in nyc, and being someone who loves to eat, that says a a lot. The sheeps milk ricotta app is probably the tastiest thing I have ever eaten. I literally fantasize about it. The pasta's are also outstanding, particularly the pappardelle with lamb bolognese, ricotta and mint. Add a trendy location at the greenwich hotel, and an intimate and very cool interior...this restaurant can do no wrong. Skip the long wait for a table and sit at the bar.... you get the best service there anyway.

Stopped by for lunch and had the lamb sliders and branzino.  The branzino was about the size of my thumb and nothing to write home about.  A little bland and nothing spectacular.  The lamb sliders, however, were AWESOME - juicy, bite size, tender.  Was also cool eating lunch next to Ed Burns - Iconic NY figure, no?
No comment
No comment
No comment
Went there for my bday, and I absolutely loved the place! Both the food and the dessert were amazing! will definitely go back again.
Great hot chocolate (with a high quality marshmallow) - could have been a bit hotter though.

2.5-3? I wanted to like Locanda Verde more (and suspect that I ordered incorrectly) but things just fell a bit short. It was a lovely room, especially during the daytime. I love The Dutch, and never made it here for some reason. The bread brought to the table was delicious, but my Scampi ravioli lacked that extra something, and was cluttered with unspecified octopus (which I don't really eat). Lemon tart for dessert was very good, if not spectacular. I would like to come back and order differently, but I was not thrilled with my selections.

Came here for lunch on one of the last nice Friday's of the year and snagged a table outside.  I ordered the Grandma's Ravioli and I must say that I was left utterly underwhelmed.  It was good.  But nothing amazing.  This restaurant is certainly super trendy, but based on that one dish I expect the food doesn't quite live up to the hype (I had heard similar but needed to see for myself.)  I probably won't be trying to snag a dinner reservation here.
A MUST for anyone visiting NYC. The cocktails alone are enough to stop it, but the food is phenominal!
Loved the place and the Food. My pasta was finger licking good. One of my best food places in the city

I have been here for brunch a few times, but recently went for my first dinner.  It is still hard to get a good dinner reservation here.  The service as usual was great, and the meal was very high quality.  Portions are on the small side, but I was expecting that.  We started with the crab crostini, they were small but an amble portion of crab and really delicious.  Then shared the seafood ink pasta, which I love and order whenever I see it on the menu.  This was almost as good as what I've had in Italy, and I'd definitely recommend trying it.  We finished with the red snapper cioppino, which was really good but a pretty small portion.  We had a few glasses of wine throughout the meal.

Locanda Verde is my favorite restaurant in NY right now. You can have a stroll around the West Village before going. The area, the food, the wine, the staff are awesome! Every dish I've tried is good but I definitely recommend the duck.
No comment

Interesting atmosphere.  The beef tatar was really nice.  I enjoyed the hazelnuts.  The chicken and veal were both satisfying entrees.  Great wine list, although the print was really small haha.  I wish we had had space in our stomachs for dessert!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Had lunch here on 12/21/10. Loved it! The place was packed...for lunch!  gorgeous restaurant and delicious food.  We were even seated near Amanda Peet. Can't wait to try it in the summer when all of the doors are open.
No comment
Sheep's milk ricotta is my favorite thing here.

I'm so glad I tried this place. We couldn't get dinner reservations so settled for a late lunch. Started at the bar waiting for our table and had a delicious lemonade. I got a peek at the bar of some of the food so I was really looking forward to sitting at our table. A really cool space. Nice atmosphere. Started with a fig salad & the daily crostini. Then had the eggplant parm sandwich which sounded like a everyday meal but something about it was sooo good. The spread on it was delicious. The service was great too.
Went here for brunch, had great seating outside. Good wait staff but more importantly the food was amazing, everything we order was delicious.

I loved every minute!!! I'm on crutches and not only did they make me feel welcome, but the ambiance was wonderful as screamed sexy!! The staff  was wonderful in making the experience memorable and the food was literally the icing on the cake!!! I love Duck and their take on it was by far one of my best!!!

The food was pretty good , especially the ricotta and dessert. We ordered 4 different pasta, they were tasty but kind of salty. However, what I want to say is , no matter how good the food was, the service was bad enough to ruin the mood of the dinner. When we asked the details on the menu, the waiter answered us impatiently. The busboy just took our appetizer away without asking whether we have finished or not. I placed my bag at my back, after the dinner when I took my bag, a fork came out! Good that I didn't find any food dropped on or in my bag! There are some bad experiences happened on my friends at that night too. Overall, this is just not a place where i would go back.

I went there for lunch today; service and food are both good. I tried their Arugula Insalata Salad, fresh and fig is definitely added on to the flavor. Their Pumpkin Ravioli (they called another name, which I don't remember) is to die for! Portion is reasonable but the price is a bit above my taste. Because of the cost benefit ratio, I give it 4 stars!
No comment

Expensive but very good.  We had the wonderful sheep's milk ricotta (agree you have to have it), beet salad, pumpkin ravioli, and scallops. Oh, and topped off with a chocolate cake.  Loved it all and worth the $ for a special celebration.

This restaurant, for all of the glitz and glamour surrounding it, did NOT live up to the hype. The food was mediocre at best, the room too loud to hear oneself think, and most importantly: the service was TERRIBLE. This was a dinner party for my birthday, and my waitress was very unhelpful and simply mean to me the whole night. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Yo this place is amazballs! if you can get a seat.... its chillin by the bar and they have a great wine selection, but the lamb burgers and whole garlic chicken is redic! dont be afraid to sit in the family style shared tables in the backroom, its totally not awkward. The staff is very nice and helpful, and will answer any questions you have. I didnt give 5 stars because its almost impossible to get a seat, or reservation, I reccomend showing up early with a small party and wait for something to open.
Good food, Good ambiente, but the fact that the managers check your table every 5 minutes isn't that great.

Went for lunch. Beautiful decor that's totally unpretentious. Love the farm style tables. Food was excellent and service terrific. The ricotta appetizer was my favorite and the scallops were cooked and seasoned to perfection. Highly recommend.

Good food.  Poor service.  First drink delivered wrong.  Second drink delivered wrong.  Asked that meal be spaced but got first 2 courses at the same time and main as the dishes were being cleared.  Wrong food delivered to our table.  After trying literally for months to get an 8pm reservation on any day of the week and at different times of year settled for 6pm on a Sunday.  Plenty of unoccupied tables upon both arrival and departure.  Great food but not worth the hassle and inattentive service.  Add this place to the list of restaurants that scream "don't bother unless you're a bolldface name." Won't go back.
I got the linguini and it was salty. I'm visiting the city and am very disappointed that one of my few meals was here.

This was one of the best meals, start-to-finish, that I have eaten in NYC in the past 5 years.  Their home-made foccacia was outstanding! I started with the steak tartar with truffles, which was awesomely tender, perfect amount of truffle, maybe a little more salt or acid, but bangin'. Next, came the pasta with Octopus in a light, flavorful red sauce. Dessert was a Maple pudding (budino), such a masterpiece. The server was very friendly, attentive and knowledgeable. I will go back many times.

This place is pricey, so I've only been once, but it was a wonderful experience. The service was flawless and the food was divine. The bread with sheep's milk ricotta is my favorite appetizer in nyc. Carmellini is a genius!

Nice decor and staffs. I went during the lunch and it was very busy. I only had to wait for 20 mins because there were only two of us. We ordered the famous ricotta bread and pasta for main course. I would come back again for that appetizer alone but the pasta was very good also. I want to come again for dinner. Highly recommend!

Fancy place with lots of celebs. Food is good and clean. It's not amazing but 4 star worthy. Definitely better than a good place as there are many in the city. Not the greatest but you're paying for service location and celebs

Went for brunch. The sheeps milk ricotta with honey and orange toast was exceptional. The porchetta sandwich was OK. Service was pretty good, but we were rushed through our appetizer, to get to our second course. Tight seating. May be a one time experience.

Waited a while to eat here and definitely not worth the wait. Burrata appetizer was cold and lacked flavor, not to mention that it tasted more like mozzarella. Pesto pasta was ok, not worth $30 and duck entre was a brick, nothing special. I don't really post reviews but I had to on this one. Disappointed, try Marc Forgione instead

Hostess told me an hour and a half wait for two. Went over a block to have a drink for 30 minutes. When I came back they said they'd had tables but we weren't there. Waited a total of 1.5 hours and never got to sit. Gave up and went to TriBeCa grill. They were waaaay nicer there.

Massively over rated.  Reservations rarely work, the food must be prepared somewhere else and then re heated here as it often is watery and the menu's a bit strange. I have been numerous times and I know I'm in a minority here but I just don't get it.
Best meatball sliders and bolognese I have had in ny.  Amazing drinks too.  Can be tough to get reservations.

One reviewer here says she lives in FiDi.............  OMG !!!   Gives you the picture of who in habits this pretentious place.......... As usual for Tribeca hash houses,  over priced.........$14 for two eggs ??    Oh sorry, Organic.  I forgot...

I tried to snag a table on a Weds. night without a reservation and of course the place was jammed, so for New Years Eve we made reservations about three weeks in advance. The place was full again but we got seated right at our reservation time and it was perfect from there. The ricotta crostini was light and delicious, the pumpkin angolotti a little sweet but yummy, and the scallops were absolute heaven. And then there was dessert (do not pass it up--the dessert chef is fabulous!). The whole time the servers were attentive but not invasive, and there was complimentary champagne at midnight. It was the best way to ring in the New Year...much better than freezing our butts off in Times Square!

Still have yet to sit for a meal at this place - but am a frequent visitor of their pastry counter.  Their apple cider donut amazing.  One of my favorite desserts in the city.

This place was truly wonderful.  I recently wen here on a date and I found my experience to be everything I had hoped it would be.  I actually drove by this place years ago and thought "that would be a grate place for a date".  The decor and lighting are vary nice and dark giving it a nice romantic feel.  Tying that in with the bar and this restaurant creates a vary enjoyable ambiance.  The menu is designed to be shared witch in my opinion makes it all that much better for intimate settings because you'll have to collaborate and share your meals.  All in all I found this restaurant, their staff, and their meals to be really enjoyable and I'll be looking forward to going back soon.

Fire-Roasted Whole chicken, Kale salad and the all the pastas.  YUM!

The food was ok.  We were somewhat disappointed in the Berkshire Pork Chop.  The pork was cooked well but the flavor was fairly bland.  The staff was good but not great.  If you want a great meal, head the Scarpetta at 355 W 14th Street.  For roughly the same price, you will be treated to food that doesn't disappoint.  Maybe we just went to Locanda Verde on a bad night, but it was at best just an ok experience.
Breakfast - really quite good. Interesting pancakes, great espresso and coffee. Nice service, nice room. Would recommend for breakfast.

Wonderful dinner!  We walked in Monday evening and although it was busy, got a table after waiting a few minutes.  Offered us a great Barolo that was not on the menu.  ordered the sheep's milk ricotta, which was good, but not amazing.  The lamb sliders were great.  Scallops were absolutely delicious- pancetta and zucchini on top, on a bed of sweet corn 'polenta' - perfect.  The pesto pasta was also good.  Great service, great food!

Great brunch spot.  My wife had the zucchini fritatta and I had scrambled egg crostini.  Both were delicious.  Service was great and the atmosphere was very pleasent.  Known to be hipster we found everything to be very welcoming.   If your looking for a great brunch spot with food flair go here.  Great location, great food, can't miss.
Food is nice but for what you're getting, it's a little pricey. Their ricotta is wonderful, and so does the corn dessert.

I had a good experience here in the past but this time it was lousy. We made an 8:30 reservation on a Friday night almost two weeks in advance. We arrived 5 minutes later and was not seated until after 9pm. The bar was mobbed and one of our guests was pregs so it was annoying. When we finally did sit our party of 5 was put at what amounted to a table for 4. Grrr. The waitress was pleasant but had too much to do and so was extremely slow. The food was good especially the ravioli and lamb meatballs. I thought things had been redeemed and when the bill came we split it down the middle on 2 cards. The waitress charged both cards the full bill.

Horrible hostesses! I was told that the wait would be an hour and told i would be seated earlier if possible. After an hour and 15 minutes wait we were still not seated, when we inquired why it was taking so long we were told we had misunderstood the wait time and that we were pestering the wait staff. I have never been treated so rudely and with such disrespect at a restaurant. Their unhelpful and negative attitude unnecessarily put a damper on our evening and for that fact I would never go back to Locanda Verde. The owners of this establishment need to train their staff to learn what it means to be in the service industry because the people standing at the front if that restaurant have no clue.

This is our new favorite brunch spot. Yummy, interesting food. Went late night, noticed a little cafe/pastry bar...otherwise, terrible service. Unfortunate for a place that someone is supposed to enjoy and enjoy spending money. Will never go back. Too many other restaurants with so much more to offer.
Wonderful restaurant. Really pretty inside. Nice staff if a bit clumsy. Loud but within reason. Nice menu. Beautifully executed food and reasonably priced for what it is and what it is, is very good.

Good food and the best Cosmo I've had. The portions are a bit small though, specially if you order pasta. Also recommend making reservations, because the place seems crowded. We went on a snow-storm day and it was still full.

Went for the brunch and had an awesome dish of poached eggs and some kind of meat sauce... simple yet fucking delicious... blah blah mimosas were good... celeb sightings out the wazoo... I want to go for dinner.

Had dinner at Locanda last evening.  Meh.  Duck meatballs were dry and had little flavor.  Fava bean crostini was good. Beet ravioli had a off flavor.  Sunday gravy was good. As was the almond semifreddo.  Service subpar.

Great for dinner and brunch. Great scene, atmosphere perfectly matches the traditional/sophisticated cuisine. Worth eating brunch outside on a nice summer day over the weekend. For brunch I recommend the ricotta with honey, the hazelnut french toast  and the crispy potatoes. For dinner I recommend the burrata, the hamachi crudo as starters,  the ravioli, and the casarecce for the pasta are amazing and the branzino is an amazing main

The ricotta crostini was so creamy and with the fruity olive oil and lemony thyme...oh man it was such a beautiful thing. The veal however, really blew my mind. Perfectly cooked, tender as could be, gorgeously pink and brilliantly sauced. The flavors were so deep and rich..but with perfect balance that left you wanting more after every bite..If I could eat something every single day it might just be the meal I had at Locanda Verde. The wine was excellent and the service was outstanding. If you want a fabulous meal at a fair price along with great service --this place wins on all counts!

I'm a little confused why this place as such amazing reviews. Everything was fine, but not one person I was with thought any dish was exciting. I personally wouldn't recommend it or have a desire to go back.
No comment

Came here for brunch? lunch? with my sister on a Friday afternoon. She made reservations for 11:30 am, right when it opened and luckily was not packed (YET) so we got seated right away. For a Friday (almost) afternoon, I've yet to see a place so filled with people. I did hear however, it's a very VERY popular place! I loved the partially open kitchen, where you can see the chefs do their thing while eating. We started off with two cups of coffee and the waiter brought over their complimentary cheesy onion bread. BOY, was I in for a surprise...slightly hungover from the previous night, my taste buds are usually not up to par the next day, but THIS onion bread was DELICIOUS! So much so that I almost forgot about our entrees as I was eye-ing my sisters piece, which of course she gave to me out of love? sympathy? Whatever the case may be, extra onion bread for me! For our entrees, she ordered the sea bass special and I had the fresh pasta (I believe it was bolognese). Both our entrees were not large portion wise, so if one was super hungry, an appetizer would probably be best. As for the flavor, I didn't try her sea bass, but she loved it (picky eater). MY pasta however, AMAZING!! I'm not sure why some yelpers didn't like it, but it was def fresh pasta and not overly sauced. A good amount of meat, sauce, and pasta ratio wise in every bite. We had wanted to try one of their pastries early on, but when brunch was over (it was still REALLY early), they had run out of it! The waiter suggested the pistachio cake with raspberry sorbet instead and YES IT WAS ABSOLUTELY DIVINE!

Waited 20 minutes for a table, then sat down with a rhubarb bellini, yummy, at a cafe table. Overwhelmed by the crowd, and being bumped into by an over zealous buskid, but the blue crab crostino changed our mood to satisfaction.  We shared grandma's ravioli, which was hearty, and I wondered if we would have room for the wonderful rare Hangar steak with crushed potatoes and the prawns, which satisfied more than I could imagine. Together,we put our heads together, to be separated by someone eager to refill our water, and discovered the chocolate torta with the buttermilk gelato, that cooled us as there seemed to be a problem with the ac. I think this is a good place for lunch, but a week night might find a less harried aura.
